author: {'steamid': '76561198016632416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1672351584}
review: The SteamWorld Dig games are some of my all time favorites.  I'm a lifelong fan of Megrodvania's and Dig Dug clones, and this one delivers more of both than the original.  The game is supremely well made with no glitches or broken mechanics.  The wold and characters are cute, but a little shallow, however they move the story along and keep you digging and exploring  which are what the game excels at.  My one complaint about the game is a clunky grappling hook mechanic that does not feel like the rest of the physics in the game.  It does what it needs to do, but it's in such stark contrast to the love and polish every other item in the game has, it just sticks out in my mind.  That said, if you love mining and exploring I cant recommend this game enough.   It's truly one of my all time favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008892932', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1676073237}
review:
An excellent successor to the first game! After getting unexpectedly hooked on the first one, I was very excited to see there was a sequel. Like the first, the story, gameplay, and soundtrack were phenomenal. All the puzzles, tricky situations, and new tools/abilities that make this game unique from the first one were a real treat and did a wonderful job in setting this game apart from its predecessor and presenting its own challenges. I'm also REALLY glad they changed the death-loss mechanic from the first game to dropping some of your ores from your pack rather than just losing 50% of your gold. Being able to change special upgrade perks with a quick trip to the main village was a godsend and I really liked that you didn't have to stress out over which perk you spent Cogs on since you could just take them out again. I thoroughly enjoyed this game and I really really hope there's a third somewhere in the steam pipe because I'll buy it immediately!

TL;DR: Perfect successor to the first with its whole own personality. I highly recommend it.

Однако здесь добавились скрытые локации, и ждетпак с крюк-кошкой. Весьма занятно))

author: {'steamid': '76561198072140962', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1675731892}
review:
Good game that deserves 8 out of 10 stars! The plot and character development are nothing to write home about. The digging is nice, but not much purpose into it because this is not a resource-gathering type of game; you get a pickax just to destroy dirt so after a while digging becomes boring. Once you get the jetpack, using the pickax becomes obsolete as you will be flying most of the time which is pretty fun like Iron Man or Spider-Man. 

There is no New Game Plus, but I honestly wouldn't replay it. 

I would definitely buy a third game should they develop it as Dot promised [spoiler]to rescue her BFF; I don't think Fen is dead because he's a digital ghost![/spoiler] 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2929626736

author: {'steamid': '76561197992801270', 'num_games_owned': 3943, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1675723581}
review: Pretty solid game and a notable improvement over the first one.  Better graphics, larger map, more variety of enemies, biomes, mechanics and unlocks and a notable reduction in annoying elements from the first (lack of built in teleporters namely).  About 7ish hours for the main storyline, though a few hours more if you're looking for all the items and secrets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172544382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1675637015}
review:
The game is... weird?

I did enjoy my time with it, the music, artstyle etc. really make this game enjoyable, however, the very short play time, the absolute lack of bossfights (aswell as normal enemy types) and the horrible story sadly changed my opinion drastically within a time frame of like 10 minutes.

I didn't even know I just beat the Final Boss of the game until the credits rolled, since the overall presentation aswell as communication are lackluster. I literally thought I was finally fighting the first major boss of the game and that I'm still in the starting phase.

Upgrades and progression is fun, however, completly useless. You get the best and most fun upgrades like 20 minutes before the final boss and since there is no endgame besides that AT ALL, the upgrades feel very out of place and borderline unused. There even are so many upgrades left, which I didn't get/buy and I have zero interest to grind for them, since there is absolutely not a single place in which I need to use them.

Pacing is awful. 

Game honestly feels like they designed the final boss as an actual first boss but then just rushed the game and called it a day, idk.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967801258', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1675466168}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 to platformowa gra akcji, wydana w 2017 roku przez studio Image & Form. Poniżej znajduje się krótka recenzja tej gry:

Grafika: [list][*]Grafika jest bardzo atrakcyjna, zapewniając przyjemną estetykę i dobre modele postaci.

Gameplay: [list][*]Gracz wciela się w rolę górnika, który musi eksplorować i odkrywać tajemnicze podziemia.
[*]Gra oferuje różnorodne wyzwania i możliwość ulepszania swojego ekwipunku.
[/list]
Oprawa dźwiękowa: [list][*]Ścieżka dźwiękowa jest świetna, a efekty dźwiękowe dodają głębi i emocji do gry.[/list]

Trudność: [list][*]Poziom trudności jest odpowiedni, z możliwością dostosowania go do własnych potrzeb.[/list]

Wymagania sprzętowe: [list][*]Wymagania sprzętowe są niskie i pozwalają na uruchomienie gry na większości komputerów.[/list]

Fabuła: [list][*]Fabuła jest intrygująca i pełna niespodzianek, dodając głębi do doświadczenia gry.[/list]

Plusy: [list]
[*]Świetna grafika
[*]Dobry gameplay
[*]Interesująca fabuła 
[*]Odpowiedni poziom trudności
[/list]
Minusy: [list][*]Brak wielu wyzwań dla doświadczonych graczy.[/list]

Ogólna ocena: [list][*]SteamWorld Dig 2 to świetna gra, zapewniająca przyjemne doświadczenie dla fanów gier platformowych.[/list]

SteamWorld Dig 2 to dobrze wykonana gra, która z pewnością przypadnie do gustu fanom gier platformowych i poszukiwaczom przygód. Jeśli szukasz nowej, ekscytującej gry, warto rozważyć jej zakup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063202889', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1675183343}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Steamworld Dig 2 is a Metroidvania with a twist: you get to dig your way through the environments, traversing them as you see fit (for the most part) and collecting a worthy sample of upgrades and powerups as you go. Light on combat and heavy on platforming and exploration, this game is a fun, accessible romp well worth the $20 asking price.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
At its core, Steamworld Dig 2 is a game about [i]digging.[/i] While that may seem obvious given the title, the digging comprises the majority of the game loop: head into the mine, dig for treasures, go to town and sell the treasures, buy gear to dig deeper, repeat. It’s a simple loop, but there’s enough variation to keep things interesting for the length of the game, including a few puzzle sections that require to dig and platform [i]just so[/i] to get to the prize.

The digging mechanic is simple: whack blocks with your pickaxe until they break, and take whatever goodies may be stashed within. It has a puzzle element to it, in that you have to think about how you cut through the map, because once you dig a block away, that block is (usually) gone for good; leaving the mine does not reset the mine to a fresh state. This means that it’s possible, especially early on where your equipment is limited, to make it impossible to reach certain goodies—at least until you find upgrades that let you get back them. And while it has the [i]look[/i] of a roguelike, the map isn’t randomly generated; the environment has been deliberately crafted, so there’s no likelihood of getting stuck due to unfavorable map generation.

Combat is [i]not[/i] a primary focus in this game, being very basic; whacking enemies with your pickaxe will be the majority of your combat experience. A [i]very[/i] limited ranged attack option will present itself early in the game—but it’s also needed for digging at a distance, and ammunition is pretty limited in the early- and even mid-game (depending on how you prioritize your upgrades), so it’s relegated to an emergency option rather than a proper ranged alternative. The game expects you to get creative with dealing with enemies rather than just bludgeon them all to death. There are only two bosses in the game, and the encounters heavily feature digging either to get to or get away from the boss.

Rather than combat, the game primarily supplements the digging gameplay with extensive exploration, and rewards the player [i]mightily[/i] for looking around. There are some [i]very[/i] hefty upgrades hidden around the world that are optional so can be missed if you aren’t looking for them. Aside from the big upgrades, there are [i]lots[/i] of goodies scattered around for the eagle-eyed explorer. The game also doesn’t enforce many strict progress gates; there are points in the game you’re have to travel to a new zone to progress, but it’s rare for a zone to be inaccessible before it’s required.

The upgrade path in the game is very flexible; while your tools/abilities are found in the world, you upgrade them by spending your hard-earned cash at a toolbench, and the order you purchase the upgrades is entirely up to you, letting you decide what will help you best as you progress.

The game isn’t particularly difficult, although there are a few “upgrades” you can purchase at the toolbench that will let you add some difficulty on the fly: risk/reward propositions, like having enemies do more damage but drop treasures more often. A casual gamer should find the game challenging but not too demanding; just make sure to head back to town to unload your goodies frequently, as being killed drops some of your carried treasures, and [i]treasures you’ve dug don’t respawn,[/i] so death has unusually nasty consequences. If you find you’re getting dunked on a lot, there’s an upgrade available early on that reduces how much treasure you drop on death.

That said, there is an optional set of “trials” presented in the late-game for collecting all of the hidden artifacts that most players can [i]and should[/i] safely ignore. The difficulty spike of this challenge is [i]madness[/i]. I won’t spoil them here, but if you find yourself taking on the trials, don’t feel bad if it’s too much—less than 4% of players on Steam have completed them, and there’s no gameplay or story reward for doing so; they’re there entirely for bragging rights. Skip it unless you feel like banging your head against a brick wall for a couple hours—and since access to the trials is the only reward for collecting all the artifacts (aside from a Steam achievement), if you don’t expect to tackle them and don’t care about the achievement, you can safely stop bothering with the artifacts once you’ve gotten 28 and unlocked the last useful reward.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
The visuals of the game use the “paper puppet” style of many high-definition 2D games, and while I always prefer a hand-drawn approach to 2D graphics, these are well-executed, being stylized in a way that is both visually appealing and well-suited for the animation technique. The character designs are creative and charming, and the environments are colorful are varied—especially El Machino, the base town, which feels exactly like you’d hope a ramshackle robot town would feel.

The HUD is stylized and minimal, staying out of the way and clearly conveying what you need to know. Menus carry the western feel well, and I always give bonus points when I see unusual or bespoke fonts in games.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
The music of Steamworld Dig 2 is catchy and energetic, with some [i]righteous[/i] beats in a couple zones that had me bobbing my head while I whacked away at the walls. Each zone has its own theme, which slips politely into the background once you’re done noticing it; Archaea, the first main zone, is my favorite, although the final zone is a close second.

Sound design is sufficient; while not particularly special—most could be stock effects—the sound effects are well-balanced and not obnoxious. Even the dreaded “low health beep”, while present, manages to be subtle enough not to make you want to put your fist through the TV.

[h1]Story[/h1]
The story centers on the main character, a miner robot named Dorothy, searching for her friend Rusty—the protagonist of the first game—who’s gone missing. As she searches, she discovers that the robot town of El Machino is being plagued by earthquakes, and that it seems Rusty might actually be the cause of it. Very quickly, she comes across a glowy spritey thing named Fen (that I kept misreading as “Fren” and I kind of wish it was Fren) with a penchant for chaos who offers to help her figure out what’s going on, and to get to the bottom of things, they’re going to have to do some [i]digging.[/i]

You don’t need to have played the first game to keep up with this one; it stands effectively on its own. While the story beats themselves are somewhat predictable, they suffice to keep the game moving forward; more interesting is the character dialogue and interactions, which are charming and fun and don’t overstay their welcome. At no point does the game lock you into lengthy cutscenes when you’d rather be playing the game; in fact, almost all of the dialogue is completely optional, requiring you to seek out and engage with the characters in town if you want to get it, letting you dug as much or as little into the story as you like.

[h1]Additional Thoughts[/h1]
If there was one powerup I was waiting for throughout the entire game, it was the ability to swing in midair; no such powerup ever manifested, which was a bummer, as such a mechanic was sorely missed and would have been very handy in the mid-to-late game for cleaning up the last few treasures here and there. In general, if a game is going to have me in the air as much as this game does, I’d like to have more aerial defense options.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997197349', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1675153178}
review:
This is a fun Metroidvania-like where you dig to fund a steady stream of upgrades. 

It was enjoyable enough but I wish there was a little more of it. I don't normally ask for more of a grind but I enjoyed the basic gameplay loop and wished I could have had a few more hours before maxing everything. 

Make some DLC, please!

review: Muito divertido, recomendadíssimo para fãs de plataforma clássico. A mineração não faz taaanto assim peso no jogo, ele é mais platformer do que survival. É como se cada área de mineração fosse uma grande fase de plataforma de precisão para você navegar. Achei uma pegada muito única e o jogo conseguiu se manter consistentemente divertido do começo ao fim, sempre trazendo novidades! Teve pouquíssimas boss fights, o que me gerou uma certa estranheza (sendo que o jogo praticamente começa com um boss fight), mas tudo bem, não tirou valor da experiência

author: {'steamid': '76561198072268617', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1675085530}
review:
9.5/10 bu oyun nasıl kasabilir mk
bu bölümü yaptım şimdi ziktirin gidin https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xVmksRmM-ZA

yarı açık dünya ve puzzle dolu odalar var ilk oyundaki gibi. spelunkyin puzzlelı hali. gameloop çok güzel: maden kaz, sat, eşyalarını geliştir, ulaşamadığın yerlere ulaş, geliştirme bonusları bul

ilk oyuna göre su kaynakları tükenmiyor sonsuza kadar kalıyor uğraştırmıyor iyi olmş. jetpack(yukarı doğru giderken taşları kırma upgrade'i de vardı)ve hook gelmiş upgradeler yine ilk oyun gibi şahane güzel gelişme hissiyatı var eski haritalara geri gelip ulaşamadığın yerlere ulaşıyosun bambaşka yerler açılıyor. keşif hissiyatı da çok güzel her yere bişey eklemişler.

keşke oda tamamlanınca bişey dese anca odadan çıkınca görebiliyosun ama bu seferde oda resetleniyor

boss savaşı çok iyiydi mermilere kazma sallayınca geri gönderme upgrade ile öldürüyosun

[spoiler]üçüncü oyunda uzayda geçicek galiba. oyunun hikayesi şöyle: birinci oyundaki marketteki kızı oynuyoz ve birinci oyundaki rusty ana karakter patlamadan sonra kayıp onu arıyoruz ikinci oyunda ve meğer shiner denen insanlar bunu ele geçirmiş shinerslara yardım ediyoruz son ana kadar. bir tane de ruh var  (yazılım gibi bişey) ben onu hain sanıyodum da değilmiş o da bize yardım ediyo. boss savaşında rusty kurtarıyoruz ve o ruh kendini feda ediyor ("geri döneceğine inanıyorum" diyor üçüncü oyunda bunu buluruz kesin mk) ama depremlere sebep olan reaktörü durduramıyoruz dünya patlıyor biz de robotlarla beraber roketle uzaya gidiyoz[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025223960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1674712630}
review:
8 / 10

Enjoyable short mining / puzzle platformer. Great steampunk art style and lots of good visuals throughout. Reminded me of the old Xgen Studios Motherload flash game from the mid-2000s a little bit. 

Puzzles are not that difficult to figure out and combat is fairly easy. Upgrades felt far enough apart that there was something to work towards, yet significant enough that you actually felt like you were getting stronger. I really enjoyed the overall feel of the game - controls are very smooth and the world was nicely designed.

All-in-all, its a great little game to just kick back and play for a little while after a long day.

review:
У каждого жанра есть иконические игры
Рогалики? Dead cells, rogue legacy
Стратегии? Hearts of iron  4, civilization 5
В метроидваниях же, на ровне с hollow knight, как вы поняли, стоит steamworld
Игра на 90% состоит из открытия абилок,поиска их применения, зачистки шахт с решениями головоломок.Но при этом игра совсем не душна и хорошо расслабляет, ставя перед игроком цель.
Сюжет довольно прост, что в рамках игры является плюсом,ведь он не отвлекает от геймплея метроидвании

author: {'steamid': '76561198025797330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1675437295}
review:
Un metroidvania bien pulido y divertido. Es como el primer SteamWorld Dig pero más grande y mejor.

Una mecánica principal del juego es la de ir recolectando minerales y gemas para después venderlas y forrarse. Con la pasta puedes comprarte mejoras (que, aviso, hay bastantes y el juego te ofrece muchas opciones de talentos). Por otro lado, hay enemigos que al matarlos consigues experiencia y subes de nivel, el cual sirve para que te den más dinero en la tienda, entre otras cosas. Ambos aspectos se combinan para darle un elemento estratégico a la venta de minerales (es decir, si vendes los minerales en pequeñas tandas no vas a conseguir tanto dinero que almacenándolos y subir varios niveles matando enemigos), lo cual me parece bastante inteligente.

Por comentar algo negativo, quizás es demasiado corto. Conseguí el 100% de secretos en 15 horas, aunque soy consciente que el juego contiene opciones para los jugadores más hardcore y probablemente puedan exprimir el juego durante más tiempo.

Lo dicho, recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561199227320885', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1695665927}
review: 真的好玩，没中文我也玩下来了，非常棒。挖挖挖得太爽了，钱的那个技能我没有早点，导致最后整个地图的矿都挖完了都不够。只能刷刷怪。太爽了，一路向下，不像1代还得挖成阶梯好上来，1代的回城太贵了。

review: Отличная игра! Одна из лучших метроидваний на ряду с такими мастадонтами как Ori и HollowKnoght. Игра и в меру простая и в меру сложная. В ней очень классная система прокачки персонажа, интересная механика поиска золотых слитков.  Один минус, она короткая. Игра кайф.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314652319', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1585361933}
review:
Very enjoyable digger game, still struggling with the idea of it being a pure metroidvania but that's likely to come down to my own interpretation of the genre, I absolutely love both this and SteamWorld Dig, I cannot get enough of SteamWorld!!

Really satisfying game, yes there are complexities to it but those tie in with the genre/style along with this game providing it's own front to it.

Would recommend to fans of the genre, (those that enjoyed 1 are in for a treat) those that are purists however may find some absent problems/issues due to the somewhat fluid approach to the genre the game provides. That isn't a negative in my opinion, simply an important aspect to bear in mind.

Totally recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208508647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1674861914}
review: I finished game within 12 hours on normal difficulty. No wishing to play one more time. Got most of the archievements. It was a nice game for a 5 euros -75% discount , good that i didnt pay more for that. I hoped little bit longer game.  Nice puzzles in the game. Nice visuals. Nice upgrades.  Hope to see more games like that, but little bit longer and more possibilities, maybe  build house also and trophies etc.   World with robots i died a lot, i didnt like that world.  How the hell i beat game without any deaths,  ending it showed i died like 22 times total. I have to play at least 10 times same again and easy difficulty to beat without dieing, and even then i can drop myself into hole.  After i got jetpack it was pretty safe, not easy to fall death then. Gameplay 6/10 because it was so short, overall OK.  Motherload 1,2 was better game, hope to see longer and more intersting digging  games like Motherload.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970472123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1676314724}
review:
After 5 hours in, the game is still very interesting and motivating. It s a Metroidvania Style game. Your character gets constantly new items and uses them to unlock new path. What I really like is the minshaft gameplay, where you can use a pickaxe to dig away squares of sand. Once you fall deeper into the mine, new gameplay and riddles are discovered. A quicktravel function to the shop and game makes everything really fluid.

The grafics and light effects are always nice and I really love the character designs of the robots!
I can recommend the game to everyone that likes plattformers like Mario, Broforce, Spelunky, Metroid etc.

review:
Grandisimo metroidvania. 

Facil, adictivo, extremadamente bonito y con un estilo unico, la historia quizas daria para mas, pero el gameplay cubre esta carencia con creces. Todas las mejoras son interesantes, y todas son muy utiles y necesarias.

Te lo terminas en menos de 10 horas y probablemente te hagas el 100% en menos de 12, pero te vas a disfrutar todos y cada uno de los minutos que lo juegues. RECOMENDADISIMO

review: A fantastic Platformer merged with mining for a fresh platforming experience. Mining for gems and gradually upgrading your gear is very satisfying! The storyline is also more enjoyable than I expected, and there is plenty of technical challenge and SO many secrets to uncover. I wish I'd played the first one before this!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970560724', 'num_games_owned': 3046, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1674606460}
review:
Bigger and better than the first one. 
It drew a lot from Hollow Knight but lacks its atmosphere. Except for the Voltron cave, where I'm almost sh*t my pants. Unfortunately, the first game's "dig your own way" is simplified to simple raw material gathering and rather moved to a normal Metroidvania game. The boss fights are still very easy, but at least there are now 3 bosses, compared to the first game and the first 2 are like a tutorial for the last. But as the first game, it's quite captivating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815440763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1674660339}
review: Estava gostando do jogo, do design dos cenários e personagens, embora seja um tanto repetitivo e a gente tenha que voltar atrás toda hora e refazer o percurso depois de pegar o que interessa em cada área. O grande problema é que o meu progresso não está sendo salvo e isso simplesmente acabou com minha vontade de jogar, pois não quero ter que começar do zero e fazer tudo de novo toda vez que pausar o jogo. Pesquisei no Google e aqui no fórum do jogo e nenhuma das soluções oferecidas funcionou pra mim. O problema não é com o meu antivírus (coloquei o jogo e a pasta dele na lista de "permitidos"), meus drivers estão atualizados, já desinstalei e reinstalei o jogo, reiniciei o steam, reiniciei o notebook, apaguei os arquivos de save que recomendaram, etc. Nada funcionou e o jogo continua sem salvar o progresso real, pois ele salva somente os primeiros minutos (da entrada do subterrâneo), não importa quão longe eu chegue. Os arquivos do save estão lá na pasta e são atualizados toda vez que saio do jogo, só não correspondem ao meu progresso real. Também não aparece nenhuma mensagem de erro de salvamento (como apareceu para algumas pessoas). Enfim, tô bem chateada...

author: {'steamid': '76561198865336697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1684509355}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028098709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1674594231}
review:
Decent metroidvania.
A bit grindy, but nothing cheatengine could not solve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040163485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1674160105}
review:
Не шедевр, но может быть довольно увлекательно собирать руды (главное - решить вопрос как их достать), прокачивать и экспериментировать со снаряжением, искать секреты и сражаться с небольшим количеством боссов.
Игра не скатывается в гринд, что большой плюс. Ничего особо сложного нет, если не пытаться получить все золотые звёзды.
История - есть и хорошо.
Есть куда более интересные игры, но ставить негативную оценку этой игре было бы нечестно. Добротный середняк, коих сейчас не так и много.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995846701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1675062368}
review: Ia played through the first and here is my bit on these games. It has a bit of steampunk mega man to it, a bit of terraria mining to it, a western theme, and some metroid thrown in for good measure and then allowing you to upgrade your gear as well. It doesn't showcase any blood or gore or have any language so it is safe for children. These two games have been very addictive and creative and inspiring for me. I would say this game and its predecessor are two of the most fun, interesting, and original games I've played among my library of games and above all it is quite simply just fun. I think these games are both individually and collectively now among my favorite games ever. Totally worth the money:) I strongly recommend these games for everyone. I know it isn't multiplayer, 3D, or some kind of super deep commentary on humanity but sometimes you just want something fun and interesting to enjoy. I hope to visit other games made by this developer in the future because these two have given me so much joy. I was a kid the last time I felt like this with a game I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032830634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 22497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 12529, 'last_played': 1712232686}
review:
Almost perfect digging game that's much more than just digging. Awesome world design with many things to discover and find, great mechanics (wall jump, grapple hook, etc.) and awesome upgrade system (getting new equipment). Already finished game at least 10 times, still digging, and 100% will dig again. 
Also hoping for SteamWorld Dig 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963905026', 'num_games_owned': 3642, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1673743409}
review:
Steamworld Dig 1 was fun, but not much of a metroidvania. 
Steamworld Dig 2 is a good metroidvania with tons of cool upgrades, plenty of secrets, etc

You alternate between digging/mining and selling your spoils, and doing side zones or story progression content, both are fun, but it feels like the end of the game was rushed.  

I didn't earn enough money to buy everything, and there are no more metal/gems left in the world to be mined.  I didn't feel like endlessly grinding against enemies to earn pennies at a time.  

Some of the achievements are REEEEEEEAL tough, good luck if you're gonna try for them!

Good game, wth a few disappointing aspects.  I also wish it was longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027453870', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1670816484}
review:
Robots, and even MORE Mining!

SteamWorld Dig 2 is the sequel to the original game, expanding on nearly everything the first game provided: the world, the story and the gameplay. Following Dorothy from the previous game as she search for what happened to Rusty, the protagonist from the first game and able to explore far beyond what the original game offered. The game took what the first layed out and tweaked it and added to it to make the a game a bit more in depth while keeping what made the first so fun.

Gameplay of SteamWorld Dig 2 remains a lot in it's roots from the first game. With digging, collecting, materials, getting paid, upgrading and returning to the depth to do it again is kept and like the first game is a very good loop. Though unlike the first game, the way you progress is a lot different. Being more focused on the story in terms of having a lot of detours into new areas, rather just digging down since that's the only way to go. Another aspect introduced is the greater use of the challenge rooms from the first game being expanded to not only being used for new upgrades but also other collectables, such as the Gears. Gears are a new collectable that provide a bit more depth in how you upgrade Dorothy. Having a system very similar to Badges in Paper Mario you spend your stockpile of gears on perks to enhance your abilities and having that tiny bit of strategy instead of the same upgrade progression every time. Lastly is actual collectables in the form of fun trinkets that give a bit more world building or a nice joke. Overall, it's a lot more focused on jumping to a new location to get more stuff rather than simply digging straight down to the next area and helps give some much needed variety in the mining challenges.

Now since this game has a bit more story to it I think it would be nice to mention it along with the style. As a Sequel the Story picks up sometime after the first game which already setups a lot of questions, like what happened to Rusty at the end of the game? And from there at the same time is able to build upon the lore from the first game and I guess the other SteamWorld Games but as of this review I haven't played them. With the Style continuing to provide that fantastic mixture of robots with now this time a variety of different themes of western, cultic, and whatever the heck vectron is going for. Especially with the much more detailed artstyle really paying off here.

Overall, SteamWorld Dig 2 took what made the first game great and expanded around it with new abilities, collectables, and a greater focus on the story aspect. Really filled that itch that the last game ended with. Really the only major complain I have would be the greater focus on challenge platforming rooms rather than sole mining but as I don't see myself 100% this game any time soon due to certain select achievements it's pretty excusable. Now with the two Dig games beaten, maybe I should check out the other games in the SteamWorld franchise...

author: {'steamid': '76561198053783918', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1638039947}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 to świetna platformówka z elementami zręcznościowymi, która oferuje graczom interesującą historię i ciekawy świat do zwiedzania.

Plusy:
[list]
[*]Interesująca fabuła, która trzyma w napięciu od pierwszej do ostatniej minuty.
[*]Ciekawy świat, który jest pełen tajemnic do odkrycia i skarbów do zdobycia.
[*]Doskonała grafika, która jest pełna kolorów i detali.
[*]Zróżnicowane poziomy, które zmuszają gracza do myślenia i wykorzystywania różnych umiejętności.
[*]Rozbudowany system rozwoju postaci, dzięki któremu gracz może dostosować swojego bohatera do swoich potrzeb.
[/list]
Minusy:
[list]
[*]Niektórzy gracze mogą odczuwać brak różnorodności w przeciwnikach.
[*]Poruszanie się po poziomach może być trudne dla początkujących graczy.
[/list]
Ogólnie, SteamWorld Dig 2 to doskonała gra, która zapewnia wiele godzin zabawy. Posiada interesującą historię i ciekawy świat do zwiedzania, a także wiele opcji rozwoju postaci. Jedynym problemem może być dla niektórych brak różnorodności w przeciwnikach i trudność poruszania się po poziomach. Jeśli jednak lubisz gry platformowe z elementami zręcznościowymi i masz ochotę na świetną przygodę, to SteamWorld Dig 2 jest grą dla Ciebie.

[h1]Dziękuje za przeczytanie mojej recenzji na temat gry SteamWorld Dig 2, jeżeli ta recenzja ci się spodobała, przydała podczas zakupu lub poprawiła ci humor - zapraszam do rozdania nagrody lub pozostawienia oceny pod recenzją.
Zapraszam również do przeczytania [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/HyperSonic0/reviews]moich recenzji na temat innych gier[/url].[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198364032661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1673325927}
review:
A MASTERFUL SEQUEL! 

I remember playing SteamWorld Dig 1 ages ago on my 3DS when I was a kid, was tons of fun back then. 
This game captures that and delivers even more than the first game, improving on every front.
If you played the first, the biggest change you'll immediately notice are; the graphics! The first game has a charming look to it, but this one is clearly a lot better looking. The other big thing are the controls being tighter. You have a lot more control over Dorothy than Rusty, specially later into the game once you start to get some of the better mobility upgrades. 

To put it simply, it's a nice short Metroidvania style game that makes the most out of its thematic. 
A direct sequel to the first game, with a bittersweet conclusion. I can hardly believe it took me this long to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198981660165', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1673196043}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008034045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1672842253}
review:
Первая игра, пройденная в 2023 году. Милая, забавная (мое уважение локализаторам за «бомжей»:) ), ненапряжная и несколько монотонная, но в хорошем смысле этого слова. Это не скука, а поток:) Копай, продавай драгоценную руду и прочие богатства земли, прокачивай костюм и шахтерский инвентарь. Повторять до ощущения превосходства над врагами и окружением. Нельзя не отметить кайф от разрушения подземелий. Бочки с динамитом, взрывающиеся грибы (?), плюющиеся кислотой цветы — это не ловушки, а возможность разнести все к ебеня… Короче, устроить капитальный дестрой. И это отдельный вид удовольствия от игры. 

Рекомендую всем, кто хочет отдохнуть. По скидке — то, что надо для расслабона на пару вечеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026663817', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1672779397}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 1 was good for 2013. SteamWorld Dig 2 is just good. The Metroidvania aspect has been expanded upon, and the digging is less about resource collection and more about exploration. Even the upgrade system is not so closely tied to your monetary gains, but more to unique cogs that you find by getting into all sorts of hidden places. And there's an actual plot this time around!

One major improvement is that the world is not just the main mine that goes down. You can explore sideways as well, and there are a few "side caverns". Even the surface is meant to be explored. That makes the game longer - in a good way, free of filler. You do less mindless digging and more general exploration, digging being but one way to get past obstacles. 

Those cogs in mentioned - they're a little like spirit orbs from Breath of the Wild. You complete little dungeons to get them, and you can use them to activate upgrades, changing things up as needed. Luckily, you can also find them lying around in the wild - almost always in hidden areas. Finding those things stays satisfying at all times; not only the challenges needed to get them are well designed, you also constantly unlock new blueprints so you have something to do with them.

The game's also a lot more polished than Dig 1. Movement feels better, the abilities feel better tuned, the challenges are tighter (in a good way), the music and graphics are better... and of course the script.

I won't say much to avoid spoilers, but after finishing the game all I could say was... wow. I need to play the rest of SteamWorld series. And the best thing is that it unfolds very nicely, you don't see it creeping up on you... until suddenly things get serious, and you know you need to finish your quest.

I don't really have many complaints, except perhaps that the very last segment of the game felt a little... I don't know, drawn out. But the urgency of the plot and the shift of the game's tone kept me going all the way to the climactic ending.

Do you like Metroidvanias with a twist? That's what this is. Even when comparing it to Dig 1, the game remains fresh and interesting. I don't think you should think of it as a digging game, ironically - but that's alright with me. Here's hoping for SteamWorld Dig 3... or something else to continue Dot's story.

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42922988/]Curator Page[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991625956', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1916, 'last_played': 1672758605}
review:
Отличный платформер. Игра захватывает и не надоедает через 20 минут, как обычно это бывает в подобных играх. Тут есть всё и микроменеджмент и аркадная составляющая и даже система прокачки персонажа. А еще куча всяких головоломок. Ну и на самое вкусное тут ещё добавили сюжетную линию. И это действительно целая история постапокалиптического мира с динамичным сюжетом и элементами юмора. Разработчики постарались угодить всем. 

С технической стороны, никаких глюков и тормозов нигде не заметил. Начинал играть под Linux а продолжил с другого компа под Win и никаких проблем нигде не встретил. Игра отлично оптимизирована и идёт даже на слабых системах без проблем.  Сохранения подхватывались из облака. Джойстик поддерживается отлично и всё игру можно пройти с геймпадом на диване. 

Рекомендую, 10 из 10 бомжей игра точно заслуживает.

Posted this a year ago, it failed, so i'm gonna try to again

This is an excellent game that keeps the same gameplay as the original game except fixing most of the problems people had with the first. The map is like 10 times as huge with a gigantic surface section so not everything is underground, many more upgrades available for virtually any situation, and the continuation of the story after Rusty did the thing with the robot and the big explosion (play the first if you haven't.) Recommend to anyone with hands and eyes, the game is probably for everyone

author: {'steamid': '76561197995201117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1672296096}
review:
There's a concept that comes up a lot in designing and analyzing video games: the gameplay loop. A gameplay loop is the broad, abstract set of actions the player is frequently performing throughout the game. In Halo, you could say the core loop is entering an area, locating enemies, killing them, and figuring out which way to go next. In Super Mario 64, it's entering a painting, selecting a star, and exploring until you figure out how to get it. Of course, each iteration of this loop might feel vastly different to the player. It's not a bad thing, nor is it a critique, but it's present. I recommend Action Button's review of The Last of Us for much deeper insight into the development of top down cyclical gameplay in a game that does its best to disguise it.

What's interesting is that some games don't even try to hide it, presenting a loop as a matter of fact. This shows up a lot in roguelikes, where the repetitive nature of beginning new runs is central, and it's perhaps most fully embraced by idle and clicker games where the only gameplay involves waiting for time to elapse. It's strange, right? Lots of titles emphasize plot and spectacle and emotion and variance in ways that make it feel like we're constantly experiencing something new, yet there's a certain comfort in the discovery of a routine.

It's that sense of routine that bridges SteamWorld Dig 2 to its predecessor and distinguishes it from other games in its genre. If you haven't played the first, the general premise is that you're a robot in a steampunk western town, digging down into the mine below the city to kill monsters and find resources you can sell on the surface. That right there is your loop: enter the mine, dig in an area you haven't finished digging in yet to find stuff, and return to town when your health runs low or your pockets get full so you can get cash and buy upgrades. But SteamWorld Dig 2 isn't a roguelike - indeed, the mine permanently retains almost all the changes you make to it rather than resetting or randomizing. Rather, it's a Metroidvania (AKA Igavania [AKA Castleroid]). This is where the game shows the most growth from its predecessor, with a fairly large, less linear world to explore and key items allowing access to new areas throughout, and it adds a new wrinkle to the loop: searching for secrets.

Qualitative analysis time: I like the repetition of SWD's game loop. Burrowing deeper and deeper through the mines, discovering new types of ores and enemies and key locations. It's comfortable. And it's also a little personal in the way you can decide how to approach your mining and get used to the tunnels you create. I would probably play a roguelike or pseudo-endless version of this game for longer than I should admit. But the way it combines with the new exploration elements is awkward at times. A big part of this is that you have several distinct mines now rather than just one. Each new mine you enter starts with the weak enemies and low value materials you'll have long since outgrown, and each mine also ends rather unceremoniously. The game's two overworld sections have very little meat or challenge. Because of this, there are portions of the journey where the routine becomes a bit of a chore as you studiously explore in the absence of any real tension, only surfacing because your torch keeps running out, and this is where the overt loopiness of the game flow starts to wear thin. Most Castleroids only draw you back the hub by offering you utility; SWD2 has limited inventory space, limited lantern fuel, and areas so cumbersome to navigate that you'd rather fast travel home and back out to another warp. In practice, I think any one of these would have been enough. With all three, you can only get so much done before that loop kicks in and interrupts your travels.

But the bigger issue from this world structure is the secret-gathering. Deeply hidden secret areas in Metroidvanias can be great; I love Symphony of the Night, and some of the rooms in that castle are pretty obscure. But most Metroidvanias present you with a largely static world to parse and navigate. SWD2 has a few consistent ways in which it telegraphs its secrets, but by asking you to make your own path through the mines it removes its own ability to guide you. As a result, a lot of hidden areas require you to dutifully dig to the edges of the map to check for false walls or breakable blocks, and in low-light areas it's even more difficult to spot. There is an unlockable ability to make these locations easier to spot, but it doesn't come until late in the game and doesn't show on your minimap, meaning you'll still have to scour every inch to see those sparkling blocks. (Or look up a user-made map, which I did for the last five or so secrets I missed.) I should stress, you don't need to do this to beat the game, but a neat postgame challenge is locked behind 100% completion. And the end result is that if you're going for completion without using external help, SWD2 asks for a lot of your time.

Well, a lot of time relative to the overall game length. Unlike some people, I found SWD2 disappointingly short. I beat the game with a fairly high completion percentage in about 10 hours, then spent another few hunting for secrets before using a map to find the remainder and maybe 60-90 minutes on the final secret. I've got 15 hours on file and a solid hour of that was me being AFK, so factor that however you like. The ending also felt a little underbaked, unfortunately. I won't go into details here but the conclusion was so abrupt and brisk that it slightly undercut my previous investment in the world and left me feeling like something was missing.

Let's talk positives, though. Despite my quibbles with the overall flow, the core gameplay loop is still really good for most of the duration. I haven't talked about the puzzles which appear in caves, but they're generally fun and not too tricky. The game's Metroid-style upgrades are satisfyingly powerful and significantly increase your mobility and options in a way I really liked. And the overall gamefeel is pretty nice, with only occasional hiccups in what are otherwise solid physics. On the story side, the writing is fine, if a tad predictable. But my favourite aspect was the cog system. Replacing the linear equipment purchases of SWD1, you unlock blueprints for upgrades to your various abilities. You can toggle these on and off from town, but each one requires a certain number of golden cogs to use, which you find by solving puzzles and discovering secrets. It's effectively the same as the badge system in Paper Mario, except you find badge points in the wild. You're actually given good reasons to change up your loadout for different locations and it encourages going out of your way to try and get extra cogs to kit yourself out. More games should explore this type of progression.

This is the part of the review where you're supposed to tell the audience if the game is worth it, but I don't think that's super useful for indie releases like this. This game regularly goes on sale for $5 or less. If you're reading this, you're probably curious enough to get your money's worth out of it. The real question is whether this game is worth your [i]time[/i], and I'd say... probably? If you liked digging around in the mine in the first game, you'll probably like doing more of that here. And if you're a big Metroidvania fan who's already played the big ones, this is a nice palate cleanser. For anyone new to that genre, there are several games I'd prioritize higher than this one unless the steampunk mining overtone really speaks to you, but SteamWorld Dig 2 is well-polished and more than playable enough to warrant a positive outlook, even if the parts don't come together how I'd like.

[b]Recommended If You Like:[/b] SteamWorld Dig; the "Drindy Adventure" mode in Mr. Driller DrillLand; the idea of playing Spelunky but not its difficulty level

author: {'steamid': '76561198124002913', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1671969794}
review:
真正的短小但是精悍，之前就玩过前作，这作更是把银河恶魔城的特点发挥的更加出色。
虽然流程就十几个小时，但是整体体验下来十分流畅，能力解锁的频率十分高，每个能力解锁后都能够立马给玩家带来新的体验。挖矿基本上在探索的路上随手挖挖就能攒够钱了，升级所消耗的钱不是作为卡点来让玩家反复刷的。
整个流程就在探索地图和找各个隐藏收集品下驱动。十分推荐

review: Still good, but I liked the first one better. This one goes a bit harder on the Metroidvania aspect as opposed to the Motherload aspect, and that's not what I enjoyed about the first one. I seem to be in the minority about that, though, and I can see why most would consider the second one the better game. If you're going for 100% completion, the sequel misses the mark when it comes to overstaying it's welcome as opposed to the first one, but only ever so slightly. Regardless, lots of fun to be had in this one as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198817878797', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1505, 'last_played': 1671863994}
review:
[h1][b]全成就历时25小时，不负众望，终于填平了上一作评测时挖的坑——请继续叫我“矿工大师”！[/b][/h1]

本作仍然有汉化补丁，只不过需要先安装3DM的原版汉化补丁，再用最新的补丁文件覆盖（评论区有资源），安装完补丁后，会出现技能图标上下移位的情况，不过不影响总体游玩，且成就仍能正常获取。

游戏紧接上一作剧情，也新增了更多可使用的装备，且装备增加了可升级的被动技能效果，升级被动技能所使用的齿轮可根据个人需求镶嵌以及返还，让本作的可玩性相比上一作有所提升。
当全遗物全收集之后（完成度42/42），还可以跟收遗物的NPC换取最后的蓝图，用这蓝图开启隐藏的试炼（用喷气背包飞到风之平原上方可以找到入口）。严格来说，一共有7个试炼，且试炼顺序随机，最后一个“试炼的终结”，只要去场景右边破坏掉隐藏的砖块，来到道路尽头就能获取第43件遗物“完成证明书”（完成度43/42）——至此全遗物收集完成！

这里要吐槽一下，游戏依旧有限时评价类成就，二周目才能全成就又是要求对游戏的了解足够透彻。其实本人最不喜欢这种强制性的成就了，毕竟它影响了我个人正常的游戏方式，我必须尽量减少多余的失误，尽可能记住每一处隐藏地点和各种机关的解谜方式，在规定时间内达成才能取得最后的金牌评价。

不过本作依然适合剧情党养老，慢慢玩总能体会游戏带来的乐趣——挖累了，停下来做做其他事情，想玩了，打开游戏继续挖。
之前也说过，本作曾经是白嫖+1来的，不过游戏的质量肯定是超过一般的喜加一，特别是玩过上一作的朋友，请一定不要错过本作，这一作肯定不会让你失望！

author: {'steamid': '76561198084000741', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1671024838}
review:
První díl byla má srdcová záležitost, a druhý díl opět nezklamal. Je větší, lepší, zajímavější, prostě po všech stránkách rozšířená verze původního konceptu (jen už nemá ten punc novosti). S robotí holkou Dorotkou jdete po stopách Rustyho, hlavního hrdiny prvního dílu, a opět si užijete spoustu kutání, těžení drahokamů a plošinkování. Základní premisa zůstala stejná, ale máte mnohem širší možnosti pohybu i boje. Vylepšujete si vybavení, aktivujete si speciální schopnosti, a permanentně se těšíte na příští zlepšení. Mapa je rozsáhlá a posetá jeskyněmi, ve kterých si ozkoušíte hbitost svých prstů i mozkové buňky a následně budete odměněni.

Moc se mi líbilo, že si můžete vybrat mezi moderní přístupností (ukazatele úkolů v mapě, navigační šipky) nebo klasickou hratelností (průzkum bez ukazatelů) přímo ve hře, jako "vylepšení" své mapy. Herní postava vám rozdíl vysvětlí, a vy si prostě kdykoliv zapnete nebo vypnete tuto funkci mapy, stejně jako zapínáte vylepšení jiných svých předmětů. Takže já jsem jel samozřejmě na old-school průzkumný režim bez berliček. Oceňuji, že to šlo vůbec nastavit, a ješte takto dobře zakomponovanou formou.

Ve stylu metroidvanie se vám postupně zpřístupňují části mapy, kterými jste již prošli, ale tehdy jste se daným směrem nedokázali dostat (plošinka moc vysoko, kámen příliš tvrdý na rozbití, atd). S novým vybavením se najednou můžete dostat dál, takže se vyplatí všímat si okolí a snažit se zapamatovat si, kam se chci později vrátit. Odměnou je spousta tajných předmětů poschovávaných po celém světě, které vám pak výrazně zlepšují schopnosti.

Hra je vizuálně krásná a technicky naprosto bezchybná, takže i na notebooku s integrovanou grafikou je všechno naprosto plynulé, s bleskurychlým nahráváním a s až fascinovaně minimální velikostí instalace. Sympatickému švédskému studiu Image & Form se druhý díl výborně povedl, a držím jim palce, ať s takto kvalitní tvorbou pokračují i v budoucnu.

Celkové hodnocení: Výborná / Nářez

Zdroj komentáře: http://dbher.cz/k31483

review:
I've not finished the game yet (came close last time), but you can probably tell from my hours that I've restarted this several times - it's that much fun. The complete package is superb, from the art to the music and the characters and especially the Metroidvania gameplay. It's great for casual bursts but it also hooks you in so it's hard to put down.

I played to first game and this one is better, and more complete, in every way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083541750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1669700545}
review:
Unlike 1, this game has challenge rooms that do NOT lead you into the concepts. It throws the hardest difficulty new danger at you with zero mercy. The controls are also broken half the time with various keys not able to be pressed simultaneously. 1 had much better character control and progression, this one throws you in immediately and has different mechanics. The enemies are also pretty annoying, most all of them after the last normal cave requiring you to sacrifice your health to kill them in hopes that they give you health back (which they don't).

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197974872157', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1669821297}
review:
The trailer is misleading — the action in this game is really not that fast-paced, except when fighting certain enemies, such as those that look like snails or... masked wizards. I don't know the real names; you'll know them when you see them. Mostly, you'll be digging, much like the desert areas of Super Mario Bros. 2 (USA; Doki Doki Panic in JP) or Dig Dug and its various clones. If you find digging tedious, this may not be the game for you. That said, the light combat, treasure hunting, and gear upgrades kept me coming back. The music is simple, but it's good. The gameplay is, for the most part, fun.

There are a few areas, however, where the difficulty ramps up to 11. Most of these are challenge areas for expert players, and are not required to complete the game. One is a windy area you must pass in order to proceed. You will need the hookshot, and you will need a lot of luck and patience. No need to look up a guide, you probably have the right idea, you just have to have expert timing. If it gives you problems, go back and explore a bit more. It won't help, but it'll keep your finger off that Refund button.

The other area I want to warn you about is called Vectron. The difference here is, once you're here, you cannot leave until you complete it. Completing it will give you an item that will make an optional area easier to traverse; however, if you can complete that area without the Vectron item, you will get an item that will make Vectron a bit easier. The difference is, you can leave the other area whenever you want. Before entering this area, I would consider backing up your save manually as the Vectron area is incredibly difficult. You'll be sneaking by enemies that can kill you in one or two hits, and it's more luck than skill if they wake up. But, once you pass this area, the game gets a lot more fun because of what you obtain upon completing it.

Those two experiences should sour my opinion of the game, but I'd probably only take one star off, maybe rate it 3/5 or 3/4, since the Easy difficulty setting should mitigate some of these required challenges, and the latter should allow you to regroup in town. Rather, they point to a larger issue with the game. It's fun, it's simple, but it's not very well polished. It could have used another pass or two through QA to tighten up some of these issues. Games are tested by seasoned gamers and, well, the people who make the game. They should let some casual gamers have a go, and see where they stumble.

All that being said, I logged about five hours before the game really blocked my progress behind an unfair puzzle. If you play it for five hours and call it quits, you've got your money's worth for what this game costs, especially how often it goes on sale. But if you can tighten it up and push through, you'll get a lot more time out of it. I'm writing this review at 11 hours in, and I think I'm near the end. I know I have most of the map uncovered, but actually finishing this game will require completing the optional challenge caves, which will take much longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301707455', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1669411902}
review:
Во всех аспектах замечательное продолжение первой части: более красочная картинка, больше интересных механик, приятное звуковое сопровождение, интересная история с неожиданным финалом, секреты и пазл-пещеры. Я бы сказал, что эта игра, почти, идеальна для своего уровня, и точно как продолжение. Но есть одна единственная вещь, которая очень сильно смазала мое впечатление и удовольствие: Есть такое место как пещера испытаний, которую можно открыть только под конец игры. Там есть разные комнаты с испытаниями игровых навыков, и все они чуть сложнее или проще, но по честному... все, кроме одной: комната мастера, которую нужно пройти исключительно прыжками. И это было невообразимо глупым решением. Речь не о том, чтобы не делать такой уровень в месте под названием Trial Cave, а о том, что в самой основной игре никогда не было объяснения или необходимости каких-то хотя бы минимальных трюков с прыжками. Когда я пришел в ту комнату с нулевым опытом и ожиданиями такой "подставы" и начал искать в интернете что не так, этих трюков, как оказалось, хватает на целые мануалы.
...А теперь, имея это в виду, помните, что комнат несколько и если вы умрете, то начнете с самого начала ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

author: {'steamid': '76561198896831485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1669432024}
review: Overwhelmingly positive?? Yeah right. Maybe 10 years ago. This game is so freaking booooring. All the backtracking just to sell gems, and not even have enough gems to buy something, then having to search around while your light goes out... its just too much repetitive boring gameplay. But the worst aspect of it is the jump. Whoever created the jumping mechanism needs to be fired. Every time you jump you overshoot your jump. Every.single.time! There is no way around it. There are only two good aspects about this game..... 1) the music (which is phenomenal), and 2) the colors. That's it. If I was 15 and getting high on a Friday night and staying up all night drinking Mountain Dew then yeah I would play tf outta this game. But in 2022 this is ridiculous. I know the game is 5 years old, but come tf on... stop giving this game such a great rating!

review: I played the original Steamworld game and i enjoyed it quite a bit, the sequel I loved the cog system which would let you set up upgrades/buffs in a strategic way and you could change them as you played along.  I was amused by the artifacts in the game and the flavor text and pop culture references. If you liked the 1st game i felt this improved on the formula.

review:
Очень хорошая игра на пару вечеров, в которую интересно залипать.
Музыка и дизайн пушечки.
Ну и главное, улучшилась со времён первой части, убрали большое кол-во расходников по типу "лестницы" и тд, что, как по мне, хороший плюс.
Рад что прошёл эту игру и всем советую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012809151', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1668929448}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009884241', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1668865258}
review:
[h1]Примерно то же самое, только лучше[/h1]

[b]SteamWorld Dig 2[/b] это отличное продолжение отличной игры.
Всё стало лучше и приятнее:
- Больше сюжета
- Больше хорошего юмора
- Больше приятной анимации и динамики
- Больше апгрейдов
- Больше геймплея
- Больше квестов и интересных испытаний

На этот раз мы играем за Дороти и пытаемся найти пропавшего Расти (робот из первой части). По ходу прохождения игрок встречает новых друзей и врагов, а также узнаёт много нового о загадочном мире роботов и бомжей. 
В истории постоянно происходит что-то интересное и масштабное, но игра не потеряла ощущение уюта и тепла, которое запомнилось с первой части. Бегать по пещерам так же приятно и атмосферно, а диалоги всё так же наполнены умеренным юмором.

[i]Если первая часть вам понравилась, то [b]SteamWorld Dig 2[/b] тоже оставит приятные впечатления.[/i]

review:
A good sequel, I'm still 1/3 into the story and I'm having fun, there are more upgrades and perhaps a bit too much freedom, to the point where I' skipped a couple of caves to proceed with the main quest and I feel like I shouldn't be able to go that far without exploring everything first but honestly that might be a plus for most non-completionist people. also it's a metroidvania so you're required to leave some areas to come back later anyway.
I like it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198095249733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1661432999}
review:
Really good Metroidvania. Looks awesome, good leveling system and unique idea.
This game may be too easy for some, but there is a lot of stuff to find, so it doesn't run out that soon.

The controls (on controller) are super responsive and play perfect.

My only issue is the end boss is stylistically very different from the rest of the game.

If you like the first game this is the cat's meow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139870067', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1667768009}
review:
Amazing. Steamworld Dig 1 walked to SteamWorld Dig 2 could run.

If you thought the first one had cool mobility this one blows that aspect out of the water.

The exploring-mining-upgrading loop is MUCH more enjoyable than the first one. Not only there are way more things to upgrade than the first one but there are much interesting and different areas to explore than the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280796693', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1667062562}
review: I'm not much of a metroidvania gamer but I can easily say one of the best metroidvania games i've ever played. I would say top two with Ori and the Will of the Wisps. I purchased the game for free, I had no expectations from the game and saw overwhelmingly positive review and i gave this one a shot and i really liked it. Great map and level design, entertaining digging/selling and upgrading system. Some maps even made me nervous by the atmosphere. The only con is there are no satisfying boss battles in the game but that doesn't change my mind. Totally must play 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072076329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1669861571}
review:
This game ROCKS! (pun intended)
This little gem (pun intended) is doing everything right. Super smooth gameplay, fluid like hot water in pipes. Requires some reflexes but to the perfect extent. You won't get frustrated, maybe unless you're totally clunky but it's still worth the shot. When you get the grip later with some extra upgrades, wow! You'll find smile glued to your ugly face.
 
The story unfolds nicely, and is great too. Far from filler just to be there for... filling.
I'm in the middle of the adventure, but nothing will change my mind already. Animations, characters, world, backgrounds, everything checks out. Logical puzzles are awesome – platformer style with extra steampunky touch. I can't find single thing done wrong. Sound effects, music... perfect.
 
I do recommend starting with SW: Dig 1. It's not inferior to 2, like many say. 1 was first, providing fresh take on the subject, and also done everything perfectly well. Let yourself fall in love with 1 first. When you finish 1 and move to 2, you will apreciate 2 even more while still keeping respect for part 1. Just my advice, you can ignore it :) but seriously, don't ;)
 
Dig 2 is to 1 what Fallout II is to Fallout I. Keeping proportions. Both are basically the same in a good way. Part 2 takes some elements from part 1 and does them nicer and cooler, but what is most important – doesn't break what was working well. Just my two Trashiums... I mean two cents.
 
Get this! Sale or not!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056798354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1666482397}
review: Absolutely loved the game. It's an unusual action-platformer that combines a fun world with a mechanically interesting gameplay. Quite often I made guesses about what the future upgrades or techs might be, and I was wrong, and it always was a pleasant surprise. Definitely a recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013543348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1389, 'last_played': 1666460643}
review:
In a World...

Where robots rule the surface... and humans have umm... gone someplace else...

A young robot girl is searching for her missing friend from the 1st game... 

She will have to face many dangers, dig deep into mines, run across windy deserts, climb treacherous paths and swim through underwater caverns... 

...but she is [i]not alone[/i].

Her only chance to survive depends on seeking guidance from her trusty ghost companion (who kinda lives inside her?) and a few townsfolk that have absolutely no idea why they voted for their current Mayor...

To aid her in her quest, she has at her disposal a small arsenal of upgradeable equipment and deadly weapons... such as:

A map, lamp, backpack, pickaxe, chainsaw, heat seeking missiles, proximity spider mines, cloaking device, automated defense turrets, immortal droid army, a flying battlecruiser and an orbital super weapon.

(Kindly note that some equipment listed above may not be available in the final version of the game due to potential balance issues and/or time constraints - please contact the game devs for any assistance or unreasonable requests. Thanks!)

So strap on your mining boots and gather those precious minerals, find the missing artifacts, discover hidden areas, complete the cave challenges, outsmart your enemies and most important of all....

DON'T...
...STOP
DIGGING.

author: {'steamid': '76561198957921881', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1666379469}
review:
[h1] ℍ𝕠𝕝𝕪 𝕞𝕠𝕝𝕪, 𝕨𝕙𝕒𝕥 𝕒 𝕥𝕣𝕚𝕡 𝕥𝕙𝕚𝕤 𝕘𝕒𝕞𝕖 𝕙𝕒𝕤 𝕓𝕖𝕖𝕟... [/h1]

Why have I waited this long to play this absolute gem of a game? I know not... Gather round, fans of virtual spelunking, as I review Steamworld Dig 2 that, unlike most sequels nowadays, not only bases itself on the previous game's mechanics but also improves on them, by a huge margin, which in turn makes the game so much more amazing than the previous entry.

You take on the role of Dorothy, a bot you meet in the first game Steamworld Dig. Dorothy was, I guess, blown away by how cool your character from the first game, Rusty, was... As he disappeared in the lowest depths of the Archaean mines after beating Vectron. Dorothy meets a guiding spirit, Fen, who is obssessed with smashing things and as the story progresses you'll learn more about, not only these two characters, but also about the townspeople... or should I say, the townsbots lol! 

As with the first game, your task is to dig through the mine to the lowest level. You'll need to progressively upgrade your tools as you venture deeper; sometimes you'll obviously get sidetracked to different parts of the mines to find more equipment you'd need to blow up part of the mine that are difficult to slash through. This is the best spelunker get you'll have the privilege to play through, with a lovely story of betrayal and idolization and as Dorothy finds out more about the truth of what happened to her Idol, Rusty, she'll find herself questioning her choices a little more. 

Let's talk about mechanics and let me tell you, grappling around the more dangerous parts of the mine (like the lower temple) is literally the most fun I've had in a platformer spelunker-type of game. It offers also great variety to the digging itself so as not to make it a mandatory boring thing to do. It's really amazing how this game has managed to do EVERYTHING right... Now imagine it had couch co-op... and that's basically the only "bad" thing I'm going to say about the game; it lacks co-op.

Even if it does, though, I'm going to give it a flashing, glowing [b]10/10[/b] and I can't recommend the game enough; the spelunking is so much fun, the townsbots are quite hilarious, the shiners have made a turnaround from complete maniacs to actual people who live in the harsh claustrophobic caves of the mine and the gadgets... You can't help but utter the famous "weeeeee" while grappling around! Did I mention that I got it for free at some point? The devs literally gave this gem away for free... I thought because of this generous gesture, the game would suck (you know how devs' freebies are normally these old games nobody likes!!)... So glad I claimed it when I did but now I kind of feel guilty about it because the game is quite a trip.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970393740', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1666044730}
review:
It was OK for the sale price.
Controls are a bit too sensitive for my liking. I was using a XBox 1 controller, and I found that the jumps and movement weren't scaled very well, leading to my character jumping past the safe spot. As a result the character feels too lightweight, and I felt moments of deep frustration, to the point where I nearly abandoned the game.
Still, the classic style graphics are great, and digging invokes memories of Minecraft and Terraria.
The music became extremely annoying after a few hours, and ambient sounds were pretty basic, almost 8 bit in character at times.
Not exactly the chill time waster I was hoping for. A wee bit too finicky and frustrating, but I'd recommend it when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023757658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1666017735}
review:
(#1) The game design provides and promotes an immediate sense of  failure of accomplishment fatigue. After you complete an entire area and have spend 20+ minutes in it and use a different mine tunnel exit, then return, the area that you previously cleared is completely reset to its original state as if you've never explored it before.  

(#2) Trying different strategy approaches is dishonored. If you get stuck and can't complete an area, you're completely dishonored in your progression. You have to go back a level or two and trying another strategy and then point  #1 listed above is immediately slapped on as a negative penalty and erases your progression just because you wanted to try a different strategy.

(#3) The game mechanics favor / promote the inducement of Carpal Tunnel Syndrome. You're forced you to use awkward & repetitive long wall double jumps / leaps constantly. If not executed correctly at the right millisecond, you fail and have to repeat 15+ times again. There is no immediate relief so you're screwed. Its said there is relief or aid  in mid to late game, however by the time you reach it, you've already damaged your hands / forearms requiring professional medical attention & treatment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410604507', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1665788541}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 – весёлая и ненапряжная игра. Я бы назвал её лайтовой метроидванией. Я узнал об этой игре случайно из какого-то отрывка и она меня заинтересовала. Я добавил её в список желаемого и только недавно купил.
 Стилистика у этой игры довольно интересная. Нарисованный дикий запад с роботами, словно из мультиков 80-х создаёт приятную и дружелюбную атмосферу. В этом мире приятно находиться, что очень важно для любой игры, кроме специальных исключений.
 Скажу прямо, я не играл в первую часть и не хочу. Однако, вторая часть продолжает историю из первой и сама по себе она не особо интригует, но знакомит нас с персонажами, диалоги с которыми довольно забавные, как реплики нашего спутника – сознания в виде частицы без тела. Его рвение что-то постоянно взрывать подбадривает, ведь «ничто так не красит приключение, как хаос и неразбериха». Однако подобных реплик довольно мало, поэтому большую часть времени вы будете слушать только звуки ломающихся блоков. Но даже те малочисленные реплики немного придают всему путешествию смысла и значимости.
 Механика этой игры довольно подвижная и гибкая. Все инструменты используются в двух целях: копать и перемещаться. И каждый инструмент имеет свою определённую «побочку», которую можно использовать. К примеру, главный трюк, который я нашёл - это «инерция крюка». Инструмент крюк-кошка даёт вам инерцию при подьёме, если вы отпустили кнопку притягивания, а прыжок в игре - управляемый. Это довольно непростой мув, поскольку для оптимальной инерции нужно отпустить почти в самом конце и успеть завернуть подьём за блок. Изначально, я подумал, что так и должно быть, что это скилл, которому игрок сам должен обучиться, но оказалось, что я просто придумал спидранерский финт.
 Прокачка в игре довольно интересная. Улучшения открываются за уровень определённого инструмента, который открывается за деньги, полученные от продажи руды. А использовать его улучшения можно за «шестерёнки», они находятся в пещерах, своеобразных доп. уровнях с испытаниями. Некоторые из улучшений очень полезны, как например «портал». Это улучшение даёт вам возможность перенестись в хаб, почти из любой точки, ничего не теряя, или улучшение, при котором вы теряете меньше ресурсов после смерти, тоже очень полезное.
 Говоря в целом, я от этой игры ничего не ждал, но она меня удивила и порадовала. Я действительно получил удовольствие проходя и изучая её. Хоть она и является довольно легкой, но это не мешает прохождению, скорее даже даёт больше возможности расслабиться. Если вы хотите ненапряжно и с интересом провести 10-15 часов, то это игра вам точно подойдёт.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450557661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1665286591}
review:
This is a really amazing Metroidvania that I regret not playing sooner.
I mean, not really, because I got to play it now :P
It is not the Metroidvan[i]iest[/i] Metroidvania (no, it is not a roguelike), but it has a lot of what makes the genre great:

[list]
[*]A large, varied, interesting world to explore
[*]Interesting setting (not so much lore. There isn't much lore. I'm fine with that and it adds to the intrigue)
[*]TONS of secrets to find...
[*]...but not secrets that recontextualize or change the ending
...except, it's looking like...ONE BIG SECRET THAT DOES. ;P
[*]Moving around the world is satisfying, especially after you get a few new abilities and upgrades.
[/list]

Combat is pretty simple but it isn't dull and it isn't twitchy bullshit. Bosses range from really easy to moderately difficult. You can expect to lose at least a couple of times and to eat it several times out in the world.

There are a lot of things I like in this that I would compare to [i]Guacamelee[/i], but they are very different games. There is one hard dark turn that blew me away. I was disappointed that I didn't see more of that area. Maybe if I finish the secret area? Side note: Several metroidvanias I have played recently, that are not top-ranking games, have at least one or two areas that meet or transcend the quality of areas in better games. [i]Hollow Knight[/i] is still #1.
