author: {'steamid': '76561198146692284', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1665130383}
review:
Приветствую, диггеры!
Первое знакомство с этой игрой не вызвало у меня каких-то впечатлений а напротив, я посчитал эту игру куском кала, но дарёному коню в зубы не смотрят. 
Полное знакомство с этой игрой у меня произошло (по классической для меня причине) когда я увидел достижение "а я солнышко поймал" которое глядя на картинку только человека вчера севшего за компьютер не вызовет вопроса: - А это чё, отсылка на Солера на ДС?
Естественно я не мог подобное достижение пропустить, но прочитав его описание я лишь тяжело вздохнул и настроил себя на не самый лучший геймплей. Ведь когда ты видишь описание "улучшите на максимум" в голову ничего больше не приходит как осознание того что тебя ждёт фарм часов на 5-10. Но эта ачива сильно врезалась мне в глаза и поэтому я, взяв фонарь, кирку и припасы пошёл покорять это творение. На моё удивление игра меня даже затянула и мне самому хотелось искать секреты, пройти как можно больше пещер и получить как можно больше достижений.
Нет чего-то особого что можно было бы про игру сказать, за исключением музыки в некоторых местах. Вот честно, если бы я не видел картинку на экране я бы подумал что играю в Skyhill и Grim Dawn. Уж не знаю, сделано ли специально или нет но... Хотя... пока я проходил игру, я нашёл много разных отсылок на игры и фильмы, поэтому я бы не сильно удивился если бы и музыка была отсылкой. 
От себя хочу лишь сказать что игрой я остался НА УДИВЛЕНИЕ доволен. 
Штош, спасибо за внимание и хорошего вам времени суток!

author: {'steamid': '76561198887998523', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1656005946}
review:
Dobra gierka!

Szukasz gry mincecraft, ale tylko jaskiniowe przygody, to ta gra jest w sam raz dla cb!

Dochodzimy do miasta, które jest naszą główną lokacją tam dostajemy wskazówki od robotów, z jednym można się handlować kupując śrubki, które potem możesz wykorzystywać na różnego typu ulepszenia własnej postaci (więcej żyć, więcej miejsc na rudy, a także ulepszać gadżety jakie z czasem fabuły będzie się zdobywało). Jest także robot, któremu sprzedajemy nasze wykopane rudy i on nam daje za to monety, które potem wydajemy na lepszy kilof, który szybciej będzie rozwalał rudy, kamienie. Można też ulepszyć swój pancerz, aby zadawane przez przeciwników w jaskini obrażenia były bardziej redukowane.

Gierka ma własną fabułę, która po jakimś czasie jebnie takim basem, że sam się zesrasz czy na pewno jesteś w grze od 7 lat czy od 12. Gierka ma momenty dość straszne i na pierwszy rzut oka patrząc na zdjęcia, tego nie widać! 
Dodatkowo trzeba dodać, że gierka posiada challenge, takie jak nie zgiń ani razu, przejdź grę mając ulepszone rzeczy na maksa itd. Także gierka ma pełno sekretów, które są polokowane w jaskiniach, a także na samym początku gry!

Gierka wciąga bardzo szybko i przejście jej zajmie troszkę czasu, więc zabawy nie powinno ci zabraknąć.

Moja ocena gry 9/10

review:
What an amazing game
Constantly engaging with an amazing gameplay loop.
Dig and explore, upgrade, dig and explore faster/better, repeat

Probably one of my top three metroidvania:
1- Hollow Knight
2- Ori 1 & 2
3- Steam world dig 2

Do yourself a favour and try it out

review:
this has got be one of my favorite games of all time

Gameplay is lots of fun, doing every trial/shrine/whatever isn't a chore, incredible sound design & music, and the artwork is very unique and just feels... right, I guess?
The only bad thing is that its kind of short. DEFINITELY worth it though

author: {'steamid': '76561198032883708', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1674120965}
review:
Это прекраснейшая игра о которой все забыли. Этот дизайн, геймплей, саундтрек и сюжет который стоит выше множества ААА-игр. Я все идеально расскажу об этой игре по подробностям пытаясь нечего не заспойлернуть.
Основное:
Саундтрек. Просто превосходный хотя и кажется простым если начать его слушать можно понять насколько он велик. (хотя когда я пытался найти последние проценты меня начал доставать тема локации Ярроу). 
Дизайн. Это невероятно изумительный, потрясающий пейзаж. Некоторые локации прекрасные до такой степени, что я иногда просто разбирал задники вместо прохождения игры. Также большую часть занимают как некоторых персонажей нарисовали. (ОСТОРОЖНО ВОЗМОЖНО СПОЙЛЕР). К примеру возьмем братьев Ёнкеров которые застряли в шахте и не могут выбраться. У них у всех одинаковые волосы которые легко заметить и не предать смысл такому, но у всей семьи Ёнкеров одинаковые розовые волосы. (СПОЙЛЕР ЗАКОНЧИЛСЯ). Даже наш спутник по имени Фен можно увидеть что она намного отличается от своих сородичей. (Я считаю это не спойлер и она девушка!!!).
Сюжет. Весь сюжет частей Steamworld находится в одной вселенной переплетение всех частей сложно не заметить. Всё начинается после того как главный герой первой части ушёл из своего города не попрощавшись. Его подруга начинает путешествовать ради того чтобы узнать что случилось с ним после первой части игры. Весь сюжет очень связан с первой частью так что не грех пройти ещё и первую часть. 
Геймплей. Геймплей на высшем уровне. Множество приспособлений которые помогут в трудную секунду очень хороши, а улучшения на оружия делает игру очень приятной и веселой. Платформинг не настолько сложный как можно подумать. Все эти инструменты и улучшения прекрасно дополняют игру.
Дополнение:
Как я нашёл эту игру. Когда я был младше я увидел первую часть игры на Youtube и дальше мне понравилась концепция игры и сюжет. Через много лет я вспомнил об игре и узнал что есть сиквел и поиграл сначала в него, а потом уже и сам в первую часть сыграл. (Сначала прошёл сиквел на PS4, а потом уже и на компьютере).
Достижения. Эти достижения не дадут заскучать, а от достижений "Невероятный сон" и " В ад и обратно" заставят вас устроить взрыв Хиросимы у себя дома. А некоторые заставят повеселится и показать себя на 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325369895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1664046726}

author: {'steamid': '76561198208520808', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1663427916}
review:
It is pretty much the exact same gameplayloop as in the first game. If you liked the first game you ll most definitly love this one aswell. Its a chill relaxing atmosphere exploring those mines. I recommend playing the first game first since this games story connects with the story of the first game.

Oh also this was the first game I played through on the steamdeck only and Id say this game is perfect for someone that looks for an easy layed back chill streamdeck game. Had some really fun relaxing time with this one and I hope they make a 3rd game for me to play on the steamdeck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116332284', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1663457487}
review:
Hacía tiempo que no jugaba un juego tan bueno.

La jugabilidad es fantástica, la curva de dificultad equilibrada (con un modo difícil opcional), el mapa muy intuitivo y a pesar de que es extenso, no te pierdes. La cámara es fija, por lo que no marea nada, la historia no está nada mal, aunque los diálogos son magnificos. Muy divertido y en muchas ocasiones emocionante. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971006349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1663181973}
review:
Really fun, chill game with a gorgeously vibrant art style. In SteamWorld Dig 2 you dig in into the ground to mine for resources and find upgrades to dig further, reach new places and progress the story. The simple gameplay loop is pretty addictive so you always want to go for one more dive. The difficulty is forgiving and there are multiple ways to further adjust the gameplay to your liking with the cog-mods, making this a good game to relax with.

Haven't heard a lot of talk about it so it feels a bit like a hidden gem of the genre and definitely worth a shot if you like platformers and metroidvanias!

author: {'steamid': '76561198223631980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1699955139}
review:
Хорошая, приятная игра с хорошо настроенными механиками и интересным дизайном уровней.

ПЛЮСЫ:
 • нельзя прыгать и махать киркой. Вроде должно быть минусом - а нет. Пока Дороти в шахтах, этот момент немного охлаждает пыл новоиспечённого шахтёра, не позволяя разобрать рудник по камушкам, а добычу ресурсов превращает в мини пазл - придумать ещё надо, как пробраться.

• прогрессия и перки. У дороти есть очень много возможностей для апгрейда: исследуя шахты, Дот может разжиться очень полезными штуками, такими как бур, крюк-кошка, более мощная броня и т.д. Для этих плюшек у местного механика можно купить улучшения. Каждое новое улучшение открывает новый перк для конкретного инструмента, который затем можно активировать, вложив в него требуемое количество шестерёнок. Что приятно: перки можно выключать, позволяя при этом вкачать высвобождевшиеся шестерни в другие перки. Так можно можно смело пробовать разные навыки или пересобирать билд под разные ситуации. Например, когда игра вдруг вспоминает, что она ещё и метроидвания и начинает подкидывать боссов.

• много... Очень много подземелий! При чём эти подземелья битком забиты всякими секретами, загадками, опциональными пещерами с секретами и загадками и, конечно же, лутом и шестернями, за которые покупаются апгрейды, которые потом позволяют тебе добывать ещё больше ресурсов! Лепота! 

• в игре полно всяких приятных мелочей. Сюжет, хоть и простой и скорее всего уместится на одной странице вордовского  документа, всё равно интригует. Даже один "вотэтоповорот" есть. Все локации в игре разнообразны и довольно здорово нарисованы, а психоделический саундтрек El Huevero (его реально так зовут), в отличие от многих игровых саундтреков, можно слушать, как говорится, из коробки: в оригинальной аранжировке и вне так называемых medley. Так же Дот может отыскать в шахтах трубы для быстрого перемещения, а через убийства врагов можно пополнить запасы здоровья, воды или горючего для лампы, чтобы лишний раз не бегать на поверхность. Короче, хорошо разрабы постарались, на 4+!

МИНУСЫ:
• пердически игра включает режим метроидвании или пазл-платформера... - и знатно так кладёт в штаны. Например, из-за вышеупомянутого ограничения про кирку и прыжок, все боссы и некоторые враги становятся настоящей занозой в заднице. Кроме этого время от времени разрабы хотят протестить навыки игрока, заставляя его проходить через полосу припяствий. В половине таких случаев этих разрабов хочется посадить жопой на шипы из классических частей соника. Про гестаповские огенные или кислотные капли, вечно стекающие в некоторых локациях с потолка, я вообще говорить не хочу... Благо, таких моментов не так уж и много, а при прохождении опциональных пещер с испытаниями, в случае смерти, ГГ не теряет весь лут, а здоровье востанавливается до значений до входа в пещеру. 

• Игра проходится за 10 часов (с относительно тщательным посиком секретов и шестерен) - мало! Хочется ещё! Особенно не хватило какого-нибудь финального забега перед последним боссом, где нужно было бы использовать все способности Дороти.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049830553', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1662931411}
review: El perfeccionamiento de la fórmula del primero, es perfecto en todos los aspectos: mazmorras, exploración, puzzles, progreso, etc. Es muy difícil pensar en seguir la saga "Dig" porque no queda ningún aspecto a pulir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003949636', 'num_games_owned': 2662, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1590971996}
review:
Surprisingly solid sequel to a fairly unique game. This embraces the more metroidvania elements of it's predecesor more directly, creating a true sequel that feels like a natural progression of the original's mechanics and an expansion on them. Can fool you a bit in the beginning, but this game expands to quite an adventure with a good mix of exploration and platforming. Like it the first game, combat is the real weakpoint, being fairly basic but I think the game is definitely worth playing and tolerating this lesser element. 

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198199856874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1656596237}
review:
엔딩 보고 삭제했는데 플레이타임이 20시간 찍혔네요.
켜놓고 딴 짓한 시간도 많고 수집요소 잡으러 돌아다닌 것도 많아서 아마 보통은 이보다 적게 걸릴 겁니다.

이런 장르에서 기대할 수 있는 요소들(기능 업그레이드, 미니던전, 보스전 등...)이 부족한 것 없이 있는, 적당히 잘 만들어진 무난한 게임입니다.

개인적으론 이런 게임을 할 땐 몰입해서 모든 NPC들에게 말 걸고 세계를 이곳저곳 탐험하길 좋아하는 편인데, 1편을 안 해서 그런진 몰라도 스토리나 세계관이 크게 흥미롭진 않았습니다.
그렇지만 게임 자체는 재밌게 했습니다.

review:
[h1]Digging Deep on Simplicity[/h1]

Dig, fight, loot & solve puzzles... get back to town, sell spoils and upgrade/customize your (many) tools... repeat. An easy relaxed journey, with room for a real challenge for achievement hunters. Controls great on gamepad. My first playthrough took about 9 hours. 

A solid little Gem

挖矿挖矿，挖矿游戏

成就党提示
有两个大后期的成就，不能进机器关卡，建議备份存档 
地图上也有许多隐藏区域

成就"Sequence Breaker" & "Solid Sneak"
[spoiler]精灵凡会提醒是否准备好进入，进去后会自动存档也无法中断了，出来也只会获得半成品的喷射引擎，有两成就不能进去,一个是序列破坏者(通常指不造顺序游玩游戏) ，另一个是 不碰到超过一只幽灵(一次性) [/spoiler]
像我不小心跟进了任务指引错过成就机会了，在往后就可以准备结局了~

author: {'steamid': '76561198149281429', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1636802880}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090082186', 'num_games_owned': 2294, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1660669542}
review:
Same as the first part, but... Harder, faster, better, stronger.

You can check my review on previous Steamworld dig [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/kiko_kitsune/recommended/252410/] here [/url]

I can just only add the game became better in any direction. It is more challenging and more addictive now. But it is the same gameplay as before. In your disposal more perks and upgrades for your tools and weapons, more secrets and bonuses. It has everything for that I love metroidvania genre. Buy SWD2 if you like it too. And rest assured, the game will give you many hours of fun and positive emotions. I am gonna buy all the developer's games. They earned my loyalty with that dilogy.

P.s. All my reviews you can find [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/kiko_kitsune/recommended/] here [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198081290221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1660548777}
review:
La direction artistique est vraiment chouette. On retrouve cette ambiance Steampunk loufoque avec nos robots 'cowboy' que l'on avait croisés dans un précédent jeu des développeurs (SteamWorld Heist).

Les compositions musicales sont sympas, mais malheureusement en nombre insuffisant. Il y a donc une certaine redondance des ambiances lorsque l'on reste longtemps dans une zone.

Du point de vue du gameplay, j'ai apprécié la grande liberté qui nous est offerte. C'est l'un des points forts du jeu, qui repose sur l'exploration. Vous vous dirigez, armé de votre pioche et quelques outils (à découvrir), où vous souhaitez, et ce sans contrainte. Il est même possible de désactiver le marqueur de quête (ce que je recommande) pour une meilleure immersion.

Les combats sont peu nombreux, c'est à dire peu de "combats de boss". Ce n'est pas le coeur du jeu. Cela ne m'a pas dérangé, mais il faut le noter.

En revanche, il y a beaucoup de puzzles, et beaucoup de passages et autres secrets à découvrir, par la voie de l'exploration. J'ai vraiment apprécié.

J'ai bien aimé les nombreux clins d'oeil et références cités dans les descriptions de nos artefacts.

Du point de vue la durée de vie, il faut compter une vingtaine d'heures de jeu pour en venir à bout en prenant son temps.

En conclusion, SteamWorld Dig 2 est un très bon petit jeu de puzzles/plateformes avec des élements de Metroidvania. Les amateurs du genre apprécieront.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970416306', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1659133160}
review: This game is a huge improvement compared to the first Steamworld Dig (which was already great FYI). It's an almost perfect metroidvania, with excellent level design, funny characters, great controls, tons of secrets to discover, no needless backtracking and colorful graphics. Very, very recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992071236', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1660253517}
review: I played SteamWorld Dig 1 for about 30 minutes years ago and didn't feel much interest in playing it. I started playing SteamWorld Dig 2 and could literally not put it down. It's an interesting blend of metroidvania with tile-based digging that's more tactical than you'd think. It is amazingly polished, has great gameplay, amazing music, great art, high skill ceiling movement and feels perfectly balanced with enough modifiers that let you scale the game harder or easier as you like. It's as close to a Perfect game as I can think of in recent memory, I'd say the only thing I'd want is slightly more character narrative but that's a nitpick at best. Because I'm a degenerate I wish the game was 3x longer, but it never overstays its welcome and constantly gives you new abilities and upgrades that make you go, [i]"are they allowed to give this to me?!".[/i] I had a blast playing it and would highly recommend. I can't wait for them to make another one, I'll be there Day 1.

It has the challenge caves.
Some require you to sit and think about the solution for a bit, others require upgrades to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136390646', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1659248471}
review: SteamWorld Dig was already an extremely impressive and fun game, and SteamWorld Dig 2 is in every way better. It's more fun to control, the environments are more unique and the story is more engaging. I love this game so much that it's one of the few games that I 100% completed on my first run. If there's ever a SteamWorld Dig 3, I wish the developers well, because it will be hard to surpass this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096079278', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1659323232}
review: This is a good sequel to a good game. Everything that I liked about the first game is back-- go see my review of the first game. This game continues the story from it's predecessor but with a new protagonist. The gameplay is pretty similar to the first game, with a similar satisfying progression, but with lots of new and cool mechanics. There are plenty of secrets to find so exploration is really satisfying. The artwork and soundtrack are good, but I have to say the ending is a little dark considering the cutesy steampunk Old West robots theme. The ending felt incongruent with the overall tone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260102625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1659216417}
review: Un gran metroidvania dentro del universo steampunk. Esta secuela es un metroidvania mucho mas completo que el anterior, sin embargo justamente por eso se siente un poco mas genérico y como que perdió un poco la esencia del anterior. A pesar de todo solo es mi opinión, ya que la mayoría prefiere este juego frente a su predecesor. Este tanto como el anterior son extremadamente recomendables para juegos metroidvanias un poco mas diferentes que el resto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198805005266', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1703787983}
review:
Honestly Very pleasantly surprised! 
I expected a classic platformer but this was a very nice aesthetic puzzle/platformer mixed in
The music fits very well, definitely one of my favorite parts of this game

Had a bit of trouble cause I havent played puzzle games in a while but gave me a good nostalgic feeling and I would definitely recommend for people looking for a more chill game right now :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198882808138', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1648324848}
review: Хороших отзывов вы и так начитаетесь, потому я расскажу о моей проблеме. Самое главное препятствие - это ограниченность ресурсов. В какой то момент у меня просто кончились ресурсы на покупку снаряжения. Из за этого я не могу получить соответствующую ачивку в данном прохождении. Да, я выкопал ВСЕ минералы во ВСЕХ регионах. Гриндить кучу монстров ради копеек мне не особо хочется. Вот и получается огромная проблема которую разработчики никак не решили. Можно было бы добавить некую арену, где мы, например, должны были бы накопать определённое количество минералов за время или убить врагов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133624401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1658751693}
review:
Just finished it. It was pretty good. In a lot of ways in is a noticeable expansion of the original Steamworld and puts some interesting twists on the mechanics and story. In fact, "remixed expansion" is the perfect term for this game. You have a character (Dorothy) who has many of the same abilities as the original protagonist Rusty, but they are subtly altered to rectify some of the problems of the original. You get the run out of the gate, a timed bomb replaces the rocket fist, you get a hook shot in place of a steam jump, you get a jackhammer instead of a drill, and you get a jet pack in place of the spark dash. Over all the tools you're given feel much more apt for building on the difficulty.

Sadly the enemies are a pain to deal with. While rusty had the tools to effectively and quickly dispatch most enemies, Dot doesn't have that luxury. Aside from the starting insects, most enemies you "fight" will often stomp you into the ground during the early game simply because you don't have a cost effective means of dispatching them. The birds and snails are particularly guilty of this as in order to dispatch these fast moving enemies (yes, the snail is fast, don't ask) you have to time a shot on your bomb arm, which itself is set to a timer. Meaning that you spend a lot of time dropping down, shooting at an enemy, then climbing out of the way as you wait for the bomb to go off. Not bad by itself, but it gets tedious when you add in that bombs are connected to your water supply - meaning that this tool which is near essential for some enemies has a handful of uses before you have to haul your butt back to a water source. 

Speaking of hauling yourself back up to town - the light is back and it is just as big a waste of time as before. I was hoping they would add some mechanics to play with it, like ghosts or something (they do play around with "ghost in the machine" nonsense, so I don't see why not), but instead they do nothing with it. In fact, they added an upgrade that pretty much makes end game light a non-issue. There are a few upgrades like that and it reeks of "well do you have a better idea?".

I've been pretty negative, but I do recommend this game. It is fun and I was curious what it was all building towards. The characters and the art style make it a pleasant enough experience, even if the writing leaves me feeling a bit cold. And I guess this is where my big crituque comes in: the story is nonsense. I don't want to spoil it, but if you played SteamWorld Heist and was excited to see how Fen got to be the way he is... we don't get that. There is some serious retconning going on and that has always been a personal pet peeve of mine. Even worse, there is a twist ending that somehow raises more questions than it answers. So we have a retcon for a twist ending that leads to unsatisfying answers and leaves holes in the tale.... Why? Even so, it is delivered well enough so I can't complain too much.

This game is SteamWorld Dig: More Please. If you want *more* of SteamWorld Dig, this is the game for you. And you know what? I do want more. Even after all this game put me through, I came away with an overall positive feeling and would like another game in the series. Maybe one set in space like Heist was? Maybe tell us what became of our main characters in this era?

Oh and one last thing: devs, if you ever put a super difficult secret challenge at the end of a game, please do not make the reward for said challenge a "conglaturations, you iz best a gaymz". I don't care about achievements that much - give me a bit of lore about the world. That I will accept as a reward. The reward you set at the end was nearly as insufferable as your puns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043964299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1658683302}
review:
THE GAME HAS A ROUGH START.

This is an interesting genre fusion of a metroidvania with destructible environments. Oh and there's a plot. Even though not much is known at first. Most of it is environmental storytelling. 

THE PROBLEM is that in the beginning you are too limited in resources so you are forced to go back to town every couple minutes. Your lamp oil runs out fast. Your water tank runs out fast. Your backpack space runs out fast. And if you are careless you health runs out too. You feel like you spend as much time going back to town as you spend in the underground. But after A LOT of upgrades you overcome these issues. It does take a while though, You will spend about 50% of the game like this. Afterwards it feels more like a metroidvania, and you get more plot, and the destructible environments give it a weird feeling of belonging. Kinda like minecraft.

Not as good as Hollow Knight, Ori 1 and 2, Bloodstained. Doesn't sound much like and endorsement sorry. But it is a god game.

review:
Completed the game taking my time at 7 hours. 

Its the continuation of SteamDig 1 with additional content and movesets. Its a bit better in terms of gameloop instead of changing maps\regions, its all in 1 big one. 

The story though feels lacking even compared to the first one. 

Pros
- upgraded movesets
- Decent length
- Good enough map diversity

Cons
- Story was so simple and lacking. Didnt even explain what actually happened to MC in 1st game

author: {'steamid': '76561197978698186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1657429300}
review: The mechanics of the game are well done, and the digging aspect is really nice. That being said, this game was WAY too easy. Only a couple 'bosses', if you can call them that. If you want a mining experience with very sparse enemies once in a while, maybe this game is for you. If you want a metroidvania, with cool bosses and great action, skip this one, as it is not that. There are upgrades you can get to your various items, and that system feels good. The story is pretty lacking, though. I wanted to love this game, but it just doesn't deliver where a real metroidvania should. Needs more mobs, and more than like, 2 bosses.

Игра не является идеальной и совершенной, но поиграть в нее стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448899451', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1700774291}
review: Now on my fifth playthrough of the game, and it is absolutely beautiful. The story is so captivating, and I really really got into the characters. I'd say it is important to play the first game to have an idea of what the plot beforehand looks like, but Steamworld Dig 2 can be played on it's own. It improves on the first installment in so many ways. All of the music and art is beautiful and the secrets make the game so much more fun. Having to use my brain to figure out all of the secrets in the dungeons was so nice, but it wasn't so hard that I would become frustrated. I've been playing this playthrough on Linux running through the proton compatibility layer (Version 7.03) and it's worked like a charm, so those playing on a Steam Deck will have an amazing experience. Many many nights playing this game until the early morning, and many more to come. Give Steamworld Dig 2 a try, you'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010270718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1614060934}
review:
The Steam World games are all way better than they have any right to be. 
As a sequel, 10/10
As a metroidvania, 9.5/10
Polished, fun, and long enough to be satisfying but short enough it doesn't over stay it's welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198879306636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1688410960}
review:
Je trouve le jeu est très qualitatif.
Les différents powerups changent vraiment la façon de jouer dans le bon sens du terme et ouvrent plein de possibilités. Ca donne d'ailleurs quelques possibilités pour douiller le jeu et accéder à des endroits à l'avance, mais sans casser le jeu pour autant.
Le jeu présente du défi, que ce soit au niveau de l'histoire ou des objectifs secondaires (notamment la dernière épreuve).
Je trouve également que les collectibles sont très bien dissimulés, tout en restant accessibles et avec des indices.
Le scénario de l'histoire n'est pas révolutionnaire mais permet quand même d'avoir un objectif et de s'attacher un peu aux personnages.
Je recommande !

author: {'steamid': '76561199022491112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1657658746}
review:
I don't like Metroidvanias. I find very annoying to return several times to the same areas trying to find secrets. I like my games more straightforward, with only one or maybe two secret areas. So I had "SteamWorld Dig 2" in my Wishlist at least for a year, waiting for a good discount, and expecting a game I would play for 10 minutes before giving up and uninstall it from my laptop.

Man, I was SO wrong. This game is FREAKING ADDICTIVE!

Controls are user friendly, the underground world is great to explore, and missions are not too complicated, not too easy. Perfect if you are a casual gamer who wants to spend 30 minutes, or if you want to spend 2 hours finding secret entrances.

Avoid this game like the plague if you have a deadline in your work, you need to study for an exam, or if you want to keep a happy marriage :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198985438158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2433, 'last_played': 1657553341}
review:
На удивление игра оказалась интересной и превзошла мои ожидания, ведь мало чего ожидаешь от бесплатно полученной игры с забавными персонажами. За время прохождения игры немного напрягало, что повествование крутится вокруг сугубо женских персонажей, но это было до того, как мне в голову прошло возможное развитие сюжета.
*Тех, кто игра в другие части данной игры и глубже знаком с сюжетом, прошу сильно не ругать мои версии, ведь я проходит только эту игру из всего набора(доступного в стим) и не знаком с историей первой части.

Версия первая:
Дороти представляет из себя молодую девушку, которая влюблена в очаровательного парня по имени Расти. У расти есть мать, которая предстаёт в образу псевдо сильной и независимой. Этой матерью является Рози, которая использует сына в качестве эмоционального ресурса и видит в страшном сне, как его сынуля может повзрослеть и уехать. Для этого она запирает сына в его комнате, а его девушку дает странный вариант развития событий, при котором она и не знает где Расти и вообще есть задание, которые могло бы помочь его найти. В этом мире разные поколения показаны разными существами: 1 молодое поколение представляет из себе более технологичную версию человека в виде роботов, пусть и развитых не во всех смыслах 2 более взрослое поколение, которое представляет из себя существ, больше похожих на людей с явными признаками отсталости общества в виде странных нарядов и предметов в руках. Также есть шахта, что есть образ внешнего мира со своими проблемами и "монстрами", но и с большим количеством возможностей и ресурсов. 

Версия вторая:
Дороти является образом беззакония и жестокости. В мире, где в гармонии существуют люди и животные, внезапно появляется робот. Этот робот занимается полным расхищением подземных ископаемых, зачисткой грабниц (с последующей продажей награбленного третьим лицам), убийством различных существ(по действиям улитки видно что она защищается и не преследует нападающего, а наоборот старается укатиться). в финале игры, после полного опустошения шахт, Дороти бросает вызов Оставшемся в живых людям. Лидер людей, понимая суть происходящего, строит меха для уничтожения захватчиков, но Дороти убивает её. После финальной битвы, из-за перегрузок, возможно вызванных вмешательством Рози, планета взрывается, а вместе с ней и все люди.
Также в игре представлены фанатики, кто является отдельным видом существ, так как я вижу их как людей, желающих спокойствия. Для своих целей они нашли старого робота, который мог испепелять всё живое и надеялись что он подарит им свободу. В их группе был Пророк, который знал наперёд все планы и людей и машин, при этом никак не вмешивался в происходящее, ведь они хотели лишь прощения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198967761281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1658454749}
review:
Это наверное моя самая любимая игра, не знаю чем именно, но глубоко вьелась в сердце. Очень давно, наверное в году, эдак, 14 проходила 1 часть, сразу же влюбилась в эту игру, ждала выхода 2 части, хоть каких-то новостей. Со временем забылось, я все равно помнила об этой игре, и как-то болтая с другом зашел разговор на тему любимых игр. Я собственно говоря говорю о SWD и что так сильно ждала 2 часть, на что мне отвечают: "Лол, так 2 часть вышла уже давно". Я молча закрываю диалог, ищу 2 часть, устанавливаю, подключаю геймпад и играю на одном дыхании до утра...
Прекрасная атмосферная игрушка, с приятными саундами, весьма забавными диалогами. Ну и я просто люблю платформеры и стимпанк.... 
Возможно не зайдет концовка игры, но в целом она очень приятная, ламповая и я ее люблю.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198025518269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1681096539}
review:
In a sea of trash, this is a game that captures the imagination and makes you feel like you're playing a favorite game from your childhood but for the first time. The polish is off the charts. Responsive intuitive controls, fun mechanics, freaking amazing art direction, a chill soundtrack, and a core gameplay loop that's strangely engaging.

Easily one of the most enjoyable games I've ever played. [b]I couldn't stop playing it or thinking about it.[/b] What a blast! It reminds me of an XBLA game I played long ago called [url=store.steampowered.com/app/1441790/Miner_Dig_Deep/]Miner: Dig Deep[/url], but heavily expands the adventure and puzzle elements.

You'd think digging for 12+ hours might get boring, but nope. Upgrades! And this isn't the bog standard uninspired derivative junk of every other game. Each upgrade has unique properties that change the dynamics. None of this +1, +2, +3 stat crap. Actual game design!

There's awesome challenge rooms, lots to explore, secrets, a cute little story. Hop, skip, jump, grapple, swim, and dig! My only minor complaints are the lack of enemy variety and slightly wonky structuring of the game's pacing and twist, and the game is rendered at 1920x1080, so the graphics are a little pixelated at higher resolutions.

The game is always giving you something new and interesting to do and every second of it is of the highest quality. This is one of the few non-Nintendo games I could see being made by Nintendo and that's the highest praise I can give it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970633599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1654269834}
review:
Lots of quality-of-life improvements over the first one with a more interconnected, Metroidvania-style map. I love the extra mobility; particularly being able to move upward. It expands on the original in many ways, but I feel it lost some of the charm. I prefer the goofy simplicity of the first one. This one gets dark and dramatic, but I didn't feel emotionally attached to the main character or the story.

I personally did not care for the music. I understand wanting to mix a bunch of styles because it's a robot western, but most of the soundtrack felt stale to me. The hub music really annoyed me. Tune your bass!

review: Неплохая игра. По сравнению с первой частью переделали прокачку. Теперь не все покупается за деньги и есть смысл шариться по секретам. Ввели индикацию в % для локаций сколько секретов вы нашли + помечаются подземелья что вы уже полностью зачистили. Из минусов в храмах ближе в финальным подземельям будут другие подземелья с секретами и нет подсказки что у тебя еще нет нужных улучшений чтобы его пройти. В итоге умирая и мучаясь ты понимаешь это сам. Странное решение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198882910931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1654954009}
review: Muy buen juego. Entretenidísimo. Es un juego de picar, picar y picar. Pero, no sé que tiene, que me ha enganchado muchísimo. Dejé a mi novia por jugar la primera parte y, cuando quería volver con ella, va y sale esta segunda. Cuando me lo acabé, ya estaba con otro. Terrible. Lloré mucho. Pero me ha gustado mucho el juego por sus variedades de biomas, distintos artilugios, jefes... Continúa con la historia del primero (que si todavía no lo tienes ya sabes que comprar) y mejora mucho su banda sonora, apartado gráfico y arte. Mejora muchas características del primero, con más secretos, steambots y misiones secundarias. Y, por cierto, va antes del SteamWorld Heist, con una historia que enlaza todos estos juegos... Un juego indispensable. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992206547', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1656172282}
review:
First thing you see in the game is a message that the game should be played with controler. After starting the game I quickly found out that the controls suck with K/M input. You can rebind, but that messes up everything and you will have to rebind everything. I mean this is just lazy from the devs.  Add at least a normal K/M preset with normal WASD movement in a platformer game.

It also does not help that this game is co-funded by the nazi supporting European Union. Which was the second splashscreen I saw after starting up the game for the first time.

So no, I do not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389560283', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1682602366}
review:
It builds on everything the first game had. Drill becomes a powerjack, double jump becomes a hookshot, that steam-cannon or whatever became a grenade launcher. There's even an entirely new cog system which allows you to install "mods" that allow you to change the functionality of certain items. It's objectively a perfect sequel and subjectively a fun game in of itself. I remember playing the first game back on my 3DS years ago, so this game had to beat quite som nostalgia. To my surprise... it really did.

And your computer WILL be able to run this game. If you have a laptop or a Steam Deck, then this will be great for you since it drains next to no battery.

9/10 
I'd relive it for the first time if I could. This game made me happy when nothing else did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236632390', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1637284440}
review:
Joguei o 2 sem ter finalizado o primeiro. Se esse for o seu caso, pode ir na fé. A história é uma sequência do primeiro, mas explica basicamente tudo o que você precisa para entender esse universo.

Os personagens são muito carismáticos, e possuem algumas referências externas. Possui muito tom de sátira, e talvez esse seja o maior charme dele.

A trilha sonora desse jogo funciona em função do gameplay, você precisa jogar para entender, mas o fato é que é incrível o quão relaxante são as músicas. Acho que é impossível não comparar a trilha sonora de Donkey Kong Country.

O jogo tem uma dificuldade bem acima do normal, mas nada no extremo. Se você, como eu, acha que é algo parecido como Spelunky: não é. Ele é relativamente mais fácil, mas também é desafiador.

Os colecionáveis tem historinhas interessantes, e também compartilham de algumas críticas, não são meros colecionáveis, contribuem bastante para a experiência satírica.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980827404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1647951067}
review:
This game is great. Take the prior game and adds a whole new dimension to it. Ticks the exploration, combat, and progression boxes all just right. 

The only advice I have would be to play the first one before this, because if you do the reverse, then the first game will seem primitive in comparison.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132194853', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1655773712}
review:
Fun game. Not to long to overstay its welcome, and keeps tossing fun mechanics at you at a pretty good pace.

Story and gameplay have taken a much-welcomed turn for the better in regards to SteamWorld Dig 1. If you disliked SteamWorld Dig 1 due to its repetitive gameplay and nonexistent plot, SWD2 improves upon SWD1 in pretty much all fronts, and definitely is something to pick up.

Semi-spoiler:
[spoiler]SWD2 also ties into SteamWorld Heist, so fans of SteamWorld Heist should pick this up as well, if you're into the lore.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999110961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1655750837}
review:
This is an amazing follow-up to the original SteamWorld Dig. I got hooked really quickly and couldn't put it down. The game has a really nice balanced progression. Upgrades come steadily as you mine, so you feel like you're always progressing and getting stronger as you go, unlocking more access to other areas you couldn't access before. The music is nice too. I truly hope a 3rd game happens!

If I had to summarize this game in one quick description, I would call it "Mr. Driller mixed with Metroid." That's really what it felt like as I was playing. It's a Metroidvania but with Dig Dug / Mr. Driller mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054476162', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 982, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1655520973}
review:
穴掘り＋2Dアクションゲームで楽しかった。アクションゲーム部分と穴掘り、パズルっぽい部分が上手いバランスになっていると思う。ファストトラベルやシークレットの位置など、全体的に遊びやすく作られている印象。
言語設定に日本語はないものの、次に向かう場所は教えてくれるので遊べるはず。アクションゲームが好きなら間違いなくオススメ。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1654117766}
review:
What makes a perfect sequel? If you ask me (and you implicitly did because you’re reading this), I consider a perfect sequel one that takes everything the previous game did and builds on it in some way. It doesn’t miss any of what made the original good, whether that be in game design, balance, aesthetic, or feel, and only adds more on top of that rock-solid base. There are great sequels that don’t do this, of course, and instead choose to go far afield and make something bold and new that still relates to its roots. But we’re not talking about those games, because SteamWorld Dig 2 is what I call a perfect sequel. Everything that the first SteamWorld Dig did, this one does bigger and better, and then goes on to do even more that I never would have expected.

It’s been a spell since trusty ol’ Rusty disappeared down in the mines, last seen locked in combat with the deadly Vectron. Dorothy, the local shopkeep’s daughter, knows he’s still ticking out there somewhere, and has embarked on a rugged quest to find our wayward hero. The trail leads to an old trading town, perched atop another mine full of beasts and secrets, and we all know what our new heroine has to do there. Digging down through the layers of history, Dorothy discovers forgotten realms and ruins that hold the key to finding Rusty and understanding the strange earthquakes rattling the town. Along the way she’ll find plenty of valuable ores and gems, exactly what she needs to trade for upgrades to keep her tunneling ever further down. But this journey will take her beyond the confines of mine shafts and caverns, and into the clutches of some unexpected foes.

The premise of SteamWorld Dig 2 is definitely similar to the first, with a vast underground world to mine goodies from for the upgrades to mine even deeper. However, the scope of this one is so much greater than the three discrete zones you had to explore in the original. In fact, the tutorial area in 2 already promises a game that will stretch far and wide, with how unexpected it is and also the bits of lore it sprinkles in up front. This is a far more open game, with more creative areas to explore and more to do in each of them, with loads of optional caves and secret alcoves to reveal through clever use of your powers. Even when I made it to the endgame, there were still a load of collectibles and upgrades tucked away in places I never would have suspected.

Your powers and upgrades are a huge part of why this open design works so well. Honestly, this is one of the most fun and transformative arsenals I’ve ever seen in a metroidvania. The difference in capabilities between the start of the game and the end is monumental, and there were no less than three points where I was absolutely gobsmacked that the developers saw fit to give me a certain upgrade. You end up with so much more mobility and so many more options for pathfinding in SteamWorld Dig 2 compared to the first, yet every upgrade feels like a logical progression and fits perfectly into the game’s pacing. The addition of a fully parallel trait system on top of the powers and upgrades from the first is huge, allowing you to swap in new conveniences and capabilities for each of the abilities that you get. And the challenges are designed to push your understanding of these gifts, making them more challenging than before even as your character becomes far more powerful than in the original game.

The gameplay systems aren’t the only parts that got massive upgrades, either. SteamWorld Dig 2 is a gorgeous game, with wonderfully hand-drawn characters, lush environments brimming with color, superb visual effects, and rich sound design. Just running around the world and poking at things is a warm, inviting experience, and makes scouring for secrets more fun that you would ever expect. The story, unsurprisingly, is also a big step up from the first game, with a lot more twists and turns and an ending that I absolutely did not see coming. It’s also a significantly longer game, easily twice as big if not more, and they’ve packed every bit of the experience with something to see, do, or collect.

It’s the easiest recommendation in the world to say that, if you enjoyed the first SteamWorld Dig, then you’re guaranteed to love SteamWorld Dig 2. But even if you skipped the first one, this is a masterpiece of game design. The balance of mining, upgrading, exploring, and progressing is just about perfect, with no low points or frustrations. The new powers and traits flesh out the core gameplay in fantastic ways, and the improved presentation makes this one a joy to play through. I’m a big metroidvania fan to begin with, but SteamWorld Dig 2 has quickly become one of my favorites in the genre, with a sense of depth and freedom that few can match.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

review:
Отличный сиквел, привнесший много исправлений и улучшений:
- обновленная графика, ощущается глубина, детализация, игра света
- значительно расширенные система прокачки и инструментарий гг
- появился нормальный платформинг, ощущается вес персонажа, его инерция, гораздо приятнее прыгать по стенам
- адекватная система быстрых перемещений по шахте, несколько параллельных шахт вместо одной
- появился базовый сюжет

author: {'steamid': '76561198063269884', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1654920030}
review:
I'm not sure where or when I got this game...some bundle perhaps? I gave it a try because I'm on a bit of a Western theme kick. I'm also not generally good at platformer games but I do like to play them...within limits.

All that being said, this was a fun game. Fairly short though - I think i finished it around 6-8 hours and then spent a few more hours looking for secrets and achievement hunting. It's apparent that there is a lot of back story (I haven't played the first one) but it did a great job of telling the story and it actually makes me want to know more about the Steamworld universe. Not sure about the replay value. I don't have a lot of interest in speed running or trying to do it without dying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802287289', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1687618056}
review:
[h1]非常值得推荐！！[/h1]

简单说一下：
[b]游戏核心要素是：沙盒探索、解密、横板2D动作。[/b]

直接英文版玩的，一开始还不断查阅词典翻译对话来了解剧情，逐渐明白了故事情节。主角为了找失踪的朋友，结识了一个地下精灵Fen（姑且是个精灵吧，有点忘记它的自我介绍了😂，当时应该没仔细看，现在看来，算指点主角的引导人和同伴），开启了挖掘地下世界找朋友之路。
主角是个挖掘机器人，一开始在地下世界时，只能在有限的时间内探索、挖掘，随着打怪升级，卖水晶、矿石升级装备，以及不断地探索获得新技能（[spoiler] 挖掘、电钻、水枪、抓钩、短距离飞行[/spoiler] ），到后面可以自由地穿梭在整个地下世界。

游戏还有个收集神秘物品的成就，说实话，这个挺靠运气的，瞎闯瞎撞那种，目前通关了一次，再次进入游戏，陆陆续续找也才收集38个（omg，总共42个，太折磨了）我以为地图会全部点亮欸，通关了也才发现，仍存在黑暗区，一共有4种不同场地（[spoiler] 地上、岩石区、湿地区、岩浆区[/spoiler] ）（也不知道是不是还存在我没有发现的隐藏地图，应该没了吧，我上天入地边边角角都探过了😂）。

---------------------------------------------------------
以下涉及通关剧情，介意者请留步
---------------------------------------------------------

目前通关过一次，成功地赚取了我的眼泪😢。
[spoiler] 主角最终找到了朋友，但是精灵Fen为了主角能带着朋友离开即将毁灭的地下世界，它把主角和她朋友送出了地下世界。当主角和所有机器人一起坐上火箭离开这个星球后，这个星球就毁灭了😭😭😭！！！
我还想着下个任务该是主角寻找Fen了，没想到星球就没了！！炸没了！！！
😭😭😭我可爱的Fen！！！😭😭😭我可爱的Fen！！！😭😭😭我可爱的Fen！！！[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198929617756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1638791339}
review: I got this game for free at one point and I think it's very fun. The main aspect of this game is really just to mine ores and find hidden temples. I like the tools and upgrades for this to mine ores, although I do find the creatures a bit annoying to deal with and the main enemy of the game isn't very interesting. I say the most fun part is really the exploration and the mystery and the puzzles of the temples.

author: {'steamid': '76561198823459110', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1654874426}
review:
Une pépite cachée.

J'ai joué sur GOG puis sur Steam, et j'ai fini le jeu en 13h à 100% (c'est-à-dire obtenu l'entièreté des secrets des différentes zones et battu l'épreuve finale). 
Les graphismes sont beaux, mais c'est surtout fun. C'est simple, je ne me suis pas du tout ennuyé. 
On peut se déplacer fluidement. 
On peut affronter des ennemis simples mais bien pensés. 
On peut créer des passages dans la zone de minage, qui aideront à naviguer plus tard (jusqu'en endgame).
On peut aussi explorer les caves, qui sont en fait des énigmes diverses avec des récompenses à la clé.

Au fait, j'ai beaucoup apprécié tout faire exploser avec mon triple lance-grenades haha

author: {'steamid': '76561198111343074', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1654981290}
review:
Steam arayüzünde vakit harcarken denk gelmiştim,iyi-kötü yorum dengesi inanılmaz iyi olduğu için ve metacritic puanı 85 olduğu için ne zamandır istek listemde ekliydi,indirim gelince satın almıştım.
Spoiler vermeden oyunun temel amacını yazarsak;Madencilik,yani kıymetli taşlar buluyorsunuz,bunları toplayıp satıyorsunuz,biriktirdiğiniz paralarla eşyalarınızı geliştiriyorsunuz(veya cog bulup özelliklerinizi de dizayn edebiliyorsunuz),yeni yerler,değerli taşlar keşfedip daima ilerliyorsunuz.Grafikleri hoş(grafik olarak zombotron'a çok benziyor maden kısımları)
Hikayesi açıkcası benim tatmin etti diyebilirim ne iyi ne çok kötü...Yada şöyle diyeyim şuana kadar oyunda hiç diyalog olmasaydı eksiklik çeker miydim?Belkiii ama yine şuan ki gibi oynardım.Sonu baya üzücüydü bence :)

-Müzikleri gerçekten berbat,ciddi anlamda rahatsız ediyor.
-Takriben 2 saat dolayında oynamışımdır,şuana kadar yaratık veya npc tipleri hep aynı,yani yalnızca 2 farklı tür görebildim umarım çeşitlilik bu kadarla sınırlı değildir.(değilmiş,farklı düşman çeşitleri çıkıyor)
-Bunlardan ayrı bir eksiklik daha var ama bu eksiklik tam olarak aklıma gelmiyor evet garip bir durum ama bu oyuna her girdiğimde sanki 4 tarafı kapalı ve devamlı daralan kutu gibi bir yapının içerisinde ezilecekmişim gibi oluyor,sebebini çözemiyorum.

Vel hasıl:Öneriyorum,güzel vakit geçirebilirsiniz.Alıştığınız zaman saatlerin ne zaman geçtiğini hissetmiyorsunuz.Yalnız oyuna (şuana kadar oynadığım kadarıyla özellikle en son -'nin sebebiyle)benim puanım 85 değilde 81 falan olurdu.

review: Feels almost like an open-world, metroidvania Spelunky, which is fantastic. Great mechanics - a lot of times your abilities will be simultaneously attacks, movement, and a way to alter the environment, which in turn changes the setting for fighting enemies, and can set up environmental traps and chain reactions. Everything is super dynamic... The level design is also extremely well done for introducing mechanics in a structured way, with plenty of secrets everywhere and great pacing. Charming visuals and music as well - everything about this game is good, I just wish it was longer!

author: {'steamid': '76561198442058794', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1654137454}
review:
[h1]Продолжение первой части[/h1]

Это продолжение игры Steam World Dig, в которой мы играем за Дороти, робота, которая блуждает по планете, в поисках своего друга - Расти, прибывая в город Эль-Мачино, узнает что частные землетрясения беспокоят жителей, а так же узнает что, Расти, ранее появлялся в этом городе, отправившаяся в подземное приключение, ей предстоит увлекательные раскопки и тайны, которые ей приготовил город Эль-Мачино.

[h1]Геймплей[/h1]

В этой игре, уже другой арсенал инструментов, который знатно отличается от первой части, тут есть пневмо-кулак, пушка стреляющая липучими бомбами, крюк-кошка, реактивный ранец, которые разнообразили геймплей игры, но так же есть система копай - продавай, которая была и в первой части, однако, тут присутствует значительные улучшения, это уровни главного героя, и его улучшения за счет шестеренок, которые мы находим в ходе раскопок и поисках.

[h1]Мнение[/h1]

Это часть, далеко ушла о первой во всем, в сюжете, геймплее, атмосфере, очень приятно играть, так же замечательный саунд, который хочется слушать и слушать. Однозначно советую поиграть.

review:
Я крайне редко оставляю положительные отзывы, ибо, если игра хорошая всегда найдется тот, кто это сделает. Но черт возьми! Эта игра заслуживает, хотя бы минимального упоминания о себе. 
Эта игра, пусть и маленький, но шедевр. Маленький шедевр, который заставит трепетать от восторга каждого: от мала до велика. Маленький шедевр, который заслуживает того, чтобы его знали многие. Маленький шедевр, в который вам обязательно нужно сыграть!

review: Очень крутая игра. Напоминает по геймплею spelunky, а по графике ori and the blind forest. Музыка на фоне создаёт атмосферу уюта. Прошел на геймпаде, на нем комфортнее чем на клаве. Единственный минус - игра короткая.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1653652335}
review:
For some strange reason, I decided to try SteamWorld Dig 2 earlier this week.  I got it on a giveaway in November 2021, never expecting to ever play it.  The day that was never expected to come did arrive, and I was sucked into this game!

It's a simple game about digging, digging, and digging while doing the usual platformer stuff.  It has the metroid-vania mechanics that I guess every modern platformer is obligated to have.  Gaining new abilities is still as satisfying in SWD2 as it ever has been.

After I started playing SWD2, I checked my GOG Galaxy launcher, where I have linked all of my games accounts, and realized that I also have the first SteamWorld Dig game on EA's store.  I also got that for free at some point.  Maybe I should have played that one first, but I continued with SWD2 and just completed it.

The ending indicates unfinished business, but I don't see any indication of a SteamWorld Dig 3 in the five years since this game released.  A platformer with destructible terrain is a great concept, and I think it deserves to be explored again in a SWD3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040484521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1653680155}
review: All the exploration of Motherload and Terraria packed into a perfectly concise package. Easily in my top 10 games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997051619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1654391186}
review: I just loved this game to bits.  It's such a worthy successor to the original Steamworld Dig game!  The controls were easy to understand and the emphasis on exploring and selling resources remained intact.  The side characters were a lot of fun and the dialogue (along with the artifact descriptions) didn't take themselves too too seriously.  Good job artists! :D  As it is for a Metroidvania side-scroller game, I appreciated earning each upgrade by beating the mini cave-stages.  The game was mostly relaxing to me, but if you want a more hardcore experience, you can unlock some features as you advance during normal play.  Plenty of post-game content too if you'd like to collect all the gears and artifacts.

author: {'steamid': '76561199096509945', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1653420665}
review: SteamWorld Dig 2 to świetna platformówka, w której wcielamy się w żuka i eksplorujemy podziemia. Gra jest naprawdę przepiękna mimo swojej jako takiej prostoty. Produkcja opiera się głównie na kopaniu i cały ten system jest zrobiony wyśmienicie, z czasem ulepszamy swój kilof, lampę i różne gadżety, możemy schodzić coraz to głębiej do jaskiń. Przeciwnicy i lokacje są dość różnorodni i mimo tego kopania cały czas, gra ma nam coś nowego do zaoferowania. Jako chyba jedyny minus podaję cenę, za pełną kwotę raczej nie warto, ale choćby na moment pisania tej recenzji tytuł można kupić za 25zł, ja otrzymałem go za darmo i jestem bardzo zadowolony.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335721011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 593, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1653439185}
review:
Sequência do 1. Embora tenha saído um outro do universo SteamWorld antes.

Lembra o primeiro (duh!), porém tá uma espécie de "gourmet", digamos assim. Gráficos mais modernos.

É praticamente no mesmo nível do anterior, mas acredito que com algumas novas funções.

[i]O ponto negativo é que ao contrário do outro [u]não vem localizado em português[/u] =[. Portanto só vai ser um pouco melhor pro caso de você manjar o idioma.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078403549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 581, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1653208274}
review:
The good:
+ Fine story
+ Beautiful visual/artstyle
+ Nice soundtrack
+ Neat and mostly-balanced game mechanics
+ Some anti-frustration feature
+ Lots of options for easier or harder gameplay

The bad: -

The ugly:
* Using keyboard/mouse feels awkward, although i solved it with custom binding

I haven't played the prequel, but i really enjoy SteamWorld Dig 2. The gameplay is very fun and little grinding is needed, although the story is easily forgettable. I strongly recommend this game, even if you're not fan of platformer/metroidvania game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307373996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1653209349}
review:
Bastante divertido y adictivo. El tiempo que tengo jugado hasta esta reseña fue lo que me costó pasarlo con el 100% de secretos y objetos. 
En general es divertido pero para la gente que le gusta obtener el 100% de coleccionables, a veces es tedioso tener que estar buscando los objetos escondidos en las cavernas ya que en algunas, están muy bien escondidos.
Si te vas a lo speedrunner y te olvidas de obtener todas las mejoras y lo demás, creo que se quedaría corto de tiempo, la magia está en obtener todo si es que quieres que valga la pena la compra, así que recomiendo que le dediquen tiempo a minar y a apreciar un poco más el juego.

Calificación final: 8/10
Es muy buen juego y le hace honor a la primera entrega y puede que hasta sea mejor, pero siento que se vuelve un poco aburrido después de unas cuantas horas. Recomiendo que lo compres solo si está en oferta ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198162100572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1653171920}
review: Like the prequel - SteamWorld Dig 2 is fun game for everyone who likes some pickaxe action. Lots of exploring, lots of upgrades and cool mechanics, fun puzzles, alright boss battles. All in all very good game. Again it ends kinda on a cliffhanger, so maybe 3rd part is in the cooking? Hope so :).

author: {'steamid': '76561198105785707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1201, 'last_played': 1652810811}
review:
[h1]First of all, fuck the E.U.[/h1]

I generally avoid the Steamworld games because they're incredibly casual and formulaic. Nauseatingly so. I got this one because it was free and I like digging games.

This one didn't fall too far from the tree. The endgame feels like a marathon, where you're ticking boxes in a list, executing soulless platform challenges, finding all the secrets you're supposed to find and getting all the upgrades you're supposed to get in order. The upgrades are just there to annoyingly pad you out, for example they annoy you for several hours with a light mechanic that forces you to go back to town, and then suddenly you get an upgrade that makes light eternal.
The digging is acceptable but not very rewarding because platforming takes center stage and the quick travel back to town is too present.

The physics are very floaty and extremely annoying. Probably due to the fact they tried to include too many different movement schemes so they had to made bad compromises. It's  very difficult to land on the platform you want, almost impossible most of the time. And the grappling hook never fires the direction you want it to.
At the end of the game you'll be flying  everywhere anyway and won't need most of the movement skills you so patiently acquired.
The two bosses do that thing where they destroy all the platforms and you're left with a few single-tile platforms to avoid falling in lava and then the bad physics fuck you up.

Big thumb up to the game engine. The devs coded their own engine and this is really a breath of fresh air comparred to all the other devs who use a third party kiddie engine and are incapable of getting a simple 2D game to run correctly

The music OTOH, it's not that it's bad, but every song seems to be a 5-seconds-long loop. Extremely repetitive.

[h1](follow my curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33882793/]GenXPlayers[/url] for more retro and indie reviews)[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198065542223', 'num_games_owned': 1533, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1652747001}
review:
Steamworld dig 2 is a metroidvania platformer with mining elements added on top. You will be terraforming the levels as you go down in the mines and you can screw yourself up of minerals (money) if you're not careful. 

It can absolutely be played in short bursts and is enjoyable although a little repetitive if you want to go look for every single mineral or secret in this game. 

The tools the game gives you and the pace I think is great. Just when you finished mastering a tool you get another one and makes pleasant to traverse the same places with your new toys. 

I would absolutely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091433569', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 528, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1652746131}
review:
This game is much better then the first one but still has problems similar to the first one.
I finished the game with 60 % secrets found and upgraded most of my equipment and I flew through the game and the last boss. Not well balanced in terms of progression neither. The story is full of meaningless chit chat and ends on a low note.
Good game that has many flaws but in the end it is fun, just don't expect nothing special.

review:
Muy buen juego en formato 2D. En un principio no creí que fuese un buen juego, pero al jugarlo me sorprendió.
Historia buena, mecánicas de movilidad y ataque muy originales, mapeados increíbles que cuentan con pruebas y zonas ocultas, y bosses bastante buenos.
Lo recomiendo muchísimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198841610767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2542, 'last_played': 1652124152}
review:
En Steamworld dig 2 es un título de acción, aventura y exploración ambientado en un mundo estilo steampunk, cuya tarea principal será la excavación como pieza clave para descubrir nuevos mundos y artefactos debajo de la tierra que serán necesarios para resolver el misterio que envuelven a un viejo amigo; Tal vez su historia sea corta y simple, pero ofrece todo lo necesario para mantener al jugador un buen rato en la pantalla, enfrentándose a los retos que hay dentro de las minas, la búsqueda de todos los secretos y los logros que cuenta este videojuego. Para aquellos interesados en cazar un par de logros para su colección jajaja. 

Sus gráficos son agradables a la vista, una banda sonora excelente para los distintos entornos donde actualmente se encuentre el jugador con controles fáciles de aprender. 

En conclusión. Steamworld dig 2 es un juego agradable para mantenerse un rato agradable en la pantalla donde los distintos retos lo hace divertido para todos aquellos amantes de este genero de videojuego. 

Gracias por leer =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984180355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1646951554}
review:
This game is really good. Not too hard (except some of the puzzle rooms), the upgrades are interchangeable at the town, so if you need a certain extra help with an upgrade, or another one for something else, it's no problem. There are many cool gadgets to use, the NPCs are funny, and the game has a useful map, except for the puzzle rooms, those don't have maps. Puzzle rooms have a variety of challenges, there was one I just gave up on, but I could complete the others.
All in all, this is a gorgeous, cool metroidvania with a dig mechanic, I loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055498088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1651328452}
review:
In this 2D platformer game you go underground, digging your way down to explore caves, gather minerals, find and upgrade game-changing tools, fight threats, and uncover secrets. 

While the game's main loop of finding resources and returning above ground is not original, it excels it what it does while leaving some taste for more, so if you haven't played anything like that, and even if you have, I recommend the game on a sale. 

The average player will finish the game in 10-15 hours, while the dedicated player will find and solve all secrets in 15-25 hours, and the achievement hunter would need to speedrun the game without dying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326110786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1651655497}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045754600', 'num_games_owned': 1319, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1651525179}
review:
After years now of disappointing, overrated and frustrating games being recommended on Steam, reviewed highly or simply being the best of a mediocre bunch of recent releases, I always welcome gems (pun intended) like this game.

I stopped playing SteamWorld Dig 2 at about the 3 hour point years ago for reason I forget and recently came back to it and spent another 9 hours completing it. I'm so glad I did. 
After the frustrating mess that was The Messenger (which I've also reviewed), It has been refreshing that I have played two similar game (this and Metroid Dread) that have reinvigorated my hope in not only a genre of games, but the lackluster, disappointing games industry as a whole. After The Messenger, I was left feeling disheartened thinking that maybe the problem was me, maybe I just don't like these good games. But no, I have been proven right by these two games that have been a pleasure to play from start to finish.

Steamworld Dig 2 is a sweet, fun and very solid metroidvania with a heavy emphasis on digging your own path in an almost entirely filled map. You might think that this could get boring but the game always finds a way to stay interesting by doing things like:
- Introducing new enemies that may also affect the environment
- Having resource or gem placement that asks the player to deviate from their path and be creative in their tunnel planning.
- New hazards that often can be tackled with basic gear or traversed more efficiently with better gear.
- Challenge rooms that adds linear puzzles or platforming challenges to add variety to a game that has a simplistic core gameplay loop of digging and mining resources.
- Having upgrades with attainable prices that shake up how the player tackles certain obstacles.
- Unique locations with completely unique themes and challenges of their own
- Secrets to find all over. Many that are actually useful and rewarding to the player.
- Fun and lovable characters, including your player character who encapsulates the brave, young, slightly naive yet resourceful adventurer. I believe her character design and presentation was perfect for this kind of game that focuses so much on adventure and discovery.

These are what I feel are the games strongest features. Although I didn't think the story was particularly special, I think that the characters were interesting and had very believable and comedic writing. I'm still not entirely sure how I feel about the ending, If it links to the larger SteamWorld universe I would be very interesting. But as a story for a metroidvania that's focus is strong, varied gameplay it was a decent story.

When Did I Stop Playing?
Completed, I'm also likely to go back for all of the secrets as I wanted to get my thoughts written down while they were fresh in my mind. Since I didn't finish the first one, I'm tempted to go back and finish that as the stories are directly linked.

Rating - 9/10
A very strong metroidvania with a unique and charming setting that kept me invested until the end. The game does a great job of making you feel like a young, headstrong adventurer with the visuals, music, freedom and challenge that it offers. As a whole it was a great package overall and has actually spurred me on to play more of the SteamWorld series.

This game has cemented itself as one of my favourite metroidvania/platformers not only because it is great in it's own right. But more importantly for me personally because it has shown me that there are games out there that are worth my time. In the torrents of biased and clueless reviews (Steam included), toxic communities that are overprotective of their mediocre games and simply straight up bad games that get a pass because they don't literally steal the players money or hurt them physically, there are gems out there that deserve the praise along with their developers who cared and were skilled enough to release a finished, polished package that for some reason is rare these days. 

This is one of those games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199171509630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1650878838}
review:
nearly a perfecto.

A Steampunk Western, it allows you to dig into subterranean world and enjoy fantasy adventure. With pickaxe and other upcoming gears, you can almost reach anywhere, and how to make it--use hook-shot? fly with a easily-overheat jet engine or just dig straight down, it is all up to you.

Alongside main story and quests, rich content offers artifacts collection, caves of puzzle(some of them pretty hard), upgradable gears and cog mods that unlock amazing capacility. Going through story cost me 6 hours, and it took another 20+ to get all of them and steam achievements, except that the designing-for-masochist ultimate trail really frustrated me.

Just be honest, SteamWorld Dig 2 is a pretty good work.
