author: {'steamid': '76561198916153852', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1642766519}
review:
[h1] Небольшой обзорчик на SteamWorld Dig 2 [/h1]

[h1] О игре: [/h1]
[b] Действия игры происходят в мире Дикого Запада, в котором нет людей, зато есть паровые роботы. Главная героиня этой игры, Дороти, ищет пропавшего протагониста предыдущей части - Расти. Помогает ей в этом синий огонёк по имени Фен. [/b]

[h1] Геймплей: [/h1]
[b] SteamWorld Dig 2 предлагает нам не только пробивать земную породу в поисках Расти и ценных минералов, но и решать головоломки, связанные c гаджетами героини. Так, крюком-кошкой можно цепляться за стены и потолок, а на реактивном ранце, который получаешь под конец игры, — пролетать небольшие расстояния. [/b]

[h1] Итог: [/h1]
[b] В целом мне игра очень понравилась. Единственный минус в том, что она короткая. Я её прошёл, буквально, за 4 часа, а дальше просто бегал и выполнял достижения. Графика очень приятна глазу в этой игре, также как и музыкальное сопровождение. Механик очень много и все по-своему интересы. Я могу полностью порекомендовать вам на прохождение этой замечательной серии игр SteamWorld Dig. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074138313', 'num_games_owned': 1148, 'num_reviews': 906, 'playtime_forever': 1778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1643406184}
review: хотел глянуть, что за игру мне бесплатно раздал Стим и удалить, а залип. реально интересно сделали. даже удивлен, что такую игрушку раздавали всем даром. тут есть все, что мы все так любим, и копание. что? ты не любишь копать? что ты делаешь на страничке с этой игрой??? выйди отсюда, розбийнику! и прокачка персонажа, и поиск секретных мест.  геймплей сам по себе схож с Майнкрафтом и Эйб оф ексодус(кто играл). копаем землю, собираем ценные вещи, ищем проход глубже, прокачиваем своего персонажа, помогаем верхним жителям вернуть шахты под свой контроль. очень лампово и затягивающе, особенно на геймпаде икс бокс. игра не тупая копалка, иногда надо и серьезно подумать, что делать, чтоб не потерять все нажитое не посильным копанием

author: {'steamid': '76561198027847713', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1642617137}
review: A metoridvania with the shift away from "combat" and more towards "exploration". There still IS combat, mind you, but the ratio is flipped around. The map is big but if feels more tedious than in Metroid games. If you like metroidvanias this is a good game. If the exploring-over-combat aspect really ticks a box then I think you'd LOVE this game. First playthru only took about 7hrs and I had NO CLUE what I was doing, so estimate your mileage as such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391883120', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1642626513}
review:
Steam world dig 2 is even better than the first one.

the gameplay is new and improved, there are new and cool tools to try out, it has improved graphics and feels like a solid metroidvania, 
and all that while keeping the main aspect of the game: miningggg shiny rockkk

and tbh i am amazed by how many little easter eggs to various other amazing games you can find in this game, e.g the artifacts that you find along the way or just little details in the world that are really fun to discover. 
on top of that i am amazed by how well this game connects steam world dig and steam world heist in terms of lore. 
and the biggest aspect for me is the soundtrack. the OST of this game is beyond beautiful. on one hand you  got tracks like the main theme of el machino that just slapp and on the other hand you have some beautiful melodies like in yarrow.

overall its def an 11/10 and i would recommend it to everyone, especially if you have played the other steamworld games! (if you havent played them, play them as well, they are all amazing)

review:
All of that digging made me be like... Great exercise for one's fingers, yeah. xD
Still, it's really a cool game, and while I do get pissed off, dig my way into no-way-back, get lost or die, over and over again, I enjoy it.
It's even more fun with family or friends watching you play, fail and rage. There's nothing like those persons making fun of you while you are already enraged. @_@
Overall, it's a 9/10 in my books. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025210092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1642402274}
review:
I played the game twice, so I could get all the achievements on my second run. I made sure I experienced everything the game had to offer.

The game is fun, but at some point it kind of felt like a chore, you keep going down with little changes to your environment. The story isn't special at all, the characters and their motivations are not very interesting, so don't play this for the plot. The game is too easy, enemies are easy to defeat and boss fights weren't a problem at all; don't expect a challenging metroidvania.

I really enjoyed my second playthrough though (and convinced me to recommend the game), in which I succeeded in getting all the achievements that I didn't get on the first one, including the [spoiler] [speedrun, get rich, don't die, 100% secrets] [/spoiler] achievement, which was a lot of fun to get.

Anyway, the characters are cute and funny looking. Puzzles are amazing and feel quite rewarding, make sure to explore every cave, even if you're not aiming for a 100% run. And overall is a relaxing and satisfactory experience.

Expect an easy game; just relax with it as you dig, get resources and sell them. If you're looking for a challenge, aim for the difficult achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043708046', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1642782423}
review: Es un juego con buena dificultad (nada extremo o imposible), buen desempeño gráfico y ambientación; conforme vas avanzando en tu perforación, conocerás más enemigos y obtendrás mejoras más rápido. Una excelente opción de juego estilo metroidvania, que comienza quizá un poquito lento, pero recompensa el ir buscando, explorando, cada cuadro que puede llevarte a una zona oculta y seguir avanzando en las misiones del juego. Eso sí, requieres sí o sí de un control (joystick) sino, será muy difícil o cansado manejar a tu personaje.

review: I played the first one and I thought it was a mixed bag but I enjoyed most of it. This game is much better in a lot of ways. It now knows what its trying to be and what it wants you to do. Jump and Smash stuff. Explore the map. It helps that the game guides you along and has a lot of options for easy or normal. It also tells you where it wants you go. Their are bonus areas for you to unlock along the way. Fun game. Easy to pick up and play.

review: Pretty decent game.  Having to go back up constantly to sell and such felt like a bit of a way for the devs to pad play time.  The puzzles were pretty simple but still fun.  I feel like the jetpack upgrade is a bit op and makes the rest of the game too easy.    Overall 7/10 if you buy on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991630098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1642213996}
review:
Steamworld Dig builds upon its predecessor by being a bigger metroidvania than the first. There's more upgrades, more puzzle caves  and more ways to explore and it all builds upon that first game's mechanics of digging and exploring.

I finished it in about 10 hours doing as much exploring as I'd care to do  and it was a fun experience. Some really neat moments (best being when you're in a certain dungeon, if you play it, you'll know what I mean) and just some solid metroidvania action.

author: {'steamid': '76561198453631957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1643041215}
review: Diría que es uno de mis metroidvania favoritos, pero me dejó un sabor agridulce al terminarlo, y es que cuando termina realmente no piensas que va a terminar. Le falta demasiado contenido, el lore está increíble pero no lo aprovecharon bien, te cortan el juego con un jefe final el cual es único jefe, que te lo matas y ahí acabó la historia. Muchas mejoras no sirven para nada, el juego se acaba tan rápido que se vuelve redundante mejorar tu equipo al máximo, no hay más exploración ni más jefes (tan sólo 1) no hay más nada. El soundtrack es increíble, el juego te engancha, te divierte y te enamora, pero se termina muy rápido y quieres más de él, yo esperaba más.

author: {'steamid': '76561199113500749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1640749431}
review:
SWD2 is an awesome successor to SWD. It keeps the addicting and satisfying cycle of dig, explore, cash out, and upgrade. However, by eliminating any procedural generation or randomness and instead making it a fully hand-crafted world, they have provided so many satisfying ways to explore, sequence break, unearth secrets, and connect the map in really clever ways. The feeling of digging in one cave, then popping out somewhere and realizing you've been there before is always a great reveal, the kind of clever thing people associate with Hollow Knight, Dark Souls, etc. The power ups are really good, and have a genuine Metroidvania-like progression to them. No spoilers, but on several occasions I was expecting a certain kind of power up and was totally blown away by what I actually got when I hopped out of the power-up machine.

I enjoyed SWD, but playing through SWD2 I was immersed to a much greater degree, and I just didn't want to stop playing. I would generally encourage playing them in order, but SWD2 is definitely the star of the series. I would love to see more from this line in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847053801', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1641586536}
review:
Play as a robot Dorothy in a quest to save your long lost friend Rusty. You arrive at desert town with dire situation. Other townfolks robots needs your saving to escape this growing danger to be exploded into thousand pieces. Something is not right and you need to dig deep deep into a dark underground layer filled with tombs and secrets with many paths that leads you back at earth surface. Using your trusty pinaxe with many gadgets that will be presented you in later game that you can be upgraded. From fast charged hard rock crusher to a bomb bazooka. In your journey you will not be alone cause flamie Fen will light your path when the darkness shroud your eyes. 
This game reminded me of good old classic DigDug style play. This is much more evolved and tweaked out version filled with greatness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095256832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1641721994}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019538561', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1566, 'last_played': 1641668343}
review:
Really good game, and it's incredible they actually gave this away for free at one point.

The visuals are absolutely gorgeous. The game really manages to combine high-fidelity lighting effects with the detailed cartoony art style. While I like pixel art, I would really like to see more of this in games instead. Both environments and character designs have a lot of personality, and they're just fun to look at as they animate,

The soundtrack is solid too. There aren't that many tracks but they go very well with the game. Most are atmospheric, though there are bops that had me whistle along as well.

The controls are fine, but the way running and momentum works is a bit weird at times. I'm not even going to bother with that Trial of Skillness lol.

While the world is unfortunately not that big, there are tons of nooks and crevices to explore in the underground, and the challenge caves make for very rewarding obstacle courses and puzzles. The only one I couldn't stand is the one in Yarrow with the toxic bounce pads. Trying to do it without the last major tool is just a pain.
Gaining new abilities was always satisfying, and the upgrades and equipment mods were a lot of fun to work with.

The plot isn't really a big deal, and the finale felt a bit short and rushed. I wish the whole game in general went for a bit longer.

Overall a solid metroidvania. I will definitely get the first game when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969171579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1641612468}

author: {'steamid': '76561199012755698', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1637515808}
review:
Забрал данный платформер бесплатно на раздаче , когда я его забирал он не был для меня чем-то примечательным и он меня не сильно заинтересовал , но к счастью почему-то я решил скачать его и поиграть в него. И вот что я могу сказать после его прохождения : это потрясающий платформер с довольно неплохим сюжетом , обширной прокачкой и с множеством секреток , незнаю для кого как но для меня управление было крайне не удобным поэтому я полностью поменял управление под себя. И да большую часть времени вам надо будет копать но это будет очень интересно ибо там очень много секреток. 
А также в этой игре очень интересная концовка которая оставляет много вопросов.
И так стоит ли покупать игру ?
1) По фулл прайсу - незнаю для меня дороговато ибо это платформер , но если вам не жалко столько денег за платформер берите !
2) По распродаже - конечно да ! Там по-моему скидка 80%
P.S. игра проходиться +- за 8 часов вроде

review: Que onda con la actualización? el juego se ve mal ya que muchos objetos son invisibles hasta el propio npc de la gota azul o bola de fuego o lo que sea, ni las flechas ni rallos o lo que lancen los jefes se ve y es molesto jugarlo así, daña la experiencia de juego y da ganas de no seguir por ese error sinceramente, por favor repárenlo

author: {'steamid': '76561197980675983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1701433403}
review: This game is awesome! I hadn't really heard of it, so I played the first Steamworld Dig game before this one, just in case. I thought it was really fun, with an addictive gameplay. But this second opus is just amazing: it is a full Metroidvania, with very good level design and game mechanics. The powers are fun to use, the sense of exploration is very present, and everything blends together beautifully. Definitely a hidden gem, which is now in my top-3 indie Metroidvania list (with Hollow Knight and Ori). Good job, devs, and thank you for the fun! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003508911', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1642118950}

review:
Massive improvements, built upon the basis of the first game.
It has greatly improved movement, collection value, and way more upgrades.
The enemies are also a lot more variable and interesting, and actually feel dangerous in this game.
Generally, get this if you liked the experience of the first game, you'll enjoy this even more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036029370', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1641412203}
review:
Juego de plataformas para un jugador donde minas para abajo un montón. Volves a la superficie, vendes todo, compras mejoras, y repetís. Pero ahora con mas sabor a metroidvania y con muchísimas mejoras con respecto a su predecesor. Mas mapa, mas items, mas refinado en todos los aspectos y con nuevos agregados, veamos:

*Prácticamente se dobló la cantidad de horas de juego. El mapa es mucho mas grande y hay mas zonas por explorar.
El diseño de las minas es genial, le encontraron la vuelta para que no sea siempre lo mismo. Hay 3 zonas claramente diferenciadas. Se aprovecha mas la horizontalidad en el diseño y hay nuevos bloques para minar que le añaden variedad a las cuevas.

*Hablando de cuevas, las cuevas con retos de habilidad y puzzles siguen estando, pero ahora en versión recargada, con mas variedad, cantidad y objetos escondidos.

*Pulieron los controles, ahora el movimiento es fluido y mas preciso. Arreglaron el tema del pico y el walljump que me hacía mal de la primera entrega. Los movimientos de la protagonista se sienten cómodos. Podes mapear los controles como se te cante. Recomiendo mucho jugarlo con joystick.

*No hay gran cantidad de enemigos nuevos pero los patrones de combate mejoraron. Están muy bien diseñados. Hay veces que te obliga a pensar como encarar algunos encuentros.
Hay situaciones donde las reacciones en cadena con el entorno y los ataques de los enemigos provocan un lindo caos en pantalla. Buena relación sistémica ahí.

*Hay nuevas herramientas y mejoras. Incluye un nuevo sistema donde podes equipar o desequipar las mejoras a piacere. Esto hace que el jugador pueda graduar la dificultad a gusto. Si sos mas hardcore las desactivas y listo.
Por ejemplo, al comienzo, te preguntan si querés desactivar los marcadores de misión en el mapa, cosa de tener una experiencia mas clásica. Si se te complica podes volver a activarlos en la mesa de mejoras.
Me pareció un sistema muy interesante.

*Al igual que en el primero, hay varios tipos de minerales para juntar, pero también contas con nuevos coleccionables: los artefactos y los engranajes. Esos dejo que los descubras vos.

*En la reseña del primero no lo mencione, pero la fluidez del tutorial es genial. Como te introducen al juego me pareció, en ambas entregas, muy buena. Ni se nota que estas aprendiendo algo.

*El apartado de arte sigue brillando. Los fondos, el diseño de personajes, la interfaz, los colores, los efectos de iluminación, la elección de fuentes. Todo está fríamente calculado para que en la composición final los elementos se luzcan por completo. Una dirección artística muy buena. Bravo.

*El apartado sonoro mejoro un montón, la música tiene mas variedad. El cambio de música cuando te quedas sin luz te hace dudar que vas a volver con vida a la superficie. (y no me hagan hablar del audio en Vectron, todavía no puedo dormir)
Las composiciones musicales me parecieron bastante particulares. Hay una mezcla muy variada de instrumentos y de estilos, sin embargo, encajan bien con la estética del juego. Si lo que el compositor buscaba era identidad, la verdad que lo logró.
No nos olvidemos del diseño sonoro. Algunos premios para ese apartado también.

*Un montón de mejoras pequeñas que elevan el gameplay: Que los minerales picados brillen en la oscuridad, la tilde para las cuevas cuando están exploradas, los globitos descriptivos de dialogo, etc.

Algo que me parece importante destacar es que podes seguir explorando el mapa una vez finalizado el juego. Lo menciono porque hay juegos de este estilo que no dejan hacer eso.
Cuando lo terminas cargas el último save y te deja justo antes del final. Te ahorro la preocupación. Explora tranquilo.


[h1]¿Me lo llevo?[/h1]

+Si, es un juegazo. Si lo podes cazar en oferta ganaste. No es muy largo pero es bueno.
+Si todavía no jugaste al primero no se que esperas. Como ejercicio recomiendo jugarlos consecutivos para que notes como mejoraron los diferentes aspectos del juego.
+Si te van los metroidvanias, dale una probada. Me recuerda un poco al [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/275390/Guacamelee_Super_Turbo_Championship_Edition/[/url]Guacamelee![/url]
+Me gusto el final. Lindo terreno para los títulos posteriores.
-Maldito nivel de la calavera. Decí que no lo pusieron como parte del 100%. El trial de habilidad es para el hardcore, déjense de joder.
-La verdad que no encuentro mucho en contra. Todo está muy lindo para la experiencia que ofrece.

review:

Больше гаджетов, апгрейдов, секретов, персонажей, диалогов, пасхалок, разрешение спрайтов... Абсолютно всё в игре стало лучше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137513791', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1640842355}
review:
So why a negative review for this game? I think the feeling that summarizes my experience was that I didn't really care about the game. It feels as a game designed around fan service (literally every standard/non-groundbreaking metroidvania element in the game), and around the false sense of progression (UPGRADES, UPGRADES, UPGRADES). The story in my opinion is a hot mess, and I couldn't care less about the characters in the game, everything feels standard and already done a gazillion times. 

I will say that the most enjoyable part of the game was the endgame dungeon, which was provoking and completely out of place in regards to the rest of the game, and that was pretty daring to me, I suffered, but I actually liked the overall idea. 

Other people seem to be onboard with this design logic, like, staying true to the Metroidvania roots, give us incremental progress with unlockable (UPGRADEABLE) abilities, so that we feel great. I know that I am an outlier here, I'll just say that I am a firm believer that games can be much more than that. Given the great number of works that came out the last few years, originality is something that should be expected now, and this game in my opinion had none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084049245', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1641309605}
review:
An absolute improvement over the first game in every possible way.

The movement options are massively expanded, and the platforming challenges force you to use them to their full extent. The enemy variety is better, it feels more like a metroidvania with the different areas and shortcuts between them (and a working teleport system lmao wtf was that in the first game). The story feels more relevant and the dialogue is fun. The music definitely feels better. All in all, if they can improve a sequel this much, I'm excited to see what this dev team can do in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198167382572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2736, 'last_played': 1636797421}
review:
I had a blast playing this game. I was expecting just another digging game like the flash games of old on Armor Games or Kongregate, but the story in this game is fantastic! I loved the characters and the puzzles and challenges scaled well as the story progressed and new abilities were unlocked. After finishing the story I was deeply saddened to learn there was no direct sequel to tie up the cliffhanger the story leaves us with.

There is another game that takes place after the events of this story, but from the trailers available it does not look like it follows any of the characters from this story or provide closure to the open ended cliffhanger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053428327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1640891823}
review: I'm glad I didn't buy the game. I was expecting relaxing digging and instead got fights with annoying enemies and arcade minigames. Decided to give it another try and finish the game besides that, but I rage quitted when the horror map appeared - I hate horror games and don't like feeling scared!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007540184', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2106, 'last_played': 1678760377}
review: A great little game I only played due to the free giveaway earlier this year. I'm glad I did, because it's very solid, and from playing the first game afterwards, I can see how far improved the sequel really is. That extra level of polish makes all the difference, avoiding frustrating moments and leaving you a fun and addictive gameplay loop. Put simply this is the [i]SteamWorld Dig[/i] game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413297664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1640843582}
review: La segunda entrega de la saga "Dig" y otra más del universo SteamWorld, la verdad este equipo hace maravillas con sus juegos orientados a mecánicas simples pero divertidas, ademas que todo este universo de robots acompaña a los juegos de una manera increíble, no es necesario que juegues el primero para este, pero, si es recomendable ya que te puedes enamorar de los trabajos de este equipo y terminar jugando toda la saga SteamWorld, como es mi caso

author: {'steamid': '76561198041164224', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1640724121}
review: Медитативная игра с различного рода несложными головоломками, платформингом, убийством монстров. Иногда он может поддушивать и затягивать время, но, в основном, вполне играбельно, особенно с учётом того, что он стал заметно сложнее и многограннее в плане механик, чем его предшественник, но не потерял его дух. Это не уровень какого-нибудь Ори, но на то, чтобы убить пару вечеров, пойдёт.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079389961', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1695906556}
review:
This game is truly a masterpiece. Its like Motherload, but with so much more content. You mine to find resources, which you sell to upgrade your gear to dig even deeper to gather more resources.

Controls feel just so natural, and graphics are really nice.

Cant wait to find out what there is to find when i dig even deeper into the ground!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028162879', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1677594342}
review:
Aşırı zevkli oyun. İlk oyun güzeldi, eğlenceliydi eyvallah ama bazı can sıkan detayları vardı. Bu devam oyununda ise ne kadar eksik gedik sinir bozucu şey varsa toparlayıp ortaya harika bir iş çıkarmışlar. Oldukça çeşitli güç gelişimleri, iyi tasarlanmış bir harita dizaynı, sağlam atmosfer, keyifli platform, zırla gizli lokasyon, tatmin edici düşman ve combat çeşitliliği her şey olması gerektiği gibi dolu dolu.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054915862', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1640637241}
review:
It's a good game, it expands on the first game. It took me ~9 hours to complete, trying to get everything, upgrade, secret, etc. 
It's a better metroidvenia than the first one, but the emphasis on digging got cut short, because the point of the game is no longer digging, it's exploring the world which is fine, but if you are looking for the comfy digging that the previous game had it's not there. 
The exploring and the areas in the game are very interesting. 

It's pretty fun and not difficult at all. Give it a try its a good one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001151045', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1640590702}
review:
Like the first game, Steamworld Dig 2 is a semi-relaxing game where you dig. There's a story - a continuation of the Steamworld saga, and explains what happens after the first game and before Steamworld Heist. So key gameplay elements: dig, explore, jump a lot, fall a lot kill some monsters, find upgrades, and do some puzzles. In typical game fashion there are areas that can't be reached (or at least not obviously) without those upgrades.  All the while you're listening to some very good music (though it's the type of game where you could put your own and not miss out on the game's atmosphere - except in a few key areas/scenes). 

If you liked the first game, and want to spend a few nights relaxing on it I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097299018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1640574718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198404823768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1641683970}
review: 游戏目前来看不错，让我想起来小时候4399一个叫钻地小子的游戏。2D画面比较精致，背景是多个层次，光效有氛围感，BGM也不拉跨。人物跑动有惯性，有点难做到精准的平台跳跃，我个人还是比较喜欢没有惯性的操控感。玩法上，这游戏是有主线剧情的，由于没有中文我也没仔细读对白，似乎是需要寻找前作主角，然后就是线性的一段一段的人物，不断向下挖掘深入，路上挖到的矿石可以回到地表卖钱，用钱购买各项能力的升级，剧情节点上也会逐渐解锁新的能力，地图上有那种需要发现的隐藏区域，给点钱或者升级资源。整个地图是以格子为单位的，很多方块都可以挖掉或用炸弹破坏（当然地图边界还是有不可破坏的墙），有点类似spelunky那种，并非随机生成，也不是类似恶魔城那种，路上给你放个东西但拿不到，得解锁新能力才能回头来拿，基本还是线性的。目前也没有看到那些纯粹浪费时间的NPC跑腿支线任务。总的来说就是不断探索，升级解锁新能力，继续探索，继续升级。简单的循环，不至于无聊，还是挺解压的，有时候玩点轻松的游戏也不错，何况目前打三折，推荐入。

author: {'steamid': '76561198407309288', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1640468651}
review:
Pod wieloma względami lepsze niż pierwsza część.
Jest rozległy, zróżnicowany świat, który można zwiedzać trochę poza ustaloną kolejnością. Mamy też znacznie większy wpływ na wybór ulepszeń, ścieżkę rozwoju. Całość o wiele dłuższa.
Jest o wiele więcej zagadek, trochę logicznych, ale w większości zręcznościowych. Niektóre wlaściwie nie do przejścia bez posiłkowania się rozwiązaniami z innych źródeł.
Fabuła OK, fajnie spina się z pierwszą częścią i pasuje do klimatu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359153807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1639711500}
review:
A well-crafted mining metroidvania-style game. The puzzles are competently designed and the various mechanics are fun to learn. The progression through the different areas and challenge/item caves feels natural and it is very satisfying when you finally complete a cave.

It is a game that I found myself coming back to and wanting to explore further through to the end (though there are still secrets I didn't find and challenging modes I could have tried during my first play-through of the story).

All in all, [u]it is a good game[/u]. I was very fortunate to come across a free promotion for it on Steam, though it was on my wishlist to try for some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326009223', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1640300918}
review:
I have literally never heard of this franchise before, and I have no idea if I was supposed to play the games out of order or what. Honestly, I was worried going in I'd have no idea what life was and be out of the loop. But I figured "Why not, let's try it. I like Metroidvania games anyways."

The plot is okay. Its not terrible, but its also not extremely exciting either. It felt a little basic in its premise and delivery and I wasn't super interested in most of the characters besides Fen - Fen is adorable - but I didn't even mind that much, because where the plot was just okay, the gameplay was amazing.

I love the premise of combining spelunking with a Metroidvania style play. The focus on exploration over combat felt like such a fresh take. More often than not in Metroidvania games, the main concern is either to see every single room or fight all the things you can, and that's fine, but I really found it awesome to just have a few absolutely enormous maps that it was your job to dig through and comb into every nook and cranny to get the most money possible. No, I wasn't able to get everything, but I felt really motivated to try. Honestly, if you spend as much time hunting around as I do, you'll often go long periods of time without even getting a poke from the plot, which is kinda fine with me. With gameplay this good, its perfectly okay for the game to be focused on its gameplay more often than its storyline. If the first game is anything like this, I might just have to give it a try after all.

That final boss, though. Sheesh. I am NOT good with 10,000 projectiles, but I managed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136719168', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1640221302}
review: Fun little exploration game which encourages player to finish the story. I really enjoyed the arcadey-type of gameplay. Storywise the game isn't that long but for people that enjoy looking under every nook and canny, the game offers double the hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561199102312957', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1666730906}
review:
An absolutely terrific game.

Brief explanation of what it's all about: the robot dorothy is looking for her friend rusty, who also seems to be responsible for the mysterious earthquakes that have been occurring lately. She then takes a job as a miner and digs deeper and deeper into the earth towards the source of the earthquakes. Along her way, she also gets to know a whole bunch of bizarre people/robots, who all have their very own character.


The gameplay basically consists of a mixture between a platformer and just digging. You mainly search for various gems and ores, which you later sell on the surface. You then use the money to improve your equipment, of which you get more and more as the story progresses. The whole thing is not easy because the deeper you go, the more enemies (monsters and robots that are not friendly) there are. The game uses well thought-out mechanics to make sure that you can only get to harder areas with special equipment. This means that you never run the risk of going further than you should. But that's also why the game is much more linear than you might think at the beginning.


Besides that, there also a lot of caves, which can be compared with dungeons in other games. These are closed areas, at the end of which you often get a so-called mod-cog, which you need to upgrade your equipment with special abilities and advantages.

Especially through the dungeons, the game becomes much more varied, as those can also contain puzzles or real platformer levels. Or it simply has a completely different style/look. for example, in the vectron cave, which is quite simple in itself, there is a bit of a horror feeling, simply through the atmosphere that is created.

In general, the atmosphere is one of the best aspects of the game... the comic-like graphics are just cute and the soundtrack is great.

In the end, there are unfortunately two small things that bothered me. one is the somewhat imprecise controls (at least with the keyboard), which have sometimes failed, especially when it comes to jumping accurately, and are responsible for the one or other fall damage I suffered. The other would be the combat system, especially when it comes to the boss fights. Unfortunately, the gameplay is simply not designed for fighting. That doesn't bother much with the normal enemies, because you hit them once or twice and they're gone, but adding boss fights is simply unnecessary and it's good that there aren't so many of them.

Nevertheless, at the end of the day (and as I already said above), it's an absolutely terrific game, and i'm already looking forward to playing it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198912258401', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1637512981}
review:
Fantastic little wind down game. 

The mining mechanics and world are surprisingly fleshed out and the characters are super fun. This game doesn't take itsself too seriously but still has a few emotional moments. The upgrades system is a great way to make sure you're not just sitting in the mines for two hours. 

Sadly about two hours is what it takes you to beat this game. I played this on Switch, hence the low playtime. This game is totally worth the money though. Its super fun and has replay value. 

9/10

review:
An absolute joy to play. Lots of fun niche puzzles and sort of secret stuff to keep you engaged. Outstanding controls, music, gameplay, level design, had a lot to keep me coming back. Probably not a ton of replay value, but definitely worth the price point, a stellar play through!

Also, I noticed they had a pretty sizable play test group, and I'd say I was surprised to see how many folks it was when the credits scrolled, but to be fair, I didn't notice a single bug at all

review:
A chill dig-sell-upgrade metroidvania-ey game with decent story and mind-BLOWING ending ;)
The upgrades are fun and powerful without making the game too easy. The secrets are well thought and getting them feels rewarding. Making trip back to town is not a bother anymore, definitely a well deserved sequel to the game I enjoyed.

I got it free when they announced The Gunk but I can see myself buying this full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087922603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1639903523}
review: Вкрай посередня гра, повторюваний та не дуже цікавий геймплей,  досить нудна історія. Мені вистачило 3,9 години, щоб усвідомити, що треба дропати гру, поки не настав момент того самого відчуття що "навіщо я граю в неї до кінця". Гра не варта того, щоб чекати на той момент "ну, а що як далі буде краще", ні, не буде, тому що вона одноманітна і поліпшень далі не передбачається. Єдиний плюс у грі, який я собі виокремлю — це пастки в деяких печерах і певна частка головоломок у них, але в цьому ж плюсі ​​ховається і мінус, що часто не можна пройти ці печери до кінця, тому що немає в наявності якогось обладнання, тобто ще потім сюди знову повернутись треба ... Але, мабуть, не цього разу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000942469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1639859560}
review:
Probably the most "true" metroidvania of the last decade or more. Optional, meaningful upgrades (not just a linear slog with "optional" health boosts or whatever), choice in area ordering, real exploration... it's all here.

All the flaws I can remember:

1) The controls have a couple minor flaws, notably when dot is sliding near the bottom of a wall.
2) The "100% helper" stuff is solid, but not perfect. If you want 100%, prepare to wander a bit and/or use a guide.
3) The final boss is a pretty whacky difficulty spike out of nowhere. I didn't realize I was near the end of the game, nor that I was apparently underleveled. This wasn't a big deal, but it made the finale feel less smooth.

Other than that, the graphics, audio, controls, pacing, etc. are all very good. Definitely worth playing, even if you've been burned by games labeled "metroidvania" before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064677710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1639848108}
review: O jogo é maravilhoso, com um sistema de progressão muito satisfatório. Você tem aquela sensação de querer obter todos os upgrades para acessar áreas antes não acessíveis apenas para conseguir os itens escondidos e artefatos. Eu não joguei o primeiro, pretendo muito depois de ter jogado essa obra. Nunca havia ouvido falar no jogo e não dava nada quando comecei a joga-lo, e fui surpreendido. Amo ser surpreendido dessa maneira, quando você menos espera de algo, esse algo te cativa e conquista infinitamente. Parabéns a todos os desenvolvedores. Uma pena eu não conseguir salvar ele 100%, acho algumas das conquistas muito difíceis de serem realizadas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198853265374', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3216, 'last_played': 1639668550}
review:
Steam World Dig 2 - это хорошая игра, в которую стоит поиграть.
Порадовало: удобная система улучшений (вам всегда дают возможность передумать, когда вы распределяете очки снаряжения), красивые локации, приятное музыкальное сопровождение и самое главное, без чего не обходится любая легендарная игра - это копание.
В игре есть контент для всех: хочешь просто покопать под приятную музыку? Пожалуйста. Хочешь выжать максимум из механик в особом подземелье Dungeon Master? Huh, another victim.
Единственное, что меня расстроило - это непродолжительный сюжет. Основные события можно пересчитать по пальцам. 
 




P.S.: Я не боюсь человека, который прошел 10000 уровней. Я боюсь человека, который прошел один и тот же уровень 10000 раз

author: {'steamid': '76561198253200386', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1638178188}
review: 白嫖党的胜利！这是个集采矿、探索、战斗于一身的横版动作冒险类精品独立游戏，2代不仅比1代的游戏内容要更加丰富，而且操作手感也更好。强烈推荐给所有横版动作冒险类游戏爱好者～

author: {'steamid': '76561198093137086', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1639728392}
review:
A story-driven sequel of SteamWorld Dig that improved upon the first game's mechanic and turned it into something much more.

Pros : 
+ A variety of mods to choose from
+ A Lot of NPCs to talk to
+ Water sources won't dry up anymore
+ Better transportation system
+ A lot more dialogue between main characters
+ Some platforming puzzles can be challenged without using advanced upgrades that you'll get later on (You can go back to those puzzles once you obtained those upgrades for easier puzzles)
+ Better control response compared to the first game
+ Great atmosphere

Cons : 
- Digging and backtracking can get repetitive to some players
- Turning off screen flashes will skip some really cool effects later on. Could use an option to minimize the number of the effect's occurrences instead of turning them off completely

author: {'steamid': '76561198452557609', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1648234550}
review:
Se eu fosse falar desse jogo de forma rápida eu diria que ele é um terraria em forma de Metroidvania. mas claro que o jogo vai mais alem que só isso.
   SteamWorldDig 2 é um ótimo Metroidvania tem cenários bem bonitos e bem detalhados e com puzzers muito bem pensados e muito divertidos de fazer. juntando com a trilha sonora que é ótima torna a exploração desse jogo algo extremamente divertido e bem viciante, sempre fazendo o jogador indo cada vez mais fundo no jogo e sempre achando locais ou recompensas novas.
   Mas uma coisa que eu não gostei tanto foi o sistema de batalha e a baixa variação de inimigos, as batalhas nesse jogo é algo chato e pouco recompensador.
   Fora isso esse jogo é incrivel , ele é perfeito pra pessoas que curtem um bom metroidvania e que gostam mais de um jogo mais lento focado na exploração. NOTA 9/10.
    PS: caso você seja como eu e prefere jogar o jogo completamente em portugues entre nesse link abaixo para saber como instalar a tradução feita pelo Cacarama. é um processo totalmente seguro e simples detalhes no link abaixo.
https://steamcommunity.com/app/571310/discussions/0/5017567849290883768/

author: {'steamid': '76561198001485347', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1639618087}
review:
To be honest, I didn't plan on even playing this game, the original, was quite honestly, mediocre at best and could be finished in a single 5 hour sitting ony our first try.

But later on I played Steam World Heist on the 3DS and LOVED that one to bits, a wonderful game from beggining to end. 

So when I got this game on a recent giveaway, I figured, the time might have learned a thing or two ever since the first game. And was pleasantly surprised, its concepts are much more developed and balanced than in the original, The first one had a level design that felt almost proceduraly generated, while this one simply put has good level design that very apt for its gameplay.

Music is fine, does its job, history is simple but enthralling enough to make you want to see it through the end. Gameplay is very much improved and very tight. I played it in a sorta completionist way, got about 85% on my first run and got about 17 hours out of it, and will probabbly try to get it to 100% before uninstalling. 

Well worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561199040009573', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 10574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10574, 'last_played': 1641058516}
review:
Отличная игра, которая подарит множество положительных эмоций. Приятная графика, ненапряжная фоновая музыка, интересный геймплей на месте.
В лучших традициях жанра исследование мира вознаграждается, а заниматься этим увлекательно (особенно ближе к концу игры, когда получите большинство апгрейдов).
Здесь довольно простенький сюжет, но от него большего и не надо.
Немного не хватило возможности копать по-диагонали, а так твердая 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324486049', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1639323829}
review:
游戏性：4 / 4
以挖地作为核心玩法的metroidvania，令人上头。
新能力获取、地图探索、解谜、属性提升都要依靠挖掘实现，而这些又作为正反馈进一步鼓励挖掘。
主线任务的内容只有寥寥数语却指使玩家挖穿3个各具特色的地下区域。
无需jet engine通关的破序方法以及进入Vectron时的赛博恐怖风格让流程具有一定深度。

剧情：1 / 3
[spoiler]机娘寻找男朋友却被坏人利用，最后还是救到了的故事× [/spoiler]
无官方中文有些可惜，建议使用汉化，因为这游戏的文本量还是有一些的。

画面：1 / 2
蒸汽朋克+西部荒野，但是看久了有些单调。

音乐：1 / 1
每个区域均有自己的主题音乐，我个人比较喜欢Yarrow的风格。

综合：7 / 10
整个游戏中不乏一些玩梗的致敬，比如最终试炼中利用操纵杆击杀伪boss的操作。
最终试炼的难度对比通关流程相去甚远，代表Dorothy的性能其实没有得到完全的发挥，但冲刺弹墙技巧没有教学且难度较大：在碰到墙面的一瞬间按【跳跃】键，下一个瞬间拨【反方向】，整个过程中【冲刺】键不要松开。
最后，没有什么比满载矿石含恨而终更难受的事了，最终试炼更是善用【破财回血】技能，贪不得啊。

author: {'steamid': '76561199156895515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1639858622}
review:
[h1] Buena segunda parte [/h1]

Realmente se la curraron, dejaron todo lo que estaba bien y agregaron cosas mucho mas interesantes.

Tiene nuevas mecánicas y el mismo modo de progresión que es muy destacable, la historia ahora continua la de el primer juego y se pone muy interesante. Nuevos enemigos, habilidades y como dije antes mecánicas hacen de este un juego bastante diferente a su predecesor y muy disfrutable.
Tambien se mejoro un poco el aspecto gráfico y se conservo el 2D que es algo también muy importante ya que cuando suelen cambiar esas cosas los juegos pierden su esencia y ya no es lo mismo.

Conclusión, si les gusto el 1 compre este también (si no lo recibieron gratis como yo) que les va a encantar también.

PD: Mi reseña numero [b] 100 [/b] :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198931274356', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3946, 'last_played': 1639127255}
review:
Взяла данную игру бесплатно на раздаче, и когда впервые запустила, то подумала что это за ерунда, до чего я докатилась и как же я избаловалась, что 2D игры меня не впечатляют, подавай реалистичную не кубическую графику и т.д.

[h1] НО. как я была не права! [/h1] 
Это оказалась отличной игрой, которая подарила множество положительных эмоций. Приятная графика, не раздражающая фоновая музыка, интересный геймплей, юмор на месте. В общем очень качественный платформер.

так что я похоже одна из немногих кто начал эту историю со спасения Расти, главного героя первой части.
однозначно рекомендация, палец вверх.

после трехчасового прохождения пещеры "в ад и обратно" (ಥ﹏ಥ) я была выжата как лимон. и даже, увидев что на этом собственно всё - я даже не обрадовалась, я ничего не чувствовала. настолько тяжело мне это далось....
и найденный артефакт в этой пещере - [spoiler] сертификат, который подтверждает ее прохождение с глубочайшими извинениями от разработчиков [/spoiler] :D 

похоже что скоро меня ждет покупка игры под названием "Terraria"
так как приквел SteamWorld DIG 2 уже приобретен

author: {'steamid': '76561198114895902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1692899726}
review:
Very fun game! It's absolutely not a long game, but the pace of progression feels really good! Beautiful art style, and a soundtrack that complements it perfectly. The combat isn't very interesting, but I still had a good time! I just wish the game was longer. Definitely going to come back and 100% it!   

Overall, i'd say this game is more than worth it on sale!  :)

review:
An absolutely fantastic metroidvania adventure, hinging on a very unique and addictive gimmick (that being the mining)

The world and characters are great, the gameplay loop is exciting and as good as most metroidvanias I've had the joy of playing, and overall it's just an ace (if short) experience.

review: Great little game with lots to explore and a nice story. There is a nice sense of progression in terms of both your own character and the story as there is always a goal marked on your map and upgrades are meaningful changes that change how you play the game. It is a bit short for the asking price so try to get it in a sale, but other than that no major criticism.

author: {'steamid': '76561198849569964', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1695581421}
review:
Отличное продолжение первой части. Нам предстоит играть за племянницу Расти и искать пропавшего дядьку. Тут придется много прыгать, много копать, решать головоломки. Разработчики рекомендуют играть с контроллера, что я и вам советую сделать. 
История немного элементарная - мы ищем нашего пропавшего друга, нам помогает в этом злобный синий дух, что любит разрушения. Яркая графика никого не оставит равнодушным, музыка ненавязчивая и отлично подходит под тематику каждого вида подземелья. Интересная система прокачки навыков и оборудования. 
Важно не расстраиваться сразу, если не получается пройти какой-то кусок локации или пещеры, оборудование улучшается - мы находим новое и в результате можно вернуться и открыть ранее недоступные места.
Прошёл с удовольствием - затягивает неплохо!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010780880', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1638881083}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094748826', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1676038143}
review:
NOTE: This review comes from my discord server, and thus is designed to fit a character limit. It won't be extremely in-depth, but trust me. This game is worth every penny.

Dig 2 is one of the most interesting games I've ever played. Coming from very little experience in Metroidvania titles, I am more than glad to call Dig 2 my first true experience. Dig 2 is a story-based Metroidvania with mechanics similar to games like Spelunky - a 2D tile-based mining system with various tools you can use to navigate the caves. Follow the story of a lone steambot searching for a lost friend, and try to find the root cause of disastrous earthquakes hitting the city of El Machino.

Story: The story is easy to follow, even without having played the first game. The reveals and twists are extremely enjoyable, and many of the characters are fun to talk to. This game does a great job of establishing context, and not assuming you've played the first game.

Gameplay: The gameplay is - by all definitions - incredible. Mine down to reach different fast travel locations in the main mines, earn money from ores for upgrades, and find hidden cogs in mini puzzle dungeons for upgrade mods. Discover new equipment the deeper you go that lets you revisit previously-inaccessible secrets in old areas, and reach new exciting areas all at the same time. You can even collect hidden secret artifacts to receive special, powerful cog mods in the main city.

Graphics: The artstyle in this game was very enjoyable for me. It's similar to Hollow Knight, but softer. The artstyle honestly feels like a very solid mix between indie and Nintendo, and most things are very nice to look at. New areas are beautiful, too, so you're not always staring at the same tileset.

Audio: Dig 2 has a super enjoyable soundtrack, that never grew old in my several straight hours of gameplay. I would definitely listen to this game's soundtrack idly during my day, which I can't say for most games. The sound design itself is also very satisfying, especially the jackhammer once you get it wound up. The audio in this game really ties the experience together.

Overall score: 10/10. One of the only games I have ever 100%ed in only a few sittings - I COULD NOT put it down. On top of that: It's only $20. I may have gotten this game in a giveaway, but I would have spent twice as much on it and still considered it worth every penny. What are you waiting for, buy it already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069187695', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1638852718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198941674584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1640649029}
review:
Great game, not too hard but still with some challenge, and the exploration and treasure hunting is lots of fun.
Also played SteamWorld Heist by the same maker, so here is a small comparison

Both are very great and enjoyable game, but
Art : Heist is better in my opinion, because of the space scene, different star ship, and the pubs out there.
Music : Heist is definitely better, with the steam punk nostalgia style. The music in dig 2 is good for bringing out the atmosphere and mood, but not enjoyable by itself.

But the gameplay of dig2 is more fun then heist for me, maybe because I enjoy exploring more than combating. 
Heist have different stages, while Dig2 is a huge and connected map. I enjoy the big map more, but the stage  style is better if you only have a short while each time. You can also stop at any time in Dig2, but the endless underground caves make it additive.
In conclusion, both are great games and highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561199068295529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1638820836}
review: Good not over complicated metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010241670', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1638784104}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is the logical progression from it's predecessor, maturing into what I now feel comfortable calling a Metroidvania. The world is more than a bottomless cave, upgrades give new ways to explore, and exploration is strongly encouraged. The hookshot is a fantastic movement option that game needed to really shine. However, the final upgrade, the [spoiler]jetpack[/spoiler], ruins the puzzle-like, thoughtful navigation that the hookshot promoted. For this reason, I think the game is better played by sequence-breaking in order to avoid the [spoiler]jetpack[/spoiler] altogether. 

I appreciate the ability to customize my experience, toggling upgrades on/off at will. Game is pretty easy, so casual players should feel right at home, with the exception of some bonus challenge content.

I recommend it to fans of the first game and as an introduction to larger Metroidvania titles. Playing the first game is not necessary at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084608649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2574, 'last_played': 1638994547}
review:
Nao canso de me surprender com a industria indie sao jogos bastante criativos e fora da caixinha que voce sempre se surprende quem diria que jogo de mineraçao seria tao divertido,e um metroidvania de grande qualidade tem grande variedade de cristais que pode ser vendidos para fazer upgrade um numero bem consideravel de acessorios que voce vai ganhando conforme progredindo na campanha que tem tempo bem bacana nao chega ser curta demais nem esticada demais tem tempo bem ideal na questao dos inimigos poderia ter variedade maior porem os que tem moveset bem diversificado um do outro oque torna bem criativo os mesmos na questao de dificuldade ele bem justo e mais facil voce se matar sem querer do que com inimigos o unico inimigo vai ti dar um pouco dor de cabeça e um maginho ele e bem troll ti persegue quebra as plataformas que voce ta o bixo e uma praguinha xD

Resumo - metroidvania de extrema qualidade com excelente trilha sonora e com graficos cartoon de alta qualidade eu recomendo demais a jogatina vale muito a experiencia!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021442265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1638744241}
review:
While playing SWD1 before 2 isn't required, I'd strongly recommend it. Not only will you have a little more attachment to some of the characters, but it'd be hard to go back after all the improvements they made to this game. SWD1 was a casual miner with occasional platforming. SWD2 is a casual metroidvania with occasional mining. It's a thoroughly enjoyable experience that continues the story from SWD1, and appears to lead a bit into SWH[eist], which I've not played yet at the time of this review.

For the enjoyment I got out of it, and likelihood of replaying in the future, it's probably worth full price. However, it goes on a big sale about once a month.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
+Even more colorful and well-animated
+Still good music, and majority of OST is in the game files
+Helpful map that tracks secrets and cave completion
+Easy and Normal difficulties (*)
+Still includes puzzles, and a few of them require some thought
+Added XP system, item modifications and artifacts
+Lots more dialog and expanded, detailed world
+Pools of water don't drain when absorbed
+Melee range increased
+Going to town restores all your resources
+Much more frequent shortcuts back to town
+You can see shortcuts back to town from a distance
+Button mapping for abilities is much better
+No bugs or crashes
+You can still abuse some mechanics for sequence breaks, and the game rewards this
+Took me 13 hours to casually (no guides) 100% complete game, except for hardcore secret area
+There are mods to help you find every secret, or cheese most difficult platforming sections.
+(*) There are a number of optional modifications that add difficulty to the game. There's also a secret area that requires some seriously intense platforming skill and patience. (**)

[h1]YMMV[/h1]
~The light system still feels awkward

~The game is absolutely family-friendly, though the brief [spoiler]Vectron[/spoiler]portion may be scary for young children.

~A few of the collectibles may require a guide, even with the mods that highlight secrets.

~More bosses (though all easier than first game)

~Without farming some respawning enemies and picking money-making mods early, I don't think you can buy every upgrade or mod. However, you can casually finish with more than enough to breeze through the endgame.

~(**) To get all the achievements, you'll have to complete the ultra-hard platforming marathon.

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
-Can't really think of anything straight-up bad. It's a darn good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043268673', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1641247170}
review:
Overrated. 


First half of the game is amazing. You start out with nothing, enter a mine and slowly progress, get new tools, upgrade existing ones and collect resources for one of the progression types. Platforming and digging smart (so you don't lock yourself out of resources) is a huge part of the opening experience. 

Later in game you get a grappling hook and rocket shoes and that's when the game loses its identity. The the game shifts its focus towards puzzles and platforming while making you deal with hordes of annoying enemies. Mining no longer requires any attention and becomes more of a chore. Most tiles become impossible to break. Most enemies have gimmicks that make them a nuisance. Areas where you'll spend most time have mostly unbreakable tiles. Even if you find destructible ares, hook and rocket shoes ensure you don't have to think too much (unlike in first half of the game).

author: {'steamid': '76561198079323277', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1638575728}
review:
Charming side-scroller. Unlike many other representatives of the genre, this one is [i]NOT frustrating[/i] due to insanely difficult jumping sections or similar. Instead, the gameplay is sometimes challenging but always fair.

[b]GOOD[/b]: Nice progression - gameplay changes from start to finish because you unlock new skills and upgrades. This makes gameplay extremely fun.

There is a lot of variety and the game does not get boring. Every cave is different - in some you have to avoid traps, in some you have to fight, in others you have to jump, etc. Enemy types and traps change in every area. Visuals also change.

The mining and upgrade system provides motivation besides wanting to progress through the levels. You also want to get rich!

[b]NOT GOOD[/b]: Don't expect a captivating story. There is no voice acting, so all dialogue is written. I just skipped everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103495485', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1638564640}
review:
Muy bueno, si te gusta el género este es un candidato a tu favorito.
Justo cuando te estás por aburrir meten una nueva mecánica que te hace imaginar nuevas posibilidades.
El juego sabe que no querés perder tiempo y te permite hacer rápido lo que muchos otros juegos hacen tedioso.
Los puzzles aumentan la dificultad de manera razonable, el juego te hace pensar en mas de una ocasión.
Los pocos jefes que enfrentás son muy buenos.
Recomendado! Hubiera pagado 100 pesos argentinos por jugarlo, soy medio ratón, este juego vale la pena para los que suelen comprar juegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028615861', 'num_games_owned': 1143, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1638490921}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 es justamente lo que promete: un juego de plataformeo 2D relativamente mono (aunque sin duda no es Ori) donde excavar, obtener minerales, subir a vender, mejorar el equipo, bajar a excavar de nuevo y así rehacer el bucle mientras vas avanzando por la historia. ¿La historia es gran cosa? Pues no, pero el bucle de excavar, enfrentarse a enemigos, progresar, encontrar secretos y demás sin duda es entretenido. 

Gráficamente es un juego mono pero no para echar cohetes. El sonido cumple decentemente. Y, al menos en mi experiencia, no me he encontrado con ningun bug. 

Por todo ello es un juego recomendable para matar unas horillas entretenidas, aunque a nadie le va a cambiar la vida. Un 6.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997460621', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1638826049}
review:
- precisa jogar com controle para se divertir!!! -

Jogo muito relaxante, me lembra o clássico jogo de flash Motherload onde vc fica coletando minérios e vendendo para ganhar upgrades
tem um quê de metroidvania com os upgrades e segredos q vc só consegue encontrar após desbloquear certos itens, fazendo com q vc tenha o pq retornar a áreas já exploradas
a história é OK, com alguns elementos sombrios e um tanto esquisitos em certas partes, fazendo com q o jogo q parece ser para crianças tenha em si um tom um pouco mais maduro

Me diverti bastante, o jogo é relativamente curto, tentei explorar o máximo sem virar monótono e zerei com 90% dos segredos descobertos em ~8horas
muito gratificante ficar pegando din din e comprando upgrades
jogaria novamente

author: {'steamid': '76561197967346265', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1638415172}
review: Cute game, but as far as platformers go nothing really new or innovative. Good enemy variety, somewhat varying environments. Difficultly scales up pretty linearly but it's still a very easy game with no real challenge except maybe the final boss and even then it's only slightly challenging. Veterans aren't going to get much out of this - I'd say it's a good intro for kids to platform gaming. I'd pay under $5 for my kid to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121112670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1638409560}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 is an action platformer where you dig a lot and blow stuff up.  It's the sequel to Steamworld Dig.  Beat it and 100%ed the map and secrets in 15.5 hours using a game controller.  Difficulty is Medium to Easy-Medium.  

- Controls are easy to figure out, but judging sideways movement is a little difficult to master at first.  Navigating the town on the surface is harder than playing everything else in the game because she refused to go up ladders and her sideways jumping is wayward.  The rest of the game (the large, bulky, mining part that you're playing this for) is peaches and pancakes easier with the controls once you get use to everything.  And that's all that matters.

- Steamworld Dig 2 is leagues more improved than Steamworld Dig 1.  And SD1 is awesome in its own right.  It gives you more to do, more ways to Miiiiine.  It's so awesooooome........!

- The story is interesting until wanderlust set in.  This game lets you explore to your hearts' content.  You have freedom to go where you want!  Can't say the story is engaging.  It's more there.  Sorry, Rusty.  I found a secret cave in a random temple and the plot will have to wait.  

- The graphics are westerny sorts of good, and all the robots and critters are creative and memorable.  It's easy to tell one block from another, which pools of liquid you should be sticking your steel toes into, and what will explode in your face.

- The music is OK.  Some songs can get extremely repetitive after a point like a broken record.

*** - Epilepsy Warning.  The game warns you when you start it up that it can trigger.  There is an option in the menu that turns off flashes and blinky bits and that is a life saver and a half.  Even so, take care.  

* - Light Sensitivity warning.  Same as above.  Use the menu option to turn off flashes.  With that set, the game is not as obnoxious as other games, but the dark screen with the many lights can cause a headache if you play too long or in a dark room, especially in the 'underground plant' area.  



If you like SteamWorld Dig 1, you will love SteamWorld Dig 2.  Picks down.  Get it.  Play it.  Enjoy yourself.  If you like Spelunky, this is also a heavily worthy series to invest in.  If you like mining ore for hours on end while avoiding giant bugs and acid, you'll love this.  Any gripes I have are small and negotiable compared to the sheer entertainment I had digging a hole for myself to get lost in.

review:
Esta Es Mi Reseña Sobre El Videojuego "SteamWorld Dig 2", En Verdad Es Un Gran Juego, Tiene Aproximadamente Unas 10 Horas De Campaña, Y Si Eres Uno De Esos Jugadores Que Le Gusta Terminar Un Juego Al 100%, Te Tomara Unas 3 Horas Extras De Contenido. Eso Si, El Nivel Final Es Muy Difícil, Por Lo Que Perderás Constantemente, Así Que Trata De Equiparte Con Un Buen Armamento, Y Más Aún, Si Lo Juegas En La Dificultad Alta, Debido A Que Es Un Verdadero Reto Pasártelo.
Mi Calificación Personal Es Un: 9.4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149062649', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1638434934}
review:
你喜歡挖礦嗎?你喜歡類銀河戰士惡魔城嗎?
那這非常適合你，挖著挖著就破關了

這遊戲是沒有所謂的[b]跳砍[/b]，主要的難度就是建構在這邊
雖然在地圖方面沒有好好地發揮出類銀河戰士惡魔城的特性，但整體的可玩性是非常的足夠
挖全部礦+100%大概10小時左右，總共只有兩場boss fight
對要來跑100%的人相對友善，每個地圖上要搜集的資源並不多，主要都在洞窟裡
而每個洞窟收集完成後都會打勾，每個地圖也有自己的完成度，要對照攻略很方便

最後最後如果你覺得沒甚麼挑戰的話，收集完42個神器之後有額外的洞窟可以挑戰，絕對能滿足你。

author: {'steamid': '76561198122563466', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1638242615}
review:
Esse jogo me surpreendeu, achei que era somente mais um jogo qualquer mas me enganei redondamente!

SteamWorld Dig 2 é um jogo de plataforma 2.5D (eu acho) de mineração e aventura bem interessante pela história e por ter uma protagonista cativante. O jogo consiste em você coletar minérios e vende-los na cidadezinha para assim comprar melhorias para seus equipamentos, você também pode encontrar plataformas onde pode adquirir novas habilidade (achei bem parecido com as cápsulas do Megaman).

A história se desenrola com nossa protagonista Doroty em busca de seu amigo Rusty ao qual está desaparecido depois dos acontecimentos do primeiro jogo (que aliás, não joguei), durante essa busca ela encontra um amigo que outrora seria inimigo e os dois entram em trégua por conta de tudo o que está acontecendo no pequeno planeta.

No mais, eu realmente gostei do jogo, a trilha sonora é ótima e a jogabilidade é muito boa, seria um jogo pra relaxar e jogar com calma, mas se quiser platinar vai ter que tryhardar, pois tem uma conquista por tempo de jogo.

SteamWorld Dig 2 está sendo vendido na Steam por R$37,99, eu o peguei de graça em um evento relâmpago de 24hrs, mas o compraria se estivesse até com 20% de desconto em alguma promoção.

Nota?
Jogabilidade: 10/10
Gráficos: 8.5/10
História: 7/10
Dificuldade: 5/10
Músicas/Sons: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198291155474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1638341330}
review:
已經好久沒玩到這麼神的遊戲了

如果只是要主線全破，那不用花多少時間，這遊戲主要是神在解謎跟探索，尤其是秘密道具，很多都藏在你意想不到的地方，要全找齊真的有點難度，我已經好幾次在找到的瞬間讚嘆製作組，怎麼有辦法想到如此多絕妙的藏匿方式，跟我一樣喜歡把隱藏要素全找齊的玩家請務必一玩

除了隱藏要素外，主線也不馬虎，就算戰鬥不是重點也做得很好，尤其是破關前的戰鬥，真的做很好，某些地方也很考驗操作，可以說這款把解謎探索動作戰鬥這四個要素完美的融合在一起，單憑這點就足夠給10/10，真的是難得一見的神作

author: {'steamid': '76561198138207476', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1638127423}
review:
Se você gosta de um Metroidvania que não seja complexo e impossível de achar itens, com um sistema de upgrade simples e intuitivo, além de escavação (ao bom estilo Terraria, mas simplificado); esse jogo é para você.
Além disso, o enredo é bacana e nada muito complexo, porém todo em inglês, por texto. 
As áreas (level design) são bem construídas, com inimigos, obstáculos e armadilhas novas, cada vez que atinge uma área nova. Isso te força a melhorar seus itens e evita que seja muito repetitivo.
Mas nada disso funcionaria se o controle não fosse bom. O controle desse game é ótimo e recomendo por Joystick, que fica uma experiência perfeita, de tão bem feita que as mecânicas são. 

Resumindo: fiquei com um gostinho de quero mais quando zerei, mesmo não sendo fã de estilo Metroidvania, como eu sou. Recomendo a todos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036154170', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1637266576}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is a perfect sequel to this Metroidvania series. It takes everything the first game was and improves on it while adding some neat bells and whistles to the formula all it's own. 

First of all the game is just gorgeous with this really interesting painterly art style. Big bold colors and fun shapes are used everywhere. It all perfectly sells the town of El Machino, the incredibly detailed main hub (including it's denizens) of this adventure.

It picks up where the first game ended and you're playing as Dorothy searching for Rusty, the previous main character, who vanished at the end of 1. The game breadcrumbs you story bits every now and then to keep you intrigued and wanting to further dig up this mystery. The story was kind of bare bones in the first one so I'm surprised they cared enough to expand it but I'm glad they did.

Don't let the extra care to the story fool you though, the main draw here is still the core loop from the first game. That being to dig up as much ore as you can carry, haul it to the top, and sell it to kit yourself out with upgrades that will let you carry even more and mine even further. Along your descent you'll find challenge rooms that will test your ability and reward you with various treasures, upgrade stations, and a new resource: cogs. 

Cogs are one of my favorite additions to this game that adds a lot of depth and replay value. As you naturally upgrade your gear to be more effective you'll also unlock optional mods. That's where the cogs come in. Some mods cost 1, 2, or more to activate but they're not permanent. If you find that a mod isn't useful anymore and want to spend upgrade cogs elsewhere, you can slot them out and put them in the new thing. This essentially gives you total control of your play style and the freedom to experiment. You never have to worry if a weird upgrade will ruin the experience for you, just take your cogs elsewhere.

There are some great additions to your arsenal and gear that I don't want to spoil, just know that the developers keep things fresh and the gameplay ever evolving. There's always a new upgrade to learn, a secret to find, a challenge room to conquer. 

The level design is in top form too. With all the options the game gives you it kind of has to be and they don't let things go to waste. There are some levels I'm never going to be able to forget and I'd reckon you won't be able to either.

All in all SteamWorld Dig 2 is one of the best Metroidvania titles I've ever played and I urge you to try it yourself if you like the genre. I'm surprised they gave this away for free. From the goofy steampunk western setting to the gorgeous artwork and the addictive gameplay you're spoiled for choice at finding something to like here. As for me, I eagerly await SteamWorld Dig 3 but I bought the spin-off SteamWorld Heist to tide me over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040934941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1638682335}
review:
I can already say I really like this, as I just finished SWD1. It's basically a visual upgrade, and in turn new content and a whole new story. But the only thing that kinda sucks is that when you go to refill water, in SWD1 you would drain the whole pocket of water, but in SWD2, that doesn't happen and water is just infinite. Kinda sucks as it makes it easier and you don't need to think about your water consumption. But besides that it's a lot of fun.

After beating it, I enjoyed SWD1 a lot more. This one really focuses on the platforming and different puzzle rooms, than the mining and metrovania aspect. The last boss battle was also really boring, and just combat overall in the game was pretty lackluster.

author: {'steamid': '76561199004519682', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1638060570}
review:
I saw this game was free and downloaded it despite not being into platformers since I was a child. Tried Ori and it was nice and charming but it didn't make me want to play it again. The second Ori came out and I just wasn't interested. Saw a video of Hollow Knight and it looks well made but it also looks basically just like Ori except you have a skull head and a sword. I wasn't interested and I told myself modern platformers just aren't my thing. I was wrong.

It turns out that modern platformers that rely on a certain aesthetic aren't my thing (that aesthetic being a black and white character, foregrounds which are mostly silhouettes, with backgrounds that are out of focus pastel scenery. I don't find it appealing). I'm also not a fan of platformers that require me to have perfect button timing if I wish to advance. I don't want to "get good" when I'm playing a platformer, I want to have fun.

SteamWorld Dig 2 is the best platformer I've played in the last 20 years. The world and characters are fun and charming. The controls are fantastic. The story makes me want a SteamWorld Dig 3 (seriously, I want to know what the heck happens to these characters). I had so much fun playing this game that I felt like I ripped the developer off so I just bought SteamWorld Quest. If Image & Form Games ever makes a SteamWorld Dig 3, I'll definitely buy it without a second thought. 10/10
