author: {'steamid': '76561197999455115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 104, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1711632557}
review:
TL:DR - Great Metroid-Vania style game with fun art, challenging boss fights, and real fun movement. 8/10

Plot: Cool story to continue after SteamWorld Dig left off. Nothing too crazy or to write home about, but it was nice to have a character motivation that made sense.

Graphics: Love the style choice and the puppet movement works great in this game. Everything is well colored and the use of light while spelunking is fun.

Music: The music definitely fits the game and the areas, and while not the best definitely works well. The music also changes  when your lamp runs out, which is a nice touch.

Movement: Pretty standard at the start. Once you get the Sprint Hydraulics and the Hook Shot... boy howdy! Also, you can Double Jump by assigning jump to two buttons and press them within rapid succession of each other. Dash -> Double Jump -> Hook Shot a wall to get to areas and get secrets as soon as possible to get more upgrades equipped with Upgrade Cogs.

Combat: Fighting enemies is something best taken only as much as needed in this game. Dot isn't built for combat, she's built for digging. That isn't to say the combat is bad, simply fitting for the style of game this is.

Bosses: Most of the boss fights are fair enough, though the final boss gives a good run for your money. My advice, upgrade the Armor all the way, and pick up the True Survivor Mod.

Secrets: There are tons of secrets all over the place to collect so be sure to look and check everywhere! There are hidden walls and bricks to break and all kinds of things like that.

Overall, I know this is a game I love and if it wasn't for the final boss fight being a touch frustrating and wanting a little bit more from the sound design, this could have easily made it into huge success. I love it and would definitely recommend getting your hands on it. Currently, I am learning the Four Gold Star speed run of the game, which really blows how the mechanics work open. I would recommend beating it first on your own before learning the speed run if you want to go that way, especially since some categories of the speed run skip some elements of the plot which I think is pretty nice. 

I got this game as part of a free deal they were holding online, though I was not given this copy directly by the company with the explicit intent of review nor was I given any other compensation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023154119', 'num_games_owned': 5242, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1637273880}
review:
Podobnie jak w poprzedniczce, pętla rozgrywki jest prościutka: schodzimy do kopalni, kopiemy, zbieramy zasoby, wypełniamy plecak, wracamy sprzedać skarby, ulepszamy ekwipunek... i od nowa. I znowu. I znowu wciąga to jak bagno. Jednak tym razem kopania, zdolności, wszystkiego jest więcej i przejście zajmuje dłużej. I to zdecydowany plus!

To po prostu lepsza wersja pierwszego Diga. Ładniejsza, lepiej brzmiąca, dająca jeszcze więcej frajdy. Z powolnym startem, ale od kiedy zyskujemy hak do przyciągania się do ścian, zaczyna się robić cudownie. Ciężko mi się tu przyczepić do czegokolwiek (nie chodzi o hak, ten się klei niemal do każdej ściany!). Walka nie powala, ale to dodatek. Bonusowe wyzwanie jest irytujące, ale nikt do niego nie zmusza. Fabuła do zapomnienia... ale co z tego?

Czysta rozrywka. Żadnych zbędnych zapychaczy.

review:
The exploration and gameplay are really fun in this. The dialogue and characters are forgettable, so I recommend skipping through the dialogue and getting to the real meat and potatoes of this game: mining around and solving the puzzle rooms.
It has clear inspiration from Hollow Knight, but it puts its own twist on things and adds a lot to it.
Highly recommend for just sitting back and relaxing to this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358112131', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1698324869}
review:
[code]Этот обзор был написан для моей [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41075366/]кураторской группы[/url]. Я целюсь на инди-игры, о которых почти никто не знает, так что если вам интересны обзоры в таком духе, то, будьте добры, подпишитесь, это мне очень сильно поможет.[/code]
[b]"Копай, прыгай, стреляй, цепляйся, летай - что еще нужно для любителя метроидваний?! 
...Да, интересный драматичный сюжет. Но про него тоже не забыли. [/b]

[h1]SteamWorld Dig 2[/h1]


[b]Год релиза:[/b] 2017
[b]Описание:[/b] SteamWorld Dig возвращается! Копайте глубже: вас ждут сокровища и ужасы подземного мира. Это платформенное приключение в шахте. Метроидвания в лучшем смысле этого слова.

[b]Плюсы:[/b]

- Прежде всего, я хотел бы сказать, - очень интересная идея самой игры. Почти всю игру ты проводишь под землей, и чуть меньше - копая ее. Нет нет, если вы искали хорошую затягивающую метроидванию - эта тоже вам придется по вкусу. Ходите по шахтам, напряженно думаете "блин там рудочка, как бы ее сломать, а точно можно выстрелить вверх моей новенькой пушкой" "Ой там враг спавнится, как бы там не упасть" "Черт побери новый карьер, осторожней бы надо быть". 
- Красивая графика, - очень красивые локации и их бэкграунды, враги, и все оно очень стилистично. Палитра зашибись.
- Хотел бы подметить, что у роботов в городе очень интересные личности, их манеры и внешность, история. Кто то стесняется себя и пытается быть полезным, не мешая тебе. Кто-то считает, что слишком важен для других, и все время лезет со своей помощью. Мэру вот вообще плевать на ситуацию, - вся земля трясется, а ему лишь бы добычу продвигать.
- Если учитывать то, что сказано выше, то и история продвигается очень интересно. Финал вообще очень неожиданный - [spoiler]думал, что уже спас планету, а в итоге землетрясения только продолжили развиватся, а ты послужил оружием для злодея, чтобы уничтожить друга и покорить планету, а друга ты изначально хотел просто найти и вернуть домой.[/spoiler]
- Способности. Дофига. Интересных. Разнообразных. Способностей. Очень большая фича в игре пожалуй.
[b]Минусы:[/b]
- [strike]Нема :3[/strike] Ну... что сказать... их почти что нету?
Лишь иногда бесит, когда очень долго нет станций, и очень долго приходилось возвращаться, а там снова подыхаешь. Да и когда для получения апгрейдов приходится возвращаться в те места, которые ты давно залутал и заходить в пещеры, чтоб получить чертежи.

Вывод:
[strike]С вас хватит моего бреда[/strike] Почти что идеальная игра! Да, есть лучше, но мне достаточно и такой ламповой простенькой игры. Твердая рекомендация!
Оценка: 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028872273', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1639133568}
review:
One of my personal favourite platformer games ever.
[h1]Enjoyed:[/h1]
💚 Improved upon SteamWorld Dig 1 in almost every aspect (and SD1 was already great!)
💚 Clear, beautiful and living graphics style, lighting
💚 Incredible Soundtrack!
💚 Lots of non-linear Exploration
💚 World Exploration aspect is very fun
💚 Skills and platforming are very tight, intuitive and comfortable
💚 Lots and lots of clever secrets to discover in the game world
💚 Fun and clever puzzles to solve, including platforming challenges
💚 Allows choosing Easy and Normal difficulty
💚 Allows choosing guided or non-guided quests
💚 Very lighthearted mood, multiplied by funny items' descriptions
💚 Platforming is advanced, allows some interesting speedrunning skips and sequence breaking
💚 Runs really great for the look: very fast (over 60+ FPS) even on an Intel HD Graphics 4600 in 1920x1080

[h1]Could Be Better:[/h1]
💔 There is some kind of story, but not too satisfying (for me)
💔 Combat and enemies are not as advanced as in other games
💔 It would be nice if the game allowed to cap framerate to a desired amount (other than turning on Vsync)

author: {'steamid': '76561198154589726', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1637800742}
review:
Um jogo feito com um carinho MUITO grande.

Eu já tinha adorado o primeiro Steam World Dig, esse só melhorou tudo que o primeiro já fazia. Ele está mais dinâmico, com animações estão mais fluídas, mais visualmente agradável e com vários efeitos de iluminação que dão um charme para as cavernas escuras que você vai enfrentar.

SWD2 funciona dentro de um loop de gameplay, você vai descer na caverna, coletar vários minérios, talvez achar umas engrenagens para upgrades, voltar, vender seus minérios, fazer upgrades na suas ferramentas e repetir. Ao longo dessas etapas você vai seguindo a história do jogo, que é simples, mas cativante.

As engrenagens servem para ativar upgrades das ferramentas que você evolui na loja, esse sistema é mais interessante que o sistema do jogo passado na minha opinião, pois faz você precisar escolher o que é mais importante para você ao invés de simplesmente desbloquear tudo.

O level design é simplesmente incrível, enquanto explora, você percebe como alguns pontos foram meticulosamente pensados. É algo que só vendo para entender.

A única falta que senti nesse game foram as escadas do primeiro jogo, elas eram muito úteis e infelizmente não se encontram aqui, apesar do jogo compensar com outras ferramentas.

Lembro que não esperava muito do primeiro jogo, mas joguei o primeiro e fiquei com vontade de jogar o segundo, recentemente ele ficou grátis por um tempo limitado e aproveitei para jogar. Já posso dizer que já quero um Steam World Dig 3, tenho certeza que vai ser tão bom quanto, se não melhor, visto a evolução que teve desde o primeiro jogo.

Tenho certeza que qualquer um vai ter pelo menos um pouco de diversão com esse jogo, mesmo que não o termine por causa do loop de gameplay. Mas para pessoas como eu, que gostam de escutar algo enquanto joga, esse é sem dúvida uma ótima compra. Ele também tem muitos secrets para descobrir, ótimo para os complecionistas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367122151', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1637777489}
review:
Простая, но захватывающая и атмосферная игра, в которую хочется продолжать и продолжать играть. Чем дальше, тем интереснее. Лично мне эта игра подарила много положительных эмоций)

ПЛЮСЫ 
+ разнообразные локации
+ удобное управление, которое можно настроить под себя
+ много разных способностей
+ приятная графика
+ секретки
(и многое другое)

МИНУСЫ
А я их не нашел) Мне всё понравилось)

P.S. Если честно, то изначально по скриншотам игра мне показалась не особо интересной... Но я все-таки решился установить её. И совершенно не пожалел! Просто шикарная игра. Прошел с удовольствием :) Рекомендую любителям подобного жанра)

Оценка: 10 шестеренок из 10-ти ))))

review:
Simple platformer with puzzles and collections.

The biggest problem for this game is: after acquiring late game upgrades like long range grappler for hook shot, and jet engine, lots of puzzles or secrets are too easy to solve. The game became boring after that.

Overall it's an average platform game. If you like solving puzzles and discovering secrets then you can have a try. Otherwise there are lots of other platformers to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198983211883', 'num_games_owned': 2196, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1637859711}
review:
[b]Back to the hole! A smashing return to the steampunk Wild West.[/b]

SteamWorld Dig 2 is very much the sequel everybody were waiting for. It has the same core gameplay loop of digging for riches as in its predecessor, but  every single aspect of this game has been improved up on from platforming, puzzle solving and RPG elements to its gorgeously detailed aesthetic.

If you played the original SteamWorld Dig (and you should!) then you'll be familiar with Rusty, the hero from the original SteamWorld Dig who has gone missing. So, his friend Dorothy (who had a role in the original as the townsperson who purchased all of Rusty's mined ore) sets out to find out what happened to him. Early in her adventure, she'll meet a quirky blue and possibly deranged entity called Fen that joins her on her search. Together, they seek out Rusty and try to find out what's causing the mysterious earthquakes affecting the town of El Machino.

In this metroidvania, you’ll dig down into the earth to find caverns, enemies, puzzles, challenges, and some pretty crazy boss fights as you progress towards the bottom. The great part about the game is that each tool you acquire and each skill you gain (by spending money back in town) serves a very specific purpose: to help you keep digging but in contrast to its predecessor, SteamWorld Dig 2’s mines are not procedurally generated and while the digging process seems repetitive in nature, it never becomes tedious. The exploration feeling will push you to cover all areas in-depth in seeking of new rewards or secrets.

As in other games from Image & Form team, overworld and different areas you will find while progressing across the game are carefully constructed and works beautifully in practice. Music is both charming and existing too! Sadly, there aren’t a huge variety of enemies, but you would fine some remarkable boss fights.

All in all, SteamWorld Dig 2 retains the original’s addictive digging mechanics but takes every aspect of the previous game and doubles its quality. The mixture of exploration, combat, platforming, and puzzle solving, alongside a set of extra abilities to unlock within the gameplay gives it plenty of variety and a great rhythm. If you enjoyed the prequel, give it a try to this game its even better! 100% Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197998529543', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1637544850}
review:
A very fun and addictive game that I really enjoyed playing after the first part.
The game is a mix between a Metroidvania (not that much) and an exploring game, the story is fun and interesting, although kind of easy to miss since some times you have to go near the NPC's to see if they have something new to say.
The world is HUGE, and interesting and with a lot of biomes and difficult tricks and monsters, and that is something that actually makes it more addictive. Some parts have a checkmark when you finish them and I sure finished them all.
Totally recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111012284', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2042, 'last_played': 1637675970}
review: Very excellent and enjoyable game. Very impressive overall too. I was put off at first as it seemed too complex compared to the first game and thought it would annoy me, but it didn't. There's just a ton more digging and exploring to do. Some very clever puzzle elements too which make you stop and think and feel rewarding. The devs obviously put a lot of work and effort in, you can feel life in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192131554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1637602609}
review:
Огонь игра! Прям топчик среди платформеров, Только стилистика карты немного выбивается от игровой графы.. Могли пиксели сделать не такими явными и было бы в тему.. В общем. разрабы молодцы! Игра тянет на рублей 200, Реиграбильность не особая.. Прошел на 94%, на нормальной сложности, честно говоря даже не тянет проходить, ибо остались мелочи, которые особо и не интересны в прокачке..Но в любом случае, игра достойная внимания! 
Спасибо за эмоции!

author: {'steamid': '76561199142193894', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1687781516}
review: Простая и не притязательная платформерная игра с приятной графикой. Простая механика и понятное управление. Есть весьма забавные название драгоценный минералов. С озвучкой никаких проблем вообще. Роботы просто трещат и скрипят на разный лад, а смысл передается текстом, которого не так много, чтобы надоедало читать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080120355', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1637587173}
review:
전작을 계승한 좋은 후속작
편의기능같은게 많이 생겼고 파밍이 강요시되지 않아서 좋았다
전편에서는 노가다만 겁나하다가 플탐 엄청걸린 경험이있어서
이번작은 미션위주로 했는데 3시간정도 걸린다
나름 재밌게 즐길만 하다고 생각함

author: {'steamid': '76561199096968316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1637186851}
review: Это игра мне понравилась своей рисовкой,в игре она красивая и приятная.Основная суть игры:это найти своего пропавшего друга.В игре мы будем копаться в шахте и полученное сдавать и получать деньги,за эти деньги мы обновляем наше снаряжение.Игра одиночная[советую проходить на геймпаде].Сложность игры низко средняя.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048809163', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1638634539}
review:
発売から4年の突然の期間限定無料配布

残念ながら日本語非対応、あとゲームパッド強く推奨

掘って、進んで、鉱石宝石を拾って換金してアップグレード！
それ更に楽に掘って、進んで、鉱石宝石拾って換金してアップグレード！！
アップグレードとは別に見るからに入るとパワーアップしそうなカプセルに入って能力開花なところはすごくメトロイド
隠し部屋も多く存在し「あ、その壁半透明なのかぁ・・・」ってのもしょっちゅう
チャレンジ部屋みたいな場所は隠しアイテムを全部取るとチェックマークもつくのでかなり良心的

ただし中盤過ぎてくるとノーダメは不可能なレベルでダメージ食らうことが増えてくる
でも逆にそれが燃えてくるんですよねぇ
「あそこに隠しがあるのは分かってるのに行くのが難しい！」って場合は先に進めて新能力を手に入れて戻ってくるとあっさり取得できたりするので意地にならないこともまた重要

2050円と言われても納得のゲームです

続編はガラッとイメチェンしてターン制RPGなんすね

author: {'steamid': '76561198022996002', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1645727978}

author: {'steamid': '76561198401606625', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1637572898}
review:
9時間ほどでクリア
ひたすら下に掘ってたまにある素材入りのタイルから素材を入手して売って強化を繰り返すゲーム
マップが固定なので素材タイルの数も限らているのですが最終的に金欠になると思います
死ぬと持ってる素材をロストするので死に過ぎるとさらにジリ貧に、体力減ったら直ぐ帰ろう
敵を倒すと少額のお金が手に入るが雀の涙レベルなので素材掘りつくすと強化できなくるのどうにかしてほしかったかな

author: {'steamid': '76561198273892969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1637301557}
review:
Contém spoiler!

Considerando que anteriormente, meu amigo Rusty foi dado como morto depois de um desmoronamento no profundo subsolo da mina que ele herdou, explorava e entro em um embate com um outro rôbo, que seu tio projetou e se fundiu a ele, passo a procurar este meu amigo.
Ouço que ele se tornado um monstro, sou enganada por um grupo de primitivos viciados em drogas, ao ser orientada a destruir as máquinas que ele havia criado e se "tornou um problema" para a estabilidade da área.
Pois, as máquinas atrapalhavam o funcionamento de uma destilaria focada no aumento da produção de drogas, que escravisari4 o restante da humanidade. 
Com o resgate de meu amigo e a instabilidade do atual planeta, todos os moradores embarcam em um foguete e vão civilizar um outro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134133857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1637534820}
review:
Un plataformero muy solido con mecanicas bastante interesantes eh originales con un poco de mezcla del gameplay del primer juego ( el cual necesitaba una pulida ) y una historia bastante interesante y simple de entender. El estilo artistico es para mi el mejor cambio ( Del primer juego ) con colores que destaca mas y escenarios mucho mas llamativos y espectaculares.
Es un juego super recomendable a fanaticos del genero plataforma y metroidvania pero para el resto de jugadores, es un juego interesante con un lindo arte eh mecanicas friendly para los que recien empiezan con el genero
3 / 5 Una experiencia muy hermosa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096969070', 'num_games_owned': 1331, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1703408436}
review:
发布于：2021 年 11 月 21 日 下午 7:28前几天不知道哪里弄到了这个游戏。画面明显是精细制作，一下就玩了20分钟。好玩！
2023.12.24更新时隔2年，今年主要玩类恶魔城，终于重启把这个游戏打完了，而且是用办公室电脑与笔记本交替完成。
游戏评价，9/10，唯一差的地方就是汉化问题，官方不是没有汉化，但是在NS日区版，3DM的汉化已经不可用，修改的版本有贴图问题，实在是遗憾！为了顺畅通关还是使用了英语，但肯定没有母语沉浸感好。本作之前是3DS的游戏，轻巧且精妙，几百M但是不简陋，完全停不下来！
类恶魔城平台跳跃，重收集，难度不太高，这简直是为我定制的。成就进度30/34，没完成的是4小时内全收集0死亡相关，最速通关是多年前偶尔看的东西，本作TAS成绩不到20分钟，我一直是观赏，几乎不做多周目体验，而且0死难度也太大了。
其中能错过的成就有2个，指南区俄语篇有提示，但是提前都做好了，尤其是【潜龙谍影】这个成就（没有汉译，solid snake我当然就这么翻译啦），触发警报只能ALT+F4，所以我备份了一次存档，试了半个小时终于完成！
其他全收集还是挺容易的，尴尬的是地图资源不会无限刷新，虽然金星，全升级都能做到，但是最后商人的2个齿轮没钱了，虽然不在成就范围而且没有任何价值，还是在最后修改了金钱买了一下。
目前唯一差的成就是【To hell and back】，全收集后的隐藏试炼（sigillum caelum et infernum蓝图，翻译过来是seal of heaven and hell），乱序地图无补给，条件禁道具。对我来说真的好难...油管看了一下视频，可以放弃了，每个机关图我都不能确定2条命能过关，这还这么多图连续无存档补给，再见啦！本作如果出了3代我会入库的！！

author: {'steamid': '76561197993329136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1637484559}
review:
They offered it for free as a promo, so I got it.  It's perfectly charming.  I easily got my money's worth.

That sounds sarcastic, but it kind of isn't.  I had a good time but I wouldn't have bought the game.  I'm not keen on platformers and I'm ambivalent towards "metroidvania"-type stuff.

Happily for me, the game doesn't really make you backtrack so much as present an obstacle you can't surmount and then immediately give you the tools to surmount it... pluuuuus a couple hidden optional bonus things you're under no obligation to resolve unless you're a 100% completionist sort.  I am not.

Platformers often have this "pixel perfect jumping" conceit, which is not for me.  It's not that my reflexes aren't up to it, it's that it's a not-very-rewarding exercise of precision.  This, again, doesn't really have much of that except as optional bonuses.

So supposing you want a kind of charming, platformy metroidania sort of thing, here you are.  It's right here.

author: {'steamid': '76561199019531152', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1637466808}
review: 《Steamworld Dig 2》,Dig all over the Steamworld.挖掘几乎是游戏的唯一要做的事情，探索、解谜与战斗，甚至前进都需要挖掘。而以挖掘为核心的平台游戏玩法被开发到了极致，轻度银河恶魔城的地图设计与丰富的齿轮模组让挖掘的过程乐趣无穷。非常享受每一次的十字镐挥舞。

author: {'steamid': '76561198121189618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1637465061}
review:
Its a SUPER polished platformer whose comparisons would only be part of the picture.
-Its sorta like Spelunky, but with more terrain destruction.
-Its sorta like Zelda, in that there are puzzles, a story, and new upgrades that deepen the gameplay
-The boss battles are few, but when they come around they flow incredibly well with the game's mechanics
-The tools you unlock over time are incredibly fun. Its like every tool is twice as cool as the last (one of them is a hookshot...)
-The game never really slows down and stops being fun, it only gets better.
-the art and animation is SUPER well done to compliment its amazing gameplay.

I got it for free during its giveaway on Steam, but after looking at the normal price I can say its definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028150162', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1637465078}
review: This game is exactly what I expected. Simple and fun. I don't get bored of it and any issues you have with the equipment are eventually solved as you get more money to upgrade it. I am very impressed and am definitely trying my best to find all of the cogs you can get so I can have every upgrade possible and every blueprint possible. I definitely recommend this game.

review:
A cute metroidvania type game as a direct sequel to SteamWorld Dig 1, though you don't need to play the first to enjoy this or understand what's going on.

While digging down isn't a varied task, it was still a fun adventure, though a little easy.

Developers did a fantastic job in a certain mechanical area with both audio and visuals, that was a great time.

Recommend for a casual and short-ish metroidvania style game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117102408', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1637424819}
review:
Mein Wohlgefallen dieses Spiel vollumfänglich fand.

 15 Stunden Spielspaß und am Ende fühlt es sich an, auch dank Story und Musik, als käme man nach einem guten Film aus dem Kino.

Der Wiederspielwert ist überschaubar, außer vielleicht für Achievementjcracks - aber ein Playthrough lohnt definitiv, spätestens im Sale. 

Eines dieser Spiele, bei denen wirklich niemand etwas falsch machen kann, so wohldesignt, so griffig und so poliert wie es ist.

Das Preis-Unterhaltungsverhältnis ist einfach erstklassig.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971326073', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1637422587}
review:
This was an easy game to sit down and play while multitasking.   7/10.  Easily Recommended.
They absolutely nail pacing, progression and upgrades which makes the overall experience enjoyable.  

The reason the score isn't higher comes down to a few things.  The game never really blew me away...I was never hyped to return to the game or eagerly awaiting what was coming next...I just went with the flow.  A little like playing through a game you really like for the 2nd or 3rd time so you're comfortable with everything but are just having a good time. 

The game could have done a much better job with enemy variety.  The melee combat never felt all that great.  The complete lack of boss fights especially surrounding the 'devices' you destroy was a major misstep.  There was certainly room to improve while at the same time being a very well polished experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319585895', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1637406442}
review:
This is such a wonderful title that I can unconditionally recommend to any players.

Pros:
[list]
[*] Great cartoonish art style.
[*] Large hand-crafted map.
[*] Western & Steampunk themes platformer with Metroidvania elements.
[*] Mining, digging, and exploring the map with fully upgraded equipment are such a pleasure.
[*] Numerous collectibles that are neither too easy nor too difficult to get.
[*] Each cave is a different mini puzzle and offers more varieties to your adventure.
[*] The game is linear and indicates clearly where you need to go to proceed the story (you don't have to follow the guidance strictly though, and there is even an achievement for that). This is a pro for me, maybe not for everybody.
[/list]

My small complaints:
[list]
[*] Uninteresting plot/dialogues.
[*] Mediocre soundtrack, especially compared to its predecessor.
[*] Unfriendly towards completionists: speedrun/no death/farming achievements; achievement for very difficult trials.
[/list]

SteamWorld Dig 2 is such an improvement over its predecessor, SteamWorld Dig. What SteamWorld Dig did right, SteamWorld Dig 2 does even better; what SteamWorld Dig did wrong, SteamWorld Dig 2 properly corrects them. Detailed improvements over its predecessor for those who have played SteamWorld Dig:
[list]
[*] Even better graphics.
[*] The map is larger and hand-crafted (i.e. the same for all the players) and the game is also twice longer to finish (around 10 hours).
[*] Water and health are much easier to replenish. They are fully recovered each time you go back to town or when you are in a water pool if you have upgraded equipment. After upgrading your equipment, defeated enemies drop plenty of replenish orbs.
[*] Less likely to die, and does not take away half of your wealth when you do. Hence, more casual and more focused on exploration.
[*] More equipment, in particular [spoiler]Jet engine and long-range grappler/hook[/spoiler]. They make navigating the map much easier and joyful.
[*] Plenty of teleport points scattered all over the map. And unlike in Steamworld Dig, you can teleport between any of these points, which means you no longer waste tons of time navigating a completely explored part of the map.
[*] Has a secret percentage shown on the map so that you can know if you have found all the secrets in an area. You can also refer to this wonderful secret guide: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1144149252. This guide provides a high-resolution map with annotation of all the secrets of the game, an essential reference for completionists.
[*] Feels much less repetitive since the caves are more interesting to explore.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198014940729', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1637369539}
review:
This game is great. The things I liked:

- Core gameplay loop of exploring, mining and returning to town is amazing.
- Movement is tight. You get more and more mobility as the game goes on.
- Optional post-game is short but fittingly difficult.
- The game looks great and runs well.
- It's possible to sequence break and doing so is pretty fun. The game even encourages it with an achievement.
- The upgrade system is well-made and it's fun to interact with it and see the small bonus effects you can accumulate over time.
- The game is really good about explaining a new gameplay concepts with the simplest puzzle it can come up with before having you solve the real puzzles. Example: It will put you in a room with a mine cart and the only way out is to smash it. The game teaches the cart is smashable before you need to smash them for the puzzle in the next room.

The things I disliked:

- Going back to town after making progress in the story and seeing all the towns folk have "..." above their heads always felt bad. The "..." indicates that they have new dialog. It's such a slog having to read their dialog. It's not well written. Also only 2 lines are shown at once so it's a chore to click through it all. You can't just spam your way through it, you'd miss the story!
- Once you mine everything the only way to make money is to farm enemies and it sucks. It's not a fun grind.
- 100%ing the game's achievements requires 2 or 3 playthroughs.
- The game's short. 14 hours to beat the story and find all the secrets and collectibles.
- 99% of the time the game is consistent about its rules so it almost never feels bad when a secret is hidden too well. The thing is: like 2 or 3 times a secret is something like: break a block that's not breakable in every other situation but is breakable here.
- I like the music but it can get repetitive.
- The story between the main character and their companion sucks. They're friends in 2-seconds and never talk to each other. At first, it seems the companion is there to act as a hint system but there's only like 5 prompts in the entire game to talk to them.
- A LOT of the story in this game is dependent on knowing the events of the first game. This game explains the main points; that "Rusty" was the main character of the first game and he was really important but all of the finer details are not present.
- It feels like one of the plot-lines just gets dropped and forgotten about roughly 2-thirds of the way in.

Overall I'd recommend this game. I really enjoyed my playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340774998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1677010511}
review:
Игра мне настолько понравилась, что я её прошёл, а это удивительно для меня. Что можно сказать об игре, не сильно трудная, не сильно напряжная, прошёл с удовольствием. Геймплей не замысловат, но затягивает, сюжет не сильно сложный, без первой части можно понять. Вообщем категорически рекомендую, но брал по скидке, хз если честно, нужна ли она вам за фуллпрайс
В будущем обязательно перепройду игру, короче, рекомендую

author: {'steamid': '76561198101808464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1637345450}
review: Что я могу сказать про игру - чисто на любителя. Для ребенка до 15 лет зайдет, по старше, ну если любите Метроэдванию, копать и ставить себе задачи(Пол это лава!!! - если у вас есть желание получить секрет, то пока вы не получите 2 вещи, даже не думайте соваться, так с большинством комнат.). Хочу отметить очень хороший баланс сложности. Игра не такая простая, чтобы её бросить на пол пути от однообразия, но и не такая сложная, чтобы вызывать у вас приступы гнева. Так же она ставит перед вами чёткую цель, а не "найди мне то, не знаю что". Но немного раздражают босы(немного простой пул атак, которые не вызывают у вас напряжение); очень сильно выбешивал порой проектировка комнат с испытании, если вы хоте найти все секреты; музыка - рекомендую сразу на минимум или совсем выключить(после 3 часов игры с настройками по умолчанию и головная боль обеспечена). 16 часов игры в режима пылесоса всех ресурсов. Если решитесь, то приятного погружения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076753735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1988, 'last_played': 1637345636}
review:
Круто
Второй по шикарности платформер после Hollow knight для меня. 

Hollow knight был сложнее и с более интересным сюжетом
SteamWorldDig 2 - спокойный и приятный для исследования.
(отмечу для сравнения что Ori и Rayman Legends мне обе куда менее нравились)

Плюсы:
+ спокойный исследовательский геймплей
+ много секретов
+ реально удобное управление, много навыков
+ офигенный, хоть и маленький, саундтрек
+ хорошая графика

Минусы:
- Сюжет довольно примитивен и учавствует в игре по минимуму (хотя концовка прикольная)
- Иногда казалось что игре не хватает какого-то хаоса, что-ли... Слишком линейненько всё шло.
- Финальное необязательное испытание слишком сложное( Как-то лень по прохождении игры было в нем страдать, может позже...

ИТОГ: Игра не идеальная, но очень приятная. Если вы ищите что-то спокойное или какой хороший платформер то это самое оно

author: {'steamid': '76561198044073685', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1637338344}
review:
Отличная игра, которая подарит множество положительных эмоций. Приятная графика, ненапряжная фоновая музыка, интересный геймплей на месте. 
В лучших традициях жанра исследование мира вознаграждается, а заниматься этим увлекательно (особенно ближе к концу игры, когда получите большинство апгрейдов).
Здесь довольно простенький сюжет, но от него большего и не надо. 
Немного не хватило возможности копать по-диагонали, а так твердая 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209516945', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1637716625}
review: Steamworld Dig 2 es una gran secuela y no dudo en recomendarla. Mantiene la fórmula jugable del primero, pero la pule con un enfoque metroidvania (mapa más grande, lleno de recursos y secretos), una buena historia que expande su universo, y lo remata con un apartado visual y sonoro que es un deleite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010990277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1637302137}
review:
It was an interesting game for the first half, but I got bored during the last stretch. Probably won't ever revisit this title. Took me about 8 hours to complete the campaign. I didn't worry about finding everything.  

It's a cool concept, but it gets dull quick. I can't recommend a game that became boring half way through. Also, the movement seemed way to "floaty" which was a hassle. IDK maybe its what the devs were going for.     

If you like the metrovania/platformer style games, this might hold your attention for a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043033329', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1637364900}
review:
If you enjoyed the first, SteamWorld Dig 2 should be an instant buy. It does everything good the first one did and makes it better. The new areas are great, the campaign is more dynamic, the exploration is much improved, and the decision to move away from procedural generation helps make the world feel so much more cohesive. 

However, It doesn't improve or really change much about how the game controls. They went almost unnoticed in the first game. Its simplicity and more arcade-y nature made them feel quirky rather than annoying. Though now that exploration and platforming is front and center with the challenge rooms being more frequent and more fleshed out, they've become that much more of a nuisance. It's not enough to swear off the game, but its certainly something to keep in mind during your play-through. Otherwise its honestly a phenomenal game and I think you could buy this guilt free at full price if for some reason you couldn't wait for it to go on sale (of which it does almost monthly) 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198260704528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1638484479}
review:
In general i don't like Jump'n'Runs.

BUT, i liked "Lost Vikings" on Amiga back then.

Not just J&R, this game enforces to think about some hidden areas and solve puzzles with the magic of J&R skill (i cannot believe i'm saying this).

In some cases it's easy, another time, it is forcing you to think about what to do to get the "grand bonus" and finish a cave.

Playing on Linux and got it due to 100% discount. It's a nice add but some achievements might be a challenge.
Still working on them, but overall atmosphere is providing a feeling of being welcomed to ignore downsides like dying or so, which might be provided by a nice music, sound and interactions.

Lets say, this game has a story to tell.

I might add, that this game also uses RPG style. You get XP and rise in levels. You can improve your primary skills with money, which you get by mining or killing bugs and selling them in the city (permanent) and can set special skills using "cogwheels", which you can rechange any time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146986200', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1637037528}
review:
Buen juego bastante adictivo, no le di mucha bola al plot pero la verdad que esta bien.
Es divertido pero el final me dejo medio vacio, tiene momentos que superan la pelea del final, establecen como una dimension rarisima en la mitad del juego y no la traen de vuelta para el final que era medio lo que estaba esperando
Dentro de todo lo que lo hace divertido es el gameplay y las mejoras que conseguimos. Es un buen juego para complecionistas tambien, ya que hay un enfasis en encontrar secretos en las diferentes salas y nos deja saber tranquilamente si nos perdimos de algo o no.
TlDr: Plataformero solido con buenas mecanicas y buen world building pero historia meh y no muy largo 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972299640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1637241500}
review:
This game was given out for free for a time, so I got it. Other than just barely having tried the former game once, I didn't expect much.

Once I got into it, I had quite some fun with it. What does it for me, is primarily the hunt for hidden stuff, of which there is plenty in this game. The overall art and style is also pretty cool, I think. There are also puzzles to solve, and some of them can be quite tricky. The mining bit is mostly about buying upgrades, but it's also part of the exploration. The story isn't that special, but it's alright. The controls and game-play works fine, but the fine movement is a bit difficult to master.

The NPCs are a bit too chatty. The voices are of the "gibberish" kind, which is a bit annoying, but I've heard worse. The replay value is limited, since the world is pre-designed. There are plenty of achievements to work for, and some of them pretty much requires playing the game again, but I think that motivation isn't quite enough to justify several play-throughs. Perhaps a more open and/or randomly generated world would've helped. I had to look up some of the last few secrets, as they were pretty hard to find. There's a special challenge area you eventually can reach, and it's very challenging indeed, but it's completely optional.

I expected to be able to continue my game after the finale, but I had to go back to the last save. Speaking of the ending, it was a little disappointing, in that they went for a comic book presentation rather than a full animation. You can complete the game in about 10-15 hours.

If you like exploration and old-school secret hunts, this game might well be for you. It gets my recommendation.

Now I might have to consider getting the previous game and play through that as well.

review:
While I got this game for free I would have totally paid a few bucks for it. I really enjoyed playing through it aswell as the previous game (which I got for free on origin xD). Honestly I probably wouldn't have bought it because I didn't know what kinda game it is xD

About the game though; its a 2D platformer with a focus on mining. You unlock more and more upgrades as you get through the game, which help you reach further or have a easier time. The game also includes some difficulty increasing options, some of which can be found via NPCs in secret areas across the game world (have fun finding them :P)

author: {'steamid': '76561198214134159', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1637178729}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 es un juego que lo tiene todo, desde una jugabilidad muy cómoda, una progresión medida al milímetro, una simpatía en el diseño y los diálogos del juego, hasta un apartado gráfico y sonoro de ensueño. 
Es cortito sí, pero ofrece todo lo que el género debe ofrecer en su medida exacta y esa es la gran baza de este imprescindible de 2017. La única pega que me he encontrado ha sido, como bien he comentado antes, la doble restricción de las mejoras de nuestro equipo o que, como en la vida real, picar demasiado puede convertirse en una tarea monótona. Es verdad, el juego parece no progresar en exceso respecto a su antecesor, aunque el apartado gráfico está a años luz si los comparamos, SteamWorld Dig 2 es más grande y mejor, mucho mejor.

[b]Puntos positivos[/b]
+Su diseño artístico, tanto gráficos como los personajes son fabulosos.
+Buena dificultad progresiva.
+El mapa es lo suficientemente grande como para que no te aburras.
+Su banda sonora es bastante agradable y acompaña muy bien en las zonas del juego.

[b]Puntos negativos[/b]
-Aunque la mejoría es notable con respecto a su anterior entrega, no lo hace demasiado.
-Excavar puede llegar a aburrir o volverse monótono.
-Una duración media de 8 horas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375993625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1637172602}
review:
Graphics 10/10

Gameplay 8/10

Story 5/10

Soundtrack 5/10

Replay Value? Sure, you can try some challenges, find extra secrets and get some achievements that you missed but other than that I would say that another playthrough is not necessary. Also, the game took me around 10 or 9 hours.

Overall, I'd say that it's a cool casual game that I recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198134617580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1637179786}
review:
A fun, but short game. I'm a really slow player, so you can expect 10-15 hours to clear the game and obtain every secret. It also took a while to grow on me. The first hour of mining gameplay was rather boring, but as the game progresses you obtain various new gameplay mechanics and unlock harder challenges.

Storywise there isn't much to talk about. The game follows the usual go there, destroy something, rinse and repeat pattern with a very abrupt, yet expected twist outcome. I haven't played the first game, but everything important is explained by the main character anyways.

Dialogues are well written and funny, but most of them are meaningless as most characters have no story relevance.

Character and level designs are top-notch.

I'm conflicted about my opinion on the music. On the one hand there are a few great soundtracks for certain parts of the map that really help set the mood. On the other hand the Lo-Fi overworld music, which you hear the most, is quite annoying with intentionally crackling audio and has a very short loop. Other sound effects are solid.

I had the most fun once I unlocked the grappling hook. This game isn't mainly a platformer, but the platformer segments are honestly the best part of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049960630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1644812165}
review:
Parkour in this game isn't "Oh yay, Parkour!"  its, "Oh, god, now I can tell how imprecise and unresponsive this game is to quick inputs."  Like how the grappling hook appears to shoot the grapple at where you were looking at half a second ago. Then that first grappling hook puzzle was a joke of "oh boy, randomly floaty physics AND imprecise grappler launching?! Oh BOY!" Cause apparently in this game you have to specifically practice climbing up a wall and landing right on top of it. Otherwise, this game is like "ahahah, you floated into the button against the wall at the top!"

It's not fun when you're actually trying to figure out what the heck is going wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966511621', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1637154231}
review:
[b]Intro[/b]

SWD2 is a metroidvania game - it's a (2D) platformer in which you explore one big map, fight enemies, gather things and backtrack. A lot.

[b]The Good[/b]

-    Quicktravel isn't perfect but better than most games in the genre.
-    General gameplay is enjoyable.
-    Some decent puzzles.
-    Respeccing is free and convenient.
-    Making stuff explode is fun.
-    Finding secrets is generally interesting.

[b]The Bad[/b]

-    You're poor for most of the game then you suddenly get tons of money at the end.
-    Some really annoying platforming... until you get the jetpack.
-    Most of the upgrades are things that should come standard.
-    Few interesting upgrades. Oh wow, another "extra storage space upgrade", how fun.
-    Upgrades are overly expensive and hidden behind level requirements.
-    Final battle is insanely unbalanced, far harder than the rest of the game.
-    Dying costs resources in a game with limited resources.

[b]The Ugly[/b]

Tons and tons and tons of utterly and completely useless backtracking. Seriously, you have to go back to heal, regain water, reset the revive ability and sell stuff constantly. You also get abilities that make things easier to find very far into the game, which means you have to go through the entire map again to find stuff. Ugh.

[b]Conclusion[/b]

Despite nearly giving up several times i did like SWD2. It just could've been a whole lot better with a few simple changes. The game is too "inconvenient" for the first 60-70% of it. Also, wow, that final boss. I beat it on my second try (after respeccing) but it feels completely out of place, like they took a boss from a game focused on fighting and dumped it in here.

It's not a bad game but i would only recommend it to people who enjoy the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046806202', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1637497721}
review:
decent game, i wish it had less falling rocks but otherwise it's fun so far. 
it gives me motherload vibes, but also adds in small "dungeons" where you sometimes have to run for your life, and other times do a jumping puzzle, quite fun! 

i upgraded my light soruce a bit, same with armor and bag, in the beginning the bag is extremely limited, but luckily the coins you sell the minerals for can be traded for an upgraded bag early on. 

this game's easy, however at the same time you might die every now and then due to simple mistakes like not moving out of the way of a falling rock or exploding the wrong item with your gun.

graphics have charm

fun for a while, story would be better if it was voice acted. otherwise great game so far. 8.5/10

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

edit after about 3 hours+ of gameplay: 

I got down to the lava area, and omg it is so much harder all of a sudden xD 
the difficulty curve is huge once you get to a certain point, especially when it comes to those small dungeons you find. 

as you dig deeper and deeper you find some more worthwhile gems, but even though i upgrade my gear i feel like the progression isn't really worth it, kinda like i was expecting better upgrades at this point. 

the game is still fun but sometimes also annoying. 
the skeleton wizards are a pain to maneuver while simultaneously trying to do a jumping puzzle.

i found one dungeon where i couldn't progress since the lava golem didn't have a source of lava nearby? not sure what to do there, maybe in the future i'll figure it out. 

due to the monotonous gameplay, lack of impactful upgrades and uninteresting story i'm bringing the score down to a 7.5/10 instead of 8.5.


current score: 7.5/10.

---------------------------------------------------------------
edit 2 final edit: 

so i've now finished the game, only found 34% of the secrets, with 29 deaths. 
it was a fun run but i wish there was a bigger focus on the upgrades and gathering of ore. 
the story was kinda uninteresting, however maybe they will do better in the third game as the story left some unanswered questions.

still recommend the game for a bit of fun when you have nothing else to play.

7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986152647', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1637076280}
review:
[b]Всем добра.[/b]

[b][i]Прошел игрульку. Проходил и первую часть. Но в Cтиме у меня только вторая.

Поэтому поговорю о ней.

История простенькая, говорить о ней нет смысла. Дядя главной героини пропал, он является главным героем первой части игры. Сюжет тут не главное. Главное тут геймплей. Он тут простенький, но интересный. Первые впечатления почему-то были как в [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/237630/DuckTales_Remastered/][u]Duck Tales[/u][/url], не знаю почему, возможно из-за обилия секреток, которые по своим механикам скрытия, очень похожи на оные в приключениях Дяди Скруджа.

Вообще очень приятная игра. Даже не знаю как её описывать, интересная двухмерная адвентура, приятный визуал. Единственное но, это музыка. Она, как то уж очень резала уши, из-за своей навязчивости и надоедливости.[/i][/b]

[b]Так, я игру советую, если нравятся двухмерные платформеры, загадки, поиски секретов и прочее. Хорошо развеивает, и приятно играется. Главное иметь геймпад. Ибо на клавиатуре в неё играть очень неудобно.

Всем удачи и приятной игры.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198086681617', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1639074239}
review:
En Steamworld dig 2,tomaremos el control de nuestro personaje  Dorothy,que tras estar buscando a su amigo Rosty,llegara a un pueblo de robots, el cual esta asediado por los terremotos.De esta forma, nos tocara encontrar a nuestro amigo y la causa de porque suceden los terremotos.

Aspectos positivos del juego:Esta en español,duracion buena(facilmente 7 o 8h, misiones secundarias aparte),poder mejorar tus armas y habilidades(cambiandolas en cualquier momento si es necesario, a traves de los engranajes)

Aspectos negativos:Es facil quedarse a oscuras(con lo cual tienes que volver,la mayoria de veces a la superficie),el enemigo final(como no hayas cogido bastantes corazones y una buena defensa es un dolor,al menos en modo normal),hay pasadizos muy bien escondidos.

Steamworld dig 2,es una adicitiva aventura,ideal para pasar el rato.Recomendable su compra

author: {'steamid': '76561199104559369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1637088732}
review:
Jogo com uma experiencia bem gostosinha, do começo ao fim joguei escutando Spotify e combinou muito!

As partes ruim desse game é por ser curto e ter pouca variação de inimigo, tirando isso o jogo conseguiu me entreter e me surpreender com varias ideias interessantes com o decorrer do game.

Vale cada centavo mesmo eu ter pegado de graça .

review:
Хорошая метроидвания
+ Приятная анимация, красиво нарисованный мир
+ Есть сюжет
+ Исследование мира откапыванием выглядит интересно
+ Не душные секреты и головоломки
= Всякие секретики, с отсылками и описанием
- Очень скучные боссы 
- Музыка средне, выключил
Разок картинка замерцала так, что мне чуть не поплохело. Если пылесосить вообще всё, то уже к середине игры персонаж будет перекачан. Копать мир чтобы исследовать с одной стороны занятно, но затягивает игру оно знатно

author: {'steamid': '76561198073750945', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1637072351}
review:
Un juego que supera con creces a su predecesor. Es una secuela directa, así que recomiendo jugar antes al primero. De todas maneras no es necesario, puesto que nos van dando información de qué paso en el anterior juego.

El juego está lleno de easter eggs. Lo vas a pasar bien leyendo la descripción de los artefactos y el equipo de Dorothy, además de otras situaciones.

Visualmente mejora bastante y se ve muy bonito. Tiene una BSO muy buena, que te mete de lleno en la zona en la que te encuentras.

Sólo me he encontrado 1 bug. Pero no me ha empañado la experiencia de juego.

Hay distintas variedades de niveles. Y disponemos de cuevas opcionales llenas de puzzles y enemigos que nos permitirán conseguir más engranajes para mejorar a la protagonista. Además de artefactos que nos darán planos extras para mejoras. Si los completamos todos se nos desbloquea una cueva especial, difícil de narices, porque en esa cueva se requiere la paciencia y la técnica del jugador.

Aunque el final del juego me ha desconcertado debido a que [spoiler]literalmente explota todo el mundo, cuando el mundo en sí aparenta ser muy grande y el generador que te encuentras al final del juego tampoco parece tan explosivo como para reventar tal mundo. Por lo que parece que SteamWorld Heist sucede después de este juego[/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561198411668431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1645587696}
review:
玩过1接着玩的2.
2的游戏内容要远远多于1，剧情方面也更加完整，由于是拯救1的主角，虽然没有中文翻译，但是代入感比较强。
个人感觉2的最终BOSS难度更简单，比1的还要弱一些。也可能这个游戏并不是一个战斗的游戏吧。
装备系统比1增加了1个天赋出来，效果也比1的要强大不少。
总体来说，比较推荐，只是游戏的价格应该在20元左右比较合适【当然，我也是在打折时候购买的，价格也就是21块钱】

author: {'steamid': '76561197979943656', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1637449304}
review:
A bit short, but fun metroidvania crossed with dig dug where mining down through blocks is a significant portion of the game. Secret and/or achievement hunting adds on a fair bit of extra time, and there are some post story challenges.

My main complaint would be design wise the light mechanic feels a bit tacked on requiring you to return to town often early on just to refill fuel. A couple other mechanics that push toward frequently going back to town may be rewarding to someone looking to make efficient trips, but to me felt like unnecessary breaks in progression. There's also two areas in the story where difficulty suddenly spikes relative to the rest of the game, but the checkpoint system keeps it from being a significant frustration.

author: {'steamid': '76561199087152308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1661364717}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997384516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1637446306}
review:
Hodně povedená hra. Dobře zpracované postavy, nádherná grafika různých biomů. A dobré herní mechaniky. Hra si bere inspiraci z více žánrů a navazuje na několik různých oblíbených archetypů, které dobře propojuje.

Začnu od těžby, která je i v názvu. Tady mi hra nepřipadá moc objevná, natěžený materiál má pouze finanční hodnotu a nic z něj nevyrábíte. Je tady cyklus: natěžíte rudu a krystaly – vrátíte se do města „potrubní poštou” – prodáte. S tím jde také dohromady inkrementální vylepšování, které je v těžebních hrách taky běžné.

Archetyp Metroidvania také nepřehlédnete. Přístup do jednotlivých lokací není dán postupem úkolů, ale ziskem schopností postavy, přičemž tyto nové schopnosti a vlastnosti získáváte v lokacích rozesetých po celé mapě. Hra ale nezřídka dává (ať už to byl záměr nebo ne) hráči možnost překonat některé výzvy kreativně a za použití jiných schopností i dříve.

Zároveň je to akční hra. I pod zemí totiž žijí různé breberky, které na vás útočí a ohrožují vás. Takže je na vás nepříteli ukázat, že váš krumpáč je pěkně špičatý. Na nebezpečnější nepřátele nebo bosse raději použijete lepší nástroje či zbraně, které získáte časem.

Dále je to podle hráčů i adventura. Nuže, do jisté míry ano, rozhodně je to dobrodružná cesta do podzemí, i do různých chrámů. A pokud si vypnete kurzor, který vám říká, kam jít, tak musíte sami podle toho, co vám říkají ostatní, přijít na to, co se po vás chce. Stejně tak to ale můžete naprosto ignorovat a prozkoumávat svět tak dlouho, než na to narazíte namátkou.

Není to logická hra, ale má v sobě několik logických miniher. Nejsou ale nijak zvlášť obtížné (hodnotím coby člen Mensy, tak to berte s rezervou). Většinou nejsou potřeba k postupu dále. A mnoho z nich lze navíc časem obejít pomocí nově nabytých schopností.

Takže už zhruba víte, co od hry čekat, a mohl bych se ještě podělit o své dojmy. Kromě moc hezkého zpracování, kde si grafici zaslouží potlesk, se hra odehrává v zajímavém světě, má (minimálně v angličtině) výborný humor. Doporučuji číst text u artefaktů. Příběh je jednoduchý a neoriginální, ale neurazí.

A závěrem, stojí hra za to? Myslím si, že ano. Strávil jsem na ní přes 30 hodin a povětšinou bych řekl, že kvalitním hraním, takže i plná cenovka je podle mě adekvátní. Ovšem ve slevě 50-70 % je to výborná koupě.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070078838', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1729, 'last_played': 1637055206}
review:
無料でもらったけど十分お金払ってもいいレベルでおもしろかった。
コントローラー推奨って起動時直後の注意書きででてきたけど気にせずキーボードプレイ。
ストーリー進めつつ、それ以外もそこそこやりつつクリアで8時間だか9時間くらいだった。

そこから全実績とって終わろうとおもって動画見ながら取得した時点でのレビューです。
正直なところさっさと動画見て終わらせずにちゃんとやればよかった。と思うくらい楽しめました。
日本語がないのが残念なところですが、ゲームのプレイだけならそれほどわからなくても問題ないくらいでした。
前作未プレイなのでそのうちやってみたいところ。

不満なところは、隠し要素がわかりづらすぎることと、一部実績の難易度の高さ。
歯車でわかりやすくできるのもあるとはいえ、世界が広いのでとても大変。
RTA実績だけならまだしも、他の項目も同時に最高スコアをとらなきゃいけないのがしんどい。
一応マップに居場所の隠し要素解除率みたいなのがでるけど、やはり世界が広いのでどこだかわからん…つらかった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198416821701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1637004844}
review:
[h1]Bigger & Digger[/h1]
SteamWorld Dig 2 hodnotím po okamžitém dohrání předešlého dílu, poněvadž se shodou okolností ke mě dostala informace, že její sequel je po omezenou dobu na GOGu a Steamu zcela zdarma. Sice jsem po rozpačitém rozpoložení mé psyché z prvního dílu váhal, zda-li se chci ještě trápit, ale velké zelené políčko "Zdarma" vzalo zasvé.

Tentokrát hrajete za parťačku hlavního hrdiny z prvního dílu, jenž záhadně zmizel a po němž s pomocí roztomilého robo-dušíka pátráte. Po jeho stopách dojdete do hornického města, jehož obyvatelé ztraceného amiga sice viděli, ale spíše než o něj se strachují o své živobytí, když se jim kutná hora kvůli vlnám zemětřesení neznámého původu viklá ze strany na stranu. Musíte tedy jednat na svoji pěst a okolí El Machina prozkoumat sami se svým věrným krumpáčem. To je vlastně vše, co potřebujete vědět, příběh je spíše v pozadí, ovšem zájemcům stále dostupný.
Na rozdíl od minule více prozkoumáváte rozlehlý svět à la metroidvania a kopání je na druhé linii, což bylo od vývojářů rozhodně dobré rozhodnutí. Po světě rozmanitých biomů jsou rozmístěna různá tajná zákoutí s drahým minerálem a (překvapivě neiritujícími) bonusovými sběratelskými předměty. Princip "kopání + kupování" stále platí, místa pod zemí (a vlastně i nad zemi) je ovšem více.
Zpočátku je vám poskytnuta variabilní obtížnost a různé dvojsečné meče, které vám doporučuji brát v co nejhojnějším počtu, v základu jednoduchá hra tak dostane zbrusu nový nádech a budete obezřetní po celou hrací dobu circa 9 hodin. Ne zrovna lehké achievementy typu "Dokonči hru s..." mi sice kvůli tomuto časovému úseku přijdou poněkud brutální, ale jsou tu i pro ty nejodvážlivější a nejtrpělivější hráče. A to je správně.
Co mě s velkým překvapením zklamalo, byl soundtrack. Možná jsem měl přehnaná očekávání, když jsem si v anotacích hry přečetl "feat. El Huervo" a euforické vzpomínky na soundtrack Hotline Miami mi zarojily mysl, ale i bez této informace bych jej hodnotil jako nejlépe nadprůměrný. Krom lehkého dokreslování atmosféry mi neustále připomínal, jak mohlo rande westernu s elektronikou šťastně dopadnout. Místo toho se na konci večera pár rozpačitě rozdělil do dvou směrů, ani čísla si na sebe navzájem nedal. Žádných výrazně lepších skladeb se nedočkáte; možná se smiluju nad žoviální skladbou El Machina, která mě doprovázela po celou hru nejdéle. 
Sice se pořád jedná o nadprůměr, ale s odstupem se žel bohu zbytečně jedná o největší kaňku na jinak podařené kresbě.

SteamWorld Dig 2 je i přes tento přešlap ucelenější, větší a lepší pokračování předešlého nemastného dílu. Vzhledem k otevřenému konci jsem zvědav, jestli se někdy dočkáme kulaté trojky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134309216', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1636999515}
review:
12 horas de jogo até finalizar, e por fim posso dizer: QUE ALEGRIA!

Só na espera pelo SteamWorld Dig 3. Este jogo contém:
Gráficos Lindos
História cativante (embora não muito profunda)
Poderes diversos e que combam super bem (entenda "combar" por poder utilizar ao mesmo tempo sem um prejudicar o outro)
Pouca variedade de inimigos, mas o suficiente para não ser repetitivo
Muita, mas muita mineração. E é muito daora pois em cada ambientação há um desafio diferente, inimigos diferentes
Soundtrack bem agradável
Boss fight claro e desafiante (me lembrou até o FTL - Faster Than Light)

Em resumo: fod#roso jogo, super recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198262149683', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1636997139}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 to druga część przygód parobotów w kopalniach.

Gra dzieje się na w śmiecie gdzie ziemią rządzą roboty zasilane i machanizmami parowymi a ludzie dawno temu zrzucili sobie atomówkę na łeb i teraz żyją zmutowani pod ziemią.

Jedynka opowiadało o tym jak Rusty'ego (głowny bohater jedynki) wujek poprosił o przybycie do jego miasta ponieważ przepisał mu kopalnie. Szybko się okazało, że wujek nie żyje, miasto średnio daje radę i jest potrzebny górnik. Rusty więc zaczął kopać i zaczął znajdywać dziwne technologie. Okazło się, że one należą do do voltbotów, które chcą podbić świat na górze. Gdy Rusty pokonał wielkeigo robota wszytko wybuchło i się zawaliło. Dorothy (mieszkanka wcześniej wymienionego miasta) podstanowiłą go znaleść. Tutaj zaczyna się dwójka.
Jedynka była, krótkim, prostym rouglike'em, którego dało się przejść w 3 godziny. Dwójka jest 3 razy dłuższa (10 godzin), ma o wiele więcej mechanik i przedmiotów do ulepszenia. Mamy 6 lokacji (jedna na chwile się pojawiła jako część fabuły).
Przeciwników też mamy całą masę. Ich AI jest dość zabawne gdy widzi się jak bez twojej pomocy 3 wrogów umie wpaść od tak do lawy bo ciebie zobaczyli.
Stylistyka gra też się poprawiła, jest o wiele bardziej szczegółowa gra z 2D przeszła do 2,5D.
Muzyka mnie mi się spodobała (a szczególnie ta w głównej, początkowej kopalni) i system tego jak brzmi od zależności ile światła nam zostało. Muszę jednak przyznać, że jeden utwór na lokacje to trochę za mało przez co odwiedzanie jednej lokacji przez dłuższy czas zaczyna denerwować. 

Jedyne czego brakowało mi w tej grze to języka polskiego (który był w jedynce)

Polecam

author: {'steamid': '76561197991758475', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1637067979}
review:
This game was briefly available for $0 and I grabbed it. I've always loved Super Metroid and this is a REALLY great game that reminds me in many ways of Metroid, but has a bunch of cool innovation.

The difficulty level is great, not too difficult but also not too easy. The improvement aspect of your character is MASSIVE fun and there's a ton of different things to play around with. Love experimenting with Cogs, amazing feature. Great controls even playing with keyboard. Very, very nicely done game. Thank you so much for the gift. I've spent a good 13 hours on it and I loved every minute of it.

If they make a sequel, I'll buy it FOR SURE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198351827345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1636977610}
review:
[h1] Глубже, ярче и веселее: [/h1]
Шведам из Image & Form удалось создать по-настоящему изумительную игру, насыщенную механиками, увлекательную и красивую. Прокапывать себе путь и пробираться сквозь головоломки действительно интересно, и за этим процессом даже не замечаешь, как быстро пролетает время. И если вы любите не слишком хардкорные «метроидвании», то вам точно не стоит проходить мимо SteamWorld Dig 2. А если ищете сложностей, то тоже не упускайте игру из вида — необязательный контент вам их обеспечит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049840197', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 382, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1636958825}
review:
How do I put this into words

SteamWorld Dig, as a setting and a game. Feels very...Kid friendly.

Small protagonist with a 3 letter name, cute companion creature, gentle art style, easy highly repetative gameplay with a fairly solid core loop.
It reeks of Indie video game. Just the way everything is designed and shaped. It feels very uninspired. Very Limbo-ish ya know?

Theres really not a lot I can say. Gameplay is so simple theres not much to talk about, its a Metroid-Vania but it just lacks any BITE. Exploration feels needless and like I'm wasting my time.

The plot is simple but it gets the job done. I don't hate it, but like the rest of the game I don't enjoy it.

It really feels like SWD2 doesn't know what audience it wants.
It wants to be a complex metroid-vania but it lacks any of the challenge typical of the genre.
It wants to be kid friendly, but then it throws out dozens of references to old music, films like Kung Fury and even throws a dig at Scientology. What kind of kid is going to get a True Survivor quote or L Ron Hubbard joke?

Glad I got it for free, because it just feels. Bland.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010315744', 'num_games_owned': 1309, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1636939266}
review:
Just as good as the first game, if not better. If you're familiar with the first game everything feels the same here so it's easy to jump back in.

Fun abilities, lots of digging, upgrades and a good story. Addicting gameplay as usual. Great mellow, relaxing soundtrack too. Played on normal mode sticking mostly to the main quest while doing a few extra caves here and there for more cogs to get those juicy perks. Difficulty felt perfect, and finished in about 8 hours. 

I was planning on buying this, but all of a sudden they gave it away for free which is very generous, thanks devs!!! Can't wait for Steamworld Dig 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013620399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1636921651}
review: It's a pretty great sequel to the first game. A couple of new items and a nice new story that continues off the first pretty nicely. There're a couple of new movement options that make traversing the vertical levels very nice. Moreover, after a certain point, you don't have to worry about leaving yourself a way back up. Overall, it's essentially the same game as the first, but with a different story and a fresh look at the upgrades; just about everything you'd want out of a sequel to a good game. Good luck 100% this one, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198959269986', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1637785458}
review:
Сначала может показаться, что игра скучная, потому что эта игра просто про то, как вы копаетесь в шахте и продаёте ресурсы, но это сначала)

Начнём с того, что шахт тут не одна, а 3. Каждая из них особенная, со своими врагами и ресурсами. Копать придётся много, но это время с лихвой скрашивают так скажем, данжы. В них будут головоломки и не только. Во всех из них хорошо запрятаны артефакты и шестерёнки. За первое вы сможете получить эксклюзивные чертежи. За второе вы сможете их активировать. Они запрятаны оочень хорошо. Большинство из них, если вы не будете вглядываться, вы не увидите, но кто ищет тот всегда найдёт)

Хочется отметить очень хороший баланс сложности. Игра не такая простая, чтобы вы её бросили на пол пути от скуки, но и не такая сложная, чтобы вызывать у вас приступы гнева. Так же она ставит перед вами чёткую цель, а не "найди мне то, не знаю что".

Если вы будете покупать эту игру, я думаю, денег вы не пожалеете, хотя игра проходится по сюжету весьма быстро. Я прошёл за 12 часов и всё это время я не скучал. Я копал руды, сражался с монстрами, максимально аккуратно проходил данжы, искал шестерни и тд. Геймплэй весьма разнообразный. От разговоров с жителями, до боёв с боссами. Да, они тут тоже есть. Их 3, но внимания заслуживает только 1.

Первой босс в самом начале игры, я его прошёл с 3 попытки, когда понял. что от меня требуют. Он нужен, чтобы вы окончательно разобрались с управлением и познакомились с вашим напарником.

Второй босс это обычный монстр, у которого в 3 раза больше хп. Ну и атаки у него чуть сильнее позже будут.

А вот треееетий))) Третий это совсем что-то новое. Я сбился со счёта, сколько я пытался его пройти. Он требует весьма хорошей ловкости ваши пальчиков, нужно уметь уворачиваться причём желательно самыми различными способами, хоть на кошке, хоть на ранце. Копать во время боя вам тоже придётся и разные по твёрдости блоки, чтобы получить хилки, а без них никак, потому что вы умрёте и всё это под чуть ли не пулемёт из ракет. А для того, чтобы нанести урон самому боссу, нужно как-то кошкой попасть по большой ракете, да так, чтобы эта ракета полетела в большого робота, пока вы аккуратно балансируете на ранце, чтобы сэкономить его энергию и увернуться от 10 000 пуль, которые отражаются от стен и разбивают их. Круто в общем! Не заскучаешь) 

Из минусов:

1. Странное управление на клавиатуре, но как его улучшить я сам не знаю, поэтому просто привык к существующему.
2. А вот за русские буквы в местах, где показывается на какую кнопку нужно нажимать, нужно руки оторвать)

В общем, игра мне понравилась. Стоит ли своих денег сказать не могу, тк получил бесплатно, но я не капли не жалею тех 12 часов, которые я на неё потратил)

review:
Good metroidvania.
The digging part of the game is very similar to Super Motherload, although you don't die when your light goes off.

You could pretty much play the entire game without the map indicators and not feel lost, but I had to enable it right before the end because I couldn't find where to go next... (Spoiler: [spoiler]it was in the "acid baths" part of the overgrown fungi area, idk how do you call that, I played the game in French[/spoiler])

author: {'steamid': '76561198014492336', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1636854793}
review:
I got this game Thursday, November 11th for a promotion where it was free.
I finished it Saturday, November 13th. This is not a damnation of the game. I was glued to it. Non-stop. In call, alone on Discord, after work, upon waking up. I absolutely loved this game. I chewed through it in less than a weekend, let alone a week. This game is absolutely a treasure.

If you like Metroidvania games, you will love this game. The controls are tight and responsive with just enough floatyness to make getting around fun and easy. The upgrades change the game in substantial and unique ways. On top of that, the story is cute, and the twists it takes actually caught me off guard, and the relationship between Dorothy and Fen growing felt very much like a friendship worth exploring.

I cannot recommend this game enough to anyone even remotely into this genre. While it might not be a 10/10 game, as some of the puzzles feel a bit "bruise your thumbs doing it now or get an item you don't have yet" and occasionally "You NEED this upgrade to get it", that's par for the course for Metroidvanias but always my least favorite part. It's still a solid 9/10, honestly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150904027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1636892690}
review:
普段は底の浅いことが多く、時間の無駄に思えるインディーゲーはプレイしない。しかし本作は、無料だったことと、グラフィックの美しさやメトロイドヴァニアに往年の名作ディグダグを連想させるゲーム内容に惹かれてプレイした。ところが所詮インディー。最初のところでダッシュしながらのギリギリでジャンプを3連続でやる場所があって、2回目に狭い空間に飛び乗ったと思ったら、後ろから矢が飛んできて押し出されるような形で振り出しに戻された。

かの有名な糞ゲーTrap Adventure（まぁあのゲームは糞トラップを徹底的に研究し尽くして、ある意味で良ゲーにまで進化したのかもしれないけど）を彷彿とさせるこの手のイライラ系ギミックが今後も続くのかと思ったら急激に萎えたので即アンインストール。

以下のSSは2マスしかない狭い場所に飛び乗って、直後に弓矢で落とされる直前のもの
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2654522956

author: {'steamid': '76561197969980534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1636896681}
review:
Steamworld dig 2 is second installment of Steamworld series and is a nice little metroidvania style game where you robot who are looking her lost robot pal called Rusty.
You start with your pickaxe and mine your way to deeper and deeper and get upgrades along your journey and with those upgrades, you can open secrets which are locked when you first encounter them.
Controls are good (which must be in a game like this). Graphics are nice and i can't find much to complain with. There are few challenges for those who crave for it (complete the game without dying, trial of skills etc.)

Overall i give thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090176036', 'num_games_owned': 3658, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1636851608}
review:
Хорошо продуманная игра по сравнению с первой частью.

По сравнению с первой частью игры тут меньше беготни, а со временем появляется возможность телепортироваться в город практически из любого места (из меню).
Карта (что не было в первой части) - отличная вещь для ориентации на местности (миникарта в придачу).
Юмор. Тот случай когда с радостью читаешь описание предметов и всего прочего.

Из минусов:
- Несколько раз попадался кривой перевод.
- Как по мне, так тут слабая боевая система. Игра вообще не про бои, а про капание (этого "добра" тут где-то 90%).

★★★☆☆ (3/5) - В общем игра крепкий середнячок.

review:
Got it a couple of days ago when it was a free giveaway and now I wish I'd paid for it. I'll definitely be checking out their catalog and the first game in the series.

The graphics are objectively beautiful and well done, and I found the imagery very appealing to me, personally. The gameplay is easy to get into, and very fun, and the interactions with the NPCs are brief and amusing. It's definitely a recommend for me.

review:
你可能是正版游戏的受害者，steam每次都把卖不脱的游戏限免，而且一定是没有中文语言。你最大的市场是在中国，却不给中文。
最tm搞笑的是这个游戏其他平台都有中文，唯独PC没有。想打个民间补丁发现 补丁也只支持老版本。

review: Marvelous game! I didn't played in the first game but like platformers with cartoon graphics. Very good music, very immersive gameplay and the maps are quite big for explore. There are also insufficient cogwheels at the start of the game that makes you think twice what upgrades to chose, but if you explore with more attention, then you will have almost all upgrades you need. Definitely will recommend this game to everyone who think "Should I spend my time on this or not?".

review:
Good game but not the best metroidvania I've ever played. Really enjoyed my first 5 hours, then the last two hours were a bit of a slog. No chance I am trying to 100% this game.

I think the games biggest strength is its puzzles, which felt very well designed. 

Main criticisms:
A lot of the combat feels too janky.
The cogwheel mods are interesting at first but then become boring through mid game.
