author: {'steamid': '76561199106219998', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1636823257}
review:
Увидев недавнюю акцию решил посмотреть ролик. Мне сразу понравилась рисовка и анимации. Когда я запустил игру, решил проверить. Серьезных отклонений от анимации типа метроид не обнаружил. Так же меня обрадовало то, что здесь нужна только клавиатура/джойстик.
Игра сразу сбросила меня в удачно размеренный геймплей. Получение способностей очень похоже на одну игру про волшебницу/признание в любви. Эти улучшения вы не сможете пропустить (ибо без них вам придется пользоваться гличами, которые я пока не нашёл, либо застопорит сюжет ). 
У вас есть многоуровневая база. Важные личности: краб-торговец, ваш знакомый на 2 этаже, и картограф.
Ах да. главная особенность игры - копать (в будущем "к"). В ней надо много к. Прокться до кния ресурсов. К для нахождения прохода к цели. К для обхода противников. К чтобы балдеть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283029447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1637223713}
review:
キャンペーンにて無料で入手しましたが、普通に購入しても文句なしです。
（日本語はサポートされてないので、実際には購入は悩むとは思いますが）

金額に対するボリュームは十分。
ゲームとしての内容は非常に楽しめるものでした。

アクション要素は比較的強め（コレクション要素をコンプしようとすると難しい部分がある）で、
最初に英語で出ますがコントローラー推奨です。
（私はキーボードでやってコレクション集めで苦労しました）

日本語は非対応ですが、ストーリーの英語は理解しなくても大丈夫です。
次の目標がわかりやすくマップに出たりしますし、探索していれば自然と次へ進みます。
強化に関して、ゴールドでのアップグレードは英語は不要なレベルですが、
コグ（という歯車のアイテム）を用いた強化は英語が読めたほうがいいかもです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198318533002', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1636800670}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054218120', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1637056110}
review:
Эта игра поглотит Вас с головой и пока Вы ее не пройдете, Вы не вылезете оттуда, это я гарантирую. 
Тут придется много прыгать, много копать, решать головоломки. Разработчики советуют играть с контроллера, но если настроить под себя клавиатуру, то и на ней вполне удобно играть, так что на этот счет даже не переживайте. 
История немного банальная - мы ищем нашего пропавшего друга, нам помогает в этом злобный (на самом деле нет) дух, что любит разрушения. Красочная графика никого не оставит равнодушным, музыка ненавязчивая и отлично подходит под тематику каждого вида подземелья. Интересная система прокачки навыков и оборудования. Главное не расстраиваться сразу, если не получается пройти какой-то кусок, оборудование улучшается, мы находим новое и в результате можно вернуться и открыть ранее недоступные места, благо тут очень удобная система перемещений. 
Любопытные описания артефактов, так сказать немного юмора не помешает ))) их всего 42, но найти все будет непросто! 
В общем игру советую! Она точно не оставит равнодушным никого! Перекопайте все до последнего и откройте все тайны подземелья под тихим городком Эль Машино)

author: {'steamid': '76561199078482539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1637229346}

author: {'steamid': '76561199183042064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1636783756}
review: Steamworld Dig 2 стала моей первой метроидванией. И первая сложность, которую я встретил это в какие комнаты я мог вернутся с новыми способностями. Ну ладно это пустяки. Сама игра очень хороша, имеют несколько заскриптованных моментов, которые меня удивили и позабавили. Ну и самая главная изюминка этой игры это локация "Вектор". Музыка, задники, вот эти духи которые вселяются в ботов и бегут за тобой одно из самых страшных моментов. Игра побуждает тебя исследовать ее, так как я за всю игру накопил только 3к золота, а улучшений там на целый десяток. К сожалению я не смог оценить доп.сюжет, который открывается после получения все ачивок. Рекомендую

author: {'steamid': '76561198010935270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1637834448}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960856271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1637212159}
review:
It's good but not great. Lots of exploration, the persistence of the map has you thinking about what to break instead of mindlessly destroying everything. Great secrets. Fun upgrades. 

The biggest negative by far is the floaty controls, could have been so much better with tighter controls. Others include the lack of many bosses and really just combat in general. Towards the end it often feels like you're at the mercy of RNG with exploding blocks and rolling/projectile snails bouncing all over the place.

review:
Начну с того, что к жанру к которому принадлежит данная игра, я всегда относился индифферентно и даже моментами скептически... но стоило лишь мне получить эту "ягодку" и сыграть в нее!.. )

Если вы искали ненавязчивый, медитативный платформер про исследования в духе Terraria, с качественным саундтреком, незаурядными шутками и самобытной, местами чарующей атмосферой - серия SteamWorld Dig явно для вас! 

10 пневмоотбойников из 10, господа!

author: {'steamid': '76561198972070807', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1638555508}
review:
Good game. nice movement mechanics, fun mining strategy and just overall polished, done and fun.

Scratches a similar itch similar to terraria, for obvious reasons. These two games feel similar, and not just because they are both 2D tiledigging games. The movement is also quite similar and fun.

The game is also clearly inspired by undetale, which is a good thing in my opinion.

I got it for free, so I can't comment on the price.

8.9/10 fun game

author: {'steamid': '76561198141475154', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1636807816}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081770185', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1636743674}
review:
Continuando directamente la historia del original, Steam World Dig 2 expande la historia  mientras tomamos el rol de Dorothy, que tiene la única misión de encontrar a Rusty, protagonista del anterior título que ha desaparecido misteriosamente.

La verdad, decir que sólo expande la historia del anterior se queda corto en comparación a la enorme cantidad de características y mecánicas nuevas que este título de exploración trae a la mesa, nuevos entornos, enemigos y el mejor sistema de progresión y mejora de habilidades que haya visto en mucho tiempo, son culpables de aumentar el factor adictivo de una forma tremenda, sin exagerar desde que se lanzó en 2017 le he terminado al 100% al menos 6 o 7 veces en múltiples consolas, es sumamente sencillo terminarle y volver a comenzar como si fuese la primera vez.

Eso sin mencionar que también es uno de los títulos más graciosos, y hago especial énfasis en el trabajo de traducción, adaptando de manera súblime todos y cada uno de los chistes, juegos de palabras y referencias a la cultura pop totalmente inesperadas, que siguen sacándome una que otra carcajada hasta la fecha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198813006303', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1636741495}
review:
A good little metroidvania with a satisfying gameplay loop of mining ores and improving your gear. In the endgame, you will be going through the levels at lightning speeds with all the movement abilities that you collect. To beat the final boss, you have to use all the abilities you have acquired thus far. It's crazy that other metroidvania games don't do this often.

    The story was surprisingly engaging.  All the 3 steamworld games seem to be connected storywise so that might be something to consider before buying. The only thing disappointing was the metroidvania design itself. Once you unlock an ability, the path where you have to use it is usually right in front of you.

[b]7/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048347273', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 391, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1636738971}
review:
[quote] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36579661-Setna/]Başlamadan önce diğer incelemelerimin olduğu küratör sayfamı takip edin.[/url] [/quote]

Aslına bakarsanız SteamWorld Dig 2 aynı ilk oyun gibi gayet keyifli.

[h1] Kayıp Rusty'i Arıyoruz [/h1]

İlk oyundaki olaylardan sonra Rusty kayıplara karışıyor. Bunun üzerine onun arkadaşı Dorothy onu aramak için yola çıkıyor. Aldığı son haberlere göre Rusty en son El Machino madenleri tarafında görülmüş. Bunu duyan Dorothy hemen araştırmaya koyuluyor. Bu sırada da önceki oyunda Rusty ile kapışan Fen ile karşılaşıyor. Birlikte Rusty'nin neden ortadan kaybolduğunu araştırmaya koyuluyorlar.

Hikaye aslında SteamWorld evreninde çok önemli bir noktaya sahip. Zira birçok konuya açıklık getiriyor.

[h1] Standart 2D Oynanışı [/h1]

Aslına bakarsanız 2D bir oyun olarak çok fazla bir oynanış farklılığı sunmuyor oyun bizlere. Lakin yine de hoş buluyorum ben. Yetenek setlerinin dinamikliği ve oynanışın basitliği kısa ve keyifli bir zaman geçirmenizi sağlıyor. Oyun zaten çok zor da değil. Lakin bazı kısımlar oyunun geri kalanına nazaran absürt derecede zor ve gerçekten insanı bezdirebiliyor.

[h1] İlk Oyunun Üstene Biraz Daha [/h1]

İlk oyunun üstüne biraz daha koymuşlar grafiksel olarak. Zaten 2D ve bu temadaki bir oyundan çok iyi bir grafik kalitesi beklememek gerekli. Olması gerektiği gibi yapılmış bence.

Genel olarak SteamWorld Dig 2 ucuz ve keyifli bir oyun. Çok vaktiniz olmuyorsa ve basit oyunlardan keyif alıyorsanız denemelisiniz. 65SP

author: {'steamid': '76561198068463769', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1636738692}
review:
Wanted this game for 5 years straight, I finally got it for free. It good and just what I was hoping, a nice simple mining game.

Is a bit too easy for my taste however, was very rarely properly challenge and never felt health was ever a problem. only death was when Fen told me to jump off the cliff and so I did.

Game is a tad bit more difficult at the very start before you get anything as there is the potential to get "stuck" like others said so you need to think on how you mine, but other than that all good.

game is good, play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844484421', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1677180808}
review:
Dawno nie grałem w gry typu Spelunky a ta totalnie mnie wciągnęła, świetna mechanika i rozbudowany system ulepszeń pozwalające na dłuższą przygodę i wciągnięcie się w fabułe gry, główną postacią jest samotna dziewczyna robot o imieniu Dorothy która wraz ze swoim towarzyszem szukają śladów jej przyjaciela, w trakcie tej przygody napotyka na swojej drodze problemy które musi wykonać. 
Bardzo fajna gra na zabicie czasu bardzo polecam cieplutko do zagrania w tą produkcję.

Plusy:
- ładna oprawa graficzna
- ładna oprawa dźwiękowa
- oryginalna fabuła
- dużo ulepszeń
- dużo lokacji

Minusów na obecny stan gry nie jestem w stanie stwierdzić ale jeżeli jakiś znajdę natychmiast zmienię treść recenzji.

Dziękuje za uwagę.
Wiem, że nikt tego nie czyta ale napisałem tako sobie z nudów bo nie miałem co robić.

Finałowa ocena: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198098434408', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1680797365}
review:
Basically if Dig Dug got a modern reboot. 
Movement is very smooth and responsive, the tools you get are all good, but go into the Metroid path of making your jump break blocks and kill things.
Graphics are nice and clean, never had issues telling blocks apart.
I've not encountered a single bug or glitch through my whole 7 hours with the game, ok... one. I somehow managed to hit the right pixel with the hookshot and grapple onto a spike block, but doesn't matter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010440715', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1664072434}
review:
Recebi o SteamWorld Dig 2 de graça via steam e fiquei surpreso, encantado e chocado com a maravilha que é esse título. Ele se trata de um game de plataforma que une vários elementos de sucesso em um único game modernizando o conceito de games sidescrolling famosos nas décadas de 80 e 90. 

O game mistura elementos de vários games famosos como Megaman, Quackshot, Metroid, Castlevania, Super Mario World; e, títulos mais recentes como Platformines, Dig or Die, Craft the World, Planet Centauri, entre outros...

É um game que possui um vasto universo dentro de um game 2D dando a impressão de ser uma espécie de SANDBOX 2D. Possui uma considerável variação de cenários, excelentes lutas contra monstros e chefes, além de entregar gráficos espantosos.

NOTA 8.

author: {'steamid': '76561198993465619', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1645952079}
review:
Игра просто бомба, когда получил её думал просто скучная игра которую я получил с раздачи 
Эта игра сочетает в себе идеальный сюжет, которая растрогает любого игрока.
Музыка на высшем уровне пойду даже закачаю её ост, если вы не разу не игра ли в эту игру, советую пройти 
Еще не знаю с чем связан баг но в игре я провел не меньше 5 часов эта проблема появилась после того как я поиграл в автономном режиме. Честно говоря я не разу не играл в первую часть, но думаю что скоро куплю и первую часть. 

Советую если вы получили эту игру бесплатно или просто купили игру, то купить ост к этой игре что бы поддержать автора.

Думаю я поиграю в другие игры этого автора.


Оценка игры :
Музыка 10/10

Управление: 7/10 ( когда бежишь на геймпаде сложно осуществить прыжок) еще я не играл на клавиатуре не могу сказать на сколько удобно на ней играть так что ?/10


Сюжет: 10/10 не знаю как другим но мне понравился сюжет, меня сложно растрогать но у этой игры получилось

Визуал: 10/10 красочный, смотря от локи разные оттенки фонов 

Персонажи: 10/10 каждый персонаж по своему уникален, честно говоря я думал что наш главный протагонист наш друг ( а именно Рози), я понял еще что в первой части мы играем за Расти он тоже очень красочен, Фен очень жалко его, хоть он и был тем еще куском говна в начале игры, но потом мне было грустно за него( кто пройдет поймет) , ну и главный герой, мне нравилось дополнять её вооружение, она очень харизматична.

Оптимизация: на самом деле игра не такая уж и тяжелая, даже на слабом ноутбуке я играл в стабильных 60 FPS

Советую ли я SteamWorld Dig 2? Конечно, если вы получили эту игру обязательно пройдите её! 

В среднем моя игра получает оценку 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198058711723', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1636707913}
review:
It's a great game and overall concept, but there's a few things I do have issues with about it.

The game's mines are consistent. You can't get new resources from the mines once you've gained them, they are gone once mined.
On top of this, even while the game's resources are notably limited, the game will punish you by removing at least half your carried resources if you happen to die.

Both of these I could go without. Unless there happens to be some secret roguelike mining mode, I'm not gonna be a fan of those two features paired together in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044161322', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1636703389}
review:
Not to my taste. Mining just isn't very fun when you constantly have to hit rocks multiple times to get anywhere. Combine that with not being able to mine a rock you are sliding down means you can accidentally lock yourself out of getting resources without having to make a huge detour. Backtracking to a fast travel point because your bag is full or your light is constantly running out of power is also annoying, as is backtracking to a water pool to refill your 'ammo' for various powers.

Not saying it's a bad game, but all this repetition in the samey environments just isn't for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083430407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1636683977}
review:
So Steam recently gave this thing away for free and...

It's alright. It passes the time. It's not too offensive.
That's about it, really.

The problem of the game is that it starts off slow, and it starts off bad; you will be able to jump, wall jump and you'll be able to hit things with your pickaxe-- although, you can only hit across, up or down from where you are. So if you want to dig up, forget it.
As you progress you get more and more powers and skills until you get to the infinite jetpack and mega range grapple, and at that point you're basically playing with all the cheats on. While fun, it's not particularly challenging; even the final boss was just kind of meh, as if the game was just shrugging its shoulders and saying "Well, that's your lot".

So if you see this available for free, or for a dollar or two, I guess it's worth it. Otherwise I would skip.
6/10.
-Sleepy

author: {'steamid': '76561198282466966', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1648763879}
review:
Menuda pasada.
Si vas a saco con la historia te dura de 4 a 7 horitas, pero si vas a por todas, a por los secretos, los desafíos, los coleccionables el juego se te extiende mucho más. 
Aparte siempre ofrece nuevos desafíos y es uno de esos pocos juegos que te animan a hacer speedrun pero facilitándote ciertas cosas.

En cuanto apartado gráfico es singular, todo está en su sitio y sólo resalta aquello en lo que tienes que fijarte (enemigos, minerales...) y la paleta de colores está bien balanceada, no hay ningún color que desentone excesivamente.

La banda sonora y los efectos de sonido en sí son muy buenos, nunca te cansas de escuchar las melodías, sobre todo cuando llegas al pueblo a vender materiales o reponer vida, sientes que ese lugar es seguro dónde puedes prepararte para la próxima inmersión.

La jugabilidad es rápida, fresca y sencilla, una vez te adaptas a los controles básicos el resto va solo. Las diferentes mejoras te dan cada vez más opciones para optimizar tu descenso y el equipo que consigues te facilitará la aventura a la larga.

La historia simple, rápida, pero emocionante y sorprendente.

100% recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561198102567286', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1658275877}
review: Simple straight forward mechanics. This is a tight little platformer that keeps you going by giving you just what you need every time you explore a little more. Difficulty ramps up as you get deeper, but there is always a new gadget or skill that will help you get through it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198986034569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1636680958}
review:
actualmente a la hora de escribir esto no me pase el juego, pero debo admitir que es tal y como me lo imaginaba. 
De primeras este juego no seria una compra que yo haría de normal, pero aprovechando que steam lo regalo procederé a contarles un poco de este.

En steamWorld dig 2 encarnaremos a una robot llamada doroti (no recuerdo como se escribia) que estara en la búsqueda del protagonista de la primera entrega, esa es la trama principal.

el juego trata de bajar por una mina y cuanto mas bajemos mas peligroso sera todo entre: Rocas, enemigos, etc...

gráficamente a mi parecer es muy bonito y nada desencaja dentro de la estética.

y no se que mas contaros xd, simplemente este juego ahora mismo esta en mi lista de favoritos y por mi esto es una compra segura si te gusta los juegos 2d de ´´plataformas`` (entre comillas por que esto va de excavar para abajo xd).

venga corre y compralo >:v

author: {'steamid': '76561198319855342', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1637852121}
review: Механіки гри досить простенька, майнити глибше, роблячи собі дорогу до певної точки і збираючи паралельно ресурси для прокачування героя. Також зустрічаються ще enemy, щоб вже не так все просто було) Але сама гра ненадоїдає досить швидко. Вона заставляє гравця досліджувати всесвіт, шукати секретки і отримувати за це дуже хороші нагороди, які в свою чергу дозволять легше і швидше прокачати героя. А шукаючи артефакти отримати якийсь пункт для прокачки. В грі також є простенький сюжет, але це вже швидше як доповнення. Дуже гарно все скомпоновано і розробники гарно постаралися. Дякую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198203711651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 503, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1636661256}
review:
Gostou do primeiro? Então você vai amar esse!

Contando com novas animações e mecânicas de jogo, SWD2 consegue inovar e ao mesmo tempo manter a essência do primeiro jogo. O jogo é todo bem trabalhado, dá pra ver o esmero em cada canto dele. E a história é mais profunda (perdão pelo trocadilho =P) que a do seu antecessor, até mesmo para se situar na história geral do Universo SteamWorld. Sem contar que a trilha sonora do jogo mais uma vez não decepciona. E se você curte exploração, colecionáveis e personalização, se sentirá em casa aqui!

SWD2 é um excelente representante do gênero Metroidvania, além de um grande jogo (mesmo) para se divertir! Recomendadíssimo!

review: Funded in part by the European Union, this game represents the future they would like to build, where human beings have all been killed and replaced with robots that need neither sleep, nor food, nor human rights. Sadly however, all is not quite well in this new utopia; Early on in the story, a mayor is berated for 'not listening to the experts'. The mayor appears to represent the 'evil capitalist'. Interestingly though, the mayor has pink hair, perhaps hoping to appeal to the social justice demographic. It certainly wouldn't be the first time a politician has pretended to be woke, just so they could line their pockets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 3540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1657474852}
review:
overall a good game.
I played it for a bit, always saw it on 3ds eshop but i havent thought of ever playing it, well now its free on steam i have tried playing it and love it.
Pros
+ Instantly fun.
+ A lot of exploration.
+ Quite unique in terms of gameplay (2D Metroidvania + mining).
+ You are free to excavate the mine as it pleases you.
+ Very distinctive environments, atmospherically speaking.
+ Hunting for the 42 missing artifacts is great.
+ Upgrades really change the way you play the game.
+ You are mostly free to explore the world as it pleases you.
+ Some achievements are quite fun to unlock, especially the "Sequence breaker" one.
+ Nice and interesting theme (post-apocalyptic cowboys robots).
+ Knowing how much secrets remained to be found in each area is very handy.
+ A high level of polish makes the game shine.
+ No useless backtracking thanks to a clever teleportation system.

Cons
- The combat is not very interesting.
- The humor tends to be more silly than funny.
- The game tends to be too casual in terms of difficulty (even though instant deaths happen).
- The "Hell" secret level is much too difficult compared to the rest of the game.
- NPC are mostly cliché and not very interesting.
- Overall the story is quite barebones.
- You are too much hand-guided in the story, where to go and so on.
- No side quests.
- Compared to the first game, the light system is basically useless (especially once you purchase the "infinite light" upgrade).

Verdict
If you like silly Flash games where you grind some funny little stuff to get upgrades and do the same thing better over and over, you will find something of the same spirit in SteamWorld Dig 1 & 2, which are games easy to get into, mildly addictive, and borderline casual. But it's also much better, extremely polished, and has a lot more depth. Especially, you are offered a huge world to explore and to get lost into. Sometimes I was amazed to access some secret room which turned out to be a huge corridor leading to a part of the map yet greater than what I had already explored. The additional "caves" spread all over the map usually offer a more puzzle-oriented or platforming-skills oriented challenge, which is welcome.

Briefly speaking, you can't really be wrong playing SteamWorld Dig 2. It's beautiful, it's clever, it's fun, and the game just gets better and better as you play it. It's a very strong recommendation.

How is it better than the first SteamWorld?

It's better in every aspect. Graphics are nicer, the world is bigger, the feeling of freedom is much more intense. It really follows the exact same structure (mining in the overall map, coming back to town to heal and get upgrades, unlocking teleporting point, going into "challenge" caves, unlocking the same new abilities). The environments are more atmospheric, there are much more upgrades available (and you can't have them all at once, but you are free to try different of them each time you go to town, so there is a mild "build" element), and, for some unclear reason, all the ingredients work together even better than they already were.

Overall, SteamWorld Dig 2 takes a step further away from the "addictive Flash game" structure of the first, and sometimes it feels. There are components of the game which are simply relics from the first, for instance the light. You are equipped with a light which runs out of fuel over time. When it stops, you are left in the near dark and it get quite hard (but not terribly so either) to go back to the town if you are away from a teleporter. In the first game, this was quite an issue as you wanted to keep longer and longer in the mine, so you wanted to upgrade that light. Here, it's not that important and you soon end up with an ever-lasting light, as if the devs decided that this component was best left out of the game after all.

As the focus of SteamWorld Dig 2 is much more placed on the freedom of exploration (and it works!), there is less incentive to get the upgrades. I never felt the urge to play "just a tad longer" to get this alluring upgrade within my reach, which was the main driving force behind the gameplay of the first game. The consequence of this is that SteamWorld Dig 2 is a bit less addictive... but has a lot more depth and delivers a more powerful experience of exploration and discovery. You don't care that much about the pick either because there is less difference in the sturdiness of the blocks as you explore the world (in the first one, the deeper you went, the sturdier were the blocks, forcing you to upgrade continually your pickaxe to avoid spending infinite time digging your into the mine; while it is also true here, you discover all different environments before finishing any of them, so the blocks do not because sturdier after a point early on in the game). Even if the two games are closely similar, this shift of focus alters how you feel playing it -in my opinion for the best.

How could it have been improved?

The thing is, the end kinda tells you that the game should receive another sequel. That's exciting, and the new perspective offered at the end only raises expectation. Yet, there are a few elements which could been significantly improved, in my opinion.

First, the "Hell" level is really frustrating. The game is supposed to be played by a large audience: it's pleasantly easy, and the challenge lies into the exploration more than the pure platforming skills. Therefore, adding a secret level, which rewards hours of exploration, just to tell the player "Eh, you started to thought you were good? Nope, you just suck terribly." is mean. I really disliked it, especially considering that I love to explore, to unlock every secrets, and I had to pass on this one.

Second, the game is much too guided. There is a blue cross which tells you where to go. Fortunately, purchasing the "Sequence breaker" achievement, I strayed away from the main story and explored more freely, and it felt extremely good. I recommend to do it even if it breaks the story and doesn't make really sense (perhaps they should have made alternative dialogues to fix this). Also, the NPCs are pretty much useless (you have sellers and characters you are required to speak to to get further in the main story), while they could have given you fun side quests. I would have loved side quests and the game can easily implement them.

Third, the combat is mostly boring. Since the game is quite easy and you have a lot of health points, you don't really bother and I tended to kill every enemies by running into them. You only have a pickaxe that you have to time precisely and that has no range at all, so it's not really interesting. The hook is nicer in that it allows you to slightly push an enemy. Overall, the fight component is really not deeply thought out, and it has almost no interest in the game.

Fourth, there could always be more exploration! The game already improves a lot compared to the firs SteamWorld Dig. But I would have liked to find more secret rooms, completely useless to the main story, more secret passways, and it would have been cool if the artifacts you hunt for in the game have had a purpose (for instance, additional pieces of lore, not just silly jokes which fall flat for the great majority of them). Side quests could also help having areas unrelated to the main story, while giving a purpose to explore them.

I therefore hope the third SteamWorld Dig will have a more non-linear structure, more secrets, and side quests. Combat is not that crucial to improve since the exploration really is the selling point of the series.

review: Raz a young boy endowed with mental abilities was first seen in the game Psychonaut in 2005 and then we saw him in other series of video games. what game is it the SteamWorld Dig 2? Following Rusty's disappearance at the end of SteamWorld Dig, Dorothy, a robot who he had befriended, travels to the mining town of El Machino in order to search for him. a nice game with fantastic story and amazing graphics and easy handling just perfect. Thank you valve for this free game

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1636640231}
review:
Boulder Dash
Sehr gute XSX Gamepad Unterstützung.
Leider ist die Steuerung so extrem träge und schwammig, dass ich schnell die Segel gestrichen habe.
Habe mir das Spiel damals auf der Playse gekauft, weil Teil 1 so toll war.
Dort auch nicht fertiggespielt, weil es mit dem Haken nervig durch die schlechte Steuerung wurde.
Ansonsten ist es ja ein extrem simples Spielprinzip. Wenn es Marioesque Steuerung hätte wäre das Spiel wahrscheinlich viel zu einfach und belanglos.
Schwierig lediglich durch die Steuerung.

review: Of course I got it because it was free. However, I did not expect it to be *this* good, I'm hooked. Already 4 hours in nonstop since I got it. I don't usually play this kind of games, but this one kept me going. I like the blue arrow pointing me where to go, it's the kind of game I want to relax and have fun with. I hear it's better than the first one, although after I finish this one I'll surely grab the other too. Highly recommended, and we've got native Linux support too! Bravo, devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198876044930', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1636595131}
review:
Pros
+ Instantly fun.
+ A lot of exploration.
+ Quite unique in terms of gameplay (2D Metroidvania + mining).
+ You are free to excavate the mine as it pleases you.
+ Very distinctive environments, atmospherically speaking.
+ Hunting for the 42 missing artifacts is great.
+ Upgrades really change the way you play the game.
+ You are mostly free to explore the world as it pleases you.
+ Some achievements are quite fun to unlock, especially the "Sequence breaker" one.
+ Nice and interesting theme (post-apocalyptic cowboys robots).
+ Knowing how much secrets remained to be found in each area is very handy.
+ A high level of polish makes the game shine.
+ No useless backtracking thanks to a clever teleportation system.

Cons
- The combat is not very interesting.
- The humor tends to be more silly than funny.
- The game tends to be too casual in terms of difficulty (even though instant deaths happen).
- The "Hell" secret level is much too difficult compared to the rest of the game.
- NPC are mostly cliché and not very interesting.
- Overall the story is quite barebones.
- You are too much hand-guided in the story, where to go and so on.
- No side quests.
- Compared to the first game, the light system is basically useless (especially once you purchase the "infinite light" upgrade).

Verdict
If you like silly Flash games where you grind some funny little stuff to get upgrades and do the same thing better over and over, you will find something of the same spirit in SteamWorld Dig 1 & 2, which are games easy to get into, mildly addictive, and borderline casual. But it's also much better, extremely polished, and has a lot more depth. Especially, you are offered a huge world to explore and to get lost into. Sometimes I was amazed to access some secret room which turned out to be a huge corridor leading to a part of the map yet greater than what I had already explored. The additional "caves" spread all over the map usually offer a more puzzle-oriented or platforming-skills oriented challenge, which is welcome.

Briefly speaking, you can't really be wrong playing SteamWorld Dig 2. It's beautiful, it's clever, it's fun, and the game just gets better and better as you play it. It's a very strong recommendation.

How is it better than the first SteamWorld?

It's better in every aspect. Graphics are nicer, the world is bigger, the feeling of freedom is much more intense. It really follows the exact same structure (mining in the overall map, coming back to town to heal and get upgrades, unlocking teleporting point, going into "challenge" caves, unlocking the same new abilities). The environments are more atmospheric, there are much more upgrades available (and you can't have them all at once, but you are free to try different of them each time you go to town, so there is a mild "build" element), and, for some unclear reason, all the ingredients work together even better than they already were.

Overall, SteamWorld Dig 2 takes a step further away from the "addictive Flash game" structure of the first, and sometimes it feels. There are components of the game which are simply relics from the first, for instance the light. You are equipped with a light which runs out of fuel over time. When it stops, you are left in the near dark and it get quite hard (but not terribly so either) to go back to the town if you are away from a teleporter. In the first game, this was quite an issue as you wanted to keep longer and longer in the mine, so you wanted to upgrade that light. Here, it's not that important and you soon end up with an ever-lasting light, as if the devs decided that this component was best left out of the game after all.

As the focus of SteamWorld Dig 2 is much more placed on the freedom of exploration (and it works!), there is less incentive to get the upgrades. I never felt the urge to play "just a tad longer" to get this alluring upgrade within my reach, which was the main driving force behind the gameplay of the first game. The consequence of this is that SteamWorld Dig 2 is a bit less addictive... but has a lot more depth and delivers a more powerful experience of exploration and discovery. You don't care that much about the pick either because there is less difference in the sturdiness of the blocks as you explore the world (in the first one, the deeper you went, the sturdier were the blocks, forcing you to upgrade continually your pickaxe to avoid spending infinite time digging your into the mine; while it is also true here, you discover all different environments before finishing any of them, so the blocks do not because sturdier after a point early on in the game). Even if the two games are closely similar, this shift of focus alters how you feel playing it -in my opinion for the best.

How could it have been improved?

The thing is, the end kinda tells you that the game should receive another sequel. That's exciting, and the new perspective offered at the end only raises expectation. Yet, there are a few elements which could been significantly improved, in my opinion.

First, the "Hell" level is really frustrating. The game is supposed to be played by a large audience: it's pleasantly easy, and the challenge lies into the exploration more than the pure platforming skills. Therefore, adding a secret level, which rewards hours of exploration, just to tell the player "Eh, you started to thought you were good? Nope, you just suck terribly." is mean. I really disliked it, especially considering that I love to explore, to unlock every secrets, and I had to pass on this one.

Second, the game is much too guided. There is a blue cross which tells you where to go. Fortunately, purchasing the "Sequence breaker" achievement, I strayed away from the main story and explored more freely, and it felt extremely good. I recommend to do it even if it breaks the story and doesn't make really sense (perhaps they should have made alternative dialogues to fix this). Also, the NPCs are pretty much useless (you have sellers and characters you are required to speak to to get further in the main story), while they could have given you fun side quests. I would have loved side quests and the game can easily implement them.

Third, the combat is mostly boring. Since the game is quite easy and you have a lot of health points, you don't really bother and I tended to kill every enemies by running into them. You only have a pickaxe that you have to time precisely and that has no range at all, so it's not really interesting. The hook is nicer in that it allows you to slightly push an enemy. Overall, the fight component is really not deeply thought out, and it has almost no interest in the game.

Fourth, there could always be more exploration! The game already improves a lot compared to the firs SteamWorld Dig. But I would have liked to find more secret rooms, completely useless to the main story, more secret passways, and it would have been cool if the artifacts you hunt for in the game have had a purpose (for instance, additional pieces of lore, not just silly jokes which fall flat for the great majority of them). Side quests could also help having areas unrelated to the main story, while giving a purpose to explore them.

I therefore hope the third SteamWorld Dig will have a more non-linear structure, more secrets, and side quests. Combat is not that crucial to improve since the exploration really is the selling point of the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970512066', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1633731650}
review:
The additional movement options are more interesting and more fun than SteamWorld Dig 1, and the game overall is more smoothly designed. A lot of the best upgrades are backloaded, so I ended up feeling like the switch from "limited mobility" to "do whatever you want" was a bit abrupt. I would have liked to get some of the key upgrades a lot earlier to establish a kind of baseline mobility groove, but I still enjoyed it.

It's a compact game that gets out of the way before it wears out its welcome, and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys the metroidvania tropes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987156931', 'num_games_owned': 1168, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1633993826}
review: Excellent continuation of the first game. Improves on it on every way I can think of. I like both titles, the first one reminded me more of a game called Miner: Dig Deep way back on XBLA and this is a mix of that plus a  metroidvania title. I loved the music, the puzzle caves, and the game feels great to play. I also really enjoyed that you can customize your upgrades to exactly how you want it, and some of the later upgrades are just fun to use. Bonus points for letting me know that I found 100% of the secrets on the current area I was on. Easy recommend if you're a fan of the series or metroidvania titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081786449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2415, 'last_played': 1634932035}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079920501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1633768893}
review:
10/10. Un juego de minería y acción en plataformas como no he encontrado otro en Steam. 
Una historia interesante, divertida y llena de desafíos que me han hecho reír, concentrarme y hasta sentir cierto vacío ahora que lo he terminado. 
A los que ya conozcan la saga: si el primer juego te encantó como a mí, prepárate para enamorarte de este segundo con todas sus novedades y mejoras. Ojalá haya una tercera entrega algún día.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035203598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1633577719}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049134301', 'num_games_owned': 4192, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1633291164}
review:
It's pretty good. I think I had more fun with the first one.

Exactly as the title says, it's a steam(punk)world and you dig. Also there was another one.
It's not hard. You dig, get cash, upgrade your stuff. Until money doesn't matter, then use cogs to upgrade your stuff.
You do get new traversal powers but they mostly let you proceed to new areas, rather than having to re-explore old areas. Maybe for a few secrets you can go back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264863922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1627718132}
review: Хорошая игра, мне понравилась. Интересный геймплей, приятные уровни, хорошая атмосфера. Проходить игру и искать секреты одно удовольствие.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186287693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1633161030}
review:
This is what I would describe as a perfect sequel, as it improves on all the things that made the first game so special.

Characters are cute and occasionally have more to them than first meets the eye. This time the protagonist has a companion, and the development of their relationship is a highlight of the story.

The lore of the world has depth, and the game reveals just enough to pique the player's curiosity, while still leaving plenty of unanswered questions to ponder on.

The gameplay loop of explore, find treasure, and upgrade is still extremely addictive and satisfying. Furthermore, you have extra options to customise the protagonist.

Environments can still be permanently altered by the player's choices, so some consideration needs to be taken while exploring. This time the depths beneath the hub town feel much more immersive. The return to Vectron in particular oozes with atmosphere and is a huge treat to explore.

Everything just feels more satisfying this time around.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000788475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1632776484}
review:
I wouldn't pay full price but the game certainly is a fun one.

The first game felt a LOT more focused on actual mining tactics. Place ladders, dig thoughtfully, manage resources. In this sequel, a lot of those challenges are removed completely or through upgrades. You can prevent your light from dropping to zero, hookshot and jetpack are earned fairly early on (and jetpack doesn't use water to be powered this time around), water pits don't empty when you use them, you don't lose your loot at the spot you died.....it's all very frustrating to those who wanted to struggle a little.

BUT

All of these changes allow the game to be a bigger experience. There is a much larger focus on exploration, and challenge rooms are a lot more interesting. Enemies aren't particularly difficult but they're fun to pop, and the wealth of traversal options allow for some fun maneuvers, like chaining jetpack and hookshot moves to dance circles around enemies. Platforming is overall a lot better for the changes, and the game makes use of your options to make nice, wide open areas to play in. This does mean that the mining very much feels more like an afterthought now, I found myself skipping mining entirely by the end, but the exploration never got old.

Boss fights are still an irritation. 

If you liked the first, this will be a jarring experience. If you like Grow Home as well, though, you'll still like this. Personally, the first is more interesting. But this one has less slog.

Takes around the same time as the previous game to beat, but there's a lot to this one, more characters, more of a story, honestly can't decide which one I prefer.

The new abilities are fun to use and upgrade, it's worth picking up if you enjoyed the first one...

author: {'steamid': '76561198053329755', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1631912779}
review:
definite improvement from the first game, story is more fleshed out. soundtrack was okay, nothing special. Gameplay was good and puzzle caves were fun to figure out/look for the secret.
Liked the look of different levels, good amount of teleports near important things.
:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198220682365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1631762704}
review:
a little longer and a little less punchy than the first, but still scratches the right itch. 

This game really doubled down on fast travel options, meaning you'll spend even less time traveling through areas you've already cleared. I am lukewarm on the change and lean to how they did it in the first game. 

There are a lot of fun and meaningful upgrades to get, even more than the previous game.

The story is pretty weak and I generally preferred the first game in this regard,

However this game is a lot more graphically interesting which I feel makes up for that.

The combat is also a little tighter and there is a fair bit more content in this game (around 50% more).

only thing I found to be lacking was the music, which I usually turned off as it tended towards grating after a while.

All in all this game (as well as the first one) is a easy recommend for someone looking for a casual yet engaging metroidvania

author: {'steamid': '76561198126071324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1631760831}
review:
Fun game, lazy/unsatisfying ending.
Overall, I'd give it a 7/10 (above average, not fantastic)
I recommend it for game-play, style and soundtrack. But the story sucks and the ending is extremely unsatisfying. Evidently, it continues into the pseudo-sequel, Steamworld Heist. But that has entirely different game-play and it doesn't really appeal to me.

[spoiler alert]
The creepy pasta style "nightmare" sequence in the middle of the game, is pointless and meaningless. No explanation or justification is ever even suggested. It's just something they threw in, to prolong the sequence of events and barely justify the second half of what can barely be called the "story".

author: {'steamid': '76561197993282995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1631702933}
review: Отличное продолжение хорошей игры. Уровни стали разнообразнее, прокачка очень вариативная, классный сюжет, управление стало отзывчивее и рисовка похорошела. Всем играть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015127044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1631386358}
review:
[b]Addicting[/b] gameplay loop with mix of mining exploration, and sub-rooms that offer more tightly designed puzzles & challenges. Reminiscent of the game [i]Motherload[/i]

Fast travel points make it very streamlined to sell your ores, buy some upgrades, and go right back to spelunkin'. Basically [b]no interruptions[/b] from cutscenes or dialogue. Good variety of obstacles that also affect the environment (boulders that fall, explosive enemies, lava drips), that you learn to overcome without handholdy tutorials.

Hookshot upgrade is versatile and fun to zoom around with. I stumbled upon lategame areas early with clever use of this which was super rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141192332', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1631158368}
review: Enjoyed a lot. I played the heck out of the first one on old 3ds, and loved it. I am glad i decided to pick up the second one years later. Rusty is a gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798792203', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1701455543}
review:
A game much better than the first SteamWorld Dig (which was a fine game on its own), a great metroidvania with emphasis on exploration, charming style, only thing a bit clunky was the combat- though this makes you choose your fights wisely, you are a digger, not a warrior

Definately recommended if you like metroidvanias

author: {'steamid': '76561198152859379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1630867496}
review:
It is a good game, but very very short. If you're okay with a short game, this is definitely a fun product and well polished. I enjoyed my time in it. Just note that I finished the main story line in about 5 hour (I didn't play to be a completionist i.e. get all the secrets and achievements, which I think could have increase the length by another 5ish?) 

If you're looking for a short and sweet game, this is worth your while!

I'm not recommending this game because $20 for a 4 year old 5 hour long game was not worth my money, personally. But, if you prefer quality over quantity and have money to spend, it is totally a reasonable purchase. No hate towards the developers or anything! It's a clean product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119843491', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1629379022}
review:
Чем-то запоминающимся игра не является.
Выглядит как аркадная игра, где:
1) ни особого сюжета (персонажи здесь говорят на своей волне, диалоги лишь для комментарирования чего-то что мы получили и все);
2) ни запоминающейся музыки (хоть и какой интересный композитор у саундтрека, но и он не вытягивает скудность в целом концепта);
3) ни геймплейно крутого составляющего нет:
Механик по сравнению с первой частью стало больше, но из-за некоторых из них изменяется баланс и она становится обычной побегушкой от точки А до точки Б с максимальной скоростью, чтоб тупо её пройти. Зачем нужны начальные механики, когда одна-две полностью их убирают из использования?
Сложность по-сравнению с первой стала во много раз легче (вторая жизнь, уменьшенный урон, механика фонаря уже нахрен не vsralas здесь, когда в первой следил за ней как можно, и чувствовалась сложность без света, тут вообще не чувствуешь его силу, ходи да ebash всех подряд, - будет свет), труб было меньше, можно было свои телепорты делать, тут использовал телепорт в меню да и hui с ним, вообще изи). В этом и ненужность игры в целом. Будто бы в игры в соцсети зашел. Пособирать руду, да продавать её, изучая при этом какой-то "мир". В который толком и проникнуться не можешь.

Извините ребят, но не согласен с "крайне-положительными", как бы прекрасна визуально она не была.
Музыка также уныла как и в первой. Не стоит оно того.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976750497', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1697190386}

author: {'steamid': '76561198173381281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1585360045}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 sees the talented Image & Form Games returning to their platforming roots after the successful experiment of 2015’s Steamworld Heist, and is an outstanding direct sequel to their wonderful PC debut Steamworld Dig. The original Dig is great, and well worth checking out before this installment; although the plot is standalone, some beats and character arcs will be more satisfying for returning players. Dig 2 delivers everything you’d hope for in a sequel; another fantastic slab of single player enjoyment, with more accomplished visuals, polished gameplay and a greater range of challenges. Set in a cheerful Wild West-styled post-apocalypse, protagonist Dorothy begins the dig down through the world’s layered history, hoping to unearth both the previous game’s disappeared Rusty and the source of earthquakes threatening her frontier hometown. 

What follows is a masterfully-paced campaign which alternates soothing mining, platforming challenges and dramatic boss fights. There’s a clear sense of forward momentum in both narrative and Dot’s accumulation of powers, with a range of upgrade options dangling always tantalisingly just ahead. Platforming and mining remain an intuitive breeze from start to finish (including with keyboard and mouse), while the whimsical plot takes interesting turns without ever descending into self-parody. Overall, Steamworld Dig 2 is an outstanding sequel to a masterful original, and a worthy entry in the Steamworld canon. Don’t miss this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1629275178}
review:
I greatly disliked the gameplay in the first Steamworld Dig game, and delayed purchasing its sequel for a long time, until I obtained it at a really deep discount (~$4.59 or so), my curiosity still getting the better of me, as is all too often the case. However, I just finished playing through this game, and had a really nice time with it. Anyone going for 100% achievements might have a slightly rough time of it, but anyone just wanting to get all the upgrades and beat the game should have a pretty nice time of things.

Steamworld Dig 2's music was quite nice, with each subterranean region having its own music that fit well, and each region also had a distinct look. As with the first game, there are little caves you can dip into with secrets to be uncovered which are very rewarding. The power-ups were a lot of fun, and most of them felt pretty empowering. Some of the little modifications you can spend cogs on (freely insert and extract them to try out different ones) even minimize issues I had with the first game, such as the lantern light dying too quickly. Sure, that's a problem very early on in Steamworld Dig 2, but it's quickly dealt with, and eventually it will never be a problem again.

Narratively, there's a lot more plot in this game compared to the first one, though I will say that it isn't story-heavy at all. The gameplay is the core of this game, and I really had a fair bit of fun with this one. I hated my time with the first Steamworld Dig, but I think I might play Steamworld Dig 2 again someday, because it was a pleasant experience and an all-around enjoyable game for me which compelled me to finish it. Heck, I stayed up an extra hour just to finish up and write this recommendation, too. If you enjoyed the first game, it's quite likely you'll enjoy this one, and if the first game's gameplay wasn't your cup of tea, Steamworld Dig 2's little improvements here and there might be enough to make you like it, as was the case for me. Take care.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277317020', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1677947862}
review: 5 лет назад играл в первую часть, очень понравилась. Вскоре я про неё забыл так как прошёл её почти полностью. Однажды в этом году я вспомнил об Steamworld dig, но не помнил название и решил загуглить и узнал что оказывается SteamWorld Dig 2 уже в стиме около года, и затем я её купил. Если сравнивать первую и вторую часть то изменений гигантское количество, много новых функций, врагов и продолжение сюжета из первой части. Эта игра мне очень нравится и ещё при том что у меня остались ламповые воспоминания с прошлой игры. Единственное что утомляет и немного раздражает - артефакты, как по мне слишком много артефактов на слишком больших локациях, с другой стороны - это вызов для геймеров(Есть ачивки с артефактами).

author: {'steamid': '76561197990224915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1628859820}
review: It's fine at the start, but later when you need good controls it just craps out.  The grappling hook control is terrible.  Its linked to your movement so if you need to move up and left which way it shoots is 50/50.  And wall jumps get really iffy when you aren't just spamming them to get up walls.  You can tell the type of brain power that went into the controls near the start where they put an NPC next to a ladder and have both interactions linked to the Up button. It just gets worse from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140283707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1628717465}
review: Questo è un bel gioco. Non lungo ma molto divertente, simile al primo episodio (di cui è narrativamente il seguito, ma giocabile anche stand alone) ma in cui hanno migliorato tutti i "difetti" del primo, aumentando di molto la mobilità, la varietà dei nemici, gli enigmi ambientali, le aree, i minerali. Il sistema dei potenziamenti poi dona una personalizzazione del gameplay buona e totalmente migliore di quella del capitolo precedente. Lo consiglio a chiunque.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025845937', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1616930275}
review:
I enjoyed SteamWorld Dig 1 and also enjoyed SteamWorld Dig 2.  Can't wait for 3.

It's a fun game where upgrades unlock new areas of exploration and new levels / areas over time.  It's one of the few games I've actually wanted to complete, and did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987119320', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1628387339}
review:
Great fun from start to finish. 

Good sense of progression, avoids feeling like it takes ages to move beyond the starting tools and abilities. 

Combat feels just challenging enough to make you careful about how you play without becoming too frustrating. And the puzzling and platforming is really well designed. 

The story is simple but well told, and there's some great music here too. The only recurring issue I had with the game was that up on the dpad is both the "climb ladder" and "talk to NPC" button, which causes a bit of clumsiness in town, but that's a small thing. This is an easy recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198143046132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1681124298}
review:
Jestem zakochany w tej grze! Przy jedynce przyjemnie spędziłem czas, ale dwójkę wręcz pochłaniałem całym sobą. Rdzeń rozgrywki się nie zmienił - kopiemy, zbieramy surowce, oddajemy je za kasę i kupujemy ulepszenia. To co się zmieniło to;
+ grafika - naprawdę miodna
+ ekonomia i ulepszenia - jest tego naprawdę dużo, nie wszystko uda się zmaksować, ale czuć ten progres
+ sekrety i tworzenie poziomów - nawet pierwsze lokacje mogą nas zaskoczyć, gdy wrócimy do nich z nowym sprzętem. Po za tym mapa nie idzie ciągle w dół, ale ma wiele rozgałęzień.
+ fabuła - dalszy ciąg znany z dwójki z ciekawym zakończeniem 

Podsumowując:
Bawiłem się fantastycznie. Te 11h nie wiem kiedy mi zleciało, nawet żałuję że raz tyle tego nie było. Odczuciami SteamWorld Dig 2, przeniósł mnie w czasie gdy jako dzieciak ogrywałem pierwszego Raymana, wszystko było nowe, ciekawe, podane w przyjaznej formie. Szczerze polecam!

review: What a wonderful game. Played the first dig game a couple of times on the 3ds few years ago, and liked it very much, but this sequel is even better, a little more generous in its content (secrets, boosts, enemies, etc.) and it does not complicates itself with the story, tho it tells one, very charming one at that. Cannot wait for a third installment. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198981370125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1663124529}
review:
Played the original steam world dig on the 3ds when I was younger, and was really addicted to the gameplay.
This sequel builds off of everything the original had, with a few modern improvements that don't interfere with the flow of gameplay.
Would highly recommend playing the duo of dig games in the SteamWorld line of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057119037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1629570081}
review:
I -love- these two little games. I hadn't even thought to approach it like a Metroidvania, which I guess is what some of the other reviews are doing, but - coming at it expecting just a simple little mining game (go dig up some goodies, return to base, sell them, and upgrade your tools so you can dig up more goodies), it's that precisely and a little bit more in terms of story and combat, and especially exploration. All the little secrets are such a fun touch, as are the puzzle-based challenge caves and then whole "here's some cool gear mod blueprints in exchange for finding secrets" system.

Love this game. Love mining games in general, and this is a really good example of a quick, fun way to spend a weekend or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012149562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1626212380}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055006994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1621917877}
review:
[u] [b] Rating: [/b] [/u]
[list]
    [*][x] [b] Recommended at full price [/b]
    [*][ ] Recommended at a discount
    [*][ ] Recommended but only at a discount
    [*][ ] Not Recommended
[/list]

[h1] I dig it [/h1]

[b] Closest comparison: [/b] SteamWorld Dig 1 (obviously)

[b] Duration: [/b] 10-20hs depending on how many secrets you find and how much of the map you explore (my game time is not correctly showed as I palyed the game in offline mode btw)

[b] Short description: [/b] Metroidvania game with the gimmick of constantly digging your way down levels, it may not sound like much but trust me, it´s awesome

[b] Best features: [/b]
+ Digging is, as before, a joy, the controls are responsive and the gameplay loop of digging your way until your lamp dies out, going back to the town to speak with npcs, sell your loot, buy upgrades and go dig again is extremely addicting
+ Immense map with a variety of different zones with fun gimmicks
+ Lots of secrets and puzzles to discover
+ Good variety of abilities scattered around the map that you can find and upgrade
+ The perks system allows you to re-spec any ability at any time by going to the town, this encourages exploration even if by the last chunk of the game you will probably have all the perks you want and more (especially if you go searching for secrets)
+ Very clear map with optional indicators of where to go to continue the story, which cave have you already emptied and so on
+ Very cool [spoiler] Vectron [/spoiler] Sections

[u] Feedback [/u]:
- Maybe the story is a bit simplistic, but I enjoyed it for what it is
- The bosses are cool but there aren´t many

[b] Overall thoughts: [/b] 
I had little to no expectations of the first game but this has risen to be one of the most enjoyable game franchises I´ve ever had the pleasure of enjoying, and this in in particular expands pretty much everything it´s predecessor started and as a result is an insanely fun and addicting game that I literally finished in two sessions, losing sight of time in both

author: {'steamid': '76561198003822853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1625865955}
review:
Without going on a tirade about it, the animation sort of defeats itself.

They use the morph and stretch animation style that's becoming more common all the time. And honestly, most of the time it's fine. It's never a mark of quality when you see it, but it doesn't directly detract from the visuals. Here, quite the opposite. These are robots, largely, and I would expect a bit less fluidity in the mouths and bodies as they move. The morphing just looks out of place.

Game play is pretty much the same as the first, if less challenging and the game leans heavily on you knowing who these characters are and the only relationship that it seems bothered about developing doesn't  have any natural progression. It just checks boxes from foe to friend. For that matter, any character who has a "change of heart" or "is not what they seem" just flips a switch between the personalities.

This game was still diverting, but I have to admit that I forced myself to finish the final act.

The end credits reek heavily of "could've gotten a better ending", but you have to write a better story for me to want to bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053481680', 'num_games_owned': 2932, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1625726135}
review:
穴掘りメトロイドヴァニアの第2作。
ミスタードリラーの様に支えがなくなると落ちてくる岩や売る事ができる鉱石などを考慮しつつブロックを下に向かって掘り進み、アイテムを集めたりお金でパワーアップしたりしながら探索していくゲームだ。
ブロックの配置は人間によるものらしく自動生成とは違った考えられた配置になっている。

ただ本作では上記のシステムを発展させて横に掘り進めたり、アイテムの入手やお金によるパワーアップで段違いの機動性を獲得したりするなど第1作に比べて穴掘りよりメトロイドヴァニアの比重が高くなっている。
そのためシンプルに穴掘りを楽しめる第1作と同じプレイ感を期待すると肩透かしを食うかもしれない。

このゲームは操作性が良くて動かしていて楽しいし、ストーリーも起伏があってなかなかいい。英語なので細かい所は想像で補ったが。
結論としてはコンシューマ版などではあった日本語がない以外は特に欠点や不満点もなく素晴らしいメトロイドヴァニアなので穴掘りだけしたい人以外にお勧め。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067661649', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1625716479}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998065407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1623042522}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169438517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1673070180}
review:
An improvement in every single conceivable way from the first game.

SteamWorld Dig 2 goes about fixing the main issues holding back the first game from being as good as it could. The story, gameplay-loop, music, character designs, world and setting have all seen a significant improvement. 

The music in particular is a real banger, with guest work from Niklas Åkerblad (aka El Huervo). The same artist who contributed both music and art behind Hotline Miami and Else Heart.Break()

Overall a real fun metroidvania that does proper service for the franchise, and at times can be very touching.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078485530', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1625759117}
review:
Es un juego divertido en mi opinión
Un estilo gráfico que me parece muy agradable y característico
También me parece que respeta tu tiempo
El juego básicamente va de minar, la historia? te la puedes acabar rápido, en unas 4 horas si quieres.
Si bien el juego parece que va de "grindear" hasta cierto punto, yo me lo pase si tener que detenerme a hacerlo, las mejoras las obtienes de forma fluida y la historia progresa a un ritmo bastante cómodo.
Creo que se considera metroidvania, ya que tienes que conseguir ciertas mejoras para llegar a ciertos lugares opcionales a los que puedes volver mas tarde.
Y si te da la gana, puedes ponerte a minar de chill sin ningún problema, buscando objetos secretos, consiguiendo dinero, subiendo de nivel y comprando mejoras.
A mi personalmente me gusta cuando un juego permite mejorar a mi personaje, y este te deja hacerlo a un ritmo bastante satisfactorio personalmente, pero si quieres te puedes poner a grindear mejoras y secretos, por eso me parece que respeta tu tiempo, lo que me gusta mucho.
Después de acabármelo, volví a mi ultimo save y ahora cuando quiero pasar el rato me meto a minar, comprar mejoras y buscar objetos secretos.
Espero no haberme repetido mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003040003', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1625345219}
review:
great game. the control is tight, graphics is good. Story is decent. Normally not a metroidvania fan, but this one is an exception. Game feels linear and where you go is fairly obvious, which is a huge plus for me as I dont like getting lost in the map figuring way out.
Secrets in the cave is also pretty cool, some light puzzle to keep things varied as well. Never felt bored and repetitive throughout my playthrough

author: {'steamid': '76561197997103678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1625355559}
review:
Played 10 hours straight.
While Hollow Knight is peak mastery of Metroidvania perfection...
SteamWorld Dig 2 might actually be "Peak Mastry of Metroidvania SIMPLICITY"

Why "NO":
- I know you're looking for reasons not to buy this, looking at the negative reviews rather than the positive ones.
- So I'm taking the spot to tell you to BUY it.

Why it's great:
- Superb controls. Almost perfect controls.
- Metroidvania excellence in exploration: You very quickly (about 15mins) get access to custom exploration...
- No overwhelming feeling: unlike more complex Metroidvanias, the map remains both very open AND simple, yet not linear. It's actually an achievement on its own!
- Chilllll. If you need a challenge, go play Hollow Knight's boss runs or something.
But do come back for this chill little title.
- Go in expecting the following: run around, break blocks, unlock powerups and paths, chill.

Completion time: 6 to 15 hours, depending on how quickly you go through instructions (or cancel them, which you can).
(I'm missing 1 artifact and will soon have completed all but the no-death-speedrun)

NOTES:
- You don't need SteamWorld Dig 1 to play this. The first is almost irrelevant to the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177985007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1625201050}
review:
(My steam playtime is wrong, the game took about 10 hours)
This is an absolute masterpiece. It surpasses the first game in every single way. The puzzles are fun, the music adds nice ambiance to the caves, and the art looks stunning. If Metroidvanias are your thing, PLEASE pick this one up. I adore this game.

review: Cool art style, awesome graphics and animations. This game starts off kinda slow because you can only be down in the mine for so long before you run out of lamp oil. Eventually you get enough upgrades that you can stay down almost indefinitely and the tedium of going back to town just to heal/sell loot all the time goes away. You also get a few mobility upgrades I wasn't expecting that made it really fun to play and go back to explore parts of the mines I missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999730961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 343, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1624065200}
review:
Very enjoyable metroidvania that is a good step up from the first title.

I feel like mining has sort of taken a back seat, or at least in its importance, whether that be a good thing or not is up to you. Always found it a bit more tedious than relaxing in this series for some reason.

Great art, GREAT game design, especially the "tutorials" which are precisely the way game mechanics are meant to be taught. No hand-holding, plenty of hints and unobtrusive examples.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016373122', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1622982786}
review:
Хорошая метроидвания. Более красочная, более разнообразная, с более удачной подачей сюжета. Как и в первой части мы ищем в шахтах драгоценные камни для продажи, и дальнейшей прокачки. Находим пещеры с новыми способностями на разных локациях, а не в одной шахте с 3мя биомами. Появились боссы - хотя их все равно маловато, всего лишь 3. Но все равно лучше чем в первой части - 1.
  Стоит сразу сказать что у неё те же проблемы что и у других метроидваний - приходится пылесосить локации чтобы легче было проходить, приходится возвращаться в исследованные локации. И вытекающее из описанного - выполнения однотипных действий. Но это все равно весело делать.
  Продолжительность тоже стала больше 10-12 часов(спидран в районе 4 часов).
  Итог: Если вы хотите поиграть в хорошую метроидванию, то игра не должна вас разочаровать. Но все равно посоветую подождать скидок, чтобы приобрести с первой частью(хотя она на пол головы слабее).
 P.S.: Если нужен челендж - он есть. Собрав 42 артефакта, откроется тайная локация с набором испытаний. Некоторые из которых заставят попотеть, и даже подожгут пердак, т.к. там придется использовать не используемые механики игры - прыжок с разбега на стену и отскок к другой, для более высокого отскока. Хотя это поможет при спидране за 4 часа для ачивки.
