author: {'steamid': '76561198131523757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1623259517}
review:
Hello,
let me try to write review in English, because I believe I have a lot to share with you about this.
[hr][/hr]
[h1] What it should be[/h1]
I believe this game missed it's purpose. It should be dig game. You go, dig resources, sell, get upgrades, dig more. It should be main purpose, most important part of the game. It should let me rst after hard day of work, like people going TIR simulator or something.

There was this classic online dig game, don't remember name (you were fighting Satan at the end). Digging was 99% of the game. It was implemented great. It was classic because of this, to this day people sometimes go back to this game (there is offline version now, I think).

SteamWorld Dig 1 was close to this, if I remember right. It was mostly digging. There was a little TOO MUCH of other things, but digging was ok and was mostly it.
[hr][/hr]
[h1] What it tries to be[/h1]
But this game, tries to be everything else.
[list]
    [*]Story
    [*]Open world
    [*]Puzzles
    [*]Boss fights
    [*]Feels
    [*]Plot twists
    [*]Change of rules
[/list]
And it is really bad in every single one of those things. But about this - later.
So those things... Are nice. Story should make game interesting. Open world should give you choice. Puzzles should give you feel of reward after completing. Boss fights - little action. Feels are core for many games, Plot twist hook you up for story  and change of rules makes digging less boring.

But those things should be addition to digging. Here, they are totally covering the digging part. You can't look for reasources in peace, because everything else is disturb you. You're not getting upgrades for more and better digging - you get them to fight stronger monsters and proceed with story or as reaction to changed rules.

There is almost no peaceful digging.
[hr][/hr]
[h1] What this game is not[/h1]
So, there is not much digging. Who cares? Instead there is story, open world...
Well but there is no good:
[list]
    [*]Story
    [*]Open world
    [*]Puzzles
    [*]Boss fights
    [*]Feels
    [*]Plot twists
    [*]Change of rules
[/list]
Actually, almost each one is horrible.
Story is boring. Open world doesn't give feel of choice. Puzzles are either easy or annoying. Boss fight are uneventful and random (you die or win based on luck, not because you git gut or don't git gut). Feels, well, I didn't care for anyone in this game. And in FIRST game i cared for Dorothy. Usually I care for third figure, but not here. Plot Twist had no sense. Changing rules felt like trying to make game more annoying instead or interesting.

It felt like they tried to NOT overwhelm the digging part... But like I said, they failed with it too.

I appreciate work put in this game, they TRIED to make it better. But I believe, they missed it [b]completely[/b].

Here, this "more" was both "too much" and "not enough". It looked like they were trying to do those other things, failed it and in the process destroyed the most important one - digging.

I had some fun from playing this game, but was very disappointed. I hoped it would be much better. Much LESS but better. More dig...

author: {'steamid': '76561198080966172', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1622968677}
review:
[h1] Моё отношение к серии SteamWorld [/h1]
Честно говоря, из всей серии мне по-настоящему понравилась только данная игра. Первая часть SteamWorld Dig – в принципе, неплохая простенькая игруха, но до жути однообразная, и несмотря на то что она очень короткая, я её так и не до прошёл. SteamWorld Heist имеет весьма оригинальную механику боя, но при этом прокачка в ней не интересна, миссии однообразны, а кампания чересчур растянута (тоже бросил … где-то на середине). А вот при прохождении SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech у меня были двоякие впечатления. С одной стороны, играется приятно, хорошая музыка, неплохая атмосфера. С другой, хоть у системы боя и прокачки есть свои плюсы, довольно часто формат коллекционных карт, ощущался пятым колесом и только вредил игре. Да и, некоторые другие её элементы, мне показались несколько бедноватыми (например, разнообразие боссов). Я её прошёл до конца, и о покупки не пожалел, однако собирать на уровнях все секреты (как и проходить полностью местный аналог Колизея) не стал, так как она уже успела, мне жутко надоесть.

[h1] Теперь, о самой SteamWorld Dig 2 [/h1]
Вы играете за робота кладоискателя, добывающего различные полезные ископаемые, которые потом обмениваете на деньги, и затем покупаете себе различные полезные обновы. В SteamWorld Dig 2 присутствует неплохой дух приключения и изучения нового. Так же игру неплохо разнообразят. Вам предстоит не только хозяйничать в шахтах (как то было в первой части), но и проходить более стандартные “уровни” для платформера (где рытьё земли будет вспомогательной возможностью, а не основной темой) и помещения с испытаниями, в некоторых из них, предстоит нехило пораскинуть мозгами. К немногим минусам, я отнёс бы разве что боссов. А точнее то, что их всего лишь 3. И при этом один из них, сильно похож на слегка усиленную версию одного вида врага.

Что касается того, можно ли играть во вторую часть, не играя в первую. То данная часть сложней первой, но при этом и управляемость персонажем лучше. Что касается сюжета, то во SteamWorld Dig 2 вам и так расскажут, всё что следует знать. При этом, она во всём превосходит первую. Так что вы не только можете пропустить первую, но и даже, возможно, в этом случае, получите больше удовольствия от игры (так как система с расхищением шахт, вам ещё не успеет надоесть).

Оценка 4 из 5. Полное прохождение игры занимает примерно 14 часов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067219837', 'num_games_owned': 2507, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1622865570}
review:
A remarkably fun game, and a rare example of a sequel actually surpassing the original, if I might say so myself, this is truly a Metroidvania game worth playing! The story is a continuation from SteamWorld Dig, in which Dorothy McCrank searches for Rusty, the protagonist of the original SteamWorld Dig game, and befriends Fen, a gleefully malicious Vectron Sprite, in her quest to locate Rusty. There are four main areas to explore, along with an overworld, and a special bonus dungeon, provided that certain conditions are met. Expect to collect tons of loot and items along your way, and above all else, keep on the lookout for Cogs!

An awesome game with an awesome soundtrack (especially within Vectron), prepare for knuckle clenched excitement with SteamWorld Dig 2!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992475773', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1621873626}
review:
Segun lei por ahi algunos se quejaron de que el juego duraba 4 horas... Se que existe gente que le gusta ir directo a la historia principal, pero 4h en serio¿? yo lo acabe con 15 y explorando un poco. 17 horas si cuento que luego intente hacer los trials sin exito. 

Definitivamente recomendado, similar en gameplay al primero y con un final un poco meh. Esperaba un new game plus para el juego o que hubiera una zona final para finiquitar las ultimas preguntas que quedan en el aire pero en fin... Y para variar y siento si esto lo considerais un spoiler, los trials no dan nada especial a parte del logro. Si alguien se los quiere saltar por que espera mas historia o algun tipo de upgrade, que se los salte, una vez pasado el juego incluso al 100% el final es el mismo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393713252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1634764003}
review: 之前玩了破解版的，这个没汉化的其实不太想打了已经，最后就着塑料英语打通了。比起第一部，2的地图和可玩性要大的多，第一部玩了六七周目，通关起来很快，2比1而言挖矿不用计算好挖哪个，不然就不能回去只能往下挖或者自爆了233，骷髅岛我感觉键鼠玩家操作起来会比较难一点，我已经放弃了反正。然后就是探索完了的洞穴有勾标识真的很好，1没有，经常忘记哪里没过，探宝的装备不能标记处已经挖掘出来的矿石，感觉这个功能应该是既定功能，单纯按照设定标记好了位置这样，如果能像饥荒那种采集好的东西放在不同位置也能显示就好了。希望还能够有续作吧，毕竟最后凡没有出来。准备开始第三周目刷成就啦

author: {'steamid': '76561198118286739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1620621509}
review: Quite possibly the biggest glowup I've seen from a sequel game in a long time, and my new second favorite Metroidvania (between Hollow Knight and Metroid Zero Mission).  I love the shrine-like challenges that test your skills, the world is bigger and more dense than ever before, the story is interesting, and the gameplay loop is just as addicting as game one. If you like Metroidvanias, you owe it to yourself to check out the wonderful duo of SteamWorld Dig games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271465530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1619567654}
review: Controller support for the game is broken. RB acts like options menu. Options menu acts like options menu. And when I tried resetting the controller buttons to default settings (in-game) every button is the LT. Unless that is fixed I do not recommend buying this for playing with a controller. (Tested with Xbox One Controller, works fine with SteamWorld Dig 1 and other games.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198997156295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1619456265}
review: This game is pretty great to be honest. I first played it on Google Stadia and it ran great there. I am now running it on my pc with a GTX 1660 Super and an AMD Ryzen 5 3600 and it runs flawlessly with no noticeable framerate drops. The game itself is engaging and has great gameplay. Would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys other games of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208665116', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1619117483}
review: Wonderful sequel! If you liked the first game, you'll love this one - takes everything the first game did right and improves upon it. Definitely grab it on sale though, 20 bucks is a bit steep - maybe grab half off or lower. I got it for 6, definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198390076770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1618134753}
review:
While the story is rather unimaginative and the ending quite sudden and anticlimatic, I can still recommend this game for its explorative gameplay and chill soundtrack. Its something to unwind with for an hour or two after a long day of work but makes it easy enough to put down to spend the rest of the evening with your family. 

Still, I recommend getting it on a sale as the regular price (19,99 € at the time of writing) may be quite steep for what you get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059626159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1617681542}
review:
While it did last longer than the first game, I still can't help but feel it's too short. It's fun but I mean, if we do 1 hour per dollar then my run was worth half what I paid.

Get it on sale or play to 100% completion.

Going back to games I beat or trying for speed running isn't my style so to ME it's not worth the price but the game itself is good.

review:
It's cute and charming.  It's also incredibly easy, so if your enjoyment is derived from overcoming challenge, this won't be for you.

That aside, enjoy fluid movement with lots of incremental additions (speed, hookshot, jetpack) and the joy of mining through lots of dirt and stone for riches in an otherwise fairly vanilla Metroidvania experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010335843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1617914433}
review:
Well, it's a Metroivania, I guess. A significant portion of the game takes place underground, which is where the "dig" part of the title comes in, but, I dunno, it's so awkward. First of all some dirt blocks have to be hit 2 or 3 times to break unless you upgrade the pick axe, which is really annoying. You can't jump and swing your pick axe at the same time which is a huge problem because sometimes treasure is hidden in specific areas. The only other tool you have is some weird explosive device that only has 2 rounds of ammo, and constantly needs to be refilled with water instead of on a cooldown which would make way more sense. Again, you can upgrade this to more than 2. So rather than unlocking new abilities, you're basically upgrading your gear for convenience. Yawn. The enemy variety is basically non-existent, each area has just one enemy copy and pasted over and over. And the combat is awful, you use the same pick axe to fight as you do to dig, but the enemies are oftentimes way too fast so you just end up taking damage. I find myself dying way too much just out of carelessness than out of any real challenge because it takes too long to kill most enemies and take no damage.

Also you get a little companion buddy thing (think Navi from Zelda) but he's a mean-spirited prick who literally tells you to fall to your death early in the game, which I don't get why someone on the development team thought this was funny, it's not, it's just dumb. And that's another problem, the fall damage, it makes exploration a chore because I can't just fall down a long chasm which slows the game down; there's a reason few if any Metroidvanias incorporate this BS into their games. When you die you lose most of your sellable treasure that you collected, and given that the treasure is finite, if you die too much you won't be able to upgrade anything. Which I wouldn't really care except the goddamn fall damage is a huge pain.

What few mechanics there are, are pointless. You have a limited backpack space to carry your ore, so what do you do when you fill it up? You go back to the surface and cash out, then go back to where you left off. Ok, so what's the point of this other than wasting my time? You can upgrade the backpack using money from the gems you dig up to hold more gems so you can dig more gems to upgrade your stuff. It's just busywork with 0 strategy. Same with the pick axe, you upgrade it so the blocks that take 3 swings will take 1. Ditto for your lamp, it just goes out and you have to go back to town for more, so you upgrade it to make it last longer. It's like they created a game, then invented all these inconveniences and then made you pay in-game currency to remove them. This is an artificial and pathetic way to try to add depth to a game. Like seriously, upgrading your kit is a big part of this game, so much so that it almost feels like a pay to win game, except instead of using real money you "work" for the money by digging it out of the ground. How about just play a different game instead of this crap. 

Anyways the game is tedious and the level design is not very good. The idea of exploring the underground is actually something that I find interesting because it almost reminds me of going to strange, exotic worlds like the Metroid games and navigating the cramped, creepy environments. They almost get it right here but I find the atmosphere lacking and each area plays very similarly except they just change the color palettes to red for the lava world and green for the poison world. Try playing a game like Super Metroid, each area plays and feels very differently and tells its own story about the area, and you can infer some lore just by the surroundings without a single word spoken. This game is nothing like that, each area is just a collection of rooms with dirt blocks to break and the same copy-pasted enemy. There's only like 4 differently-themed areas in the game and they all suck. And what's with that weird survival horror part randomly thrown in? It doesn't fit the game at all, especially when the "stealth" was implemented so poorly. You just go in, get chased by giant skeleton robots, and leave. You never even learn why you went through what you did. It's just "the Vectron". It would have been much cooler if they had introduced a creepy area like, at the extreme depths of the underground and you gradually make your way to the survival horror parts; instead this game just teleports you into some weird virtual environment, it's so stupid.

The only real game design is in separate puzzle room caves, but usually the puzzles are super easy and it's just a matter of going through the motions. It's all so boring and I really had to force myself through. The ending is garbage too. This is not a well-designed game, and it's clear these developers have no idea how to make something original, engaging, or fun. They could have at least had a cool scifi story and characters, but the story in this game is as bare-bones as it gets. Talking to the NPCs is a giant waste of time and NOT interesting at all since none of them have any depth or relevance to the story. In spite of this, this game actually has characters that turn out to be traitors and characters that are sacrificed, and it's so awkward because I don't care about ANY of them in the slightest. Seriously, go play Guacamelee, Iconoclasts, Hollow Knight, Bloodstained, Axiom Verge, Monster Boy. I give this game a 3/10, probably one of the worst games I've played in years besides Trails in the Sky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186421291', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1617305856}
review:
7.7/10
В данной части разработчики учли все недоработки довольно казуального оригинала, которые не позволяли тому выйти в элиту инди-игр, сделав очень добротную и действительно годную данжн-кроулер метроидванию (наконец, в чистом виде, и всё это - в гротескном стимпанк-вестерне). Вот только, к сожалению, и этот факт не помог игре стать действительно популярной, но всё же свою порцию восторга и одобрения от фанатов жанра игра снискала. 
Играется данный сиквел намного более интереснее оригинала, несмотря на привычные и знакомые уже всем механики. Элементы довольно олдскульного жанра Rocks and diamonds здесь уже является не единственным увлечением, хотя схватки с противниками всё ещё выглядят весьма казуально и однобоко, но собственно и игра не про это. Все самые классические элементы метроидвании в данной части сделаны намного более грамотно, тем самым заметно освежают серию, заставляя копаться с удовольствием в ранее недостижимых местах, а местные пещеры действительно дают игроку вызов, который не так-то просто пройти с первого раза. Ну и стоит ли говорить о том, как много тут секретов, каждый из которых действительно приятно находить.

review: Très sympa, je viens de finir en 17h en mode détente, je vais certainement y retourner pour découvrir tous les secrets. J'avais pas fait le premier donc je découvre l'univers, pointe d'humour avec "mine de rien" (ah ah) un regard assez critique sur l'humanité. Je retrouve les bons côtés du metroidvania (exploration, gain de pouvoirs) avec une histoire quand même dirigée et sans une grosse difficulté, on rage pas sur ce jeu ^ ^ (ça m'a fait pensé à des moments au Rick Dangerous de mon enfance, de loin mais y'a un ptit truc)

author: {'steamid': '76561198888098221', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1708911830}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 es la cuarta parte de la serie de juegos SteamWorld iniciada en 2010 y es una continuación directa de SteamWorld Dig de 2013.
Si jugaste al primero pero no te termino de gustar, en este encontrarás todas las mejoras que esperas:
✔️ Salto a nivel gráfico
✔️ Mecánicas y funciones pulidas, logrando que el conjunto funcioné a la perfección.
✔️ A medida que obtenemos minerales y los vendemos después, podremos optimizar el equipamiento de nuestro personaje y a esto se suma la posibilidad de usar "engranajes", un nuevo tipo de habilidad pasiva que podremos encontrar escondida en las cuevas y usar para modificar el equipamiento.

Para concluir: Si aún no jugaste a ningún SteamWorld, empieza directamente por este. Si te gustan los metroidvanias, no te vas a arrepentir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299419652', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1616095456}
review: I am not gonna lie going through a long tunnel that you made is fun but there is a lot of things that makes playing the game frustrating in my opinion which is fall damage , the miner physics (his jump is slow and not precise) , the small back pack and water tank , the long useless dialogue  and the thing that flew me off the handle is the light replenish every 30 seconds or sow it is so annoying that when you dig a long tunnel as long as you reach the bottom (which you intend to make longer) the light needs replenishing, WHY ? because you need to -_- I mean it's not useless because it show you the ores and bugs but why make me go up and down again and again just to replenish it! the designer could've made a more convenient  and faster way. Anyway I think the majority of people would like the game but if the things I talked about bugs you I don't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011999424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1615895641}
review:
Sziasztok !

Csakúgy mint az elődje kiváló 2D platformer ahol rengeteget kell ásni s ugrálni. A fejlesztési rendszer és pályák a nehézségi szint mind jobban kézre áll . Zene és a hangulat továbbra is kiváló a maga apró egyszerűségében. 

Sztori az első rész során megismert Rusty-t keressük meg barátjával Dorothy-val a jelentősen megváltozott kis bányászvárosban. Sajnos a misztikum ami az első rész jellemezte s Vectron területek amik nagyon hangulatosak voltak minimális teret kaptak amit egy kicsit sajnálok. 

Összeségében szépen elvarrja a történet szálakat. Jól összerakott hangulatos kis folytatás.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995664342', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1589223717}
review:
Первая игра по скриншотам и видео кажется какой-то слишком примитивной, вторая – слишком перегруженной. На самом деле не верно ни то, ни другое: обе игры прекрасно выверены, ничего лишнего, и всё возможное, чтобы сделать игроку приятно. Одну и ту же базовую механику копания вглубь с постепенным улучшением и копанием «более лучше» они развивают в достаточной мере по-разному, чтобы вторая игра не была просто расширенным ремейком первой, а игралась действительно хоть немного, но по-другому. Поэтому не могу не порекомендовать сразу обе.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2090461118

[b]SteamWorld Dig 2[/b] – это
[list]
    [*]Приятный, практически медитативный геймплей без хардкора
    [*]Симпатичные роботы и незлобный юмор
    [*]В меру неглупые загадки, чтобы решить их со второй попытки и порадоваться
    [*]Красивый и разнообразный мир, который увлекательно исследовать, и обилие улучшалок, чтобы делать это продуктивнее
[/list]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2090461437
В комментариях её называют «метроидванией для тех, кто не любит метроидвании», я бы пошла чуть дальше и считаю её подходящей игрой для тех, кто устал и разочаровался в играх вообще. Ни одна другая игра не давала такого опыта совместного сидения за компом и исследования так, как эта, за годы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124839501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1613961663}
review:
This is the perfect sequel. It takes everything that made the original SteamWorld Dig fun and makes it better. 

The biggest improvement for me was navigation. In the first game there are two set travel points within the mine where you can get back to the main town. Outside of that, you can buy and set a teleport device that allows you to travel back and forth from town. But every time you set down a teleport device, it removed the previous one. All in all, traveling within the mine was cumbersome in the original game. In SteamWorld Dig 2, they really streamlined this process. Throughout the mine you unlock different tubes. From the main town and from any tube, you can instantly travel to any other unlocked tube. It makes exploring easier, faster, and more enjoyable.

The second biggest improvement for me was the sprawling map. This really felt like a true Metroidvania. Where the original game was primarily just traveling deeper and deeper into the mine, this one has you branching off into temples, jungles, and back tracking to previously locked areas.

If you enjoyed SteamWorld Dig, you will definitely love SteamWorld Dig 2. I think it's better to play the original before playing this one, but it isn't necessary. If you only pick up one, this is definitely the better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976733585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1614049908}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057354172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1613240213}
review:
Finished the game, though didn't manage to collect all the collectibles. Steamworld Dig 2 is a semi-open world platformer where you are a mining robot trying to save the world from a mysterious earthquake, while trying to find your buddy bot at the same time. The core gameplay loop involves going into an area, digging your way through the ground, going into "temple rooms" to overcome platforming or puzzle challenges for upgrades and sellable materials, which will then give you more ways to traverse the world, from guns to grappling hooks to jetpacks and the likes. The more abilities you unlock, the easier it is to traverse and explore the world.

PROS
- Incredible sense of exploration
- Short game, but engaging all the way
- Fantastic art style
- Generous fast travel points make backtracking a breeze

CONS
- Too linear to qualify as a metroidvania
- Enemy AI is laughably simple
- Combat is a snooze-fest
- Only 3 bosses, and they're all laughably easy

As a metroidvania, it is extremely lacking. Go play Hollow Knight, Axiom Verge, or Environmental Station Alpha. As a semi-open world, exploration focused platformer? Hell yeah. This is a game that will have you hunting down secrets with an obsession. Personally, I enjoyed this game, and I think you will too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994625854', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1612345695}
review:
[code]
[h1] 游戏由鉴赏家[b]杉果点评小分队[/b]提供[/h1]
给游戏选择困难症的玩家指路
成为我们的一员[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/SonkwoClub]小组首页[/url]
欢迎新朋友[url=https://jq.qq.com/?_wv=1027&k=BYhz2hCB]杉果点评小分队[/url](｡･∀･)ﾉﾞ
[/code]

[h1]前言[/h1]
你喜欢类银河恶魔城的游戏吗，你想学习英语吗？那你应该来试试这款蒸汽世界/滑稽，这是一个想致富，先撸石头的蒸汽时代，你是为了向前矿场老板追债（明明不是/滑稽），去寻找1代男主路上与前邪教圣物蓝火Fen结伴冒险的故事。

[h1]购买扫盲[/h1]
[list]
[*]无中文
[*]挖矿
[*]独立
[*]2D平台游戏
[*]蒸汽朋克
[*]含解密
[/list]

[h1]咳咳，正文[/h1]

[b]画面[/b]
经典的冒险家牛仔，精美的画面，比上一代强不少，人物带一点3d模型感觉。
[b]玩法[/b]
游戏一共有四个场景，挖矿与前作差别不大，有特殊工具，区别在于有蓝图纸收集，可以加强工具，蓝珠子替换成了齿轮。前期还是下坑容易，上坑难。还有许多的小怪，boss，以及迷题矿坑，可以获得升级用的齿轮，以及装备。2的迷题跑酷水平有了较大的提高。（这一作也不是那么强调挖挖挖了，主要还是解密跑酷）

两大属性分为：还是血量，水量（水量这个设定就非常符合蒸汽机器人这一设定，水量是使用技能和特殊道具的必备要素。）

稿子，血量，水量，背包及火箭腰带，容量等等都能通过挖矿换钱和齿轮进行升级。

这一作没有二段跳了，直接火箭腰带，铁头功直接上顶！

战斗，打最后boss还是有点难度，其他的硬刚就完事了

[b]剧情设定[/b]
你要寻找前矿场场主（一代主角），然后投靠了另一个矿区，带着前邪教圣火开始挖矿寻找前矿主，顺便还把地球炸了，芜湖~

[code]
[h1]Pros & Cons[/h1]
[b]Pros[/b]
[olist]
[*]出色的音乐及画面表现
[*]优秀的迷题跑酷
[*]值得一玩（NS有汉化）
[/olist]

[b]Cons[/b]
[olist]
[*]无中文
[*]剧情内容偏简单
[/olist]

[url=https://club.sonkwo.com/posts/421002]完整评测文章内容请点击这里[/url][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198199619427', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1617599264}
review:
典型的西部蒸汽朋克风格，荒漠、仙人掌、牛仔帽、齿轮、蒸汽机、机械人，再加上一些诸如古迹、秘境一类的场景，在漫画画风下做到巧妙的融合。
游戏的主要玩法就是不断挖地采矿，一路向下，挖矿卖钱升级装备，然后接着往更远处探索。因为以前玩Minecraft的时候最喜欢的就是到处挖矿洞，所以我是把这个游戏当成2D版我的世界来玩。
再有就是足够多的冒险闯关元素，当成横板闯关游戏来玩也是合格的，但基本不算有难度，特别是在装备越来越好之后。

author: {'steamid': '76561198126520825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1611444291}
review:
Okay, so, I was in the mood for a nice Metroidvania and saw that this was on sale, so I got it. I do not regret it one bit, and boy, did I get a lot more than I signed up for. This game has some charm to it that's really hard to come across.

You play as a young robot called Doroty, who sets out in an adventure to find her friend Rusty, presumably the protagonist of the first game (which I've yet to play), who disappeared under mysterious circumstances. In your quest, you team up with a strange wisp thing called Fen, who has a penchant for destruction and chaos. Your journey brings you to the jolly robot town of El Machino, which becomes your base of operations, and you constantly revisit it in between perilous adventures into the mines. Much like the world itself, the story is much deeper than it seems at the surface level, with some decent lore and world building. I am probably not taking full advantage of this story by only playing the second game, but it was still a blast regardless.

The game has a lovely 2D art style to it, which conveys a lovely western Steampunk society of robots, mysterious mines and temples, cool looking monsters and traps, and lovable NPCs. Animations and sound effects have a satisfying feel to them, and the world in general feels really lively. Dorothy is just a robot, but she's super adorable. Also, the music that goes with it all is quite good too, with a mix of western-ish ambient music for the desert, mysterious music for caves and temples, and other good stuff like that.

The gameplay is a mix of the tried and true Metroidvania platformer with those mining games from back in the Windows 95 era, with breakable blocks, falling rocks, and all that. The mix works well, with the main loop of the game consisting of going down into the mines to explore and dig for ores, and going back up to the city to cash out your findings and get some upgrades. You have to avoid traps, fight enemies, and sometimes do some platforming and puzzle solving for secrets and collectibles. It all works well with the steampunk miner theme, and is quite fun too. 

The movement starts out rather simple, with a jump, a wall jump and a running jump, but then you unlock the freak grappling hook, and that's when things start getting really cool. The grappling hook accelerates you when you use it, and if you release it in mid air, you get to enjoy the momentum you gained, allowing you to not only reach higher areas, but also move really fast, quickly pull yourself away from danger, and sometimes push enemies into the lava. I often caught myself playing with the grappling hook in town due to how fluid it was.

The central activity the game wants you to engage in is exploration, which it incentivizes beautifully, with a rich world full of secrets and optional content, as well as several handy mechanics and interfaces. The map screen lets you know precisely which tiles you have been near, marks optional caves you ran into, adds a checkmark to caves you're done exploring, and shows you exactly where the next point of the critical path is, so you can avoid accidentally triggering it while exploring. There are also some handy upgrades you can get that allow you to see unmined ores in the map, breakable blocks disguised as regular wall blocks, and lots of other stuff.

Other than upgrades and ores, you can also find "artifacts" hidden deep underground, which are a variety of objects with an accompanying flavor text. Most of those are just cute and funny, with some meme references thrown in, but some actually reveal details about the game's lore. This kind of storytelling is very dear to my heart, and it was quite a surprise to find it here of all places.

There's one thing in this game that kind of disappointed me, though, and that is the amount of bosses. The tutorial mission ends with a pretty decent little boss, which led me to expect more boss battles like that would eventually take place... but they didn't. There is like one or two bosses, and then the final boss, and that's it. The final boss is awesome, by the way, but that doesn't change the fact that this game is rather anemic in boss fights. I wish there were some more, and maybe some optional ones as well. Alas, designing compelling boss fights is a hard task, and I understand that most of the effort went into the other stuff I cited, so that's forgivable.

Also, I think I somehow broke the game by exploring too much. Not sure if this is really what happened, but I managed to trigger the final boss and ending before even reaching the bottom of the mine. All I had to do was get to certain... locations and do certain... things, and Dorothy and Fen somehow reach the conclusion that a certain... someone was behind it all along. It felt really out of the blue at first, until I replayed the game and reached the area on the bottom of the mine that I was supposed to have reached. I'm not sure if this is a bug or a feature, but it was certainly weird.

I have nothing else to talk about, and this is already long enough as it is, so suffice to say the game is pretty fun, very charming, and quite fascinating. I'm a cheapskate bastard, so I waited for a sale, but this is well worth full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057218732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1610138219}
review:
[h1] Ottimo sequel di una serie con moolti margini di miglioramento [/h1] 

[i] SteamWorld Dig 2 [/i] rappresenta un marcato passo in avanti rispetto al primo capitolo, ma si porta dietro ancora troppi problemi legati alla sua struttura. Il gameplay alla metroidvania è rimasto fondamentalmente invariato nella sua struttura di base, ovvero scava/raccogli minerali/torna in città e potenziati/ricomincia a scavare più a fondo, ma l'aggiunta di alcuni strumenti particolari e dei potenziamenti attraverso i collezionabili che troverete nella mappa hanno reso il gioco nettamente più interessante; un altro sensibile miglioramento lo si può riscontrare nelle fasi di platforming, più impegnative e gratificanti rispetto il primo [i] SteamWorld Dig [/i], anche se circoscritte solamente in determinate aree o in alcune caverne per raccogliere gli ingranaggi o i collezionabili. 
Il vero problema di questo [i] SteamWorld Dig 2 [/i] però è probabilmente uno: la quantità. 
E' indubbiamente un metroidvania qualitativamente ottimo, ma soffre di una mole contenutistica troppo troppo scarna per poterlo anche solo paragonare ai pesi massimi del genere: dura poco più di cinque ore, l'area di gioco non è particolarmente estesa e ben studiata, c'è una scarsissima varietà di nemici e sopratutto di boss fight e non è particolarmente impegnativo (eccetto qualche sezione di platforming, ma anche in quel caso non parliamo di una vera e propria difficoltà). Non mi sento di sconsigliarvelo, perchè alla fine dei conti  resta un titolo molto piacevole e rilassante, ma per un ipotetico terzo capitolo mi aspetto il vero salto di qualità, il salto che lo porterebbe per lo meno ad avvicinarsi ai grandi metroidvania usciti negli ultimi anni.

review: Short and sweet. A well polished and unique metroidvania. Combat is there, but takes a back seat for exploration, and digging... The latter which provides you money and resources. Very good ability unlocks, upgrades, and secrets. Kept me playing for a good solid 9hrs of gameplay with only 50% of the map discovered. Also contains some decent little puzzles inside rooms as well as a couple boss fights that are dealt with more via your abilities than direct combat. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104392527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1608790547}
review:
[u]2020 Speedy Review Cleanup[/u]

I loved the original [i]SteamWorld Dig[/i], and I had fun in this one too. It's simple action and platforming that doesn't outstay its welcome. You keep unlocking gadgets along the way, the areas change, and you feel like you're progressing.

One thing I believe is that the characters in the first game were better, though. I preferred the silent Rusty and his interactions with Dot and the handful of bots in the smaller country town. There's a lot more characters in this game, but I felt less connected to them, though I think Dot and Fen work well.

There's not a lot more I can say that wasn't already said in my review of the original game. This game is more of that with newer enemies, larger action pieces, and more interesting collectibles/secrets.

If you have fun with action platformers, I'd suggest this one. There might be a slow start when you build up your equipment, but after some upgrades, you'll be flying through.

review: Not as shown. It is presented as an action (a lot of digging) exploration based game, but when I played it it was mainly a platformer  and the action (digging) was very slow and limited. Mostly you have to find your way out of areas and time your jumps perfectly, not explore and dig to find interesting stuff.  I played less then 30 minutes and requested a refund, which i never do, but apperently I was denied a refund so now I am stuck with this game, luckiily i got it on a good sale and did not throw away to much money, but thought I would warn others of this game and steams return policy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978572814', 'num_games_owned': 1384, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1609269247}
review: While short on story or much character development, SteamWorld Dig 2 manages to get by on its charm alone. The cartoony animation style, the deceptively simple mechanics that hide a good deal of depth and synergy, and that ever so present desire to hunt for loot all works together for a game that will suck you right in. The only major complaint I have is the final boss fight of the game in that nothing leading up to it helps you build out the skills to take that one, so it came as a bit of a struggle point for me and left me with a sour taste in my mouth. That said, I have no regrets about my time spent in the game and look forward to future titles in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252467940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1963, 'last_played': 1608610517}
review:
Man, what a game. I'll start this review by trying to quantify what I loved about this game so much, and why I consider it to be a real hidden gem.

For starters, the art style is charming. However, despite that charm there's a weight to the illustrations that give them a real sense of permanence. Having everything feel grounded yet vibrant and different is a tall order. These guys did that in spades, and all of the animations for this game are rock solid as well. Combine that with the variety of different environments, and this is a real treat for the eyes.

From a gameplay perspective, it's also rrefreshingly fun. It's a spelunky kind of game, but lacking the brutal difficulty. If anything, I'd highly recommend playing this game before Spelunky since this game will get you thinking in the same mindset. The wealth gathering, upgrades, and the characters are contained as well, so to speak. There is no wasted time or effort on something that's irrelevant. You don't have to skip cutscenes and the like for that reason.

The upgrades, in particular, shine because the creators let you have all the goodies. If you think something is broken, that's because it is, and the game is made so much more fun for it. Just as well, you have the advantage of secret finding and the like. There's just so much to love there, and I'm a hater of puzzle games. Somehow, the puzzles and treasure hunt designs here worked for me. Because of that, I was really able to be a completionist here when I normally wouldn't be.

This all culminates into a game that has been relentlessly polished until it is glistening like the many ores you'll find under the earth. My only complaint is a lack of choice regarding the narrative, but otherwise, this game is an absolute joy to play in every way.

Please play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268483508', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1607281713}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 é uma sequência que pega tudo de bom e expande com maestria uma fórmula que já era muito boa no anterior! A premissa do jogo ainda é a mesma, cavar, pegar minérios e vendê-los para conseguir dinheiro. Porém agora a exploração é muito mais complexa, com várias habilidades que são adquiridas durante o jogo que permitem alcançar lugares antes impossíveis. Para tornar tudo ainda mais interessante o jogo também adiciona colecionáveis espalhados pelo mundo, 

O que mais gostei nesse foram as mini salas que estão espalhadas pelo mapa, cada uma exigindo uma mecânica específica para passar e sempre com algum lugar secreto para encontrar! O único ponto negativo vai para a ausência de chefes, apenas 3 durante todo o jogo. Porém apesar de poucas, são ótimas lutas!

A trilha é muito boa! A arte também, melhorou muito comparado ao primeiro jogo! 

RECOMENDADO!!!

Nota 9,0/10

review:
Rien de bien nouveau par rapport au premier opus : si vous avez aimé SWD1, vous aimerez le 2 de la même manière

Le jeu n'est pas mauvais, mais l'histoire est peu intéressante et relativement courte (12-13h ?)... C'est bien dommage, d'autant plus qu'il n'est pas possible de continuer sa progression pour récupérer les derniers secrets une fois l'histoire terminée !

author: {'steamid': '76561198058231910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1606519516}
review:
It's alright, but very short for the price. The story is just serviceable. It does the job but it's not particularly remarkable. (it kind of fell flat on its face during the ending imo)

The art is fine and the music is great, probably the best part of the game. The 'puzzles' were insultingly easy and it wasn't challenging at any point except for the final boss, which is only difficult because of frustratingly bad combat mechanics. 

There are a ton of secrets in the map and upgrades to unlock, although after a certain point there's really no incentive to get any of them. I found that by the end of the game I had a fully upgraded bag (before maxing out any weapon upgrades) but there was no point because there was no longer any ore left to mine. 

The game is really short (5h if you aren't dicking around and don't plan on hunting down all the secrets) and the ending was kind of unsatisfying and left a bad taste in my mouth. Overall it was enjoyable though. Buy it on a sale for 50% or more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009755091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1606264461}
review:
It's like playing Ori and the Will of the Wisps, except on a much lower budget. Not as much eye candy and the music gets repetitive, but other than that I have nothing bad to say about this game. The puzzles are just difficult enough (and many of them are brilliant). The upgrade system forces you to strongly consider different pluses and minuses and try different combinations. The enemies are simple but interesting enough that it takes a while to get good at killing them. And the story is about as engaging as it could be without making the world bigger than they did. 

This game was way more fun to play than the videos I watched led me to believe. I was really bummed when I reached the end of it because I honestly wanted to continue tinkering with it!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198827201641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1605764275}
review:
This game is decent, it's basically a steampunk setting where you dig for ores and improve your character to progress. That's about the extent of the depth, the story was interesting. The final boss was a bit of a twist, overall it was enjoyable for just under 20 hours of game play. You could definitely finish it sooner, but I tend to drag out games to squeeze them for all the play value.

Not sure I could recommend the $20 price tag on it, $15 maybe but $10 would be ideal for the depth the game offers.

review:
우리가 한번은 해봤을법한 땅파는 어드벤처게임 

위대하진 로봇니뮤가 되어 서부 분위기의 액션 어드벤처로 땅파서 방사능 오염된 사람 죽이며 보석캐고 돈벌고 업글하고 장비얻고.. 
스토리에 구멍과 맥거핀이 상당히 많은편인데 큰 라인을 제외하면 거진 다음에 설명도 안할 쓰레기들만 나오니 신경쓰지 말자
별로 다른건 없지만 그래도 이런겜 가볍게 하기는 좋다

review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is a very good game, while not being the longest there is, it definitly makes up for it's length in it's charm, from the music, to the animation and art.
Never ran into any issues with it that weren't because of the machine i was using. That doesn't mean the game is badly optimized, it is very well optomised, playable in all it's glory on any machine.
Overall, highly recommend if you enjoy metroidvanias and/or the old style flash mining games.
Great job, Image & Form games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034035579', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1659268522}
review:
Очень понравилась! 
Эдакая террария, только без боссов и стройки)
Все сводится к тому, что ты копаешь, лутаешь денежку, апгрейдишься. Модификаций, к слову, дофигища. Их можно менять или врубать все разом. Некоторые плюшки открываются только в секретных местах - приходится расчехлять думалку и ползать по скрытым местам. Но это все не обязательно!
Короткая, правда. С учетом, что я часа 3 в афк остался в игре, то прошел я ее часов за 6-8. 
[spoiler] вот бы продолжение с новыми механиками и целой новой планетой :3 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197997553202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 1543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1604261040}
review:
Might be the most disappointing gaming experience of my life.

I got 70% of the way into a 100% speedrun, but my run appears to have glitched and is stuck at 96% secrets Yarrow. I backed up a copy of the save (since this is on a time limit) and then I spent the last four hours re-doing Yarrow 5 or 6 times over. This is more time than I had actually spent on the entire speedrun so far!

Needless to say, I did not miss anything. In fact, at this point, I have mined every single ore node in the entire region, both inside & outside caves. I have all caves with green check marks, the 3 cogs outside caves, all artifacts from this region in my artifact log, I found the Yonker brother (I'm following a video guide for all of this, and doing exactly what he does).

But alas, it looks like I'm just going to have to abandon this game unfinished, because I am not doing this shit all over again. This is the first time I can ever remember running into a game-ending bug, and this is colossally frustrating / disappointing.


UPDATE 10/31: After two days spent scouring forum posts for the solution, I finally found a post on another forum that appears to confirm the glitch. What he describes here is exactly what happened to my game; I definitely remember this:

(The only way u can be at a glitched 100% is if you broke a treasure block in a cave, but did not collect the reasure for whatever reason. However, this only applies to CERTAIN caves

But of it happened to u, theb a cave would have become ticked as soon as you entered it again, do u recall this happening?)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967459353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1603813363}
review: Great game. The basic gameplay loop is digging for minerals, which you then spend on upgrades that help you dig deeper and hold more resources. Additionally, the map is peppered with small dungeons that either give you talent points or metroidvania-style upgrades like a hookshot or jumpjets when you finish them. This game is absolutely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084497637', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1603613003}

review:
Thoroughly charming metroidvania.

Pros:
- Sharp, colorful, detailed graphics
- Fun cast of supporting characters
- Addictive mining/upgrade loop
- Nice mix of gameplay between exploration, combat, platforming, and puzzling

Cons:
- A little short, took about 9 hours to complete

author: {'steamid': '76561198029830385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1602757580}
review:
小遊戲，比1代進步許多，

author: {'steamid': '76561198253492927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1599841338}
review: SteamWorld Dig 2 est un petit jeu de type metroidvania dans lequel on incarne Dorothy, une steambot qui s'est mise à la recherche de Rusty, héros du premier SteamWorld Dig et qui a disparu après les événements de ce dernier. Armé d’une pioche, on part à la recherche de divers minerais (non renouvelables) afin d’acheter ou améliorer ses équipements pour pouvoir creuser encore plus profondément. De temps à autre, on découvre des salles secrètes contenant des minerais précieux et/ou de nouvelles capacités pour Dorothy. Le scénario, classique mais plaisant à suivre, se conclut sur un boss final plutôt intéressant. Pour le reste, c’est satisfaisant : la jouabilité (à la manette) est bonne, les graphismes sont beaux, l’ambiance est agréable et la bande son est correcte. Par rapport au premier SteamWorld Dig, on peut noter plus de possibilités ainsi qu’un monde plus grand, ce qui augmente la durée de vie mais ce qui permet également à la répétitivité de s’installer. Enfin, concernant la durée de vie, il m’a fallu une quinzaine d’heures pour terminer l’histoire en explorant tout, et il faut compter quelques heures supplémentaires pour obtenir tous les succès.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166741960', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1577233562}
review:
If you played the first one and liked it, this one is even better. If you haven't play the first one, play both.

Compared to the first game, this one is quite a bit more complex (more and more difficult puzzles/platforming challenges, more gadgets to make use of), and overall a step up in all directions (that is not to say the first game wasn't already great as well).

It also connects to the story of the first game [spoiler](this game's protagonist is a relative of the first game's protagonist and she's searching for him after the events of the first game)[/spoiler], so having played that one will bring you up to speed a bit quicker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053452667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1601229765}
review:
7/10 : j'aurais mis un 8 ou 9 sur 10 si le jeu n'avait pas de probleme au niveau des hauts faits
Un bug m'empeche d'avoir un 100%, c'est assez ch.. de devoir se retaper 20h de jeu pour refaire tous les secrets parceque le % est bug (concrètement, si une gemme dans une cave ne peut pas être prise - manque de place etc - elle est détruite et ca bousille définitivement la complétion)

Le trial (optionnel) est outrageusement trop dur également, avec une partie plateforme qui doit se faire au milimetre et qui n'est pas du tout normal

A coté de ca, le jeu est dans la lignée du 1 et sympatique, si on se fiche des hauts faits je le recommande

review: What I love about this game is it's another great 2D platformer, but built on a mining sim engine. It removed the one thing about mining sims that doesn't work - they get repetitive. Steamworld constantly offers new abilities and unlocks new secrets within the areas you've already been. Upgrades are fully customisable and are achievable without feeling at all grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152843177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1600906356}
review: This is a noteworthy sequel to Steamworld Dig, and a great entry set before Steamworld: Heist. Honestly another wonderful game, this time the wonderful Dorothy aka Dot is out to find Rusty who has gone missing since the first game. The gameplay is once again top notch, the story is enticing and pulls you in, and the cast of characters are wonderfully written. 10/10.

review:
Recommended with some caveats. 

All the technical ingredients are here; the game looks and sounds great and the Steamworld IP has its own unique flavor. However I found the game to be a bit boring and I don't have a good bead on which elements were causing that feeling. 

Overall, I still think most players will like it. Also SWD2 for most is a one and done title; IMO only a extremely small % will play through it multiple times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076560734', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1599691527}
review:
Great game. I would recommend turning off the map waypoints though, as it adds a lot to the experience. 

SDG2 features a world with a lot of depth (literally), with rewarding exploration, combat, and some surprisingly well-designed puzzles. It's addicting, it may seem like the kind of game you can just play for a couple of minutes before doing other more important things, but trust me, you'll be hooked for at least a few of hours at a time.

I could say more, but honestly, just buy it; you won't regret it.
Overall: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031387862', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1599701954}
review: The sequel is a nice evolution of the first game in the series. Movement is much more unrestricted, but it does not hinder the difficulty. Biomes are three again; only this time, there is a lot of emphasis on exploration. And it is so fun to explore and try to find secrets. It's what kept me going, and finish the game in an almost single gaming session. The game took me about ten hours at 90% secrets and full exploration. Not short, not long. Perfect game time for an indie game of this type.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023495548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1599424745}
review:
I have about 19 hours recorded play time in this only due to leaving it running while I was doing some work in my garage a few times.  Most of the game was alright, but the end boss was irritating and no fun and felt very out of place and excessive for an otherwise casual game based on puzzles/exploration/digging/item collection.   To the point that I just didn't care to bother with even a second attempt, and once you have collected everything, there is really no replay value at all.  Realistically I got about 8ish hours of gameplay time, which was enjoyable, but just not enough for the cost of the game, and that was on sale.   

If you see it on sale for under $10, then sure it is maybe worth it, but if I don't get at least an hour of joy per dollar spent, the game is a thumbs down from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992960689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1599339320}
review:
This is a pretty solid improvement over the last game in just about every way, and the original wasn't a bad game at all.

This sequel turns up the Metroidlike elements a bit more, which is a great in my book.

Controls are only a little bit loosey-goosey, but it doesn't detract from the experience. The powerups are doled out with a slow but steady pace that still leaves enough room to backtrack for previously-inaccessible secrets. And there are plenty of those. The game rewards discovery, and features a fair number of puzzle or challenge rooms that hit just the right note for difficulty versus reward.

I'm not done with the game yet, but so far nothing has been crushingly difficult, which I wholeheartedly approve of. I'm very done with everything having "souls-like" levels of difficulty.

Overall, this is a great, fun game of exploration and just-right action. Perfect for casual, or younger gamers, and anyone that doesn't want to waste all their precious game-time dying a thousand deaths.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304766352', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1599531420}

author: {'steamid': '76561198314888029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1626773359}
review:
난이도는 쉬움 
4~5시간정도면 메인 스토리 진행가능
주어진 길로 다니는 것이 아닌 자신이 직접 길을 만든다는 점이 타 게임들과 가장 차별화된 부분이다.
1편에 비해 수집요소도 늘고 조작도 편리해지고 보스 난이도도 하락했다
스킬을 배워나가면 점점 맵을 빨리 오갈 수 있기 때문에 길찾기에 시간보내는 일이 많이 없다
세이브 포인트 사이 거리도 굉장히 가깝고 마을로 순간이동 가능한 스킬도 있음

편한 난이도 적당한 볼륨
매트로베니아 초심자에게 추천할만한 작품
마지막 보스가 할로우나이트 대부분의 보스보다 쉬우므로 고수들은 코파면서 뚜드려 팰 수 있다

review:
Bueno,
SteamWorld Dig 2 es un juego recomendable, tiene un soundtrack bueno, no es increible pero esta bien,tiene unas pistas bastante buenas,Graficamente el juego se ve bien.
En general esta secuela supera en todo a la primera entrega. el juego dura entre 6-7 horas, lo cual esta bien pero se puede sentir un poco corto y quizas no sientas que valga la pena por su precio, el cual esta algo elevado (quizas solo soy tacaño) otros juegos menos costosos ofrecen mas horas de juego.

En general bueno juego, 7,3/10

Recomendable comprarlo en oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424881974', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1598940850}
review:
非常好玩的一款独立游戏！无中文也没有大碍，亲测四级左右水平即够用。
作为新买的ns pro祭手柄之作，本作的游戏素质是相当的可圈可点，是一款出色的类银河战士恶魔城游戏。前作是在switch上玩的，蒸汽世界挖掘2延续1代的剧情，化身Dorothy寻找失踪的Rusty，在游戏机制以及剧情刻画上有了显著的提高（当然没有玩过1代直接玩2也无妨，不过还是建议玩一玩1），内容上与1代相比也是加了多一倍的量。
喜欢密特罗德（银河战士）、空洞骑士等类型的朋友，一定也会爱上介款游戏！挖就完事了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198895787087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1598814134}
review: Very fun game! Pretty standard Metroidvania format. You find cool upgrades as you explore the mines and unlock new areas via the abilities they grant.  You get to use the best upgrades for a good chunk of the game as opposed to the last few minutes like in other games. My only gripes are that the ending could have been a little more substantial, there could have been a greater variety of enemies, there could have been more boss battles, and I didn't like how you couldn't do jump attacks with your pickaxe.  Small quibbles considering how fun the game is overall. I finished the game in about 14 hours, which feels about the right length for a game like this.  I enjoyed the music, graphics, and pretty much all the other functional aspects of the game.  I did not encounter any glitches or bugs.  Nothing ground breaking about this game, but what it does, it does very well. I would highly recommend buying on sale, but it's not a bad value at full price either.  8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198281137410', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1599925070}

author: {'steamid': '76561198149006845', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1585384724}
review: It's a fantastic metroidvania, played it on the 3ds orginally and it's even better on a big screen, it doesn't do anything terribly original with the "metroidvania style", but it expands on the original Dig's formula of gathering materials to sale and improve the abilties you want, giving it an adictive edge without dropping into full RPG mechanics. also hookshoots and jetpacks are ALWAYS welcome abilties.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087730263', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1575, 'last_played': 1598352477}
review:
This is a good game but not quite a great game.

These steamworld games have some of the most difficult acheivments and other that acheivment hunting there is nothing left to do making this game a one and done game with little replayability.

The platforming is the most frustrating part of this game with very floaty controls and weird hit box detection that makes fine controlling almost impossible and mostly luck to make jumps or ledges. This is one of my least favourite platformer games and hurts the gameplay and the likelyhood of me every replaying it.

Another gripe is there are heaps of better mining games allowing for the best thing in those types of games; exploration! This games fixed map makes it very linear and far less exciting as you are very confined and with all the transportation tubes and upgrades you don't need any stepping in order to get back but neither can you make "speed tunnels" pure vertical paths because there are undestroyable blocks scattered every where.

Being unable to swing your axe in the air makes no sense and makes fighting enemies a real pain, the enemy types are interesting but could be better. 

There is plently to like about the game too, it's a lot of fun and I would still recommend it but be aware it has no replay value and I would only recommend it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980259241', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1597538782}
review:
If you liked the first one, you'll love this one.

There are some rough / frustrating patches, like in the first one, but they are far fewer. Also they give you the awesome upgrades that the other game waited way too long to give you much sooner, and boy oh boy do you get to enjoy them.

If you like RPGs, platforming and relatively lite-metroidvania experiences, you'll enjoy SteamWorld Dig 2. 

Also, the folks who make the SteamWorld games generally do a great job on all their projects, in my experience. If you see others in the series and like the genre they are catering to (each installment mixes it up in terms of gameplay) then give them a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081477001', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1559411444}
review:
I don't dig this dig.

Nobody can ever persuade me that its success wan't due to its core gameplay loop being reminiscent of the one of [i]That Block Game That People Still Keep Playing[/i]. Because though it's a decent Metroidvania overall, it feels a lot more tedious than its peers. There's not much to explore, the underground where you'll spend most of your time doesn't look particularly beautiful, and the story... Well, there's nothing to say on that front, really. Plus, [i]SteamWorld Dig 2[/i] is very short for its genre. Took me five and a half hours to get to the final boss. Didn't beat it, because I was underequipped, and didn't care to grind more for it, but if I did, it wouldn't take more than two more hours until I was prepared. Which would make it seven and a half hours long.

A solid game, sure, but doesn't deserve all the critical praise it got on release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034104295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1596970894}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058404353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1596570528}
review:
A masterful Metroidvania

Mining is really fun and puzzle like, reminds me of Dig Dug or Mr. Driller, there is a bunch of things to find and the map is fun to explore. Its ok lenght wise, cca 15 hours average if you want all/most of the secrets. The caves, ie puzzle dungeons are really fun but searching for secrets on the main map is really tedious imo. The platforming can be finger breaking if you dont wait till the end game to unlock the jackpack or long range hookshot, its really fun actually to try to get that one tight jump; the game on itself doesnt require pin point jumps, movement etc.
 
Overall a really fun, good looking and good sounding game. A must play experience 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197978564275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1596036317}
review:
A very enjoyable game. Just a simple, relaxing platformer providing a moderate challenge at first, and later on very little challenge, in my experience.

It's like if something is too hard or straight up impossible, you can just return to the content later when you have more upgrades.

Gotta admit, the game becomes a total breeze near the very end when [spoiler] you get the jetpack upgrade [/spoiler].

But it's a lot of fun. It's not a game you should go into with high expectations of nail-biting difficulty, as is all too common in most platformers of our age, in my opinion. Sometimes I just want a casual game to chill with.

I fully recommend it.

I also played the original Steamworld Dig, which felt very akin to this one. Nothing but improvements over the original, both in the sheer amount of content and possibilities available to you, and without losing the style or feeling. The developers get my full applause for that. Sticking to simple gameplay that just works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050199422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 3514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2755, 'last_played': 1612382719}

review:
Обалденный платформер. Прошёл с большим удовольствием. Игра очень сильно затягивает. Игровые механики работают на должном уровне. Управление очень отзывчивое. Арт немного специфичный, но я его полюбил в процессе игры. Музыка клёвая. Юмора много и он хороший. Боссов хотелось бы побольше.

Отличная игра, которая оставила только положительные эмоции.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268665776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1594891375}
review:
Un excelente titulo metroidvania, si jugaste el primer juego, este juego te va a encantar, ya que es muy superior a su predecesor, mejorando totalmente su gameplay para que sea mucho mas rápido.

La historia que aunque si tiene cierta conexión con el primer titulo, básicamente aquí, tendrás que buscar al protagonista del primer juego, ya que misteriosamente a desaparecido, así será nuestra misión el buscarlo en una mapa bajo tierra bastante extenso y ya de paso ir consiguiendo minerales para intercambiarlos por dinero en el pueblo mejorando nuestro equipo.

Un titulo bastante bueno y muy entretenido, ademas dura bastante (mas si vas por todos los secretos). Si te gustan los juegos de este estilo o si  en su caso jugaste el primero y te gusto, compralo, no lo dudes, 100% recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117246967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1596900202}
review:
Увидев скриншоты SteamWorld Dig 2 в Стиме, непосвященный игрок посчитает эту игру двухмерным Майнкрафтом и будет совершенно неправ. Безусловно, основная часть геймплея – это копание, но с таким же успехом Майнкрафтом можно объявить и Deep Rock Galactic.

SteamWorld Dig 2 в гораздо большей степени метроидвания в стилистике стимпанка и Дикого Запада, с кучей постепенно открывающихся геймплейных механик и завязанных на них задач, постоянной добычей ценных минералов и их последующей продажей дабы апгрейдить собственную снарягу и абилки, а также периодическим хардкором в испытаниях чтобы добыть драгоценные шестеренки. И здесь это просто дико увлекательный процесс.

Внешне все достаточно простенько, но здесь тащит в первую очередь отличный дизайн, прекрасная анимация, большие разнообразные локации, атмосферный саундтрек и фирменный юмор.

Игра небольшая по продолжительности, что можно было бы записать в недостатки, но это не так, поскольку за все время, проведенное в игре, вам ни разу не будет скучно – слава яйцам разработчики не пошли по простому пути и не стали искусственно растягивать геймплей, чем сейчас грешат многие создатели инди.

Игра во всех моментах превосходит предыдущую часть плюс играть в первую часть не требуется даже в сюжетном аспекте, но тем не менее я очень рекомендую начать свое знакомство с серией именно с первой части поскольку так вы продлите свое удовольствие от этой замечательной игры. Проходится она на одном дыхании, как и вторая часть. Персональные кармические рекомендации.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041847294', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1594736182}
review:
[h1]And they call it a Mine![/h1]
SteamWorld Dig 2 is the sequel to SteamWorld Dig but follows the journey of a different character who is now looking for the main character from the previous game. 

The game for the most part plays exactly the same as the previous which is a Motherload style, resource gathering game where you dig into a mine, extract its resources and sell them for upgrades to help you get to the bottom. 

The main differences from the previous title are mostly ease of life changes like water no longer draining and combining all the different mines are areas you travel throughout the campaign into one area with all checkpoint zones accessible via the top instead of only one at any moment. 

As for upgrades there are a bunch and purchasing items no longer just gives a standard increase but unlocks specific applies that you need to prioritize as they can only be enabled with upgrade cogs that you must also find. 

There’s lots of new mini dungeons and much harder puzzles, lots of going back to areas with new upgrades to complete areas or collect artifacts, a challenging end game boss all topped off with better graphics makes for an enjoyable experience for anyone who likes these type of resource mining type games such as Motherload or Terraria. 

[h1]9/10[/h1]
[i]- dig, mine, dig, mine, run out of things to mine and mine anyway[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198014445897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1594458667}
review:
9/10

An amazing metroidvania mining game, following the events from the first game.

Like the original game, you explore a large map while mining for resources and fighting enemies, but the game also builds on this premise as well. There is now a leveling system, with your character gaining levels as enemies are defeated. This mostly affects prices of minerals sold, but also unlocks certain upgrades as well. And on that note, there are a ton more upgrades to obtain - acquiring new abilities also allows most of them to be upgraded with money and then upgrade cogs can be used to further upgrade these abilities, making it so there is an enormous difference between your character at the beginning and at the end.

As mentioned, the game follows the story from the original game, this time playing as Dorothy (who was a NPC in the first game) as she goes searching for Rusty when he goes missing after the events from the first game. While the story isn't necessarely anything mindblowing, it works well for its purpose and has some interesting moments throughout.

There is a ton of exploration to be done - many secrets can be found and acquiring new abilities allows some previous areas to be accessed.

The only downside to the game, much like the first one as well, is that since the game's map isn't procedurally generated, mined resources won't return - so if an area is cleared of resources, that area cannot be later farmed for extra cash. There are options for farming the enemies, however, and the use of certain upgrades makes it considerably easier to acquire cash, so it's not as much of a problem in this game.

I think the game could benefit by having an optional, non-story mode where the map is procedurally generated, which would give the game more replayability.

Still, however, this is a fantastic game and an easy recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169750906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 3615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1998, 'last_played': 1659415451}
review:
[h1]Like SteamWorld Dig, But Better[/h1]
It's longer, bigger, has more to do, more to buy, more to find. It's pretty much exactly what I was left wanting after playing the first game. 

Though, even though it's longer than the first game, it's still not "long." I finished my first playthrough in about six hours. 

My second playthrough, now that I knew where everything was, I did everything optimally, maxed out my upgrades, found every collectible and even completed the postgame trials. (Which I only recommend if you've done everything else and loved your experience up to that point. They will challenge you, and the reward for completing them isn't worth any genuine level of frustration.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021582780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1594214207}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is an excellent example of how to do a sequel right, it builds upon the foundation delivered by the first game and improves every aspect of it. As with the previous game, the core gameplay loop revolves around mining and during the course of the game you unlock equipment that allows you to mine better, traverse various obstacles and in general add various little things to make your life easier but unlike the previous game, SteamWorld Dig 2 is a fully fledged metroidvania with handcrafted world full of secrets to discover and optional upgrades to unlock.

My playthrough of the game took me roughly 6 hours and I still have plenty of exploration to do, that being said, this is an easy recommendation - it is a really fun metroidvania that offers different style of gameplay that you'd normally see in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009360897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1594055188}
review:
Kurzweiliges Spiel mit anfangs gewöhnungsbedürftiger Steuerung, falls man es mit Tastatur statt Gamepad spielen möchte, später gewöhnt man sich daran und schaltet neue Möglichkeiten frei, die die Bewegung wesentlich angenehmer machen. Die Erforschung der Mine/Höhlen macht Bock auf mehr.

Geeignet auch für kurze Sitzungen durch recht häufiges automatisches Speichern.

Leider ist die Kampagne des Spiels recht kurz geraten, das Verkaufen von den gesammelten Edelsteinen mag anfangs noch als gute Erfahrung empfunden werden, im Spielverlauf jedoch wirken die Zeit zum Verkaufen und die Sprüche des Ankäufers überaus zeitraubend, auch wenn es nur Sekunden dauert.

Die Rätsel sind vom Schwierigkeitsgrad stark schwankend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006498578', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1593958157}
review:
J'avais beaucoup apprécié le premier ainsi que SteamWorld Heist. J'ai attendu un peu avant de lancer le second pour éviter l'overdose et puis j'ai craqué avec les soldes Steam.
Bon, visiblement j'avais bien fait d'attendre un peu puisque c'est clairement du [I]more of the same[/I]. Globalement peu de choses qui changent par rapport (à mon souvenir du) premier et même si j'ai globalement apprécié la balade (je me le suis enfilé en 7 heures et quelques sessions de jeu), j'ai trouvé ça globalement moins bon. De ce que je me rappelle du premier, il fallait réfléchir un peu à la façon dont on creusait pour éviter de se retrouver piégé à ne plus pouvoir accéder à certaines ressources ; là, on peut faire des trous un peu partout sans trop se poser de questions.
Mais le gros défaut du jeu par rapport à son prédécesseur, je trouve, c'est qu'ils ont décidé de faire un monde un peu plus ouvert et que la progression voulue par les dév ne m'a pas parue très claire (je me suis retrouvé à revenir après cinq heures de jeu dans une zone qui était clairement prévue pour être explorée plus tôt) et à ne pas toujours savoir très clairement où je devais aller. Bon, ce n'est pas l'enfer non plus et j'ai vite retrouvé mon chemin, mais je crois que j'aurais pour le coup préféré un jeu plus linéaire.

Ca reste tout de même un jeu très agréable, juste un peu moins bon que SteamWorld Dig 1 à mon avis.
