author: {'steamid': '76561198143315498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1593981920}
review:
Nice finishing touches on the experience side of things. Polished well with small animation and sound effects. It feels good to play it. 

What I found especially remarkable is how much thought you have to put into the way you navigate and solve various things in the game. I thought this game would focus mainly on resource gathering. But this game has a puzzle feel to it. 

The way you navigate feels like solving puzzles. And they are well made puzzles and each time unique. You have to use the skills and abilities you learn throughout the game to solve more difficult forms of navigation/puzzles. 

And you can also upgrade your character with new skills which I find enjoyable. Overall a very well polished game on all aspects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198931044200', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1593470343}
review:
UNA SECUELA FIEL Y REVOLUCIONARIA

 SteamWorld Dig 2 es la secuela del título que lleva el mismo nombre, excepto claro, por su numeración.
Por lo general, las secuelas suelen fallar en algún punto, o perder la escencia de su primera entrega.
 Pero este NO es el caso, sino que ha pulido todo lo que hizo genial al segundo juego, y le ha implementado nuevas mecánicas y jugabilidad, que enriquecen el mundo y la saga de forma sustanciosa.
 Gráficamente hay una gran mejora en el apartado de la iluminación, ahora muchos más bella y creíble. Su diseño de personajes es de lo más destacado, con unos dibujos animados que son tremendamente carismáticos y alegres. Sus animaciones hacen notar que se les ha puesto una gran dedicación.
 Sus calidad auditiva también ha mejorado, con unos mejores efectos sonoros y una inolvidable banda sonora.
 En lo que consta a la duración, ha llegado a durar algunas horas más su campaña, pero lo que lo enriquece son sus coleccionables: todos ellos curiosos y divertidos, con referencias a juegos, series y música, como en el caso de Half Life, Juego de Tronos, e incluso Despacito, el famoso tema de Luis Fonsi.
 Su jugabilidad ha sido mejoradísima, con unos cambios en mecánicas que hacen al juego más largo y más adictivo, superando ampliamente a la primera entrega.
 Su historia, al igual que su primera parte, es algo relevante; pero lo que más destaca de esta es su final, que tornó todo el sentido y que da oportunidad de una 3ra entrega.
 Para todo gamer que haya tenido la suerte de disfrutar SteamWorld Dig, le aviso que encontrará la en su secuela la escencia del primero y una mejoría en todos sus apartados, dejando satisfecho al comprador.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007821464', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1593356880}
review:
I feel like I gave it a good shot but I didn't find the gameplay loop to be very fun. There's no strategy to the light time limit or size of your bag so it just feels arbitrary that you have to stop caving and go to the surface to 'recharge'. The platforming also didn't feel tight to me, with a lot of jumps requiring you to sprint but sprinting itself is weighty.
Obviously others like it but not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1593305815}
review:
Both SteamWorld Dig 1 and 2 work as 2D action adventure platformers with an interconnected world and heavy focus on exploration, so yes, they are very much “metroidvania” games. You get new abilities that help with both combat and exploration, you unlock new routes through the world, you even get a few boss encounters even though the games are not emphasizing their combat element most of the time. What they are emphasizing is the titular ability to dig. And it’s amazing how something that conceptually simple can be so fun and fit the metroidvania so well.

The concept is pretty simple – most of the game world is build with breakable blocks. Some of those blocks have gems in them that you gather and sell at the surface. Most are empty and you break them to open the path forward, finding the safest route, planning around enemies and hazards (with some classic DigDug/Boulder Dash/Supaplex ideas and some fresh ones), making sure that you can easily go back up again using your movement abilities. You can always wall-jump, which helps, but you get increasingly more efficient ways to move around and explore with both the money you get from selling the gems and the special upgrade machines you find in the game world. It’s all really simple, but it leads to a genuinely fun loop of exploring a bit, bringing back the loot, upgrading your tools and going back to explore, now more powerful than before. And most amazingly, it also adds to the player choice in how they wish to play the game – you can, if you wish, skip most of the mining, focus just on pushing forward and try to complete the game as soon as possible. It will be harder, but it’s still possible. Or, if you’re like me, and you’re trying to find every secret and explore everything, you’ll have enough reasons to do so and will have fun doing it.

SteamWorld Dig 2 is an amazing example of a sequel. It takes everything that the original title had, takes a close look at it and considers how to make it better. And then makes it all actually better. And adapts/changes the gameplay subtly in every instance where something was changed. It looks better with genuinely great looking locations. The soundtrack to the original was good, the soundtrack to the sequel is fantastic (though there are spots where it’s pleasantly reminiscent to the music in Knytt Underground and Environmental Station Alpha). The movement is fantastic and by the end of the game you get some of the most freeing and fun ways to move around I’ve ever experienced in a platformer. Even the combat has been improved and because of that the game now levels you up based on the XP you get from killing the (now respawning) enemies.

And how the world is expanded is just pure brilliance. It’s the exact same concepts as in the original, with some new ideas here and there, but simply expanded in ways that make it feel far more varied, far more nuanced than before. The story is, shockingly, really good. The way you progress is far more interesting. The map is no longer just vertical too, while the “challenge caves” are always the perfect balance of hard and fun (except for the optional secret end-game challenge, that’s a big nope). All of the one-use items from the original were removed and the game simply gives you more quick travel points, and you can jump between all of them, instead of just a one-way thing like in the original. You do lose your things permanently this time around if you die, but the game is so well balanced around that – it’s barely an issue. It also lasts about twice as long as the first title, yet I can’t say that I even noticed that it was longer simply because of how well paced and designed the game is.

SteamWorld Dig 2 is easily one of the best examples of a sequel and is one of the best metroidvania games I’ve ever played.

review:

This game does what I expected from sequels when I was a kid: You take the base game mechanics and improve on them, providing more content and more options for the player. This game was a joy to play though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044605238', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1238, 'last_played': 1592080893}
review:
Если бы нужно было бы проиллюстрировать выражение "идеальный сиквел" - то SteamWorld Dig 2 был бы идеальным примером. Все удачные геймплейные решения были  сохранены и дополнены новыми фишками, а спорные или отрицательные моменты - либо убраны, либо доведены до ума. 
Самое примечательное - это насколько разрабам удалось найти баланс в сложности - игру не повернется назвать язык простой - некоторые данжи с артефактами или апгрейдами без гайда мне так и не дались, правда, если идти по сюжету и не слишком запотевать с качем то сюжетка вполне проходима. Да и ту же прокачку запороть не выйдет - в любой момент можно перекинуть шестеренки с одного оборудование на другое.  
Также крайне порадовала техническая сторона - ни одного вылета, абсолютно стабильная работа без просадок и скачков ФПС - не зря Нинтендо портировали на Свитч эту аркадку
Игру рекомендую - она приятно выглядит и играется, хотя, с теми же данжами, как выше говорил, она может крайне потной показаться (опять таки - доп.контент, для сюжета не обязательный), приятный аудиоряд, который гармонично вписывается в происходящее на экране добавляет некоторую глубину погружения.    
Ну и родителям с детьми от 6 - 7 лет, которые следят, во что играют их чада - это прям таки идеальный выбор - насилия нет, приятная мультяшная графика, все игровые моменты легко и доступно объясняются, и много моментов, в которых нужно хорошенько подумать, чтобы пройти дальше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344284476', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1567998646}

author: {'steamid': '76561198164588733', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1591637061}
review:
[quote=Image & Form Games][h1]Dig, dig, DIG![/h1][/quote]
SteamWorld Dig 2, SteamWorld evreninden bir başka oyun daha! 

[h1]Oynanış[/h1]
Dürüst olmak gerekirse SteamWorld Dig 2'ye akıcı kontrolleri olması beklentisiyle başladım ve beklediğim kadar akıcı bir oynanış bulamadım. Platformer oyunlarını seven birisi olarak, benim için benzer platform oyunlarında en önemli unsur kontrollerin akıcı olmasıdır. Eğer beklentinizi benimki kadar yüksek değilse SteamWorld Dig 2 oynarken benim eğlendiğimden daha fazla eğleneceğinizi düşünüyorum.

Oyunda maden topluyor ve bunları şehirde satıyorsunuz. Elde ettiğiniz paralarla ekipmanınızı geliştiriyorsunuz. Bir de daha etkili ve farklı geliştirmeler sağlayan Cog geliştirmeleri var. Coglar tüm haritada gizli yerlerde bulunuyor. Cog geliştirmelerini ekipmanınızı geliştirerek ve belirli sayıda eserler toplayarak açabilirsiniz.

Oyun klasik bir Metroidvania. İlerledikçe yeni özellikler elde ediyorsunuz ve bu özellikler daha önce ulaşamadığınız bölgelere erişim sağlıyor. Eğer oyunu düz bir şekilde oynamak isterseniz haritanızda nereye gideceğinizi gösteren bir imge de isteğinize bağlı olarak ekleyebiliyorsunuz. Açıkçası ben çoğunlukla bu özelliği kullanmadım. NPCler size nereye gideceğinizi basit bir şekilde anlattığı için bir problem yaşayacağınızı sanmıyorum.

Oyunun dizaynının diğer oyunlardan farklı olduğunu söylemem gerek. Özellikle Steampunk akımı ilgili olan oyuncular oyunun dizaynından hoşlanacaklardır. Yine de atmosfer açısından pek bir beklentiniz olmasın derim.

[h1]Hikaye[/h1]
Önceki oyunun kahramanı olan Rusty sayesinde SteamWorld kurtulmuştu fakat Rusty bir daha dönmedi. Önceki oyunda NPClerden biri olan Dorothy McCrank, Rusty'nin dönmemesi üzere onu aramaya koyulur ve bu serüveninde birçok engellerle karşılaşır.

Oyunun hikayesinden ve hikaye anlatımından pek bir beklentiniz olmasın. Oyundaki amacımız daha öncede belirttiğim gibi kaybolan Rusty'i bulmak. Rusty'nin nerede olduğunu bilmediğimizden dolayı madene iniyoruz ve oyunun sonuna dek haritanın her yerini karış karış geziyoruz. 

[b]Artıları[/b]
[*]Akıcı oynanış
[*]Kendine has atmosferi

[b]Eksileri[/b]
[*]Hikayesi ve anlatımı

author: {'steamid': '76561198258467903', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1621623760}
review: SteamWorld Dig 2 küçüklüğümde hep oynadığım ama bir türlü tam keyfini çıkaramadığım internetteki "Dig" oyunlarının 3A versiyonudur. Oldukça güzel gözüken grafikleri ve şahane müzikleri yanı sıra fena olmayan bir hikaye ile benim şu ana kadar oynadığım en iyi "Dig" temalı oyun budur. Kazma temasını ve bir şeyleri yükseltmeyi seviyorsanız bu oyun size bire bir ve kesinlikle size tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977001950', 'num_games_owned': 1150, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1583411584}
review:
It's a really well crafted metroidvania. The controls feel good, the mechanics are fun and distributed at a decent pace. Difficulty is around the level of "fun challenge". Not super hard, but enjoyable. Doesn't outstay its welcome.

It's just a goodass game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045765418', 'num_games_owned': 2112, 'num_reviews': 776, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1606392589}
review:
Great continuation of previous story. This time we play as cute robot Dorothy. We look for our friend Rusty the protagonist of the previous game who disappeared. We mostly exploring a vast underground mine, coming up against enemy creatures while finding various minerals for sell as we dig way downwards. Dorothy can gain abilities and weapons such as pressure bombs, a hookshot, and a pneumatic arm that can punch through rock. We can upgrade health, weapons, and abilities for cash we got from selling minerals we found. Each of the weapons have perks that can be activated by installing Upgrade Cogs found in secret areas. More blueprints for upgrades become available by increasing level by killing enemies or completing quests, or by finding artifacts hidden in the mines.

Graphics is sharp and nice, music very fine. In one moment we are in one of kind scary place. I have feel down there pure dread of unknown and that was just great. Game worth time for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980333161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1590662585}
review: The main game is okay, the last part optional dungeon cave of skillness is bullshit. There is a part where you have to do a triple jump that was never needed in the whole game. It has nothing to do with skill just frustration. Even watching videos how to do this part is not helping at all. This prevents me to get all the achievements and destroys all the fun i had with the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274780874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1671158277}

It's a proper sequel that improves on the original experience in more ways than enough to be its own game. I found it to be a very enjoyable game with charming characters, an interesting story
and a great soundtrack made with the help of a well known artist.

Probably one of my if not my most favourite game.

Keep it up Image & Form.

I got this game before the original steam world dig, but still found this game's story to be interesting and the game play to be very much engaging without any necessary parts of story missing.

author: {'steamid': '76561199033361860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1712062095}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112502725', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1336, 'last_played': 1641668586}
review:
Продовження культової гри, яка, як і перша частина, гарна. За сюжетом ми граємо за дівчину робота на ім'я Дороті, яка намагається розшукати нашого старого знайомого з першої частини робота Расті, попутно ми продовжуємо копатися в шахтах і збираємо різноманітні ресурси для продажу та покращення спорядження. Геймплей по суті залишився колишнім (що дуже добре), з нововведень з'явилися шестерні, які як і за гроші можна витратити на поліпшення або ускладнення гри, колекційні предмети, які відсилають до різних жанрів ігор або фільмів, локацій у грі стало набагато більше в порівнянні з першою частиною, нові види ворогів (старі з першої частини були візуально та геймплейно змінені). Візуально гра виглядає дуже красиво та атмосферно для інді-гри. Саундтрек, як і в першій частині, класний і добре вписується в атмосферу гри.
Вартість гри невелика, що навіть за знижкою не варто брати.
І я дуже сильно чекаю продовження цієї гри, і сподіваюся що ми колись побачимо продовження цієї легендарної гри!
І від мене особисто 10 із 10, і палець вгору!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009217675', 'num_games_owned': 938, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1590150427}

I love this kind of games where you have thousands of ways to get to your goal.

From me a recommendation for every metroidvania lover

author: {'steamid': '76561197970353922', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1590036127}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014389178', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1589587280}
review:
A big step up from the first SteamWorld Dig, which was already a very fun game. Unlike its predecessor, which had a randomly generated world (except the puzzle rooms), this game has a huge, fully designed game world, filled with enemy encounters, puzzles, and lots of secrets. The game follows the familiar formula of digging out treasure to sell, and earn money to buy upgrades, which enables you to dig deeper and explore new areas. Some upgrades are locked away behind difficult challenges, and others require collectible cogs, which can be distributed freely for a bit of customization to your gameplay.

The story ties into the SteamWorld universe, and follows the side-character Dorothy from the previous SteamWorld Dig game. It might therefore be a good idea to have played the first game, if you want to dig into the lore of the games. However, I think the game can be enjoyed on its own as well, since I enjoyed the story a lot without remembering much of the first game.

As usual, the SteamWorld games work great on Linux, and I hope to see another Dig game, as these are my favorites of the SteamWorld series.

review: An amazing improvement on a solid formula. The platforming and combat are better than ever, and you get  a unique set of tools to solve problems. A great mertroidvania for anyone who likes the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135223', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 2744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2057, 'last_played': 1703435224}
review:
Steam World Dig 2 est un jeu ou l'on creuse, on creuse de partout à la recherche de Rusty, héro du premier opus qui a disparu.
SI le principe du jeu est le même que pour SWD1, le gameplay s'est enrichi, de nouvelles actions, de nouveaux objets, des améliorations à gogo, des secrets a découvrir...
Le jeu est incroyablement rire, arrive a toujours relancer l'intérêt.
Ce jeu est une véritable réussite!
Je le recommande très fortement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991986263', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1589092942}
review: If you played the first one, this one fixes the only problem the first had. It's a longer game, with a near perfect soundtrack. Really cool the new upgrades and how it combine with the game. If you liked the first one, you are gonna LOVE this one. Hope we get a new one soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312333161', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1588893782}
review:
En Steamworld Dig 2 somos Dorothy, después de los sucesos del anterior, y tenemos la misión de investigar que mierda pasó con Rusty, el protagonista del 1ro...
Comparándolo con el primero, tiene una mejora completa del juego y esto se nota mucho graficamente
Me pareció que esta secuela se centraba más en los puzzles de las minas que en minar recursos para mejorarnos y seguir la historia
Todas las mejoras sirven, algo que en el primero no pasaba!
Tiene un desarrollo en la relación entre Fen y Dorothy que me encantó
En fin, súper recomendado :3

review:
Fun game, similar to Steamworld Dig 1.
The character grows stronger over time, gets cool abilities. Fighting isn't hard. Music and sound effects are OK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278439761', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1611428270}
review:
Bien, una experiencia un tanto relajante, un poco continuista de el primero pero mejora en gran medida todos los aspectos, mejor exploracion, mas variedad de enemigos, mejor mobilidad, en resumen, te incentiva mas a jugarlo. En cuanto a su duracion, es un poco mas largo que el primero ya en mi primera vuelta me tarde como unas 13 horas, me lo tome con calma y saque casi todo en cuanto a exploracion, pero si te lo pasas con lo necesario sin hacer mucho backtracking te lo terminas en 8/9 horas.
En resumen, es un juego entretenido, tiene personajes un tanto planos pero con diseños interesantes, siempre se pone en descuento en la majoria de rebajas asi que le puedes dar una oportunidad ya que no te hara perder el tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020414830', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1720, 'last_played': 1586698208}
review: Just like its predecessor SteamWorld Dig, this is a great metroidvania digging game. But even more fun than first one. Theres more to explore and collect. Besides gathering minerals, there are hidden collectibles such as upgrade cogs (with cogs a player can upgrade his/her gear) and artifacts (artifacts are a cool side collectibles they unlock the blueprints if enough blueprints are collected). Mining and gathering minerals then upgrading your gadgets just feels so good. It can be an addicting game. I remember spending all day just mining and getting deeper, and saying to myself: "yeah just few more mineral nodes and a cave then I'm done for today." Yeah, you guys can imagine 1 hr extending to 5 or 6 hrs. xD I've played for 28 hours since I took my time and tried to collect most of the things, and I screwed around a bit. So even if you buy the game at full price it's totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010457905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1585946398}
review:
good game just like the first one but better.! 
 When I play this game it always remind of minecraft . I am talking about the digging part of minecraft , whitch i like the most. Steamworld dig 2 blends it with 2d gameplay and the shakes a little metroidvania sauces in to the cup . All ingredients together make for a very fun game to discover and dig some shiny ore!!! 

I didnt like that you can´t enter the secret trails without collecting all artifacts , didn´t feel like searching for them after completing the game .

Besides that a awesome game!
I would dig some more if they will release a part 3 in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198165946911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1639833249}
review:
Se algum interessado ver a minha análise da primeira versão de SteamWorld Dig, verá que o considerei minha melhor aquisição na Steam. Isso muda agora...
Em SteamWorld Dig 2, a desenvolvedora conseguiu melhorar tudo que já era ótimo na primeira versão - gráficos, história, jogabilidade, desafios, chefes, colecionáveis, sim, tudo mesmo!
É simplesmente divertido ir cavando cava vez mais fundo à procura de segredos, tesouros e dinheiro; sempre buscando alcançar as melhorias oferecidas e sim, com aquela sensação de mistério sobre o que aconteceu com o Rusty...
Enfim, essa é agora a minha melhor compra na loja da Valve, mas estou na espera de que a desenvolvedora me surpreenda novamente com um jogo de tanta qualidade quanto SteamWorld Dig 2!

review: Классная игра! Сильно не растянута. Проходится за 12 часов со сбором всех секреток. Основной геймплей (Копание) постоянно разбавляется платформингом и головаломками и другими активностями. На много лучше первой части. Выглядит прекрасно. Сбор секретов интересный. Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095224089', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1700781411}
review: A game that rewards you for being observant and curious. Gameplay can be pretty relaxed, or you can challenge yourself with special modifiers and go for high rankings. Most upgrades seem like they serve a useful purpose. Other things like the grenade launcher seem underused, but it doesn't ruin the experience. Didn't encounter any bugs during my playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091114262', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1648, 'last_played': 1584970115}
review:
Its a game about digging shiny rocks. Improvement on the first one if you have played it. Its good on its own if you haven't.
There isn't much to discuss beyond the trailer. 

They have polished their skills and made this one even more eye candy than the first one. 

It is also nice of them to include a hard challenge special level for their hardcore fans which is pretty cool.

Though I sometimes feel that there could be more. Once you get the level editor out of the way, making levels for this games should be pretty easy and it seems they only ever make barely enough to go around. Its not like there are expensive CGI and voice acting to maintain in extending the story as well. Just text.

I'm sure a lot of people wouldn't mind more digging for treasure involved than there is currently.

author: {'steamid': '76561199012576662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1810, 'last_played': 1586065992}
review: I bought this game on discount and it definily worths lots more than 4$, because it is so much better than Steam World Dig 1! Play the first time on your own. Want more? Try to get 100% secret and then go for the "Trials of Heaven and Hell" cave in the sky in Windy Plains, in which you must learn how to make wall jumps to pass the Trials of Skillness. Still want more? Learn how to make double jump, then play the second time using wall jumps and double jumps to break the sequence of the game, and pursue the 4 gold stars in the end, which requires you to finish the game with 0 death, 100% secret and more than 16000 gold (all max-level tools would cost you more than that) within 4hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005628512', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1585480698}
review:
Отлично проведённые 13 часов моей жизни. Вторая игра - это “тех же щщей, да погуще влей”, в хорошем смысле. Точно так же самозабвенно молотишь киркой, носишь руду в город, грейдишь инструмент, броню, фонарь, мешок, покупаешь перки, возвращаешься, где уже был, открываешь секретные закутки. Есть несколько сложных головоломок. Отличная музыка, трогательные графика и анимация.
В сравнении с первой игрой карта выросла раз наверное в 10, теперь роешься не только под землёй, но и поверхности. Сама шахта теперь не одна и та же, с коричневой глиной, теперь есть ещё подземные джунгли и храм. Ещё стало посложнее выкапывать руду из под камней. Местами, чтобы собрать все камешки, нужна прям СТРАТЕГИЯ добычи.
Минус только один - легковата. Да и то не все это считают минусом. Везде, кроме головоломок, я играл на расслабоне. Меня лично смутило, что некоторые перки настолько ОП, что резко снижают интерес к игре. Благо, они открываются почти в самом конце и только если будешь досконально рыться в КАЖДОМ углу.
Игра высокого качества, рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828834525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1587470402}
review: Even though I enjoyed both Steamdig 1 and Steamheist, for some reason I put off playing this game for a long time. And after having finally gone and done it, I can kind of see why. This game is a metroidvania-lite. Which is fine. It's really fun. It improves on every aspect of Steamdig 1, whilst still having the same polished arcade feel. But it is definitely a casual experience. I think there was part of me that was hoping that this game could somehow transcends the limitations of it's gameplay mechanic (which is, dig downwards) and offer a rich and immersive world, but in my heart I knew what I was in for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024561128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1584826439}
review: Was looking for something in the same vein as the "Ori and the Blind Forest"-style metroidvania.  this scratched the itch.  If Ori is a 9/10, this is a 7.5-8 / 10.  The gameplay is on par; the graphics are a smidge more basic in Steamworld Dig 2 but are still good--the graphics are appropriate for the art style, if that makes any sense.  This game was more addicting than the Ori series.  .  .   ended up starting and finishing this one in the same session, playing this one for 14 hours straight through.  Don't ask me why.  Like I said, it scratched the itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064364441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1584974839}
review:
Чувствуется что игра сделана душевно. Музыка, атмосфера, способности,интересные секретные шахты,прокачка, которую не надо долго гриндить и прочее(чем больше проявишь смекалку, тем легче, и это радует, что упор не на прыжках и ловкости). Интересно самому прокладывать путь все глубже и глубже под землю, сразу продумывая чтобы можно было подняться назад и постепенно подбираясь к разгадке того, что же произошло с Расти,героем первой части. 
Лично меня "зацепило" с первого часа и я потерялся в антураже серии SteamWorld, а это главное в играх.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364354267', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1691786991}
review:
Превзошла все ожидания, прекрасное продолжение первой части игры.

из основных плюсов:
+ Много новых механик
+ Гораздо более продуманный, в сравнении с 1 частью мир, что даёт свободу передвижения и нелинейного исследования карты
+ Отличная музыка и выдержанная атмосфера стимпанка с примесью вестерна (тут как и в первой части)
+ Много отсылок и рофланов в репликах персонажей и описании артов и руды

минусы:
- К сожалению, очень мало боссфайтов, этого не хватало всю игру
- По ходу прохождения почти не встречается по-настоящему сложных моментов, ни каких-то особо сложных головоломок (кроме пещер с вагонетками и уровня с вольтроном, но и они проходятся без труда), ни локаций с трудными местами (максимально субъективно, но если вы играли хоть в какой-то +- сложный платформер, то поймёте)

author: {'steamid': '76561198375136685', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1597119764}
review:
[h1]Trama[/h1]
Il gioco inizia con l'androide Dorothy che cerca l'amico Rusty scomparso nel capitolo precedente. Viaggiando verso la città di El Machino il personaggio cade in una grotta, trovandosi in un tempio a combattere contro un robot governato da una strana luce blu. Sconfitto questo mini boss la fiamma che conteneva decide di diventare amichevole, fornendo una mappa più dettagliata del sottosuolo e degli obiettivi, conversando occasionalmente.
Arrivati nel villaggio ci si trova davanti a una società in rovina, che ha perso quasi tutti i minatori venendo costantemente tartassata da terremoti.
Il protagonista si offre di andare alla ricerca dell'amico perduto, ottenendo minerali nel frattempo e indagando sugli insoliti sismi.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
SteamWorld Dig 2 è un platform minerario nel quale i compiti del giocatore sono principalmente estrarre minerali e venderli in cambio di vari potenziamenti dell'attrezzatura.
Scavando in profondità diventa sempre più difficile lavorare agevolmente, quindi sarà necessario potenziare il proprio piccone e acquistare vari utensili.

[h1]Comparto Tecnico[/h1]
Il gioco è sviluppato su un motore grafico proprietario, la grafica 2D stilizzata è migliorata rispetto al predecessore, offrendo ulteriori filtri e maggiore libertà di configurazione per un'esperienza che si adatta a tutti i tipi di computer.
L'audio è buono, la colonna sonora è piacevole (ndr. anche se personalmente ho preferito quella del primo capitolo) e i suoni sono semplici ed azzeccati.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034310847', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2619, 'last_played': 1585228470}
review:
What an awesome little game. Everything in this one is spot on. Graphics, music, ambiance, atmosphere, controls, gameplay difficulty, everything is near perfect. Especially the controls in a game such as this can make or break it. They are some of the most enjoyable controls I've ever had the pleasure to experience. This game and Rogue Legacy are very satisfying in this regard, though I must mention I used a gamepad. 

I can only urge everyone to try this game. It's excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 15600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5696, 'last_played': 1584633614}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 Review

The adventure continues, and it is bigger than ever before!

Some key points that this game offers:

1.	Improved visuals.
2.	New gear and tools.
3.	Indie Gem 5/5.
4.	Improved levelling system.

Gameplay & Controls:

SteamWorld Dig 2 Is available on several platforms with controls dedicated to each unique platform. Having the chance to experience it on a hand held and console game I can say with surety that the game plays and handles well and comfortably on both of these platforms. 
My final variant was on PC, my main source of gaming too. The game can be played with keyboard and mouse or with a gamepad/ controller. It comes down to preference here. 
However, playing on a controller makes it much more controllable; at the heart of this game it is and will always be a platformer; so quick jumps and stops are key here and a controller does this the best. 

I completed it with keyboard and mouse for those that want to know, a tad more difficult but you get used to the gameplay and it gets easier and totally doable. 

SteamWorld Dig 2 is the sequel to the original; with several changes and major improvements. It is the same fun game you remember; mining deeper and deeper filling your pockets up and then heading topside again to sell your riches. Using your hard-earned cash to buy new equipment or upgrade already owned ones to better versions. In the original we played with Rusty the old miner bot, in SteamWorld Dig 2 we play with Dorothy the new protagonist as she searches for her lost friend.

Another new feature that has been added to the game is mods. No not the kind your thinking of but the kind where you gather cogs hidden throughout the game that can be installed into possible mods for your equipment to upgrade and improve them. 

Graphics:

We have the same brilliant Steampunk theme and vibe out in the Wild Wild West. The visuals have been improved and updated. The game looks a lot smoother and a whole lot prettier than before.

Character models have received a major overhaul, there are a lot more characters present in the game world this time and they all have their own unique appearances and personalities. 
Level design is a lot more vibrant and welcoming as well, the details are a lot clearer and very inviting.

Under the settings panel we have a few settings we can make use of to customize our game.

Sounds:

Another spectacular add on to this already brilliant game. The soundtrack really is amazing, they went above and beyond to bring us this music. It doesn’t just add music to the game, but it enhances the overall quality of it, it enhances the game and makes it so much better.
Exploration…mining and everything is so much more fun and the music and other sounds play a big role in it.

Under the settings there are a few options to control the volumes for your game.

Replayability:

The game is fun, it is full of secrets and it offers a whole lot of addictive-quality game time. So just getting your fill of the game will keep you busy for a long time. 

However, this is the type of game that can always be replayed because it is that enjoyable.

MGR Gaming’s Conclusions:
Spoilers ahead:

SteamWorld Dig 2 is through and through a masterpiece! Everything that this game offers is pure joy and great bliss. The improvements to the game really make it such a pleasure to play. The tools and equipment we had from the original has so much more potential now with the added mods. The new tools and equipment offer a lot more options and gameplay that you can lose yourself in this game very easily.

The story line has been improved as well, we have a broader and richer story to experience this time, every moment in this game will be more than memorable. As far as platformers go this one is for the history books; It is no mere platformer, it is full of mechanics from other genres that add more value and quality to the game.

Score 9
By: MGRza
Date: 29 September 2017

Genre: Adventure: Action: Metroidvania: Indie: Mining: Platformer

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198017086570', 'num_games_owned': 1433, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1583086383}
review:
This game is a really good example of how to make a sequel; everything is improved from the first game:
the smooth controls, creative level designs, clever gameplay mechanics, and aptly suitable soundtracks.
While the overall difficulty is a bit moderate and the story could be better, the game is fun enough to play for one to look pass its slight shortcomings.

For fans of the first game, just buy and play this game; it's so so good and improves from the prequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247230438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1583025434}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 49690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49690, 'last_played': 1581845248}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2, the successor to one of the most awesome indie games of the last couple of years makes everything better than its predecessor. Better handling, higher difficulty, more biomes, some puzzles, boss fights, more dialogue, more whacky characters, more distinguished art design and a polish of the already great mechanics of the original game.

Steamworld Dig 2 has a truly great flow when it comes to whacking away rocks and dirt while collecting all the shinies.

Content wise it can a very long or a very short game, depending on playstyle, but either case it is absolutely worth its asking price. While there's no true reason to replay this apart from challenge achievements, it remains a lot of fun even in subsequent playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025083122', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1592148189}
review:
I was glad that we received a follow-up story for the first SteamWorld. But story is not the most important part of it.
I think this a game is a perfect sequel - bigger sandbox, more toys, new faces and places.
The story is average, but it's not the most important part of this game. [spoiler]The final reveal was a surprise, story ends an arc (and starts new ones of course!).[/spoiler] All I needed.
Mining is as cool is it used to be. [spoiler]I missed the ladders and couldn't reach some of the tiles.[/spoiler]
I liked the new tools and advancement system, the caves and artifacts also.
There was only one thing that might need some fine tuninig - difficulty levels. I felt it was really mixed. Some caves were very easy, some very hard ([spoiler]the exploding mushrooms!- even final battle was easy compared to this[/spoiler]). But that might be the result of my skill (or lack of it, more precisely :P). [spoiler]I seriously thought I'll pass the final battle because it was so hard, but after a series of trials and a well-slept night after it I managed to beat it :)[/spoiler]
To recap, it's a beautiful game full of things to do, tools and challenges.
FOR VECTRON'S SAKE, PLAY IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969799553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1697909307}
review: Steamworld Dig 2 is a neat little metroidvania but not, the digging mechanic is enjoyable and planning your route is a fun part of the experience. Platforming is satisfying as you unlock faster and more elaborate ways to travel along the caverns and pits. Unlocks and upgrades are interchangeable and is exciting to work towards. The art style is on point, bright and colourful without visual clutter to the player. Audio and soundtrack is fitting for the environments. The plot is engaging with it's characters ranging from hilarious to sinister. it's a game that should last 8-10/12 hours depending on how fast you want to blast through it and if you want to do optional areas and how fast you dig. One thing I would maybe recommend anyone is to turn the marker off for the map, exploring and seeing how you fare up in an area is an important part of the experience. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198123072098', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1581358149}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976408337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1580415492}
review:
[h1]Overall = 9 / 10 [/h1]

A superb game full of charming characters, wonderful gameplay and great level design.  Great graphics, great gameplay, and a great progression system that allows you to adapt the game to how you want to play it.  It is a little on the easy side (apart from the trials at the end), which makes the tougher boss battles quite surprising, but mostly, it’s a relaxing game about exploration, adventure, and combat.  The artwork, style and music all fit perfectly with the tone and premise and overall, it’s a real joy to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096748627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1579139446}
review: If you enjoyed the first one you'll enjoy this one. It follows the "if it aint broke dont fix it" stance where it doesn't change much from the first game. There are a few new mechanics but at the end of the day it's just more steamworld dig which is what you are looking for anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198978279741', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1578736815}
review: Игра крута, по крайней мере по моему мнению. Игра просто создана для копателей, и спидранеров. Я и сам порой люблю погриндить, покопать. Но всё же игра довольно мала, и скорее всего это её главный недочёт. Да я согласен, бывают игры на 2 часа, но тем не менее и они могут быть лучше всяких там Ведьмаков. а так  Сюжет довольно захватывающий и напрямую связан с первой частью. Стоит ли ждать 3 часть? Это вопрос на миллион, потому что в одно время есть огромный просто для новых фишек сюжета и геймплея, НО в то же время разрабы могут просто забить на это и поставить точку на приключениях Дороти и Расти. Но тем нне менее будем ждать анонсов и Е3. На этом мой обзор оканчивается. Всего плохого.

review: Wer den ersten Teil mag, kann mit der Fortsetzung absolut nichts falsch machen. Gleiches Artwork, gleiche Spielmechanik. SteamWorldDig 1&2 sind Metroidvanian, d.h Mit neuen Fertigkeiten kann man an bekannte Orte zurückkehren und bestimmte Hindernisse aus dem Weg räumen oder überwinden an denen man vorher nicht weiterkam. Zocken mit X-Box Controller funzt einwandfrei. Entspanntes Spiel mit ganz viel bunt^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198130687462', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1585314237}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032623323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1189, 'last_played': 1578151171}
review:
Игру однозначно советую расслабиться на один-два вечера. Со скидкой она своих денег даже больше чем стоит.
Плюсы:
Простая, расслабляет мозг после работы, хотя есть и совсем простенькие паззлы местами.
Подходит и детям и взрослым.
Хорошая, как и в первой части, рисовка и анимация.
Хороший, не мешающий саундтрек. Хотя я в большинстве игр играю под свою музыку или без звука здесь иногда включал. Особенно во время сюжетных миссий. Хорошо подходит.
Геймплей просто: бери, да копай. Можешь проходить все, можешь только сюжетную компанию. Но если только сюжет это один вечер.
Минусы:
Ну понятно, что реиграбельности тут нет. На один раз.
Да пожалуй и все.
Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268674978', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1578083160}
review: An amazing, thrilling, enjoyable, beautiful, and neatly designed game with a true sense of progress, loveable characters and plot that keeps on giving. If you are a true explorer and want to dig deeper and deeper into the world while at the same time unraveling some of its hidden secrets - you will have a great time with the game! :)  I can wholeheartedly recommend it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198186049262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1695566589}
review:
Dig another hole, Dig another hole

Steamworld Dig 2 is exactly what you should expect from a sequel. It’s more of the same, but bigger and better. With more power ups, several caverns instead of just one and a story involving the original protagonist, Steamworld Dig 2 is definitely worth getting if you love Metroidvanias or the first game

review: Amazing. I bought this on a whim and beat the game in one eight hour session.  Like crack, I couldn't put it down. This is a GAME through and through. Overall, I think I enjoyed this even more than Bloodstained to be honest. Definately pick it up if you are a platformer fan.

review: I've become additcted to this one. The 2nd part has more variety in upgrades, skills, more music, characters, levels, dangers and locations and is much longer than the 1st part. It also has a map, which you can check any time. Moving between locations became easier. And completing a cave marks it with tick on the map. You can set the diffculty to easy or normal and for those who love hardcore there are options to make the gameplay harder, which are hidden in the game itself. Totally recommend it to platform-lovers

review: Amazing indie game. Bought it immediately after playing the first one. Great story, characters, puzzles, exploration, artwork, controls. I honestly have trouble thinking of anything bad about this game. Really hoping they release a third, looking forward to finding out what became of various characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979414350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2082, 'last_played': 1577571698}
review:
This is a metroidvania of sorts, with digging. Difficulty isn't hardcore, unless one is going for all achievements.

The art style and atmosphere are great; the graphics are colorful and the music is atmospheric and fits the tone of the game. There isn't that much dialogue or many characters, but what there is is top notch.

The gameplay itself is the important thing here, and they really got it right. The progression is perfect, there's potential for sequence breaking, and various advanced movement techniques that are fun to master. I had a lot of fun looking for all the secrets, and the challenging bonus  content is great too.

Never played the first game, but this second one was a nice surprise. Not too long, not too short, threw a lot of surprises at the player. I also liked how the tone of the game varied from area to area.

I'll be playing this again, maybe attempt a speedrun or a no death run one day. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980711569', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1577522034}
review:
An adorable and excellent Hollow Knight-meets-Spelunky title. Open world with ability unlocks that give you access to further areas, while also maintaining a resource-collection based economy used to heavily modify the unlocked abilities.

Really, REALLY shines later into the game as you amass mobility upgrades; when you start, a three-high cliff is a huge obstacle, but by the final third, you will be literally flying through the levels. The quality of the mobility in this game makes it really hard to put down, it's difficult to overstate.

The story was also surprisingly compelling. I had expected the bare-bones affair you normally get with a mining game, but not the case here. It starts a little slow, but at the end, I found myself genuinely worrying about the outcomes of the two main characters, and it's impressive the twists and character growth they were able to pack in.

Legitimately one of my favorite games of the year. Highly recommend.

review:
Most of the game is good, but the controls are pretty bad. For the digging and questing this is totally unproblematic (as even lava doesn't kill instantly), but there are many difficult platforming challenges that are mostly just tedious due to the controls.

Maybe it would be slightly better with a controller, but this game doesn't support my controller (which has zero problems with other games).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030819237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1879, 'last_played': 1576626014}
review: I also enjoyed the first one.  This one was an upgrade with cool and useful new power-ups, and a dispensing of some of the more monotonous bits of the first game.  For example, now when you return to surface, your hearts and water are automatically restored.  There is an upgrade that makes it so your light never goes out.  And so on.  After my first pass, I was able to find 80% of the secrets according to the stats at the end of the game.  A good game that's been improved upon.  Probably not a ton of replayability, but worth it for a well-crafted experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084019881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1576511136}
review:
Для разумных роботов нет ничего страшнее человека пьющего (h0mo bibitor). И это был спойлер…

[h1]Abstract[/h1]
For a sapient  robots, there is nothing worse then h0mo bibitor. This is a spoiler… Works more or less (after suppressing popup windows) fine on Ubuntu 16.04 with Intel® HD Graphics 4400 in a fullscreen mode. 

[h1]Диггер-панк[/h1]
Милое и достойное продолжение [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198084019881/recommended/252410]SteamWorld Dig[/url] во стимпанковской вселенной разумных роботов. Как и в первой части — вы шахтёр, точнее лучше вы — робот-шахтёр, и даже лучше этого: робот-шахтёр женского пола в поисках протагониста из первой серии. Механика игровой метроидвании в плане развития героя стала более отточенной, история более выпуклой, но вы по прежнему по сути копаете землю и добываете из неё сокровища. Мне лично не очень понятно зачем тут враги, когда можно просто [i]копать[/i]! 

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

Проблем замечено не было кроме редких зависаний предположительно из-за всплывающих окон в полноэкранном режиме. Докопался до, страшно сказать, «самогонного аппарата» в среде Ubuntu 16.04 на ноутбуке с видеокартой Intel® HD Graphics 4400. 

[h1]Обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры.[/url][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198115204825', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1576335904}
review:
У меня есть вопросы к этой игре.

Если первая часть декларировала ущербность бездушных технологий перед лицом олицетворения всего того, что можно назвать золотым веком технологического прогресса, то вторая - учитывая финальный твист, говорящий о том, что злодеи - всегда злодеи, провозглашает новые технологии спасителем в сияющих доспехах. Будучи активистом феменистического движения третьей волны я крайне возмущён подобным развитием событий и уже готовлю заявление в суд.

Шутка.

Игра простая и клёвая, меня, правда, несколько удивил тот факт, что создатели дали игроку возможность летать практически без ограничений, но кто я такой, чтобы судить тех, кто делает мне хорошо, верно?)

Нюанс в том, что если бы я захотел пройти игру на 100% - проблем у меня с этим бы не возникло, с прокаченным реактивным ранцем, детектором полых стен и гранатомётом, разбивающим кирпичи. Не то чтобы это минус, но в таком разрезе достижение перестаёт быть достижением.

Короче, мне понравилось, а всё, что было написано выше - просто придирки к хорошей игре.

Воть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125215874', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1580532918}
review:
Well, if you love mining , exploring in games like Terraria / Minecraft, you will certainly love this game, show the Devs our support, 2 games like this is always not enough

Pros:
1) Tons of upgrade, so you learn new stuff on the go
2) Tons of secret to explore
3) A number of different biome, they are a nice change of pace
4) A lot of Puzzle for puzzle solving, and challenges to completed, they had a reason to do them too
5) A huge improved game from the previous one

Cons:
1) Combat are....erm, had a little impact
2) To 100% this game...is freaking hard
3) Don't had specific build...or route to play the game, it's like a linear game with a few reason to replay the whole game ...but the game is huge

9/10, I freaking love this game, hope to see more coming from the Devs

author: {'steamid': '76561198246845458', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 60323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1647232882}

author: {'steamid': '76561198287512340', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1365, 'last_played': 1617133394}
review:
Este juego es uno de los mejores indies que puede existir, hecho con el mayor amor posible por parte de sus creadores, fácilmente una de las compras obligatorias para su disfrute, claro se debe destacar que el juego continua la historia del primer SteamWorld Dig, por lo que antes de este recomiendo adquirir la precuela de este mismo, pues sirve para empaparse más de la historia, y de paso para ver el enorme crecimiento en mecánicas e ideas de jugabilidad que tuvo el estudio en esta secuela y hay darse cuenta de la calidad de esta entrega, que si bien no es un juego difícil, esta con una dificultad pertinente para todo público, y la dificultad se puede dar a la hora de sacarle el platino a este juego, que tiene unos desafíos muy interesantes.
Valor de compra:
Historia : no intenta ser revolucionario en historia, más bien es simple y fácil de llevar, coherente para todo lo referente al universo de SteamWorld
Jugabilidad : el juego puede llegar a ser de farmeo, si se le quiere ver así, pero la verdad es que tiene unas mecánicas super pulidas, todo el arsenal del juego esta muy bien pensado, la creación del mapa y la capacidad de minar absolutamente todo y de recoger la mayor cantidad de oro para crecer en su propio arsenal hace de este una maravilla, los controles estan muy bien hechos tanto para teclado como para control, que de hecho el juego recomienda jugarlo con uno, pero no es imprescindible si no dispones de uno.
Banda sonora : no es la banda sonora más extensa del mundo de los videojuegos, pero si es una de las más contundentes y mejor implementadas, se hace muy disfrutable esta entrega con el OST del juego
Rejugabilidad : este juego ofrece bastante rejugabilidad para conseguir el platino del mismo, y aunque ese no fuera el caso, sus mecánicas y forma de jugar hacen del mismo un disfrute y se podría decir, hasta un efecto terapéutico ya que relaja mucho jugar del mismo.
Valoración : sé que este juego no será un 10/10 para muchas personas, pero en sí será mi valoración personal la que quiero dejar, para mi es un 10, podría dar muchos más argumentos que los mencionados anteriormente, y cabe decir que es el único juego para el que me tome el tiempo de hacer una reseña tan extensa, aunque es muy personal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991323744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1575612613}
review:
I had the original Steaworld Dig since it came out and haven't played it since. I picked this one up recently after my PC died and could only game on a laptop with no 3D card. I replayed the original Steamworld and then this one immediately after. The storyline was a near perfect cross over and this game did a great job keeping everything good from the last game and improving on the bad. A few things of note, though!

In the original game water puddles in the mines were limited, so you couldn't return to an old puddle for water until you returned to town. This was removed in this game but I found it didn't need to be. I could count on 1 hand how many times i returned to the same puddle ever. The visual of draining the puddle I think was worth keeping. It's a small thing, but I found it noteworthy. 

A big change was removing the double jump ability and replacing it with a jetpack/hookshot. The hookshot I was really OK with, but the jetpack felt a bit off. Almost everyplace in the game could be reached with the hookshot and a double jump, so the jetpack made it feel almost too easy. There was only 1 place where the jetpack was truly needed but that was not even 3 minutes of the 12 hours i put into the game. I missed the double jump a lot and over all didn't want the jetpack to replace it. That said it was fun to fly around the maps. And yea, it's needed for the final boss. 

Overall the changes made were improvements. The first game has a distinct feeling of being a single mineshaft that travels down down down down, while this game has multiple caves, caverns and mineshafts. I enjoyed the fact that there was more to do here. I actually think I could safely say I'm sad I finished the game. I want to keep exploring with all these upgrades I got for rosie, or at least try to replay as Rusty, which is sadly not an option. 

It's a great game. While longer than the original, this is still a short game. It leaves you wanting more... and I hope we get it.

review: Wirklich tolles Spiel, gute Story, innovative Rätsel, geile Grafik und vor allem sind die Verstecke der Sammelobjekte (Artefakte) wirklich immer originell. Schwierigkeitsgrad auch okay, Bosse aber ein bisschen zu leicht. Die stetigen Veränderungen deiner Skills durch den Rädchen-Mod und die Upgrade-Kapseln sehr gelungen. Wer Dig 1 schon geliebt hat, wird hier nicht nur glücklich, sondern gänzlich in Ekstase gesetzt!!

review: Absolutely the best metroidvania style game I have ever played. I'm usually not a huge fan of them due to too much backtracking, but this game gets rid of the tedious backtracking. I'm not done yet, but I don't think it's going  to be a very long game, but if you are an adult like me who doesn't have the time for a 100 hour run through elder scrolls anymore, this game is perfect and worth every penny. Also for fans of the first Steamworld Dig, this is a clear improvement on an already great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213871273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1536281901}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 was a "comeback" to gaming for me. I didn't play games for a long time. This was a good starting point. 

The graphics and music were quite pleasant and it had the right combination of easy access and difficulty.  As others had mentioned, it is kind of a relaxing game (at least it was for me). 

This game is kind of short though. I put in about 30 hours just because I wanted to get all the secrets and explore as much as possible, but you can probably finish it in less than 10 hours. I enjoying myself playing this game. It is a good platformer.

review: Even better than the first one, which was already really, really good. A bit more puzzly (which I enjoy) and, my word, the ending I was kind-of thinking might happen, but not at all in the way that it did. Absolutely amazing, definitely recommend it. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039641447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1573406996}
review:
Fun little game. It's simple but charming!
For all who like cute robots (yes, CUTE), steampunk and digging goodies (like in Minecrtaft).
Pro's and cons:
+ Pleasant 2D graphics
+ Charming steampunk robots
+ Upgrades and secrets
+ Interesting locations

- Game is kinda short (but i like it that way - there is no grind)

What a great game! Good plot, great graphics and playability, nice soundtrack, and so much fun!

I loved both SD1 and now SD2 - i can't wait for an SD3.

review: Now THIS game right here? This is a masterpiece. The art is beautiful, the animation is smooth and controls are tight. The story is interesting (or, at least, *I* found it interesting) and the characters are definitely entertaining and likable. In my opinion this is one of the best Metroidvania's out there. Highly, highly recommend this game to any Metroidvania and Minecraft lovers out there. 8.5/10 will play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275253494', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1549288050}
review:
Absolutely loved this game to death and I can't think of any glaring flaws that were notable enough for me to remember, the only thing at all about this game I could say was bad was how sad I was when it was over, how short the whole thing was, but that doesn't mean every minute wasn't amazing. The game features beautiful art and an entrancing soundtrack, when I opened it up I was very quick to be immersed and get lost in it, binging it to completion before I even realised what the time was. All the different tools you unlock made the entire game one giant puzzle that I had a great deal of fun solving at every turn, extending my playtime as much as possible by getting every secret I could find. 

If you're looking for an enticing, atmospheric exploration adventure with puzzles that might make you scratch your head for a bit but not pull your hair out, this is the game for you. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198142355099', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1572370437}
review:
***SteamWorld Dig2 Review***
這是一款挖挖挖的遊戲，挖穿地心就對了

**當個快樂的礦工**
在遊戲中，就如同他的名字一樣，玩家主要的體驗就是一直往下挖，並結合了成長要素、解謎要素、隱藏物品要素等等。從挖掘的核心體驗來看，有一個很重要的機制，就是主角不能夠在半空中挖，就算後期解鎖了很多方便移動的裝備，但半空中挖的機制要在最後期且還要花費子彈才能做到，作者把這個功能做成幾乎破關後才讓玩家使用。這個設計讓玩家不能夠創造出往上走的路，因為這個遊戲有點像2D的麥塊，是方格式地圖，所以往上走要做出一個階梯形的地形，而沒有半空中挖就無法做到，就算後期有可以做這件事的裝備，但那子彈非常少沒辦法挖出一條路來。所以這個設計造成了玩家只要開始挖掘，永遠只能向下，這造成了一個很特殊的體驗，要往下每一層都要看一下地形，哪裡比較好下去，哪裡有資源方塊可以挖，哪裡有隱藏物件，下去了就上不來了，除非在回到上面的傳點，很好的切合挖掘的主題。

**成長的快樂礦工**
遊戲中有角色成長的要素，主要是把挖到的礦石資源賣錢，拿錢去升級裝備，其中還有特殊裝備，推進遊戲進度才會得到，另外一種是齒輪升級，把特定齒輪放進去技能裡就可以發動，齒輪可以隨時拔下來換裝其他技能，齒輪的獲得方法比較困難，大部分都是在地宮裡可以找到，最後一種是工藝品，收集到特定個數可以給一個伯伯他就會給你一個特殊的技能，不太是那種很大增強能力的，比較偏向特殊功能，拿到也不一定會用，不過它的特殊性也是值得一拿。整理一下上述的成長，錢的部分是挖資源方塊，齒輪是地宮，工藝品是隱藏要素，而特殊裝備等一下再說，這些要素的本身是很基本的線性遊戲要素，但是這些機制很好的融合進了核心體驗-挖掘。

以錢來說，資源方塊分散在地圖上，意味著玩家在往下挖的時候需要注意這些資源，無形之中達到了引導的作用，且整個遊戲的地圖不是隨機的，每一格都是安排好的，所以可以感受到挖掘的路線，這個地區可以升到的等級，都是設計好的，而這些良好的數值設計，路線控制也讓每個階段的遊戲體驗很好。
再來以齒輪來說，在地宮裡必定有一顆，一些劇情的流程也會送，地宮也不會很難找，因為門很大一個，隨著資源方塊的引導，幾乎都是找的到，所以作為第二重要的角色成長不會很難升級，地宮的內容是解謎或是用新的特殊裝備花式跑酷，這個設計有兩個目的，一個是解謎，照字面上意思就是有關卡讓你解，而這個內容通常都是關於挖掘的知識，像是石頭下的土挖掉，石頭會往下掉把玩家砸死，但是只要挖掉的時後馬上在繼續往前挖，石頭不會馬上往下掉的特性可以讓你往錢挖出一條路，所有謎題都是有個這種類似概念而組成，所以表面上是解謎，實際上是讓玩家學習如何當一個更好的礦工，省下了繁瑣的新手教學，並把齒輪當成是誘因讓玩家拿，而後期謎題就偏少了，變成了很多跑酷，而跑酷大部分是運用那個階段剛拿到的特殊裝備做出一些技巧，像是玩家拿到勾繩時可以拉到定點並固定在牆上，有一個地宮的內容設計成玩家不能摸到地板，要很精準的抓到某些牆壁才能過關，這也是如同上面解謎說的，跑酷的用意是讓玩家熟悉剛拿到的裝備，並告訴玩家設計者設計這個裝備的用意為何，讓玩家更靈活的使用勾繩。到了遊戲後期，地宮已經是純粹秀操作了，結合打怪與跑酷解謎等等的內容，有點像是期末考。
最後來說工藝品，這個東西就是純粹的隱藏物品了，玩家要尋找可疑的方塊，敲掉方塊然後打開隱藏的道路去拿，也有一些你看的到但是拿不到，要繞道去找路的設計，讓玩家看到怪怪的東西就會想拿稿子尻一下，這部分負責了本作的探索部分，算是線性遊戲的常態，這部分其實沒甚麼好說的，正常發揮。

**薛丁格的燈 介於有跟沒有之間**
遊戲中還有一個特別的機制，燈。燈會隨著在地下的時間越長而沒油，沒油就會看不到路，整個主角周圍都是暗的，很大的影響挖掘，回到鎮上能瞬間補滿燈，但是有趣的是當主角遊戲中期時，升級燈到一定程度後可以獲得一個能用齒輪開啟的技能，燈會鎖50%的油，讓油不會降到50%以下，這意味著燈這個機制就沒什麼差了，50%的亮度已經很夠了，而且前期會有要點燈的機制，有些路燈可以點亮，讓玩家可以在沒燈的時候也能看到亮光，但路燈在中期以後就完全沒有了，沒有的時間點跟燈可以鎖50%的時間點差不多。在以上的前提上，可以得知作者想要藉由燈的機制讓玩家在前期時較頻繁的回家，但是後期就捨棄掉這個限制了，所以這延伸到一個跟挖掘體驗息息相關的問題，玩家甚麼時候要回家?如果沒有任何限制，玩家只要一直對著地板按著左鍵，這遊戲就可以破關了，以一些基礎的設定來看，最大的限制是沒有劇情推進後的特殊裝備，有些地方是絕對過不了的，但這個機制不能常用，用多了會讓玩家感到限制重重，體驗極差，所以這個限制在遊戲中是用來區分各個階段劇情的體驗，在後面會說到這個。而另一個基礎且貫徹始終的限制是包包的容量，拿到資源會佔包包格數，高價寶石只能裝一到兩顆，所以玩家滿了會很自然地想回家把資源賣掉，順便升級角色，在野外死亡也會失去一半左右的資源，讓玩家更有理由回家，這個機制從頭到尾都適用，就算到了很後期包包格數很大，也會因為你的挖礦能力提升資源獲取量變大，而需要回家賣礦，前期後期的回家週期是差不多的，那重點來了，加了這個燈會有甚麼影響呢?我認為他的影響是在前期培養出玩家對於回家週期的潛意識教學，這算是一種新機制的遊戲，玩家剛玩這款遊戲可能無法很快的理解要怎麼玩，而燈就扮演著前期教玩家要適時回家的老師，而在玩家掌握好這個元素後，老師也很快的功成身退，成為一個裝飾品，但升級燈還是能獲得幫助探索的齒輪技能，在前期的燈很好的幫助了引導，路燈要點亮有用，玩家會傾向往那個方向挖掘，如果中途不幸死亡，看著燈也可以很快地找到路，所以燈的用途是用來引導玩家對於回家的認知。

**拿到特殊裝備對快樂礦工的影響**
隨著劇情推進，可以進到一個很酷的蒸氣裝置內，獲得特殊裝備，如勾繩、噴射背包等等，分兩個部分，一個是開以前不能挖的區域，一個是改善移動方式，開以前不能挖的區域如字面上意思而已，而移動方式的改善讓玩家可以很快速的挖礦，飛來飛去，快速回到已有道路的上面，但是不能挖往上的路。玩家每次獲得裝備，遊戲體驗也會獲得很大的改變，前期偏向挖掘，所以都是挖特定礦石的機制，後面拿到改善移動方式的裝備後關卡整個風格大轉變。主要關卡是分成三個區域的，原本城鎮底下是偏向挖掘的區域，屬於挖掘的關卡，其他兩個區域的固有牆很多，跑酷的元素較多，很多岩漿、敵人等之類的東西，屬於跑酷的關卡，可以發現作者對於挖掘體驗與跑酷體驗是分開設計的，並把挖掘與跑酷互相穿插，用這種手法讓體驗不會太單調非常高明。

**快樂礦工升等獲得加薪**
這遊戲中有幾種怪物，打死怪物會有經驗，經驗會升等。升等的用意是裝備用錢升級的上限解禁，跟賣礦物會有bonus獎金，等級是不太需要農的，怪的數量也沒有很多，隨著進度打就可以了。以怪物來看，前期有隻蟲怪，一開始是縮成一團，如果玩家快速挖到的蟲的旁邊，就可以安全地敲一下把牠打死，如果沒在他破土之前打掉，他就會把周圍方塊打掉並開始在那邊走來走去，這在一定程度上達到了引導的作用，後期機動性變高也出現了會順移的法師怪，要打他需要來回的追他，他的火球攻擊在某種角度可以幫忙開路，讓這隻怪物用到後期獲得的移動裝備，當然也有純戰鬥的怪物，讓玩家可以感受到打怪的快感。

**所有的要素結合，造就了玩家手中的快樂礦工**
綜合上面所述，可以發現遊戲的機制環環相扣，每個機制會延伸出另一個機制，而所有機制都是為了和新體驗挖掘而服務，這些結合的設計，加上探索遊戲要素，與探索最需要的引導也做得非常優秀，融合各個元素的結果讓整體遊戲機制的表現非常優秀。

**劇情**
劇情其實沒有講甚麼，就是主角去找一代主角的故事，雖然沒什麼內容的感覺，但當主角對FEN說I will come back for you，FEN說I know you will，see you around的時候特別有感觸，不知為何。

**美術**
以往的steamworld風格正常發揮，賞心悅目

**音樂**
這作的音樂只有bgm而以沒有歌，表現算是普通，但其實沒什麼影響，這款遊戲不太需要很強的音樂表現或情緒渲染，只要挖礦的音效夠爽就可以了。

**總結**
引導與機制完美的設計，讓遊戲就如同標題一樣，挖挖挖，挖到爽，推薦給喜歡探索的玩家。

author: {'steamid': '76561198066985340', 'num_games_owned': 912, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1583297454}
review:
Falaremos de: Gráfico/Som/História/Bugs/Jogabilidade/Performance/Puzzle
O que eu achei do jogo: 

Como qualquer jogo com SteamWorld, os gráficos são similares em desenhos de robôs,os sons são muito bem trabalhados, bugs não encontrados no processo, jogabilidade fácil e que lembra o primeiro jogo SteamWorld Dig, esse jogo pode ser considerado um "2.0" do primeiro, várias coisas foram melhoradas, história continua seguindo seu completo sentido desde o final do primeiro jogo. Os puzzles são desafiadores, você pode fazer do jeito simples ou tentar pegar tudo o que pode estar escondido. É um ótimo jogo pra passar o tempo, amei o primeiro e o segundo não foi diferente disso :)

PS: Gosto das pedras brilhantes :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198048350275', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1568790540}
review:
가볍게 엔딩을 볼 수 있는 단순 채굴 게임 처럼 보여도
세세하게 들여다보면 엄청난 공들 들여 만든 게임임을 알 수 있다.
1편에 비해 그래픽도 크게 발전하고. 장비 업그레이드 시스템이 크게 바뀌어서 흥미로웠고
스팀펑크 분위기가 잘 어우러진 브금은 몰입감을 높혀주기에 충분했고
아기자기한 케릭터와 그들의  대화를 보는 소소한 즐거움도 빼놓을 수 없었다.
한글판 지원이 안되는건 아쉽지만 중간중간 생소한 단어를 영어사전 켜놓고 해석해가면서 플레이 할 정도로
대사 하나하나가 막 만들어진 수준은 아니다. 
쉽지만 재밌고 알찬 갓게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128573874', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1613, 'last_played': 1541620085}
review:
[h1] Спасти рядового Расти. [/h1] 

Дороти в поисках пропавшего протагониста первой части - рядового Расти забрела в деревню Эль-Мачино, жители которой намеками дают понять что знают некого незнакомца, описание которого очень напоминают расти, но незнакомец не вернулся, отправившись вниз в шахты и  мы вместе с новым компаньоном как раз и должны выяснить где рядовой Расти и спасти его.  

[code] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/DreamsofGenesis#curation] Читайте больше обзоров от команды кураторства DreamsofGenesis. У нас вы не встретите обзоров на низкосортный треш. [/url]  [/code] 

Основные механики с выхода первой части не изменились. Все в том же стиле, но уже под управлением подруги расти: мы копаем, исследуем мир, копаем, собираем улучшения необходимые для исследования секретных мест и прохода по сюжету, еще больше копаем, улучшаем обмундирование для более быстрого исследования, и самое главное -копаем, по сути, все.  

Но в отличии от приключений расти мир сиквела стал не линейным тоннелем вниз с мизерным количеством активностей, а уже полноценной метроидванией со всеми вытекающими.  Мир теперь разделен не только по глубине, но и по регионам, или правильнее сказать разнообразным локациям, среди которых есть и похороненные под толщей земли руины майя, и даже адски жаркие болота с лавой и соответствующими врагами, испытаниями и звуковым медитативным сопровождением. 

 И то, и другое, и третье в игре не обделено разнообразием: на каждой локации разбросано по своему набору врагов и их теперь куда больше; испытания потребуют немалую сноровку, нужные улучшения и мозг для решения ряда головоломок. Сложность в игре на полное прохождение заключается лишь в отсутствии показателя пройденности подлокаций, что заставляет перепроходить все в поисках последнего процента невыполненных активностей. Но это мелочи и игра щедро вознаграждает неплохим юмором и кучей отсылок. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1559158506 

Процесс копания стал на порядок удобнее и меньше зависит от уровня кирки. Отныне у нас помимо кирки есть бур, который гораздо быстрее справляется с породной, но требует некоторую единицу воды.  
Визуально игра краше и красивее. Эффекты, дизайн локаций, грамотно выстроенное окружение с ловушками и секретами все это, одним словом, превосходно.  

[h1]Итог[/h1]
Сиквел стал во всем лучше младшего брата, а картинка лично у меня не оставляет никакого желания возвращаться.  У студии Image & Form Games  получилось передать дух и атмосферу колоритного дикого запада и не утратить достоинств первого копателя, а сюжетная арка Дороти получилась  даже лучше. Рекомендую в обязательном порядке к приобретению сей метроид и пусть я далеко не все описал в своем обзоре, пусть обилие игровых механик останется вам как приятный сюрприз при прохождении.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035575706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1566745749}
review:
A very nice action platforming experience with decent controls, great sound and excellent art. The developers obviously cared a great deal about this game and it shows in the finished product.

It is very forgiving in the difficulty department making it a good entry level game.

Highly recommend this game if you are after a nice relaxing time with a few challenging bits.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960457558', 'num_games_owned': 1790, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1562148809}
review:
Imagine a Metroidvania game for people who hate Metroidvania games (like myself). That is SteamWorld Dig 2. Exploration and backtracking, as is traditional, are large focuses of gameplay, but the game boasts build-in reminders, markers that let you know when you've fully-cleared an area or are forgetting something, smoothing over one of my largest personal grips about the entire Metroidvania genre.

Otherwise, just a lot of digging, looting, goofy robots, charming visuals and decent music. An excellent follow-up to the original SteamWorld Dig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012273864', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1566243748}
