author: {'steamid': '76561197991695694', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1547611999}
review:
I very much enjoyed SteamWorld Dig.  So much so, that I immediately hopped into SteamWorld Dig 2.  

I went in thinking it would be a rather tangential experience, with not much to improve upon--after all, I basically view the first game as a 10/10!  However...

This game improves upon the first in every aspect.  The meticulously detailed, curated, and perfected pregenerated maps are leaps and bounds above the randomly generation of the first game.  The level design is an absolute pleasure to enjoy, with backtracking only necessary if you want to go the extra mile, and it is so damn fun you probably will.  

The upgrades are often and consistent.  This is a big problem in some metroidvanias in that they suffer from "Well that's not that important, or only relevant 1/100th of the game," but every upgrade you get is a blast, significant, and an absolute joy to play with once you get it.  They each open up new avenues for exploration and ways to dominate the game.  You start the game barely being able to jump or run...  By the end you are flying continuously, grappling from one wall to the next, sending enemies flying all the while gathering 100% of everything you see with next to no issue, completely flabbergasted at how absolutely seemless the transition was.  

As I said about the first game, the only disappointing feature in this game is that it ends.  This might be the best metroidvania I have ever played, definitely in the same tier as Hollow Knight, Ori, and all the rest, and perhaps in some ways even above them.  

I cannot recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025800616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4422, 'last_played': 1565944822}
review: Metroidvania meets Dig Dug meets Boulder Dash, with a lot of charm and plenty of replayability, can ya dig it?

author: {'steamid': '76561197966550596', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1547564447}
review:
Much like the first game SteamWorld Dig 2 is a delightful little snack of a game. It's fun, looks great, has a satisfying loop with good upgrades, and doesn't overstay its welcome. If you like digging and exploring with a touch of the ol' Vania sentiment then check out this game for sure.

If I had to ding it for anything it'd be that it's VERY easy by default (there are ways to increase the challenge) and there's not a lot of reason to return to it. I feel like the digging was less puzzle focused than the first game too. Also the ending is sort of tonally off compared to the rest of the game.

But hey it's cute and good and an easy recommendation for just about anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091580093', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1544266550}
review:
Одна из лучших игр по моему мнению. Здесь можно: копать, копать, продавать, копать, копать глубже, продавать больше и дороже. А как бонус здесь есть: отличные проработанные локации с замечательным дизайном, отличнейшая система улучшений построенная как на сюжетной части так и на полном изучении мира, враги которые доставляют не мало проблем,  хорошо настраиваемое управление для клавиатуры (хотя лучше играть на геймпаде, сама игра об этом говорит), отличнейшие головоломки, хардкор, 3 босса, смешные диалоги, хаб локация где ты можешь продавть и улучшать предметы, 
секретный уровень на который я убил 4 часа.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074665584', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1547222091}
review:
[h1][b][i] «В ПОИСКАХ РАСТИ»[/i][/b][/h1]

Независимая шведская студия [b]Image & Form[/b] вызывает интерес, как минимум, по двум причинам.  Во-первых, в ее недрах был создан очень самобытный сеттинг, главными героями которого стали забавные паровые роботы. Ну и во-вторых, игры серии [b]«SteamWorld»[/b] оказались на удивление качественным продуктом, предлагающим ряд необычных механик. На 2019 год серия насчитывает четыре разноплановые игры: [b]SteamWorld Tower Defense, SteamWorld Heist[/b] и [b]SteamWorld Dig 1/2[/b] . Жанр первой понятен из названия, вторая представляет собой пошаговую стратегию в духе [b]XCOM[/b]  и [b]WORMS[/b] , а две последние – прекрасные образцы метроидвании. 

Несмотря на то, что [b]SteamWorld Dig 2[/b] на данный момент является последней игрой студии, в сюжетном плане она занимает промежуточное место между [b]Dig[/b] и [b]Heist[/b]. Героиней новой части стала Дороти МакКранк, подруга того самого храбреца-рудокопа Расти из оригинальной игры. В свое время он одержал победу над предводителем вольтботов, а после неожиданно исчез. Идя по следам пропавшего друга, Дори оказывается в шахтерском городке Эль Макино, местные жители которого не на шутку встревожены подземными толчками. Что же касается Расти, тот отправился исследовать местную шахту и не вернулся. Ну чем не завязка для нового приключения?

Безумно радует тот факт, что каждая новая игра студии показывает их творческий рост. Важным сюжетным нововведением стало появление Фена – спрайта умерщвленного в первой части Вектрона. Этот персонаж путешествует с нами в течение всей игры, нередко вступая в диалог с героиней. Такая вроде бы мелочь, но уж очень удачно разбавляет свойственную оригиналу атмосферу тотального подземного одиночества. Неплохо переданы характеры жителей Эль Макино. Тут вам и самовлюблённый эгоистичный мэр, и мастер на все руки, и изобретатель до мозга костей, и ворчливая старушка, и коллекционер артефактов, и много кто еще. Самого сюжета, в принципе, стало больше: больше событий, персонажей, интриг, драмы, твистов, забавных шуточек и отсылок. Не стоит ждать от игры глубины [b]Bioshock Infinite[/b], ее там попросту нет, но в рамках платформера все выглядят очень достойно. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1657183395
[h1][b][i] «НЕ КОЧЕГАРЫ МЫ, НЕ ПЛОТНИКИ…»[/i][/b][/h1]

У [b]SteamWorld Dig[/b] была прекрасная концепция: вот тебе шахта, хватай кирку, рой проходы, добывай минералы, отбивайся от врагов и ищи устройства, позволяющие погружаться все глубже и глубже. В сиквеле не стали изобретать велосипед, вместо этого провели хорошую работу над ошибками, ввели парочку новых элементов и вдвое увеличили количество доступного контента. 

Начнем с приятных мелочей: в продолжении наконец-то адекватно реализовали систему быстрого перемещения. Если раньше приходилось покупать дорогостоящие хлипкие телепорты, потому что пневмотруб было ну очень мало, то сейчас шахта прямо-таки утыкана этими самыми пневмотрубами. Новинкой из разряда «как же раньше мы без этого жили» стали два устройства: кошка, с помощью которой можно подтянуться почти к любой поверхности, и реактивный двигатель, позволяющий взмывать в воздух на короткое время. Эти гаджеты заметно повысили динамику платформинг-составляющей. Очень кстати пришелся бомбомет, теперь без труда можно разделаться с каменной глыбой или врагом, находящимися вне досягаемости кирки. 

Заметно переделали систему апгрейда снаряжения. Качается оно по-старому – вливанием вечно золотых монет, а вот доводка производится за счет редко встречающихся шестеренок. Модификаций много, и они весьма нетривиальны. К примеру, вкачанный рюкзак будет телепортировать своего владельца на поверхность не хуже пневмотрубы, броня даст краткосрочный иммунитет к лаве и кислоте, водяной бак научится трансформировать световые сферы в воду, а кирка отбивать пущенные в героиню снаряды. А если необходимость в том или ином умении отпадет, то никто не запрещает вернуть шестеренки обратно и вложиться во что-нибудь более полезное. Для самых искушенных геймеров появились улучшения-модификаторы, одновременно и усложняющие, и упрощающие игровой процесс. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1657183746
[h1][b][i] «МУЛЬТЯШНЫЙ СТИМПАНК-ВЕСТЕРН» [/i][/b][/h1]

Все проекты линейки [b]SteamWorld[/b]  имеют уникальный дизайн, сочетающий в себе черты стимпанка и вестерна. Все это подается в красочном мультяшном виде и определенно подкупает потрясающей детализацией, сочностью эффектов и плавностью анимации. Я бы не сказал, что сиквел совершил какой-то технологический рывок, но спорить с тем, что количество приятных деталей и атмосферных штришков заметно увеличилось, было бы глупо. 

Кардинально изменился подход к левел-дизайну. Местом действия первой части была одна большая шахта, состоящая из трех уровней-миров со своей уникальной визуальной темой, набором врагов и препятствий. Сейчас количество шахт увеличилось втрое, да и выглядят они не в пример разнообразнее. Ко всему этому великолепию прилагается еще и неплохо проработанная и довольно обширная поверхность. Количество всевозможных хитро спрятанных артефактов и прочих полезных вещиц на уровнях возросло в разы. 

Пещеры, которых, кстати, тоже стало на порядок больше, сделаны очень качественно: каждая из них предлагает либо оригинальную полосу препятствий, либо занимательную логическую задачку, а иногда и все сразу. Для желающих проверить свою смекалку и сноровку – это именно то, что доктор прописал. Если же вам подобный контент неинтересен, то ройте себе дальше – посещение необязательно. 

Тенденция к наворачиванию всего и побольше не обошла стороной и музыкальную составляющую. Предшественница была очень бюджетной игрой, и как следствие приходилось слушать три зацикленные мелодии средней паршивости в течение пяти, а то и десяти часов. У продолжения с этим все явно лучше, а уж про то, насколько залипательным получился в этот раз саундтрек и говорить нечего, вкупе с увлекательнейшим геймплеем музыка действует прямо-таки гипнотически, времени просто не замечаешь. 

[i][h1][b] Достоинства: [/b][/h1]
+ Хороший сюжет со скидкой на жанр
+ Безумно залипательный игровой процесс
+ С новыми гаджетами стало еще веселее
+ Много отлично проработанных локаций
+ Хорошо продуманная система улучшений
+ Большое количество опционального контента
+ Самобытный визуальный стиль 
+ Гипнотический музыкальный ряд

[h1][b] Недостатки: [/b][/h1]
- Хорошей игры много не бывает [/i]

[h1][b]ВЫВОД: [/b] [b]SteamWorld Dig 2[/b] – это большая, разнообразная и стильная метроидвания, от которой невероятно сложно оторваться. Сиквелу удалось исправить  немногочисленные изъяны оригинала и привнести множество полезных нововведений. [/h1]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1521769345

author: {'steamid': '76561198106998085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1546874338}
review:
Great graphics and nice progression into a beautiful gameplay, with a character that is a joy to explore with with amazing tools and weapons. Too bad they didn't spend any time developing a big world with interesting enemies, a solid plot and strong complex situations to use the skills in. Instead the game ends what feels like a third of the way in. The few hours listed here includes me veering a lot to try to explore and not follow the main mission, but still I finished this quickly.

This is a training ground for a hero that is sent home packing once she's ready for her big adventure.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046201716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1546858439}
review:
На мобилке когда то была игра про гнома, который таскает руду из шахты. Так вот: эта игра собрада все плюсы той игры про гнома и нормального платформера. НО! Самый главный ее плюс в том, что она кончается не успев как следут надоесть.

Хорошая игра, заставляет вспомнить, почему мы вообще любим видеоигры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319711884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1569238999}
review: Начьнём с того што игра очень хорошая,Она проходится в целом за два дня. Нечем не напригает Хотя были там две ебучии головоломки с воганетками но спустя полтора часы ты понимаеш и проходиш. В ней есть понятный сюжет,Хорошая для токого стиля игры графика,Приятная музыка,Открытый мир только в некоторые локации можно попасть По продвижению игры . Личьно от себя добавлю мне было очень неприятин один факт што во второй части этой игры нету и нельзя избивать бомжей как это было в первой. Хотелось бы увидеть продолжение этой игры в 2019-2020. author: {'steamid': '76561197960295217', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1546790119}
review:
단점이 없을 정도의 수작
스웨덴 감성에 취한다 크으

1. 메트로베니아 & 플랫포머 융합이 매우 잘 이루어져 있음
2. 전작에 비해 스케일, 그래픽이 완전하게 업그레이드됨
3. 스토리적으로도 전작과 매우 유연하게 이어지며 심지어 1과 2 사이에 출시되었던 [스팀월드 하이스트]까지 완벽하게 이어줌
- 덕분에 세계관적으로도 매우 풍족하고 만족스럽게 느껴짐
4. 광물을 캐는 것도 노가다가 아니라 전반적인 스토리 진행에 맞게 밸런스를 잘 잡아놨음

author: {'steamid': '76561198054973039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1546234718}
review:
And everybody, THIS is how you do a sequel. If you played the SteamWorld Dig 1 game, be sure that this is by far the enhanced, better, more fun sequel. The developers showed creativity in improving the mechanics, and fleshing out aspects that simply make the world more fun.

+The main hub is now bigger, with more fun characters.
+Some annoying mechanics have been removed
+New weapons , enemy types , environments
+Challenge Caves are more fun
+Overall a better story
+Slightly better graphics

author: {'steamid': '76561198301145534', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1561639023}
review:
这么多好评我就不说优点了吧。总之呢，玩完一代觉得一般，再玩二代觉得简直晋升了一个新的高度，游戏趣味性和平衡性得到了很大的提升。游戏公司是好公司，这三部曲（暂时这么说吧）做的一个比一个好，很期待继续出游戏。

但是值得吐槽的就是没中文啊，前两作用汉化插件都可以，二代的还要下载D版替换才能玩，而且成就系统就无法激活，这就很蛋疼了（说实话我买正版就是为了做成就装逼的……）。好游戏但是玩的人少，可能就是语言少吧。希望Image & Form Games游戏公司能向绣湖系列一样弄个多语言支持，这样才能做大。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041615917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1546553618}
review: Great sequel. The visuals are mesmerising, the upgrade system has evolved and gives you a chance to make your playthrough unique on multple runs through the game. The levels are cleverly designed with an easter egg or two. The game itself is complex enough to keep you interested 'till the end and is not too long for those who have short attention span.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033666682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1652509260}
review: 前作のつもりでマップを見たら、とにかく広くて驚いた。上も下も横も！進めていけばワープポイントもたくさん見つかり、広いけれども好きなところから攻略できる手軽さが楽しい。ダンジョン内ダンジョンでパズルを解いていくうちに操作も慣れていくので、アクションが苦手でもそれなりに進められる難易度です。自身のパワーアップも前作より豊富です。歯車による改良は自由に変更可能。組み合わせによっては攻略が難しくなることもあります。基本の難易度も設定できますので、無理せず楽しく掘りつくすことができるゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198207083779', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 853, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1546482739}

It makes you want to always play it --> to discover everything above and beyond.  It plays so well!!!  It also has some really hard challenges - hah.  Of course one now can impatiently await the next sequel and grab it right away...to rescue the missing buddy!!!  Go go wonderful everything!!! YEAH!!!  Thank you so super very much!!!!!!!! :DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD


Oh and of course: the OST/Soundtracks are amazing as well.  Perfect for an adventuring digger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040811618', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1630434248}
review:
My nope list:

- Permanent resource loss if you die, since the ores wont pop back, only the mobs
- As you progress, controll will be the main challenge, at least with xbox controller. It feels more like a struggle than a challenge.
- At the start, you just keep running back to town, or miss lots of ores if you dont take damage and could keep going (you need light to see them, and thats really limited at first). 
- At the middle, you unlock a lot of good stuff, but you cant use most of them, since you dont have enought coins to activate them all (that comes from hidden treasures). That should make the game fun and replayable i guess. But for me, its more like overlimiting the player. Oh, and you still go back to town a lot, cos you either have enought space in your backpack, enought HP, water, ect, or collect and explore easily. 
- All in all, its not really rewarding, no real combat, clearly visible secrets.. its just grinding and exploration, and if you consider using a guide, the game will turn out to be a to-do check list, with music and graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154743253', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1546466323}
review: SteamWorld Dig tomó lo mejor de su predecesor para ampliar de una forma magistral el universo SteamWorld. A nivel gráfico destacan en sobremedida la ambientación que parece dibujada a mano con unos correctos efectos especiales de iluminación y sombreado que le dan un atractivo único, la banda sonora está completamente volcada a fusionarse con la ambientación para brindar una experiencia de juego bastante inmersiva. Mientras que la jugabilidad se ve ampliada en relación a su predecesor al añadir mejoras opcionales que podemos utilizar para explotar al máximo las habilidades de Dorothy. Sin duda alguna es un título que recomiendo para los amantes de los metroidvanias y los roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037116781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1546190127}
review: Un juego maravilloso, que consigue al 100% lo que se propone. Entretiene, vicia, tiene un diseño de niveles fantástico y un nivel de reto que sin ser enorme puede ser desafiante a la hora de hacer las pruebas de habilidad. Visualmente es fabuloso, y la música es lo suficientemente ambiental como para no hacerse nada pesada y, además, producirte cierto trance mientras cavas y vas explorando. Buscar los coleccionables y lograr todas las cuevas es muy divertido. Con el 1 lo pasé bien, pero el 2 lo ha mejorado claramente. Espero que haya un tercero, con más "biomas", que sea prácticamente un metroidvania de tomo y lomo de 20-30 horas. Sería genial,.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013484803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1678, 'last_played': 1546029055}
review: O jogo é muito bom! Ótima jogabilidade! As fases são muito bem elaboradas. Ficao viciante a medida que vc desbloqueia as habilidades com as engrenagens que vc acha pelas fases, algumas muito bem escondidas. Essas novas habilidades tornam a experiência de jogo ainda mais divertida. Me surpreendi com o jogo. O final é sucinto, mas nada que estrague a experiência. Na verdade ele indica que a 3ª versão vem aí. Recomnedado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086007940', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1562015656}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is a huge improvement over the first one. 
I found this game more engaging as it had a ton of secrets that are fun to find, a really nice readable map that helps you track your progress, a good upgrading system that lets you swap upgrades as you wish and lots more.
One of my favorites things in the game were the caves  with special challenges and puzzle solving. 

The visual design of the game is gorgeous, there are quite a few areas with their own distinctive look.
Overall, it is apparent that the artists, designers and developers put a lot of work and heart into this game.
I fully recommend it, even if you haven't played the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009256426', 'num_games_owned': 1966, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1545862695}
review:
I got this game from the #IndieXmas2018 campaign for free, in exchange for an honest opinion.

SteamWorld Dig 2 is one of the best Metroidvanias I've played. It's fun from the first moment, the graphics look gorgeous and its gameplay is very addictive.

The player is given a lot of freedom in where to go, to the point I got the jetpack really late in the game (making the game a little bit harder but also did get me an achievement) because I just wandered around instead of following the story.

Some minor criticism would be not enough resources to fully upgrade eveything, requiring some money grind in the endgame, and sometimes the grappling and climbing mechanics are a bit wonky.

Aside from that, it's a great game, really recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001614017', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1545780442}
review:
This is a great game: a worthy follow up, which improved upon the success of the original in pretty much every aspect. 

It's longer, there's more things to do, the mechanics are smoother. More of an actual Metroidvania, with a decent amount of back-tracking to explore segments of the map that you couldn't access when you first got there. 

While the maps (minus the caves) are randomly generated, I don't think the game's all that worth a replay, but I quite enjoyed the one play through that I did have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979378329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1545871370}
review:
Game has some decent elements. The problem is that most of those elements are poorly implemented, making many of the caves more frustrating then clever.  At the end of each area I find myself glad it is over rather than satisfied with the time spent.

Controls are ok if you like consoles, but this game should really just stay on that medium. It seems better suited for those types of gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096299973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1545509172}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is a direct sequel to SteamWorld Dig, It follows Dorothy/Dot as she tries to find Rusty following his disappearance at the end of the first game.

Graphically, it look the same as the original but with more detail and texturing. Not a huge difference, but it is noticable and gives the game more of a flare.

Transport system has been streamlined far more. There are no more ladders and torches, and you have multiple transport tubes which have to be discovered throughout the area, compared to the first game where you only had 1 and you had to buy a new one if you wanted to replace the preexisting one.

Resources are more diverse, and I actually noticed a difference this time around compared to the first game where they all felt jumbled together.

There are a lot more upgrades this time around. In fact, there are so many that you won't have enough money to buy them all, adding a little bit of strategy to the game. That being said, I didn't like that mining was your only method of making money. For a game that puts a lot of effort towards creating the town of El Machino, the buildings serve no purpose. It would've been cool to have a renovation system or maybe a task system for the different city inhabitants.

There are also cogs you can find (or buy, limited amount) throughout the game's world, which is far larger than the first SWD. Cogs are usually found in caves, which serve as the game's "side missions". Cogs can be used to give you bonuses for your machines or your character, like increasing element orbs generated by killed enemies or making your weapons stronger.

I was mixed on the caves. They have secrets in them, but these secrets are usually discovered through uncovering some hidden pathway rather than solving puzzles (a good puzzle one being the mine cart button one), the hidden pathways sometimes being contrived in terms of their location.

The world at times feels too big for the game's own good. It gets grindy pretty soon, compared to the first where, because it was shorter, didn't wear out its welcome. I also didn't like how you had to start off with just a pickax in the beginning like in SWD1. It felt annoying having to reupgrade my character. The developers should've done something like AC Rogue where, even though you had to reupgrade The Morrigan, you started off with the charge ram and a machine gun. SWD2 could've had you start off with the drill at least.

That's another thing, the drill (my favorite tool from the first game) is replaced with a jackhammer that isn't as good or cool looking. Water pools this time around last forever, meaning you don't have to worry about draining a source compared to the first game. This might be seen as a bad thing by some players, but it's not like SWD is an inherently strategic game series (at least not until the third one).

Took me about 6-7 hours to beat the story, but there is a lot of extra stuff via the caves though, as I said above, they lack genuine puzzle elements. There's also no post-game content, meaning (like with the first Rachet & Clank) you have to beat everything before doing the final boss, otherwise you'll have to rebeat the boss at the end.

However, I didn't end up 100% the game because it gets tiring having to look for every extra and secret. I wish there was a map or something that you could unlock, because the game really doesn't have good exploratory incentives like a Metroidvania title.

It was also dumb how, no matter how much you upgraded your armor, you still couldn't survive a falling boulder. Got really annoying, especially when you lose a cut of the game's already limited ores.

Fen is annoying, and his decision at the end (like with most of the game's emotional beats) comes off as contrived (much like how the ending of the first SWD wasn't sad).

I did end up putting in 12-13 hours before I decided it wasn't worth 100%ing, so SteamWorld Dig 2 falls under the buy category in terms of cost:gametime ratio ($20 for at least 10 hours fo content). That being said, because of the grinding, I did ultimately have less fun with this game than its predecessor, despite the tube and upgrade system improvements.

Respawning enemies annoying, especially those birds that make the irate noise.

Completed caves have a green checkmark on them. However, you can only see that when you exit a cave, meaning you could end up restarting it despite not getting everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043128189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1291, 'last_played': 1545084543}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067227433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1544828969}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is the perfect example of what all sequels should be: keeping the core elements which made the previous iteration brilliant and distinctive, and improving the formula on almost every aspect. 

Playing StemaWorld Dig 1 first is highly recommended.

[h1] Pros [/h1]
+ Instantly fun.
+ A lot of exploration.
+ Quite unique in terms of gameplay (2D Metroidvania + mining).
+ You are free to excavate the mine as it pleases you.
+ Very distinctive environments, atmospherically speaking. 
+ Hunting for the 42 missing artifacts is great.
+ Upgrades really change the way you play the game. 
+ You are mostly free to explore the world as it pleases you.
+ Some achievements are quite fun to unlock, especially the "Sequence breaker" one. 
+ Nice and interesting theme (post-apocalyptic cowboys robots). 
+ Knowing how much secrets remained to be found in each area is very handy.
+ A high level of polish makes the game shine. 
+ No useless backtracking thanks to a clever teleportation system.

[h1] Cons [/h1]
- The combat is not very interesting.
- The humor tends to be more silly than funny. 
- The game tends to be too casual in terms of difficulty (even though instant deaths happen).
- The "Hell" secret level is much too difficult compared to the rest of the game. 
- NPC are mostly cliché and not very interesting.
- Overall the story is quite barebones. 
- You are too much hand-guided in the story, where to go and so on.
- No side quests. 
- Compared to the first game, the light system is basically useless (especially once you purchase the "infinite light" upgrade). 

[h1] Verdict [/h1] 
If you like silly Flash games where you grind some funny little stuff to get upgrades and do the same thing better over and over, you will find something of the same spirit in SteamWorld Dig 1 & 2, which are games easy to get into, mildly addictive, and borderline casual. But it's also much better, extremely polished, and has a lot more depth. Especially, you are offered a huge world to explore and to get lost into. Sometimes I was amazed to access some secret room which turned out to be a huge corridor leading to a part of the map yet greater than what I had already explored. The additional "caves" spread all over the map usually offer a more puzzle-oriented or platforming-skills oriented challenge, which is welcome. 

Briefly speaking, you can't really be wrong playing SteamWorld Dig 2. It's beautiful, it's clever, it's fun, and the game just gets better and better as you play it. It's a very strong recommendation.

[h1] How is it better than the first SteamWorld? [/h1]

It's better in every aspect. Graphics are nicer, the world is bigger, the feeling of freedom is much more intense. It really follows the exact same structure (mining in the overall map, coming back to town to heal and get upgrades, unlocking teleporting point, going into "challenge" caves, unlocking the same new abilities). The environments are more atmospheric, there are much more upgrades available (and you can't have them all at once, but you are free to try different of them each time you go to town, so there is a mild "build" element), and, for some unclear reason, all the ingredients work together even better than they already were. 

Overall, SteamWorld Dig 2 takes a step further away from the "addictive Flash game" structure of the first, and sometimes it feels. There are components of the game which are simply relics from the first, for instance the light. You are equipped with a light which runs out of fuel over time. When it stops, you are left in the near dark and it get quite hard (but not terribly so either) to go back to the town if you are away from a teleporter. In the first game, this was quite an issue as you wanted to keep longer and longer in the mine, so you wanted to upgrade that light. Here, it's not that important and you soon end up with an ever-lasting light, as if the devs decided that this component was best left out of the game after all. 

As the focus of SteamWorld Dig 2 is much more placed on the freedom of exploration (and it works!), there is less incentive to get the upgrades. I never felt the urge to play "just a tad longer" to get this alluring upgrade within my reach, which was the main driving force behind the gameplay of the first game. The consequence of this is that SteamWorld Dig 2 is a bit less addictive... but has a lot more depth and delivers a more powerful experience of exploration and discovery. You don't care that much about the pick either because there is less difference in the sturdiness of the blocks as you explore the world (in the first one, the deeper you went, the sturdier were the blocks, forcing you to upgrade continually your pickaxe to avoid spending infinite time digging your into the mine; while it is also true here, you discover all different environments before finishing any of them, so the blocks do not because sturdier after a point early on in the game). Even if the two games are closely similar, this shift of focus alters how you feel playing it -in my opinion for the best.

[h1] How could it have been improved? [/h1]

The thing is, the end kinda tells you that the game should receive another sequel. That's exciting, and the new perspective offered at the end only raises expectation. Yet, there are a few elements which could been significantly improved, in my opinion.

First, the "Hell" level is really frustrating. The game is supposed to be played by a large audience: it's pleasantly easy, and the challenge lies into the exploration more than the pure platforming skills. Therefore, adding a secret level, which rewards hours of exploration, just to tell the player "Eh, you started to thought you were good? Nope, you just suck terribly." is mean. I really disliked it, especially considering that I love to explore, to unlock every secrets, and I had to pass on this one. 

Second, the game is much too guided. There is a blue cross which tells you where to go. Fortunately, purchasing the "Sequence breaker" achievement, I strayed away from the main story and explored more freely, and it felt extremely good. I recommend to do it even if it breaks the story and doesn't make really sense (perhaps they should have made alternative dialogues to fix this). Also, the NPCs are pretty much useless (you have sellers and characters you are required to speak to to get further in the main story), while they could have given you fun side quests. I would have loved side quests and the game can easily implement them. 

Third, the combat is mostly boring. Since the game is quite easy and you have a lot of health points, you don't really bother and I tended to kill every enemies by running into them. You only have a pickaxe that you have to time precisely and that has no range at all, so it's not really interesting. The hook is nicer in that it allows you to slightly push an enemy. Overall, the fight component is really not deeply thought out, and it has almost no interest in the game.

Fourth, there could always be more exploration! The game already improves a lot compared to the firs SteamWorld Dig. But I would have liked to find more secret rooms, completely useless to the main story, more secret passways, and it would have been cool if the artifacts you hunt for in the game have had a purpose (for instance, additional pieces of lore, not just silly jokes which fall flat for the great majority of them). Side quests could also help having areas unrelated to the main story, while giving a purpose to explore them. 

I therefore hope the third SteamWorld Dig will have a more non-linear structure, more secrets, and side quests. Combat is not that crucial to improve since the exploration really is the selling point of the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048101201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1543545994}
review:
This is a fun sequel to Steamworld Dig - it's very much the same game as the latter, with a new world, new story, and a few mechanical tweaks. You spent most of your time digging around for resources and secrets, and occasionally encountering story tidbits; there's platforming that's occasionally a bit challenging but never overwhelming, combat that feels hectic but survivable, and an upgrade system that's fairly broad but still allows flexibility through the use of Cogs, which are upgrade points you can use to activate and deactivate bonuses you've unlocked at any time. Essentially, you can respec for free any time you return to town, which is a fantastic system for encouraging experimentation!

I would recommend playing the original Steamworld Dig first, not only for story purposes but also because the first game really introduces the mechanics that this one builds on. Overall, a solid follow-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022631050', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1708, 'last_played': 1543503720}
review:
Мне понравилась первая часть, поэтому вторую ждал. Игра не разочаровала.
Все что было в первой части + стало красивее, разнообразней музыка и уровни, больше вариантов апгрейда.
Прошел за 23 часа 38 минут.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977904226', 'num_games_owned': 1151, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1528411935}
review:
I really enjoyed the previous Steamworld games, so it's no wonder that the sequel engaged me quickly. It picks up after the first game's events where you have to explore the mines and search for answers behind your missing friend (the first game's protagonist). 

As a sentient robot, you'll collect minerals and relics that'll enable you to get upgraded in order to overcome new obstacles along the way. There are rewarding secrets to be uncovered and fun moments to keep you engaged. The game's flow is quite seamless and adds to the addiction value, which makes it hard to notice how much time has passed in one sitting. 

Warmly recommended for action adventure gamers, even those who enjoy exploration and the digging mechanics akin to Terraria and the likes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967439122', 'num_games_owned': 2256, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1511762684}
review: This is probably the "best" Metroidvania you can play.  Simple mechanics, pulling the best bits of Motherload and Super Metroid, but difficult to master.  Tons of challenges and extra play modes.  Well worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000402775', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1528852399}
review: An incredibly solid sequel which builds upon the mechanics established in the first game in a very satisfying manner. The varying approaches to navigate the environments, battle enemies, and even customizing the difficulty made exploration rewarding, fun, and tense at times. In every way, I think this made for an impressive sequel, and eagerly look forward to new entries in the series, or games produced by the developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983905441', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1666995330}
review:
Played it on Linux Mint 19.3.

Another great installment of Steamworld franchise. It improves everything, what was in the first game. The maps are a lot more detailed and diverse. There are new enemies, the game is twice as long as its predecessor. Plot is basic, but that is not what makes a great platformer. If you enjoyed Steamworld Dig 1, do not even hesitate. If you never played SD1, play it first and after it, this game.  This game is all around great, very pleasing graphics, good sound composition, great controller support (used XONE controller). Recommend it 100%.

review: A tile digger game and a metroidvania masterfully blended together. author: {'steamid': '76561198034357591', 'num_games_owned': 1539, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1549044506}
review:
Everytime I play one of the Steamworld Dig games I seem to almost instantly enter a flow state, similar to that "just one more turn" phenomenon so many people experience playing Civilization games. The difficulty and content pacing are just so expertly tuned that I never feel like I run into excessive challenges or new content lulls, and yet it's also not too easy or a content flood either. It might be a touch on the easy side, especially once you get upgrades (most Metroidvanias have this problem though) but overall it achieves a balance that's a really rare thing to experience in a platformer. 

The second game here is an improvement in every way over the first. Better look (the art design is top notch), better sound, better protagonist, significantly better story, significantly more content, better mechanics and most importantly vastly better level design due to its embrace of metroidvania style progression. I didn't envision a Steamworld Dig game leaning so hard into the Metroidvania route with its digging mechanics (figured a Rogue-like was the more likely evolution despite some of the nods in the first game), but boy am I glad they did as it really fits with what they've built. You'll quickly enter a loop of going digging to find upgrades and currency and then scrambling back to town to cash your findings in. Each subsequent foray into the underground becoming longer and longer in duration with your haul becoming bigger and bigger as your upgrades permit.  It's one of those games you'll will want to find 100% of collectibles, simply because the act of doing so is so fun and rewarding. Doesn't hurt that there's a simple yet charming story to witness to boot.

If you like 2d metroidvanias platformers, give this a look. This is about as close to perfect one of those as they come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333734444', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1523341192}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 é um dos melhores metroidvanias que joguei em 2018, quase empatando com o recente Hollow Knight.

Consegue expandir em todos os conceitos que o primeiro jogo introduziu, possuindo cavernas bem mais longas, vários segredos e coletáveis a serem encontrados, puzzles muito mais interessantes e bem formulados, mais powerups, um pós-game, momentos marcantes e um lore mais interessante e que resolve o cliffhanger do primeiro jogo e ainda consegue conectar os jogos Dig ao SteamWorld Heist.

Possui um art style muito bonito e muito bem mais detalhado que o primeiro, junto animações super fluídas e uma trilha sonora bem atmosférica produzida em parte pelo mesmo compositor que participou de parte da OST de Hotline Miami, El Huervo. 

SteamWorld Dig 2 me pegou de surpresa, já que eu não esperava uma evolução tão grande dos conceitos apresentados no primeiro jogo. O jogo deveria ser mais cansativo pela mecânica ser, em teoria, bem básica. Mas a Image & Form conseguiu fazer um level design tão interessante que mesmo com 28 horas de jogo não me senti enjoado nenhuma vez e que ainda me faz ter vontade de rejogar. Imaginei que fosse ser uma experiência legal, e nada mais do que isso. Mas o jogo foi TUDO o que eu queria que o 1º fosse, e ainda foi um pouco além mais do que isso. Um dos melhores indies que já joguei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014476945', 'num_games_owned': 1498, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1587910612}
review:
Прекрасное предолжение, великолепное издание малоизвестной студии. Пройдя игру вы узнаете не только что же случилось с нашим старым, ржавым Расти, но и узнаете некоторые подробности этой увлекательной вселенной.
Графика по сравнению с перовй частью стала в разы лучше, а это радует 5 водяных буров из 5.
Музыка не много попечалила меня, Но я сравниваю со Steam World Hiest, а здесь 3 удара капли лавы об пол из 5.
Геймплей на высоте! Очень порадовал сюжет, хитрые секреты, непростые пещеры одназначно 10 потеряных ржавых паровых роботов из 5 заявленых!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017728189', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1669310761}
review:
Awesome game with awesome gameplay. 

When I played the first game - I knew it's something special. It has it's own style, it has cartoonish but quite immersive world. This game is like the first one but more amazing, more interestin, funny, sometimes relaxing, sometimes it makes you clutch. It's not very long (~8 hours for main story plus few more hours for additional endgame content), but this is exiting expirience. 

Now on sme technical details. 
The game is best played with a controller (however, keyboard can be used too). 
Learning curve is not very steep. Game can be played even by kids. 
Optimisation is good (it should be, it's a 2D platformer) so should be fine even on low-end machines. 
Visuals are fasinating. Game deffinatelly has it's own style and looks. 
Gameplay is fun. Playing it is a pure joy.

Would I recommend this game? Hell yeah, I would. 

(If you haven't played the first game - consider it before playing this one).

author: {'steamid': '76561198035171115', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1199, 'last_played': 1604948222}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 - крайне залипательный платформер, от которого невозможно оторваться. Помимо основных элементов игр подобного жанра, В игре присутствуют базы, выполненные в виде мини-поселений, где можно сдать добытые минералы, проапгрейдить броню или оружие или прикупить полезные предметы, которые будут помогать доставать редкие минералы. Игра разделена на несколько миров, отличающихся дизайном и врагами, их населяющих. Помимо этого, в игре присутствует огромное количество секретных мест и редких трудноступных артефактов.
Подводя итоги, можно сказать, что SteamWorld Dig 2 (впрочем, как и первая часть) - это платформер в лучшем его проявлении, фактически, это эталон в мире платформеров. Однозначно рекомендую эту замечательную игру всем!

author: {'steamid': '76561198232837092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1541441617}
review:
How to make a proper sequel 101

Steamworld Dig 1 was a wonderful little time-waster of a game. It introduced new gameplay features at a steady pace and rewarded the player handsomely for exploring new areas. Most of all, however, the game ran well in a technical sense and could be picked up and played for as long (or as little) as one liked. So how exactly do you up the ante and surpass the preceding game in every way? By making the sequel better, of course.

Steamworld Dig 2 provides a boost to pretty much everything when compared to its predecessor. The story is the weakest link of the game, but surely you don't play a game like this for the story. Dorothy, a side character from the previous game, goes to search for the now-missing hero of the previous game, Rusty the robot. On her journey, Dorothy soon comes face to face with a mischievous machine spirit, Fen, who accompanies her throughout the game. Fen's purpose is to provide some snappy dialogue and help Dorothy, but fortunately she comes off as funny, rather than annoying like Navi in Ocarina of Time. 

Graphical fidelity has gotten a facelift, too, as the game looks even more beautiful than the first one. Musical score is also great, with certain tracks like the tune of El Machino standing high among the OST's. What is perhaps most important, however, much more effort has been allocated to the level-design itself this time around. There is some great variance in terms of levels and each is packed with secrets to find. Naturally, most of the areas contain hard-to-reach places which require you to come back later once you've acquired proper equipment. This is for the most part comepletely optional, however, since the game doesn't force you to collect everything. 

Like with Steamworld Dig 1, the second game relies on the mining mechanic. As Dorothy, you dig and mine your way through various environmental hazards and collect precious resources on the way. You sell these resources to a vendor in the town of El Machino and use the money buy new gear. What is different this time around is that you'll gain access to better and more potent gear more early on, making the pace of gameplay feel more fun. Cogs are introduced as new collectibles which can also be purchased for a price at El Machino. Cogs can be used to upgrade your gear, but the upgrades can be undone free of charge any time you want. This free upgrade system is not only very lenient towards the player, but it also supports mixing and matching different upgrades to suit your personal playstyle.

The game does an admirable job in streamlining the overall experience. One of the downsides of Steamworld Dig 2 is that some players might find it pretty challenging to go back to the first game and enjoy it after playing the second one. The overall length of the game depends on how thoroughly you want to uncover all secrets and upgrade your gear. My playthrough took me a little over 8 hours with a moderate amount of secrets found and most of my stuff upgraded to the maximum degree. There are no online elements in this game. And no microtransactions. 

Steamworld Dig 2 is one of the best indie games of 2017 and a more-than-worthy sequel to its predecessor.

Pros:
+ Beautiful audiovisual design with gorgeous graphics and snazzy OST
+ Better core abilities and a lenient upgrade system
+ More varied levels 
+ No P2W, no microtransactions
+ Easy to pick up and put down; play for 15 minutes or two hours

Cons:
- If you play this before the first game, you may not like the first game too much

author: {'steamid': '76561198047371910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1542097312}
review: A fine game, it has enough appealing aspects to warrant a try from most people. From the videos and screenshots provided on the store you might think this game is like minecraft or terraria, but the play experience is much different. It is open world, but it is not sandbox. There are a few areas in the game that you bounce around in but it feels pretty linear, as the story directs you to certain places at certain times, and you can return to them later when you have more abilities similar to a metroidvania. Most games of this genre have some randomization to the map layout but I don't believe this one does. The digging in the game feels more like hollowing out the levels that are already set out for you. It facilitates the puzzle mechanics and the gathering of resources which feels much more like a collectathon than randomly striking the motherload like in a sandbox game. What you end up with is an experience similar to starbound, but on a more linear and smaller scale and in a steampunk wild west setting. Its also perhaps more like a metroidvania with the power-ups and upgrades. The story is okay and serves it's purpose (the vectron part is cool though, you'll find out what im talking about), the art is simple but appealing, music is mediocre and so is the sound design. If i could give a middling review I would because I think you should try terraria and starbound first, but again the game is fairly good and shouldn't dissapoint, especially if your a fan of adventure games/metroidvania.

review: I give it a solid meh/10. Nothing was very bad, nothing too great either. Rough at the start before you get some of the movement abilities, limited light means you can't even explore very long without surfacing frequently. You get upgrades later which trivialize some annoying mechanics, but why put those mechanics in in the first place? Overall its a fine game, at least I made it all the way through. But I can't help think there was something better I could have been playing instead.

review:
比起前作 本作更加注重于平台跳跃和解谜 做的还是蛮好的 各种神奇的道具大大加强灵活性

然而相对的弱点也暴露出来了 游戏核心要素挖矿被大大忽视，难度曲线及其不合理，前期绞尽脑汁攒钱找位置挖一些小矿，后期矿就是白给，太弱智了。特别是火箭背包的存在，极大地削弱了地形的意义。

可还是瑕不掩瑜，对于喜好平台跳跃，解谜还有寻找隐藏宝藏的人呢还是不错的游戏，虽然没有中文，但不影响游戏体验，值得一试。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970934254', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1541294728}
review: The second one in the series is quite good. I like the changes to the caves--which they now tell you if they're completed in there entirety. It's also nice that the game is less linear in regards to digging. There are also fantastic powerups for you to enable, which allows for some great customization with the character. It was actually quite interesting that end game I didn't have enough money to upgrade everything--and I had completely dug every gem out. There's a ton of fantastic new moves and it plays more like a metroidvania than the first. In all, I certainly recommend it, but for some reason, it didn't have the same charm to me as the first. The town is way too busy graphically. In fact, the graphics are crazy polished, perhaps I liked the simpler look and feel. Game felt a bit more sluggish. I spent about 8 hours on the first one, 14 hours on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 4487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1666689096}
review:
And yet another game from Image & Form where I loaded the game, saw the intro screen and got hooked immediately. I don't know how these people do it, really. But I'm very happy that they do.
SteamWorld Dig 2 picks up where The Game That Showed Digging Is Fun ended - after a huge battle, Rusty has gone missing, and Dorothy (Dot), who befriended him during the first game, decides that the town (and she personally) owe him as much to go looking for him. The game starts with her camping out and browsing a map - so let's dive again into the wonderful SteamWorld and help her!

While the game starts with the same digging-and-finding-treasure mechanic as the first episode, it pretty soon (after 20-30 minutes) starts to show it wants to be a proper 2nd installment - bigger, more elaborate and more diverse while keeping the core values of the original. The slightly chaotic upgrade system of the first game turns into a well structured workbench, and we get a kind of skill tree perk system as well, available via the cogs scattered (mostly hidden) in the game's world. As usual, half of the perks are pretty useless for experienced players, some are very useful, and luckily, there are some that are first class fun. 
Dot's tools are also somewhat different - there's the pickaxe and the steampunch, but there's a grappling hook in place of the drill, and the static dash is replaced with... well, you'll see, but something much more powerful. There are more subtle changes as well, but these two determine the game's direction - while the original was a digging game, SWD2 is a mix between digging and aerial navigation.

Being a true 2nd installment, the visuals and especially the animations are much prettier, while the soundtrack is somewhat different - less oppressive but also somewhat less atmospheric. The controls are again well done, although when you try to rely on the hookshot too much you'll realize they're not perfect. However this will mostly affect you if you want to some of the the game's objectives out of sequence, before getting the... powerful thing.

As with Image & Forms previous games, I love SteamWorld Dig 2 to bits. It's a more ambitious game than its predecessor, which means a more diverse but also a less perfect end result. Rusty's toolkit of pickaxe + drill + steampunch is not surpassed here, but Dot's more navigation focused loadout opens up different gameplay opportunities. At the end, if I want the pure digging experience of SWD1, then I can go back and replay it as the map is mostly randomly generated - while SWD2 is a more traditional platforming experience, with lots of digging. And a wonderfully fun and entertaining platformer at that. Recommended? You bet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206760365', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1543120563}
review:
I found this game really fun, colorful, rewarding.  A nice break from my more strategic and challenging games.   But I give a negative review for three reasons.  

1) Once you acquire the jetpack, the whole game changes, and the work you put into finding many secrets becomes trivial.  (Although the jetpack is also really fun.  Wheeee!).  Game becomes less of a strategic dig-em-up and more of a "fly around smashing blocks and monsters-em-up"

2) Game is too short, especially for the asking price of 20 U.S dollars.  I played for about 11 hours, could have finished it sooner but spent some time getting some remaining secrets and powerups.

3) LIttle replayability, other than finding a few more secrets / hidden items and going for the "A+" score.  Once you have done the missions and secrets you know how they are done.

So, I can only recommend this game if it is on sale for 5$ or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189962585', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1671740658}
review:
Steamworld dig 1 je podle mě neokázalou a nudnou hrou na zabíjení času. No a Steamworld Dig 2 je přesně ten typ hry, ve který jsem doufal. Společnost Image & Form Games se v této hře nesnaží obnovit syl jeho předchůdce, místo toho se soustředí na vytvoření dobrodružného a okouzlujícího světa.

Není tu technicky nic co bych mohl vytknout. Vše funguje perfektně. Krásně zpracované prostředí a grafika, srdečná estetika, hezký design postav a hudba, která perfektně vystihuje myšlenku hry. Když jsem poprvé dorazil do městěčka, nemohl jsem si pomoci, zastavil jsem a jenom poslouchal. 

Steamworld Dig 2 není žádný přelomový titul, ale proces kopání se přes půdu kostičku po kostičce, nebo sbírání předmětů a vylepšování vašeho charakteru je dosti odlyšný od jiných metroidvániích. Jednoduché ovládání, příjemná hudba a okouzlující svět dělá ze hry klenot a pokud máte rádi tento styl, koupi rozhodně litovat nebudete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119727320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1539071144}

author: {'steamid': '76561198820716376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1539092019}
review: The original, but better. Fixes a lot of the annoying things from the first game and has a lot more depth. Would have been even better with some form of newgame+ mode. This would ideally include a regenerated map because resources are scarce after one playthrough, which makes it a lot less motivating to go for 100% on the secrets and upgrades. Still recommended though!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968303650', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1557603071}
review: What can I say about this game? Absolutely outstanding. It takes everything the first game did but makes it all better. Which really is a rare thing in gaming. I was so sad when the game finished. I could have actually gone on for hours and hours digging, exploring and collecting. That almost never happens with me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043924444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1538763089}

author: {'steamid': '76561198862126911', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1538871330}
review:
Pros: 
Fluid gameplay 
Stellar soundtrack 
Fun exploration
Great/humorous characters 
Cons: some areas have frame rate drops 
Story is lackluster and gets repetitive 
Conclusion: 
It's a great metroidvania, one of the genres best, but is a more quirky kind of game. I would reccomend if you're into metroidvania's.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990607803', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1658606686}
review:
A nice combination of of puzzles, RPG elements, and an improvement of the online game Motherload. Beautiful artwork, cutesy themes and an excellent inventory system, although the limited bag space can sometimes get tedious when you have to continuously backtrack

Difficulty does not scale too well, as the game becomes insanely easy once you have the necessary upgrades for 50% light as well as near infinite water. Even more so when the jetpack is fully upgraded

If there was the option to make the game even more difficult from the start and some of the equipment was balanced it would be a perfect 5/7

author: {'steamid': '76561198076219837', 'num_games_owned': 3116, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1537722738}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 mejora dramáticamente casi todo lo establecido en el original, principalmente cambia de tener niveles generados aleatoriamentes a ser un mundo diseñado a mano. Sin mencionar que continua con la narrativa establecida en el SWD1

Lo bueno:
+Gran variedad de poderes y mejoras.
+Platforming solido.
+Niveles y retos bien pensados y entretenidos.
+El juego es bastante felixible con la manera en que decides aproximarte a la mayoria de los problemas, te permite ser creativo.
+Boss battles buenas mas no excelentes.

Lo malo:
-Sountrack no diria que es malo, pero es bastante olvidable, literalmente lo mejor es bajarle todo el volumen y poner tu propia musica, esto mejora muchisimo tu experiencia con el juego.

¿Lo recomiendo?
Si, pero no pagues mas de 10 dolares por este, es un juego maravilloso, pero es algo corto y no tiene tanto replay value.

review: I really enjoyed this hybrid action platformer with crafting. A bit short (less than 8 hours to complete), but decent replay value trying for speed runs and that kind of thing if you want. Also, I don't always want a game that's going to consume 100 hours of my life. If you like the look of the screenshots and think this is the kind of game you'd like, it's an easy recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320551968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3155, 'last_played': 1590014655}
review:
Изумительная игрушка! Особенно для тех, кто вырос на Dendy.
После первой части взял эту даже не задумываясь - и не прогадал. Разработчики, как уже многие игроки подметили, доработали то, что, казалось бы, уже и так отлично работает. Добавленная способность модифицировать себя не "намертво", а с возможностью пересобирать скиллы позже - офигенна. Ты для каждого своего похода подбираешь нужные тебе способности.
Для тех, кто прошел сюжет полностью есть пещера испытаний, которые пройдет только профи со стальными нервами, быстрыми пальцами и правильно подобранными навыками персонажа.
Если коротко:
Плюсы:
- Отличная графика
- Интригующий сюжет (для платформера)
- Возможности изменять свои способности
- Размер карты (по сравнению с первой)
- Разнообразные головоломки и секреты
- Отличная локализация (ближе бандерлоги)
- Мега-кошка!!!
Минусы:
Для платформера - их нет. Упоротая пещера испытаний - ну, на то они и испытания.
Однозначно советую всем! Уже подсадил жену и друзей))

author: {'steamid': '76561198161208617', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1559682473}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971080638', 'num_games_owned': 1481, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1675656473}
review:
This game is truly great! I consider it to be a Metroidvania above all else. The pasing is excellent and the level design is great. The story is pretty good, even though it's not a huge deal. The sounds and music are great. It really makes you more immersed in the are you are in. The controls are great. All-in-all, this is a really great game and I highly recommend it!

Note: I put most of my hours in on the Switch version.

review:
Fand den ersten Teil großartig, gestern Teil 2 runtergeladen und erst mal zwei Stunden gespielt, alles gut soweit, dann das Spiel kurzzeitig geschlossen um eine Partie AoE2 zu spielen. Seitdem hab ich sobald ich das Spiel öffne (SteamworldDig) eine Framerate von ca. 1 Frame alle 10 sec.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026208716', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1533598944}
review:
Este juego lo identifico como el Dig Dug moderno. Jugué solo un rato la primera entrega de este título, no me gusto, no soy fan de la saga pero éste juego me encanto. Es muy entretenido, bastante fácil y relajante incluso.

Hice un gameplay en mi canal de Youtube
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4z9actjs7ak

Este juego más que nada es entretenido para pasar un rato agradable, tiene unos cuantos acertijos pero no son para arrancarse las greñas, quedarse atascado y volverse loco. De hecho diría que no es necesario descubrir todos los secretos o ítems para lograr avanzar.

Es un juego de aventura y exploración, en la historia nos indican que vamos en busca de nuestro amigo Rusty, así que ahí el pretexto. Comenzamos con un pico de minero pero conforme avanzamos nos vamos equipando con un buen arsenal de ítems, yo veo que no es un juego de peleas intensas es mas como recreativo, de explorar pero se siente una buena satisfacción encontrar los secretos que hay por todo el mapa.


Lo que no me gusto:
Las armas, “le hace falta ver más bax”. Sentí que estaba indefenso pues siempre esperaba algún tipo de arma apta para la guerra y iba a quedar atascado en algún momento ya que no veía avance en mis habilidades de ataque y sentí que le faltó un poco de picante en ese aspecto, aunque siendo justos solo lo termine en dificultad normal, imagino que en difícil la cosa ya se pone más intensa. Básicamente  todo el arsenal es para la exploración no esperes batallas épicas contra los jefes al menos no en normal.

Y de hecho si esto fue el talón de Aquiles que me mantuvo desesperado contra el jefe que esta en la lava porque el sí trae armas buenas y te jode a su antojo y nomas atorado esperando una oportunidad. Es el único que te puede retrasar en la aventura.

Es un buen juego, lo recomiendo sobre todo a los jugadores jóvenes que a veces quieren algo facilón.
Es de un ritmo muy tranquilo y quizá a mucho jugador “hardcore” le aburra.
El precio se me hace un poquitín alto (cuestión de esperar una oferta XD)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972835583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1514652330}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068627926', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1533424928}
review:
MEGA GEILES SPIEL!

Tiefer und immer tiefer dringt man in den Berg ein und man wundert sich echt: "Es geht immer noch tiefer!"
Am Anfang wollte ich keine Rädchen ausgeben, weil man bestimmt besseres bekommt und es sinnvoller einsetzen kann, aber man kann sie zurück nehmen ;-)

Einige Bereiche sind super Hardcore und in anderen Bereichen, kann man ganz enspannt graben. Die Musik ist hammer. Irgend wann will man nicht mehr "Looten & Leveln" und man geht zum Endboss.

Ich fühle mich zu keiner Zeit schlecht unterhalten.

Zeit: 14 Std 34 Min 07 Sek
Tode: 41
Vermögen: $ 15575
Geheimnisse: 61%

- Teil 1 habe ich noch nicht gespiel, vielleicht hole ich es nach -

author: {'steamid': '76561197974582573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1532882521}
review: Definitely one of the most rewarding and chillaxing games I have played since a long time. It's not very long, but if you have a busy day and just want to relax for 30 or 60 minutes without too much hassle, this is a safe pick. Absolutely recommended, if you don't have any good reason to avoid platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093507478', 'num_games_owned': 4755, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1512004688}
review:
Не космос, метры грунта надо мной,
И в шахте не до праздничных процессий,
Но мы владеем тоже внеземной
И самою земною из профессий.

Любой из нас, ну чем не чародей,
Из преисподней наверх уголь мечем.
Мы топливо отнимем у чертей,
Свои котлы топить им будет нечем.

Да, сами мы, как дьяволы в пыли,
Зато наш поезд не уйдет порожний.
Терзаем чрево матушки-земли,
Но на земле теплее и надежней.

Вот вагонетки, душу веселя,
Проносятся, как в фильме о погонях,
И шуточку: даешь стране угля!
Мы чувствуем на собственных ладонях.

Воронками изрытые поля не позабудь
И оглянись во гневе.
Но нас, благословенная земля,
Прости за то, что роемся во чреве.

Да, мы бываем в крупном барыше,
Но роем глубже, словно не насытясь.
Порой копаться в собственной душе
Мы забываем, роясь в антраците.

Вгрызаясь в глубь веков хоть на виток
(То взрыв, то лязг - такое безгитарье!),-
Вот череп вскрыл отбойный молоток,
Задев кору большого полушарья.

Не боялся заблудиться в темноте
И захлебнуться пылью - не один ты.
Вперед и вниз - мы будем на щите,
Мы сами рыли эти лабиринты.

Сорвано, уложено, сколото
Черное надежное золото.

https://youtu.be/DOXDqNYzljI

author: {'steamid': '76561198043317540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1533011405}
review:
A polished little mixture of Metroidvania platforming/gadgetry and the ubiquitous "dig in the mine" games, combining the enjoyability of the two.

Plusses:
[list]
[*] plenty of upgrades and collectibles
[*] decent variation in environments, tactics, and enemies
[*] some creative puzzle elements
[*] goals and destinations are always clear; you're never left wondering where to go or what to do
[/list]

Negatives:
[list]
[*] very few boss fights
[*] difficulty could be ratcheted up, especially at the end of the game
[*] relatively short compared to most games of this genre; expect anywhere from 3 (blaze through) to 12 (explore, collect everything) hours of gameplay
[/list]

But for what it is, a very well deserved 8/10. I enjoyed the little time I had.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985957043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1592195998}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169101977', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1532799767}
review:
Отличная метроидвания на несколько вечеров.
По сравнению с первой частью чувствуется большой прогресс. 

Во-первых, у нас появилось множество [i]независимых[/i] локаций.
Хотя из механик про копание особо многого не выжмешь, разработчики на славу постарались.
Например, прохождение кислотных болот кардинально отличается от прохождения лавового храма.
Каждая локация хранит свои секреты и свои улучшения.
Особенно мне понравилось, что в какой-то определённый момент можно просто начать бродить по миру и всё исследовать.

Во-вторых, есть пару десятков пещер, в каждой из которых есть своё испытание. И их разнообразие просто поражает.
Серьёзно, в этой игре сплелись и логические головоломки, и испытания на скорость, и потайные комнаты, требующие внимательности. Такое разнообразие приятно удивило.
Ну а когда получаешь новый древний артефакт, каждый раз празднуешь свою маленькую победу.

В-третьих, в игре есть куча улучшений, которые можно получать за шестерёнки — особую «валюту», обитающую в тайных закоулках мира.
Чем дальше вы прокачиваетесь — чем больше улучшений. Причём вы можете менять набор улучшений, адаптируясь к текущей локации.

В-четвёртых — это потрясный крюк-кошка. Взрывайте предметы, подбирайте драгоценности, притягивайтесь, отталкивайте врагов — возможностей не перечесть.

Графика, как и раньше, достаточно приятная.
Локализация без косяков.
Музыка — расслабляющая, ненапряжно играющая на фоне, какой и должна быть.
Управление — точное и понятное, как и должно быть для платформеров. Мне некоторые кнопки на геймпаде показались не слишком удобными, но это не проблема, потому что игра позволяет переназначить управление.

Прохождение с 100%-ым исследованием мира заняло 12 часов. Пожалуй, скучновато было только в конце, когда искал последние секреты в каждой локации.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025187473', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1531627471}
review:
SteamWorld Dig was a fantastic game, SteamWorld Dig 2 is an incredible game.
I saw another review saying "This is how you do a seuqel", and I have to wholeheartedly agree.

The game is easily twice as long as the first, now with a multiple areas to mine in comparison to SWD1's single mineshaft.

All of Dorothy's tools are completely new but also serve a simillar purpose to everything Rusty could use and then some.
On top of that, everything can be costumized with upgrades that you can turn on and off, swap them out for something else or find enough cogs to use multiple upgrades together.
If a challenge cave is too hard, get some upgrades and return later.

If you loved SteamWorld Dig, you absolutely must buy SteamWorld Dig 2, you're going to love it even more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304699736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2077, 'last_played': 1620897049}
review:
Pros: Very good game, fluid gameplay, lots of secret area.

Cons: No replayability, for me, at least.

This game is so much better than its predecesor, Steam World Dig. It is longer, had more places to explore,and definitely a lot of additional elements throw to this game. You got a hookshot which is tricky to use and need time to master, you got a rocket that can send you up to the sky... Oh, and cog wheels to enable or disable a special element your upgrades has. And don't forget, lots of the artefacts description is quite hilarious.

However, I still felt the game is too short, and after you get all achievements, there's nothing more this game can offer. It's a bit of a bummer, but it's still quite fun to play all over again. No New Game +, you'll start from square 1. I also find the music not to my liking, or not as good as the first one in my opinion.

On a side note, I felt the developer wasted a great potential. I would love to see this franchise took more mining area, such as the lost world of Atlantis, or maybe the forgotten world of Pyramids. Hope they come up with... Well, new games with those mentioned. Also, hope we can edit the mines and send for our friends to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001916427', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1531154282}
review:
好想就这么不停的挖下去，可是刚找到挖挖挖的乐趣没多久。。。通关了？
据说1代的槽点就是流程太短，2代这似乎也好不到哪去。。。不过整个游戏过程是非常棒的，画面、音乐、地图设计等都十分出色，道具也十分有趣，但是似乎对于亮光的需求和惩罚都有点不够，导致游戏过程中，缺点光也无所谓嘛，反正挖挖就好了，玩家对灯光的升级也十分没有兴趣，
另外如果不是为了成就，重复玩的动力几乎没有，好在价格合适。
总的来说，夏促最让我满意的收获就是它啦！

author: {'steamid': '76561198081991716', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2209, 'last_played': 1531214461}
review:
[quote]
[h1][ Final Verdict ][/h1]
[b]9/10 - Fantastic[/b]
[/quote]
[quote]
[b][ System Requirements ][/b]
☐ Brick

[/quote]

[/quote]

☐ Non-Existent
☐ Cliché
☑ Forgettable (Except one little Fen)
☐ Decent
☐ Loved It
[/quote]
