☑ Braindead (Apart from some platforming and the Ultimate Trial)
☐ Average
☐ Challenging
☐ Hard 
☐ Extreme
☐ Savage
[/quote]
[quote]
[b][ Game Length ][/b]
☐ Extremely Short ( 0 - 5 hours)
☑ Short ( 5 - 20 hours)
☐ Average ( 20 - 50 hours)
☐ Long ( 50 - 100 hours)
☐ Very long ( 100+ hours)
☐ Endless 
[/quote]
[quote]
[b][ Gameplay ][/b]
☐ Painful
☐ Fun for the First Hour
☐ Repetitive 
☑ Enjoyable
☐ Never Gets Boring
[/quote]
[quote]
[b][ Bugs ][/b]
☐ Unplayable/Game-Breaking
☐ Audio
☐ Crashes
☐ Ctrl + Alt + Del
☐ Few Bugs
☐ Fixable Issues
☑ Nothing
[/quote]
[quote]
[b][ Price ][/b]
☐ Never Touch
☐ Wait for Sale
☑ Full Price
☐ Free
[/quote]
[quote]
[b][ Community ][/b]
☐ Dead
☐ Toxic
☐ Competitive
☑ Friendly
☐ Saints
[/quote]
[quote]
[b][ Personal Notes ][/b]
A fantastic sequel to SteamWorld Dig. Better graphics, music, upgrades, puzzles and collectibles. Art style is beautiful, level design is awesome, soundtrack is decent. The best way to play this game is with the gamepad. 

Dig -> Sell -> Upgrade - This is your gameplay, but it does not even get too repetitive because the environment is changing, so are the obstacles. Enemy difficulty evolves too and gets trickier and harder as you progress (Yes I am talking about the snail). A lot of secret paths to uncover and if you remember them, you can use them to your advantage on your 2nd playthrough! The game has collectables known as "artefacts" but they are basically puns and references to other games and movies. Although I put its difficulty as "Braindead" it has some tricky and challenging parts, but you can reset rooms if you have done something wrong, lose a few resources if you die and can come back and there are no missable stuff in this game. Have done 2 playthroughs and did not encounter any problems with the game: no crashes, no freezes so I really dig it. If they ever release a sequel I will buy it.

Some parts of the mine are unavailable until you find a better equipment. Although the game has a decent minimap with tiny hints on hidden secrets, you will have to remember where you encountered "that one thing that you didn't know what to do with". So, if you like to explore you will backtrack a lot (or can explore after the credits the choice is yours). 

Characters are forgettable except your one shiny little buddy, and although it is not that important here, I still wanted to let you know. You will not interact with most of the NPCs unless you like to read every small bit of information. 

Two things will frustrate you the most: The deadliest snail in the gaming universe and The Ultimate Trial (Unlocks when you have 100%). Although I did enjoy some challenge after the whole story, but, if you die in the trial, you will start back from the beginning. No comments for snails, let them surprise you.

Some upgrades replace each other. If you could pass 97% of areas with a Grappling Hook, (skill applied) once you get a Jetpack, the Grappling Hook becomes obsolete (except you can still damage tiny enemies with it).
If you are planning to do all of the achievements it will take you at least 2 playthroughs unless you use a video guide on how to get all 4 Gold Stars in a single run. [/quote]
[quote]
[b][ Achievement Types ][/b]
☑ Collectables
☑ Grindy
☑ In-Game Secrets
☑ Missable
☑ Skill-Based
☑ Story Related
☑ Timed/Speedrun
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198071577080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1531032290}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082442740', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1555764704}
review:
First of all I'd like to say if you haven't played the first game... GO PLAY IT!! It adds context to the story and a good comparison while playing this game. Right let's get into it!

[h1] The Art style [/h1]
From the Promo art I really disliked the new art style however as the game proceeded I grew more and more okay with it.

[h1] Game Play [/h1]
This game is alot more story driven then the first game, they have swerved away from the mining and turned this game into more of a plot driven, puzzle game with loveable characters and 'believable story' at first I didn't like it as I had just finished the first game but it got really enoyable towards the end.

[h1] Timing [/h1]
Before playing I heard loads of reports of how long this game takes, it was between 8-15 hours although I finished in just under 5 hours but the main thing I heard is that it's longer than the first game but I finished the first game in about 4 and a half hours...

[h1] The leveling system [/h1]
My main complaint about this game is the leveling system, it's designed as if the game was so much larger, I would say it's an improvement (on paper) to the first game but it really doesn't feel like it was designed for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045829057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1530871805}
review:
Definetaly an improved version of the first game, love the artwork, the easy nature of the game but yet you can learn some ways to master it's mechanics. I never got bored, there's constant change of areas you operate in, only time I became frustrated were few puzzle dungeons and the final boss (puzzle dungeons - I hate jumping puzzles and there were two that really grinded my gears.. final boss - I feel like the last two phases can be way too difficult to overcome at normal difficulty - had to change to easy for that part)

Only problem I had with the game is that it seemed to end too quickly all of a sudden. I still had many unlocks to find, many gears to collect to get those unlocks and I just expected another part of the game to be there to support all of this.

All in all for the price it's a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001539212', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1562679388}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971144173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1706827901}
review:
Good grid mining game. mine, get story, mine, upgrade, repeat. Not many out there that are as detailed. (some games that come to mind is the original motherload, miners of mars, and a few mining games on kongregate.)

usually the genre is seen on phone apps as little games with not alot in them. its great to see games using this format.\

specially since none of the other examples sept maaaaybe miners of mars. have platforming at all. theres being sektchy at best when fighting. (mines and motherload both being kinda awkward in regards to fighting of any kind. were as this is more of a classic run dodge reflect attack type of feel or what not depending on the boss fights.) 

all in all. for 20 bucks (I got it on sale for 13) id say it was money well spent. nice and stylized and a few decent puzzles. good platforming (though it says up front this was for gamepads not keyboards) I had to remap the keys to wasd rather then the arrow keys and whatever else it wanted.

if anyone cares to replicate if there having difficulty.
-right click grappling hook.
- left click attack/swing pikaxe. 
-caps lock puncher/crusher arm for stone
-e interact
-tab the gun. one for blowing up blocks and what not. gets awkward for holding it down to fire the grenade but its not a requirement so i didnt have to hold it to often anyway. (and with the wasd format the pinkie finger can hit the button and not hinder movement wich is nice. though might feel awkward at first possibley) 
-I dont remember if i had anything bound to q or r. unlike the first game you don't have items you need to buy or cycleing items to use since there all able to be used at relatively the same time. 


all in all. I hope to see more games like this in future and strongly urge peopel to pick up both games cause there good for passing time. Unsure on replayability but regardless i enjoyed my time playing it.

review:
Better than the original

Yay

author: {'steamid': '76561197993369888', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1530418338}
review:
전작은 제한이나 한계점이 분명하다고 느꼈는데, 이번 작품은 그 단점을 매우 잘 보완한 작품이라 할 수 있음.
메트로베니아같은 건 모르겠는데, 스팀펑크 특유의 느낌을 잘 살렸고, 무엇보다 성장하는 재미가 무척 좋았음.

단점이라하면 역시 2회차 이상의 플레이가 불가능하다는 것
특정 컨셉으로 도전해보는 게 없어서 엔딩만 보고 즐길 거리가 없다는 게 단점으로 꼽을 수 있음.
9시간정도에 엔딩을 봤는데, 가격대에 비해 플탐이 짧은 감이 있음.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1530144780}
review:
What a beautiful experience.

The art style is gorgeous and unique, the gameplay can seemingly get repetitive at first, and even in concept, up until you realize how well the pacing of the game is, on one side, and on the other hand, how there's a ton of upgrades, an equipment that you can use to enhance your gameplay experience, and always be on the lookout for what's next.

It is a game that never lacks motivation, in narrative, nor in gameplay.

It is always inciting the player to play, and continue to discover more secrets, and unlock a series of more things, I managed to finish the game fairly quickly but that was simply because I miss out on a ton of secrets (about 80%) it never got unfairly hard, and whenever it was challenging, it was an enjoyable game.

I wholeheartedly recommend this game, it is a beautiful experience, and recently, I haven't really been able to get into that many new games, so to have a game this original, beautiful, and simple (in a way) comes as a breath of fresh air.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148030287', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1530121883}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 builds on Steamworld Dig.
If you haven't played the first one then it becomes time you get started on it.
Minecraft in Steampunk setting!!

If you have played the first one then what are you waiting for? Get Steamworld Dig 2!!
The game doesn't disappoint, the devs listened to the people and improved on what ought to be improved leaving you with a superiour second installment.

Music is very chill, The steampunk setting with all it is bright color palette makes that the game offers lots of eye-candy.
Digging is fun with locations offering more variety in environments.
Upgrades are always useful and fun to tinker around with.

If you love being a kid and dig in sand wondering what you will find then this is the game that you will love!
Don't wait! 
Just get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026807368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1529963703}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028119858', 'num_games_owned': 1350, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1529941360}
review:
모든 면에서 발전한 속편.

아는 사람들은 아는 명작 스팀월드 디그1의 후속작이다.

땅파기 스타일의 메트로베니아 게임이며, 파고 내려갈수록 다양한 스테이지 기믹과 새로운 능력들이 플레이어를 맞이한다.

다소 볼륨이 짧던 1편에서 대폭 볼륨업된 구성을 하고 있다. 체감상 한 3~4배정도 커진듯?

전반적인 마감이 아주 깔끔하고 맵 디자인이 훌륭하여 구석구석 탐험하는 재미가 쏠쏠하다.

전투도 있지만 탐험과 채굴에 포커싱이 맞춰진 게임이라는 것을 염두할 것.

메트로베니아류 게임을 좋아한다면 강추!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049379938', 'num_games_owned': 4730, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1506196775}
review:
I never played original Steamworld Dig and sequel game has been bought by the recommendation of my good russian Steam friend. He told me that this game was amazing and had really great and unique mechanics, however it would be a mistake to play it without knowing the story of the original game, as they were connected.  

Well, it didn’t stop me. I was interested in this game and I really felt like playing something like this. Steamworld Dig 2 reminded me of that mobila gaming era, when you were sitting at school, never paying attention to what teacher was saying and you were playing all these stupid low poly games, I don’t even remember their names actually, but I guess someone who is 25+ years at least should remember this retarded game with a guy on a bike, who was trying to get through the low poly levels, with spiky mountains and riding there, balancing back and forth at the right time, saying “f*ck you” to physics, or these games where you were supposed to dig through the tunnel to get somewhere.

Nostalgy took over me. Played this game for 9 hours in a row and finished it and to be honest, I felt like it wasn’t enough for me. I had this feeling like a disappointment, like whaaaaaat, it’s over already? Come oooon. And I must say, that usually, it’s a rare feeling for me, most of the time, when I play some kinda games, closer to the end I feel like I really want to finish it ASAP. 

In Steamworld Dig 2 you are playing as a Dorothy, which is a nephew of a first game’s antagonist. She tries to understand what happened to her uncle and find out some information, regarding him. And to do this she needs to go underground and dig, dig, dig a lot! During this journey she will find a lot of gems and different stones, available for selling. Dorothy will need this to upgrade herself and buy some really useful perks. The only trick that it’s not allowed to die, while you carrying those gems, otherwise they all will be dropped, so you have to carefully take them to the vendor. 

And what’s really cool about the exploring this world, that it’s enormous and divided on different zones, which vary with its environment and objects it’s surrounded with. Every zone is literally filled with different puzzles and hidden secrets, bringing you lots of joy, solving them. It also has metroidvania elements, when you face the wall with no chance of going through, that means that needed tool or ability is still locked at this moment and you better check it out later. In general, Steamworld Dig 2 is all about exploring the caves, digging your way there, collecting gems and upgrading your abilities to advance the story.  

In caves you will face different kinds of enemies, which can be dangerous as hell, so you will need to act smart, to avoid their hits, spikes, whatever. There are also a few bosses in game and they are not that hard at all, they are more to conclude your journey during the present chapter and also for fun, I guess, to show the devs creativity, I never had a bad time with any of them. 

Let’s not forget about the settlement located on the top of the cave site where the whole story takes place. What I liked, that devs worked on its habitants and really made them interesting, you can speak to almost everyone and learn something new, or get the useful side quest, or even learn a new blueprint to upgrade your skills and it’s all very complex and connected to the whole story and your journey.

I can say, that despite being a simple platformer in its origin, Steamworld Dig 2 still brings us a good story about real friendship and how it really matters to stay there for what you truly believe. It’s easy to see, how devs try to show us a confrontation between two groups of robots: one of them are afraid of what’s going on there and believe, that the end of the times is near and they should get out of there and explore the space ASAP, and the other one say that everything is just fine and there is nothing to worry about. However, all these drama will come to its logical conclusion and you will see, who was right in there in the end.

Ok, to sum everything up!
You should grab this game if you:

+ Miss that school times, when you were playing dat Digger game 
+ Like metroidvania platformers with interesting mechanics and colorful characters
+ Feel like playing nice small game, which can be completed in 1-2 session
+ Love solving puzzles and exploring different levels, trying to understand how to get to the treasure
+ Fan of that whole Steamworld universe and eager to know more about it. I was hooked by this game and was really interested in that story, wishing to find time for the first game and Steamworld Heist spin-off.

Recommend to avoid if you:

- Well, like I said before, the game is so amazing and satisfying, that I literally felt like it wasn’t enough for me, so if you are looking a really big game, it’s not your choice
- Looking for something serious and action-based. The game feels really arcadish and have this colourful look and vibes, suitable for kids, keep that in mind.
- Also, make sure to play the first game before, I did really regret that I missed it before starting the sequel, well, it’s not THAT important, but if you wanna be into the story and what’s going on there, it’s better for you to be informed :)

Enjoy!

[url=store.steampowered.com/curator/32013470/] Follow my curator's page if you enjoy my reviews and want to stay tuned! [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198190847589', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1528735908}
review:
Это шикарно! Отличное продолжение 1 части, вобравшее в себя и приумножившее то, что нам полюбилось в Steamworld Dig 1: огромный игровой мир и множество модификаций персонажа. Ближе к концу игры геймплей становится очень динамичным и интересным. Да и в начале и середине не заскучаешь. Мир действительно хочется исследовать. Сюжет порадовал, сделано очень красиво. Спасибо за пару отличных вечеров за этой игрой!

10 головоломок с тележками из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198096222923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1529675695}
review: Couldn't get into Hollow Knight last year but now that I am a metroidvania addict, I will have to reconsider.. thanks, SteamWorld Dig 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973580399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1528673958}
review:
Much like the original SteamWorld Dig, SWD2 is a charming, fun little platformer with a mix of exploration, digging, puzzle solving, and a bit of combat.  The story follows from the first but is mainly an excuse to go exploring through the mines and other environs that make up the gameworld.  It's a forgiving game, without a significant death penalty, though you can enable optional toggles that make things a bit more difficult if you'd like.

If you're looking for a fairly relaxed way to spend ten or so hours and enjoy a bit of hunting for secrets and items then it's worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151299924', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 124, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1712437669}
review:
ну, вот я прошел эту весьма прикольную игрушку и думаю написать обзор. Прежде всего-игра слишком короткая. Не имея никаких замашек на спидран и просто следуя по рельсам сюжета  я прошел ее за почти шесть часов. Понравилось ли мне? Да. Неплохой геймплей, не такие очевидные секреты и местами даже относительно сложные головоломки. Хотите убить время? Ваш выбор. Но как фанат всей серии у меня есть придирки к лору и сюжету.!ВНИМАНИЕ! большинство придирок-это собственно говоря придирки и они не всегда имеют под собой почву. Просто когда !СПОЙЛЕРЫ! в конце вы улетаете в космос ты такой сидишь и думаешь"Че? А, ну в принципе они роботы. В целом они тип могут выжить в космосе... эй, но они же паровые роботы! Откуда они возьмут пар в космосе?" и таких моментов много. В основном это в угоду сюжету, но эй за 4 года можно было бы написать сильный сценарий без тупняков. Например:
-Вектрон должен был быть полностью уничтожен, ведь нам еще в прошлой части сказали что там должно быть все расправлено по понятным причинам, и в прошлой же части мы вместе с вольтботом уничтожили все что могло охлаждать почву-теперь вместо вектрона должна быть в лучшем случае расплавленая порода. А теперь нас туда телепортируют и что мы видим? что вектрон в порядке! Башни из прошлой части, големы, КОМПЬЮТЕРЫ(которые вообще хер пойми откуда взялись) и духи(вероятно души убитых троглодитов из прошлой части) Ну вот как так? 
-Тот же Вектрон, а точнее его убитый потенциал-весь вектрон управляется чем-то. И у этого чего-то есть набор скриптов (один из которых нам и помогает) Ну разьве не чудесная почва? Огромное пространство для маневра сценаристам, еще одна локация полная ебанутых големов и душ троглодитов-но все это идет в топку ведь Вектрон появляется в игре только один раз! Ну что за хрень? Мы типо пришли туда за своим кентом, получили по лицу ничего не найдя и просто смылись? Тобишь лазить по пещерам и по храмам ебнутых культистов в  поисках дров хватает, а походить там где все и началось нет? 
-Про храмы-ТАМ ЕСТЬ РУДА!!! в гребаных ХРАМАХ есть руда, и ладно если бы эти храмы были бы простой пещерой, ответвлением от основной шахты-так нет это массивные постройки с подвалами под 500 метров вниз. А знаете где еще есть руда? В кирпичах! Раньше была просто очень твердая порода-в ней вполне могла бы быть руда. Это блин фигня какая-то, нельзя заменить кирпичи на породу? Вроде нет ведь надо сделать стену из чего-то непроницаемого. Так сделали бы отдельный блок с текстуркой цемента! 4 года, можно было бы и постараться. А они ушли в геймплей. 
-Не раскрытая тема старого мира. Его вообще нет! Только деревушка бомжей. И еще в конце мы устраиваем замес с лебединой песней министерства обороны газпрома. А можно было бы добавить бомжей с ружьями, стационарные орудия, шерман с перебитой гусеницей-а нам дали только это. Фигня какая-то.
 
Вроде все.  НО! В плане геймплея это прорыв. Ну, прорыв сильно сказано. Это некоторый рост. Но 4 ГОДА! Я считаю что за 4 года проект должен вырасти действительно сильно. Фар краи вон по 2-3 года клепают и они стабильно растут в геймплее-но не в сюжете. Возможно это даже какая-то тенденция-Могли бы взять пример с первой части и просто не говорить сюжет. Недосказанность дает огромное пространство для маневра. Но надо как-то расти, поэтому они решили пойти в ва-банк. И в целом они выйграли-игрушка играется приятно, а я даже не сразу догадался кто злодей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010217518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1528370895}
review:
I finished and love the first game and I must say that this is a great sequel. The devs have improved everything that is already good from the previous entry. The most remarkable improvement is the story, they did a good job on expanding the lore from the events of the first game's ending and it turned SteamWorld's world more interesting. The only thing I didn't like is the music, I'm not really fan of the techno style sound they went with for some stages. Overall this game is fun and [b]VERY GOOD[/b]. 

If you played (or not played) the first game you must absolutely not miss this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1528248858}
review:
I had a chance to try the Switch version of SteamWorld Dig 2 at PAX East 2018, and I could tell you then that it is a consistently fun and charming Metroidvania with all the essential elements that have defined many games I have enjoyed, especially in the last few years: A bright and vibrant color palette, good music, great atmosphere, likable characters, and minimal bullshit "difficulty". It's superior to its predecessor, and is paced much better then SteamWorld Heist, besides. I would be willing to argue that it is a better game then Hollow Knight, even, though that game certainly has superior presentation. 

Dig 2 tells the story of a brave steam robot named Dorothy on a quest to find her friend Rusty, the player character of the first Dig, who went missing following the events of that game. She travels East from her hometown of Tumbleton to the mining town of El Machino, where Rusty was last seen. Seismic activity across the planet is increasing, and something old and foul stirs beneath the dirt and rock. 

Compared to the first Dig, this game is much more sprawling, with not only more then one mine to dig in and minerals to find but a lot of horizontal ground to cover as well, and a range of abilities that give Dorothy greater mobility then Rusty, or indeed many Metroidvania protagonists can hope for. In particular it is possible to obtain essentially unlimited flight. Many more of Dig 2's areas are pre-designed, such as the "challenge caves" that conceal many of the game's collectibles. These include artifacts and cogs, and certain rarer minerals. The former serve to unlock certain special upgrades that you can use the cogs on, which can be removed from one upgrade and applied to another as you please. The upgrades provide varied and useful features, such as a free warp back to town, regenerating water supply, the ability to smack projectiles back at enemies and more. The minerals, as in the first game, translate into cash used to purchase improved versions of your gear, which in turn unlock the cog upgrades for use. Much of the map is still wide open shafts that are otherwise filled with blocks of dirt and brick for Dorothy to dig through, creating the signature blend of Metroid and, I am told, Spelunky, that defined the first game, though now erring more towards the former. 

Much like many games of this genre, if you know where to look and what to look for, you can power up Dorothy to the point where it largely trivializes the game's admittedly very few boss fights. Is this a bad thing? No. And if you're feeling like you've got something to prove, a few of the upgrades just make the game harder and do literally nothing to help. You can even turn off the objective markers guiding you to the next part of the story. But why would you do that? I mean, really.

SteamWorld Dig 2 is another fine addition to my burgeoning library of Metroidvanias and I strongly suggest you add it to yours as well. I hope to see more from Image & Form Games in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983088786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1511655344}
review: I love this game! I love the first SteamWorld Dig game too! Gives you that deep exploration feel, while the items, treasure and mechanics keep things fun and interesting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270397', 'num_games_owned': 4179, 'num_reviews': 735, 'playtime_forever': 1919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1527613722}
review:
[h1] Points positifs : [/h1]

- Un scénario bourré d'humour
- Des personnages attachants et un héros vraiment sympathique
- Des graphismes colorés, un plaisir pour les yeux !
- Une ambiance musicale adaptée et agréable; des bruitages réussis
- L'évolution et la rapide montée en compétences du héros
- Les différents biomes disponibles
- On ne s'ennuie jamais, on adore creuser pour trouver des trésors !
- Côté addictif du titre très prononcé
- Une jouabilité et une prise en main efficaces et rapides
- Une suite tellement attendue !
- Une fin qui laisse présager un troisième opus en créant un teasing...

[h1] Points négatifs : [/h1]

- ... Mais qui se termine brutalement !
- Quelques bugs non bloquants
- Une rejouabilité limitée (quand il n'y a plus rien à miner notamment...)
- Évolution fastidieuse du leveling du héros si on souhaite le faire évoluer au maximum (sauf à basher du monstre à foison)

[h1] En conclusion... [/h1]

SteamWorld Dig 2 est une vraie réussite et continue à surprendre, à s'améliorer par rapport à son prédécesseur. C'est un véritable bijou qui laisse au joueur le temps de profiter tranquillement des décors cartoonesques, de cette ambiance musicale qui repose les méninges tout en minant les différents trésors qui s'offrent à lui.

Le joueur profitera rapidement de tout ce qu'offre le jeu tant par son gameplay réussi que par les multiples points positifs énoncés plus haut. C'est avec ce genre de titre qu'on voit évoluer positivement qu'on se dit que les jeux vidéos indépendants ont de beaux jours devant eux... Les quelques ombres au tableau ne viendront pas gâcher la fête et le tout, malgré la fin abrupte, laisse au joueur le sentiment d'une réussite presque totale ! A jouer sans modération et à tout âge ! >> 18/20

author: {'steamid': '76561197970538611', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1368, 'last_played': 1528090754}
review:
Astonishingly high-quality 2d platformer. SteamWorld Dig 2 picks up immediately where part one left off, and proceeds to improve upon the concepts of that game in every way imaginable.

Enemies vary drastically in appearance and malice, requiring unique tactics for each. Fortunately you can spend your loot in the main hub to upgrade your kit to an insane degree. I'm not exaggerating when I say you start the game off as a weakling and by the end of your journey you will literally be a nigh-invincible high-flying juggernaut, tearing through stone and fauna like some sort of fem-bot Rambo. 

Secret challenge maps reward you with cogs and relics that can be used to upgrade your upgrades, and in true MetroidVania (short for Metrosexual Vanity) fashion, most of the map remains closed off until you return with the correct loadout. 

Fortunately, the various bottomless shafts below Machino and the open skies above are interlinked by a fast-travel system to help expedite your adventure, though these beacons are spread out just far enough from each other to make you think twice about your path. Do you take the shorter, deadlier route to the nearest teleport, or the longer one that requires creative digging?

One of my favorite things about the SteamWorld universe is its deceptively childlike atmosphere. The Steampunk / Western aesthetic isn't just a colorful wrapper. This is a future world where humanity has long fallen beneath the weight of its own sins and benign robots now live comfortably on the surface. There is a layer of horror fiction going on here; one particular dungeon halfway through the game shredded any chance of me sharing SteamWorld Dig 2 with my pre-teen niece and nephews.

My only beef with the game is that the villain is really lame and has laughable motivations. That said, the final boss fight is a real doozy. I was reminded of Neo fighting Agent Smith at the end of the third Matrix film, and I felt like a big man after I finally pulled it off.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198212278708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1527841632}
review:
[h1]Sammary:[/h1]
This game is simply awesome. It has a slow start but once things pickup you will be hooked.

I also have to mention that there is alot of secrets to this game. There are upgrades that you can get that can make it easier for you to descover secrets that were in places that are hard to get, but if you're skilled you can get most of these secret areas without them.

It has a story and interesting character, however, i thought they were blank sheets at first.

It isn't that short either as i finished it after 7-10 hours (depends on your playstyle)

There was a small twist for me in this game (i didn't play the prevous game though)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980113620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1528059746}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074628508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1528052049}
review:
I heard good things about SteamWorld Dig 2, but went in blind in terms of how it plays. The game does a good job of organically unlocking abilities and teaching you what to do throughout the game. 

There a plenty of upgrades which require money. Money is obtained by digging up gems. It's a good feedback loop that feels very rewarding. The story itself is simple but works.

I know there is a lot of hidden stuff that I did not go back for, so there is more content in this game for those who are into collecting everything.

The music and art style in the game are really well done and draw you in to the game from the outset. 

Overall, I would say this game is worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035114506', 'num_games_owned': 2094, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1528019812}
review: A textbook example of what a good sequel should be. It has better graphics, better music, expands on the upgrade system and gives you new tools to play with while removing the frustrating aspects of the first game. Another outstanding game by Image & Form. Definitely a must buy if you liked the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413010269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1564462774}
review:
This game is fun as hell if you're into collecting and exploring in a Castlevania/Metroid type setting.
I got the first one for free on another service and while it was a fun game, it was just far too short and it only had one boss. The sequel literally fixes everything wrong with the first and greatly extended the length and expanded everything.

I've been playing it for a couple of days now just exploring, gathering resource and buying upgrades and doing story missions here and there and faced a couple of bosses so far. Some of the lower dungeons get a little harder and catch you by surprise the odd time, but it's nothing an experienced platformer can't handle. And of course, like any platformer worth their salt, there are lots of secrets to uncover.

If you're a fan of platformers and you don't have this game, you're missing out. I would actually put this up there among the greats. Especially in our current times. You have your Sonic and Mario games, but you should also include SteamWorld Dig 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999649336', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1603137677}
review:
Realmente é um jogo muito bom!
Porem com o tempo (no caso 10 horas) ele fica meio repetitivo.
De qualquer forma esse game me proporcionou muita diversão, além de muitos desafios... Ponha desafios nisso!
Se familiarizar com seus controles é algo um pouco complicado, isso provavelmente seria melhor se eu tivesse um controle. Porque usar as teclas WASD para habilidades quase bugou minha mente kkkkk.
Os gráficos são muito interessantes, efeitos que realmente chamam a atenção!
Os quebra-cabeça são a parte mais interessante desse game! Muito bem feitos e nos fazem pensar muito para resolvê-los!

Mesmo que eu ja tenha enjoado dele eu o recomento muito! Vai te dar boas horas de diversão! Tem linguagem em Espanhol, não é muita coisa mas pra quem num se da com o inglês ajuda bastante!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982052706', 'num_games_owned': 5392, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1527792167}
review: Deutliche Steigerung des Spasses zum ersten Teil. Diesmal ist die Welt per Hand gemacht und nicht Zufalls generiert. Reines Solospiel. Das Spiel startet da wo WD1 aufgehört hat also jeder der teil 1 gespielt hat soll unbedingt hier weiter machen. Die Caves sind im Später verlauf sehr anspruchsvoll also an manchen saß ich 20-30 minuten, von der ultimativen Challenge am ende rede ich gar nicht. Pure Hölle! Absolute empfehlung! Leichter Kliffhänger am ende, vlt Teil 3? Ich würde mich freuen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323713506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1527785372}
review: It is a very cute indie game, which is a proper successor of the first installment. Everyone who liked the first one should be happy to play the sequel. Good job to the devs for this hidden gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991339792', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1623243647}
review:
Vastly underrated Spelunkylike with a surprisingly great OST (from the composer of a few Hotline Miami hits), and a pretty interesting story to accompany the dungeneering.
A great and lush artstyle makes the visual a feast for the eyes, too.
What the ending unfortunately lacks, it makes up for everything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1526162576}
review:
Ein wunderbares Spiel, das so ganz nebenbei auch noch wunderbar in kleinen Raten funktioniert (wenn man sich nicht vom "nur noch eine Runde graben"-Prinzip austricksen lässt). Das Design ist rund und hochmotivierend, die Präsentation sehr ansprechend und die Steuerung tiptop. Wie bei jedem Jump'n Run gibt es knifflige Stellen und ach was habe ich mich über diese blöden Schnecken genervt. Aber das gehört dazu und an keiner Stelle wurde es unmöglich schwierig.
SWD 1 war schon ein wunderbares Spiel aber Teil 2 legt in vielerlei Hinsicht noch eine Schippe obendrauf und macht einfach Spass. Auch viele Veränderungen wie die neuen Tools oder das Zahnrädchensystem mit dem man Verbesserungen sehr flexibel ein- und ausschalten kann sind wunderbar gelungen.

Fazit: Ein Spiel, das ich problemlos jedem weiterempfehlen kann. Wer SWD 1 mochte oder allgemein auf Jump'n Runs steht, für den ist es ein Pflichtspiel. Alle anderen sollten dem Spiel eine Chance geben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251766078', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1695292402}
review: Чудесное продолжение! Несмотря на то, что в конце первой части шансов выжить у Расти не было, он выжил мать вашу, но спойлерить не буду. Играем его подруженцией. Теперь выживших людей называют бомжами, ну неплохо... Игру значительно упростили. Она менее хардкорная, в отличии от первой. В плане ресурсов, хилки и прочего. Сюжет, как всегда в стороне. Ну а что, копаем, апгрейдимся, всё, что нужно для счастья. Но, но...интрига вокруг землеботов и Расти оставалась всю игру. Всем советую, стимботы на пару вечерочков!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019328070', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1527642809}
review:
I like immersive games where everything is relevant and you don't want to miss anything as much as the next guy, but I also really enjoy games that you can put a podcast on and just chill out with, and this is the latter kind. It's an aggressively bright and cheerful Metroidvania-style platformer, with plenty of fun tools and ways to navigate the world. Digging for the different rocks and turning them in for cash to upgrade your grenade launcher is a great feeling. It maintains roughly the same level of challenge all the way through, which is great considering you have so many options available to you in the endgame. 

Furthermore I think this game handles its collectibles extremely well - there's two main kinds, upgrade cogs and artifacts. The upgrade cogs are generally plentiful enough that you don't feel obligated to find them, and some upgrades just make it easier to find them (without doing anything so obvious as marking them on your map). The artifacts unlock more upgrades, but since they're all unique items, it's easy to tell what you're missing and generally where you're missing them, since each area has a visible completion percentage.

There are some things that I think aren't super great - for one thing, the amount of resources in the world is fixed, so if you die too often (especially in the late game where the loot is more valuable) you can wind up not being able to afford the more expensive upgrades. One of those is required to get into the optional challenge room at the end, and this did require some grinding of enemies for me (which are comparatively low value). I think if minerals/games were less prevalent, but the area refreshed/randomized when you left it, this would have made for a more dynamic experience and made this late-game grind a little more interesting. For another there is a special tool that seems almost redundant (the jackhammer) - this could have just been a pickaxe upgrade.

Overall though, this is absolutely worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020189110', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1694967108}
review:
:: Quick checks ::
+ Good Roguelike element
+ Fun Dig-Sell-Upgrade routine
+ Adorable Graphic / Animation / Effect
+ Good story & content 
+ Relax gameplay with well balanced time being underground.
+ Hooked you in 

:: Personal feeling ::
I actually was seeking for some games, refunded a lot ( because I'm very picky ) and then found this on sale in my wishlist. So I gave it a try, get hooked and didn't regret for buying this. It's more than what I thought it was, like other "popular" games. 

This one was fun in the way you can play creatively, while still don't feel "misleading" in the silent time, thanks to the story and main quest system. You may enjoy side quest in a very natural way like just a passing by for 5 mins, but then keep chilling on exploration and keep optimizing your ways into the depth ( yes I Do ! )

Most importantly, this game's Designer really know how to balance the time you are in the darkness of the underground and sunshine, by adding "Light & Fuel" system. Also, many other level plots are well shown his intention to players. We can play and really feel that intention, and we know we're on the right track.

Upgrades and new ability are always come at the right time, stick with the story, and where it lead you to and blend well with the level design quite tight. 

In visual, the game was like West-world in SCI-FI of a robot city. The style is cartoonish with smooth animation and effect, very smooth also. You will surely enjoy the sight and action !

Music played a long very naturally, not really super but it match the game well.

I'm on like a 1/3 or 1/4 of the game and haven't played the previous parts in series but this is what I feel right now. In overall, I will recommend this game to anyone that like creative stuffs, exploration and Robot, sure.

* Update * 
( would contains a little spoiler )

I have just finished the game, in around 12 hours of gameplay. 
And I must say the final boss would be really annoying.

Also I feel like they're rushed the game in mid-way, when we come to the "3 locations quest". It's just like re-visiting the game and repetitive some elements, also they made the game went far from what it should be. 

The other half of the game tend to focus on puzzles, repeat some tasks and trying to get over the pain in the ass type of land, which always generate negative feeling on you, I'm pretty sure.

To me, actually, I really like the game, at first, when we are just about digging deep, exploration, gather resources, move on ground to sell them and upgrade. With the very relax and slow-paced gameplay, I feel better. 

Perhaps, like some ppl here said, the game should be casual, because that's how we feel enjoyable about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988889116', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1615336318}
review: The first was awesome, this one is 10x better, highly recommended. I only wish there was more things to do after endgame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053094916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1527702386}
review:
Если вам понравилась SteamWorld Dig или SteamWorld Heist, то покупайте и эту, не пожалеете. Лично я прошёл их обе и могу со 100% уверенностью сказать, что продолжение парового копателя сочетает в себе всё самое лучшее из этих двух игр. Великолепный саундтрек, много новых разнообразных персонажей, локаций, улучшенная рисовка, наинтереснейший сюжет и раскрытие истории и мира Steam World. Геймплей тоже стал интереснее и насыщеннее, появились два уровня сложности, система модификаций снаряжения, новое снаряжение, новые механики, даже не всегда надо копать)) 
И самое главное, теперь это действительно полноценная компьютерная игра, а не мобильный платформер, ну и конечно же она является великолепнейшим продолжением серии Steam World.

Однозначно 10 шестеренок  из 10 и никак иначе ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198026196457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1527691555}
review:
Incrediblely fun little game.
Well worth the asking price sales be damned (and im pretty cheap so id normally never say that).
still has the same fun gameplay loop of the first game but with more storyline/platforming sections.

Amazingly presented metroidvania that has a nice little hook (the digging mechanic) that makes it fun and different while doing all the classic metroidvania stuff (platforming/fun traversal/lots of secrets/exploration) with plenty of polish and skill.

one thing i really liked is the (optional) objective markers. This means that while you can spend time combing the tunnels for all the secrets if you think its time to make some progress you know exactly where to go.
No frustarting crisscrossing the map multiple times because you overlooked the ONE tile the game expected you to find.

Imo this is one of the major things that people either love or hate about the genre and letting both groups play the way they like is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091787258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1527539841}

review:

all in all fun mining game which keeps you busy, would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002030270', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1712412298}
review: I really like the game.  I like the whole series, Dig, Dig Heist, and now Dig 2.  I find them very charming but they all suffer from the same problem, no real replay value.  I enjoyed playing it but once done there is no incentive to go back.  Dig 2 took longer to complete but I also made a point to comb every inch of it.  Yes, I found the hidden temple in the sky but have no interest in the frustratingly impossible levels.  The charm of the game was always that it was casual, not super hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102707345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1527462901}
review: SteamWorld Dig 2’s gameplay formula remains unchanged from the original. Mine caverns, gather ore, trade for upgrades, and repeat. The pneumatic tubes scattered throughout the world make resurfacing less of a chore. Fluorescent colors dramatically beautify this game’s environments. Powerful upgrades are peppered throughout the campaign at a timely pace to keep players engaged. Optional hidden cogs enable perks that modify gameplay to suit your playstyle. But sadly, the boss fights in this game are forgettable. Only the final boss provides a meaningful experience. The penultimate "seek and destroy" mission was a missed opportunity to address this weakness. And of course, it’s tragic you can’t play as Rusty. Why not unlock him as a playable character after beating the game? I would definitely replay the campaign and try to gather all hidden artifacts if I could play as Rusty. Overall, I enjoyed playing Steamworld Dig 2 and I recommend this game.

review: Great game. Finished it in about 17 hours with my nephew we both really liked it. Good progression, lots of secrets to find, and enemies to fight. The game has a great story that takes you all over the map finding treasure and power ups for your  character. All of the mechanics of the game surrounding the different gadgets you have to use to move around and solve the puzzles in the game work perfectly, I want to play the 1st game now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1523213470}
review:
This is a very fun game that I would recommend. Gameplay is fun, you gain a variety of powerups and face a good variety of challenges, there's a LOT of freedom in where you explore and what upgrades you want first. Plus, gathering and selling loot to rack up money is just fun.

It is a bit on the easy side, but that was probably just because I was careful to have as much loot+upgrades as I possibly could when approaching every area. I'm sure if you try to get a good completion time it's much harder.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980771676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1526364316}
review:
[h1]Die Welt der Graberei? Es muss nur funkeln und ich bin dabei![/h1]

Wer SteamWorld Dig 1 kennt, wird den zweiten Teil zweifelsohne in ihr / sein Herz schließen - was für ein geiles Spiel!

In bester Metroidvania-Manier geht's hier satte 13h durch diverse Dungeons, um Ressourcen freizuschalten, seine Skills mit Aufwertungen zu verbessern, die man entweder vom verdienten Geld kauft oder ab und zu an bestimmten Spots findet, kann später mühelos mit dem Presslufthammer durch fette Steine bohren, mit Jetpack durch die Gegend fliegen oder entfernte Ressourcen mit dem Greifhaken schnappen.

Dabei sammelt ihr zusätzliche Artefakte, bekommt stets neue Items freigeschaltet und könnt zusätzlich sogenannte (Zahn)Rädchen verwenden, um bestimmte Fähigkeiten an- und abzuschalten (die erfordern immer eine bestimmte Anzahl und verhalten sich wie Mods - können ein- und ausgebaut werden). Neben der netten Story auf der Suche nach dem verschollenen Helden aus Teil 1 gibt's jede Menge lustiger Charaktere, unterschiedliche Welten, Rätsel-Subdungeons und allerhand versteckten Shice zu entdecken.

Ich hab in keiner einzigen Sekunde Langeweile oder Ernüchterung verspürt und könnte jahrelang so weiterspielen. Suchtgefahr!
Ich dachte ja echt mal das wäre son Survival-Ressourcensammel-Beschäftigungsspielchen, aber weit gefehlt... es ist genial wie Teil 1 und gleichzeitig um Längen mehr als das!

🔫 Pew Pew Pew! 💥 Bock auf mehr Reviews? 🔎
🏃💨 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42792002/]Folge mir[/url] und verpass' keine weiteren Neuigkeiten! ⚡

author: {'steamid': '76561198001389839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1525232194}
review:
Great game, lots of exploration. SteamWorld Dig 2 is the first game in the series that I've played, and I'll probably pick up the others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083139441', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1582120612}
review:
Диггер образца 2017-го года - продукт тридцатилетней эволюции!

Контента, наверное, кто-то хотел бы побольше*, зато то, что есть, очень хорошего качества, без необоснованного затягивания игры и унылого копипаста. Достойная индюшка во всех отношениях. Неудивительно, что среди моря русских отзывов - лишь один (!) отрицательный, трудно подобрать для этой игры слова осуждения. Кому-то может не прийтись по душе графический стиль - но это уже чистая вкусовщина, да и на скриншотах все видно - не обманешься. 
В общем, весёлого [strike]забега[/strike] закопа!

И ещё: геймпад вам пригодится.

*это не значит, что я уже прошёл её за 8 часов. Хотя, говорят, возможно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976441920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1508721724}
review:
I beat this game in two sittings.  That isn't meant to be taken as a negative, as I think I clocked in around 12-15 hours of gameplay.  Both SteamWorld Dig 1 and 2 have this magical, engaging charm to them that makes them hard to walk away from.  I would highly recommend this game to people who are looking for a non-standard platformer, with RPG mechanics that involve upgrading your character's abilities, and a progression system that is constantly baiting you to go the extra mile when exploring the depths of the world.  The story isn't complex, but the characters and the dialogue will put a smile on your face as their conversations with you gradually flesh out the world that they inhabit with you.

This is a solid 9/10 for me.  The only reason I ding it in the slightest is because it's incredibly similar to the first game.  I was hoping that they would expand on the original game's concept and try some new things.  The core gameplay and overall direction is great, but I just want more.  More of anything in this universe.  This is definitely a personal gripe, but it's a personal gripe that is born out of loving this series and wanting more out of it than beating it and having no reason to keep on playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042509853', 'num_games_owned': 4181, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1506230275}
review:
[h1][b]Review | SteamWorld Dig 2[/b][/h1]

SteamWorld Dig 2 é o terceiro jogo da desenvolvedora Image & Form e uma sequência direta do SteamWorld Dig. A premissa do jogo é a mesma do primeiro, um metroidvania que tem como objetivos principais: derrotar seus inimigos, coletar pedras preciosas e escavar o subsolo, isso tudo com a sua picareta.
[quote]
Dorothy McCrank, inicia uma investigação em busca do seu amigo, Rusty, que está desaparecido desde a sua ultima aventura e para que ela possa encontra-lo vai precisar seguir a sua própria viajem ao subsolo, enfrentando uma grande diversidade de inimigos, e se fortalecendo a cada metro que vai descendo.
[/quote]

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
A jogabilidade do jogo é exatamente a mesma do seu antecessor, mas isso não poderia mudar de forma alguma, pois a jogabilidade já era exelente, porém com algumas limitações da época, pois originalmente ele foi feito para o Nintendo 3DS e depois portado para as outras plataformas, deixando o jogo um pouco mais "travado", mas não deixava de ser um jogo bom. Mas vocês deve esta se perguntando, se a jogabilidade não está diferente, porque eu devo comprar? Por que as mecânicas do jogo são um pouco diferentes, mas o suficiente para mudar a experiência, pra melhor, em relação ao primeiro jogo, começando pelos itens que você vai utilizar no jogo, que são:
[list]
[*][b]Picareta:[/b] Sua arma principal, que vai usar pra quase tudo no jogo, servindo tanto para atacar os inimigos, quanto para cavar.
[*][b]Bolsa:[/b] Local que armazena suas pedras preciosa, sendo possível aumentar o tamanho dela com o passar do jogo.
[*][b]Botas:[/b] Primeiro aprimoramento que consegue no jogo, servindo pra correr mais rápido quando pressionar X no controle.
[*][b]Lampião:[/b] Marcador da sua iluminação, quanto menor, menos irá ver.
[*][b]Armadura:[/b] Status que aumenta a quantidade de vida do seu personagem
[*][b]Tanque d'água:[/b] Status que aumenta a quantidade de mana do seu personagem
[*][b]Bomba de pressão:[/b] Arama usada para ataques a longa distancia, para alçar lugares que você não conseguiria alcançar com a picareta.
[*][b]Braço de robô:[/b] Modificação no braço da Dorothy, bem similar a broca do Rusty, só que com um delay inicial aparentemente maior que a broca.
[*][b]Gancho[/b]: Item que serve para  agarrar em paredes e atacar a longa distancia, esta segunda função servindo somente para afastar os inimigos, a não ser que eles explodam com o contato.
[*][b]Jetpack:[/b] Equipamento que serve para voar por um curto período de tempo, sendo bem útil para alcançar lugares que são impossíveis de se alcançar com o gancho.
[/list]

[h1]AUDIOVISUAL[/h1]
A arte do jogo foi a evolução mais perceptível, já que ele não tem como base um console com resolução e hardware limitados como o Nintendo 3Ds, fazendo com que o SteamWorld Dig 2, inicialmente lançado para Nintendo Switch, esteja bem superior ao seu antecessor nesse quesito. Os detalhes das movimentações, as habilidades são muito bonitas, até o movimento da boca dos personagens é perfeito.

Com a temática do jogo ainda focada no velho oeste, mas agora misturado com outros temas lembrando algo como um culto parara os deuses que os povos Egípcio e Maia faziam para seus respectivos deuses, só posso dizer que a musica é boa, mas nada não é tão marcante como o primeiro jogo que tinha um tema bem especifico, viajando profundamente nele.

[b]Conclusão:[/b] SteamWorld Dig 2 é um ótimo jogo pra qualquer fã do gênero metroidvania, com uma campanha direta um pouco curta, durando de seis a oito horas, mas podendo dobrar ou até triplicar essas horas, caso queira completar tudo no jogo e ainda possui uma alta retrojogabilidade. No final do jogo da a entender que a Dorothy ainda tem assuntos para resolver, então não seria uma surpresa se fizesse um [b]SteamWorld Dig 3[/b].

[h1]Análise feita no dia 23/09/2017 e fortalecida através do curador do grupo [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/LokooIndie]Lokoo[/url]
Apoie-nos seguindo nossa [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/27112392]Curadoria[/url] para futuras análises.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988437395', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1523456660}
review:
A beautiful game worthy of praise.

Steamworld dig 2 is a shining beacon of hope in the world of sequels, prequels, and so forth.
It's obviously heavily influenced by the metroidvania genre and manages to pull it off correctly and do so with style, making it feel fresh and not just copied from the preceding game or other genres.

The artstyle itself is what you'd expect from a dev team that cares. Pretty, bright, dark, gloomy, overlapping, smooth, and overall very pleasing.

Musical scores fit the setting but aren't my personal favourite, still great stuff there.

The gameplay is where it really kicks into Nth gear. You start off with extremely little and end up with very much, with a very strong progressional curve all the way through. Controls are near mint (minus a point for the damn grapple hook problem where it fires and then just ignores your inputs on re-fire occasionally) and feel fluid, tight and other such conflicting words. Pretty much how you'd want platformers to handle in a nutshell.

Map variety is very strong. Despite being mostly in a very same-ey looking area for stretches of times, it litters enough of the place with interesting bits and sub-areas that add to the whole.

Overall this game is very enjoyable, has clearly had effort put into it (the right kind) and feels like a worthy addition to anyone in the market for games with this theme.

Praiseworthy release, wish it was longer. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198417810061', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1566137838}
review:
First things first: if you enjoyed the first Steamworld Dig, you'll absolutely love the sequel. If you didn't play the first game, however - and you enjoy challenging metroidvania-styled games - then this can also be a great for you.

The next chapter in the Steamworld series builds upon what the first set in stone and in many great ways:
[list]
[*]The overall look of the game is a complete workaround, as SD2 went through a graphics overall using things such as more detail, better lighting and smoother animations. All while still keeping the same style that was consistent of the first game.
[*] The gameplay has been improved tenfold, with MANY more upgrades to aquire either topside or underground, along with smoother and funner combat scenarios, bosses, puzzles, etc.
[*] A few new biomes to explore are included, each with their own lore and "feel" to.
[*] Soundtrack has more soul put into it and each track sounds great, matching whatever biome or area the player is in.
[*] The story and characters have been improved much more. Each character now has a purpose, or atleast alot more personality towards them, and the story was equally cute, sad and terrifying.
[/list]

Loved it myself. Plan to try to get 100% soon. 10/10, would reccomend always!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060273587', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1522972445}
review:
Overall, if you liked Steam World Dig, you'll love this one. I highly reccomend this one over the first game. Woo!

Let me first say that this game greatly expands from SteamWorld Dig providing more Gameplay than what the first ever did.

The Graphics seem different, but seems to be a more fleshed out version of the first game.

Soundtrack is more ambient this time around. Although I feel that the soundtrack and the game itself missed the mystical feel of Old World, but provides a new Biome full of challenges and wonder. 

The gameplay is fresh as it innovates from the first game's core mechanics. 

The Story is a bit more robust this time around as Dorothy looks for Rusty. I like the twists and turns throughout the game and the ending just floored me. For Spoiler reasons, I won't get into it. If it intrigues you, play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061211327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1823, 'last_played': 1523030452}
review:
I definetly recomend this game to anyone who likes jump n jun games with awesome music, a little bit of backtracking and LOTS of secrets, witty puns and sneaky paths.
I usually go exploring out of the quest and I had it many times that I found A WHOLE NEW AREA where I just expected a tiny little secret. Some of the areas are secrets, some are just optional.
Also I recomend reading the artifact texts, they are really punny.
It is not necessary to play the first one before this, even thou I would recomend to do it. The second game is much better than the first one and A LOT bigger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1523234437}
review:
Not sure what it looks like as you read this, but I have had the SteamWorld character Rusty as my avatar for months. He really expemplifies my experience on Steam, unearthing great treasures and having a fantastic time. So, you know I am a big fan of the first steamworld dig game. It was one of the first games on steam that really thrilled me. I waited a while for the sequel to go on sale, just because I was buying hundreds of other linux games. I finally got around to playing this one tonight, and I blew through three hours in one shot. This game works perfectly on ubuntu linux 16.04, with xbox controller support, just like the other steamworld titles. It looks great, with advanced graphical lighting, and the sound is also excellent.

The equipment upgrades now have thematic descriptions, and they use a selective gear upgrade system. Much more interesting that the 1-2-3-4 upgrade progression, and it also lets you modify the game difficulty, too. The gameplay is exactly the same with wall-jumping, easy combat challenges, and the occasional boss fight. It is a lovely, lovely game, and I am glad that I waited to be in the right mood to enjoy it. I think the first game has its own merits, too, but this one is mostly superior. I would recommend this game to anyone who likes chill exploration games, with a bit of light combat thrown in. I think most people would enjoy this game.

(Update: I just finished SWD2 tonight, and I have to say that I liked the original SWD1 a bit better. I think I liked the roughness and edginess, which made the exploration seem a bit more dangerous and fun. I recommend playing these games in order, because it would be hard to go from the polish of SWD2 and then play SWD1. You'll appreciate the story if you play them in order, too.)

review: Played about 10 total hours. Super fun the whole time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012719001', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1523060039}
review:
Fantastisches Design und Umsetzung einer schönen Story. Sehr detailverliebte und durchdachte Level/ Passagen. Hier stimmt die Komposition aus Spielfluss, Schwierigkeitsgrad, Loot, Geheimnisse, Musik und Effekte....

Kurz gesagt: Dieses Spiel hat mir von Anfang bis Ende sehr viel Freude bereitet und wenn man bei Eintritt des Abspanns etwas wehmütig wird, dann kann ich für meinen Teil sagen, dass die Entwickler hier sehr gute Arbeit geleistet haben.

Danke für diese schöne Spielerfahrung!

Die GurkenNase

author: {'steamid': '76561197960817851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1522703967}
review:
This is a very good and well polished game. It's even better than the first one.

Excellent for casual gameplay and still have a lot of (optional) caves that requires high skill in order to get special items.

The graphics are great and the overall steampunk theme is really nice. Also the controls are sharp and it is fairly easy to do quite complex movements even with the keyboard controls.

Highly recommended.

review: SteamWorld Dig 2 ist das beste Metroidvania-Actionspiel, das ich bis jetzt gespielt habe. Das Buddeln und Sammeln, das Entdecken und einkaufen machen unglaublichen Spaß und motivieren ungemein zum weiterspielen. author: {'steamid': '76561198058520447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1522126018}
review:
The game is very good looking, extremely polished and mechanically sound (albeit somewhat frustrating at times), but I think it lacks the significant amount of content I expected from a game with this pricing, even though I bought it on sale. I also feel it has little or pointless replayabilty.
It's charming, clearly very well made and thought out, but I ultimately think it's a short ride for such a robust price tag.

TL;DR a really solid-built charismatic lil game without significant catharsis or substance

author: {'steamid': '76561198096608094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1592094614}
review: This game was kind of alright, for the four and a half hours I spent on it, until I managed to cut off a whole area from exploration because I didn't think to get above a golem that was moving toward me, rather than below. I thought, no problem, I'll just leave the area and re-enter. Didn't work; golem was still there. Okay, I thought, I'll trigger my self-destruct and then return to the area, but that didn't work either. Finally I quit the game and reloaded it. The golem was still there, blocking my path. That a simple mistake could permanently cut off a whole area of exploration speaks poorly to the design choices, and it was the deciding factor in this negative review of what was otherwise a merely adequate game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083990675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1692325388}
review:
This is an outstanding game. The first one was very good and this one improves on it in every possible way. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys platformers and metroidvanias. 

Two things I find highly appealing in games are a sense of exploration and character progression. This does both extremely well. You'll explore a large variety of environments and the tactics you use to navigate each environment vary within the different sections. Secrets are plentiful and the challenges required to get them all require a wide variety of skills. Your character starts off fairly weak but by the end of the game you're just plowing through the environments and nothing stands in your way. This was an extremely satisfying game to play through and I will certainly play through it multiple times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026542146', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1521477527}
review:
What an amazing short little story, the game itself has a certain charm to it which gives the game an amazing adventure feeling. The game looks gorgeus and the game mechanics are simple and easy to understand.
Good progression and exploring is rewarded, you also get progressive new unlocks as you progress through the game its not all bought.
I wanted to play this as i was a big fan of motherload when i was a kid, if you are expecting a straight up mining game you gonna get a whole lot more. The game doesnt have that much focus on the mining part, doing so rewards you with useful upgrades and there is alot of customization when it comes to what kinda upgrades you want using the gears you find around in the world but its more of a story progression game and not a grindy game, you are not locked behind anything cause you havnt "mined enough"

The game is not really hard, but you will die, several times (23 times) aswell but its more of a learn as you go, the more times you try to do something the more you will progres. There are also some nifty cool puzzle rooms which can be challenging in itself, it takes a while to figure some out and i myself struggled with some of the room to unlock the collection stuff.
I spent 5 hours completing the whole game with a 28% collection score and 5194 wealth score, i wasnt exactly looking for all collections but if i saw one i wouldnt stop before i got it.
can challenge yourself going for 100%

That being sad game is great overall but playing trough it once is enough. There is alot more to say about the game but i think you should rather just play it through if you enjoy it, if you not fan of cartoony "childish" games i would stay away but its very short and it gave me some fun downtime. Also alot of great humor in it.

Good value for your money
Looks: 10/10
Gameplay 7/10
Music: 8/10
Difficulty 5/10
Exploration: 7/10
Enjoyment: 10/10
Story 8/10
Overall 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197990887353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1570223852}
review:
Прекрасная графика, стиль.
Интересный геймплей - копаем, ищем сокровища, но думая так, чтобы можно было вернуться ))
Минусы: ужасное управление на геймпаде (попробуйте прыгнуть с разбега). На клавиатуре без проблем кстати.
Поэтому очень часто героиня тупит и никак не желает выполнять то, что вы от нее хотите. Это очень раздражает.
И сложность завышенная. На легкой сложности прямо в самом начале уже начинаются проблемы.
Не ясно куда идти, сложно понять как бить первого мини босса, на него еще и не запрыгнешь.
В общем гейплей интересный, геймдизайн страдает. Первая чась проблем вообще не вызывала.
Фонарь кончается за 2 минуты, и приходится туда сюда наверх ползать по 100 раз без смысла. Спорное решение. Ребята, мне в жизни этого хватает, зачем еще и в игре? Я в игру хочу играть, а не работать )

author: {'steamid': '76561197984345773', 'num_games_owned': 1422, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3050, 'last_played': 1654915893}
review:
This is one of the slickest and enjoyable metroidvania's I've ever played.  There is so much variety, charm and great game design packed into this thing.  The way they managed to connect the world while using inconvential digging mechanics is quite impressive.  The story is simple but well told, and you don't need to play the first game to figure out what is going on.  Graphically the 3D artwork is wonderful and the music is nice and relaxing.  This is a textbook way of how to craft an awesome and compelling Metroidvania and I think these guys are right up there with the Hollow Knight and Ori devs for best in class.

My only quibble is the end-game trials expose a little bit of impreciseness when it comes to the controls.  Not bad, but if you played Celeste and End is Nigh you will feel a bit annoyed going through these things.

Looking forward to playing the rest of the games in the series...

author: {'steamid': '76561198075194649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1521136337}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976086060', 'num_games_owned': 1948, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1520316171}
review: One of the best Metroidvenias I've played in recent times. Feels satisfying the whole way through. The story is a bit underwhelming, but thankfully there isn't much talking. The movement and gameplay is truly where this game shines. The upgrade system feels so addictive, unlocking cool new powers and swapping them depending on your needs. Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198284889103', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1522149696}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 - игра с крайне насыщенной цветами и деталями графикой. Собственно, из-за рисунка я игру и купил, и был разочарован в геймплэйе, поначалу. Потому что в игре надо тупо добывать ресурсы, чтобы продавать их и покупать «улучшения», чтобы добывать ресурсы было легче и быстрей, и так по кругу. Рутинно как-то. 
Но! После получения многих снаряжении и «улучшении» к ним, геймплэй становится чуть более веселым, и комбинировать эти устройства очень круто. Поэтому, у меня две претензии к игре: лучше бы все гаджеты были у нас с самого начала игры (а не одна долбанная кирка), и лучше бы в игре было куда больше боссов чем всего 3.
И в итоге, я все же провел приятные вечера играя в Steam… World… Dig… 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069866920', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1520571649}
review:
Отличный платформер. Подойдет людям любящим обыскивать все уголки локаций, пытающимся пробраться в те места куда еще рано, но при этом исхиртяясь пробираются в эти места. Игра получилась очень красивая. Внезапная смена локаций завораживала.
Субьективное мнение:
1. Сундтрек 50/50, были фавориты, но в основном музыка не понравилась.
2. Сложность бы повыше, боссы оказались для меня очень легкими, когда в обычных локациях частенько убивали обычные мобы.
10 разбившихся шахтеров из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075527011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1531728023}
review:
Купил, будучи воодушивлён первой частью и частью "ограбление".  Еслиб мог, вернул бы средства.

1) Анимация персонажей изменилась - они больше не роботы, а если и роботы то из пластелина.

2) Саундрек - ээээ, мне показалось или в игре действительно всего 2 мелодии одна когда просто бегаешь, вторая когда светильник заканчивается.

3) Авторам удальось таки не создать саспенс в этой игре - в СуперМазерлоад больше саспенса по прохождению.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137988952', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1519174803}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 didn’t light my world up like Hollow Knight did, but I still really enjoyed the game and would absolutely recommend it to fans of metroidvanias, or platforming games. Its focus on exploration through varied level design, a rewarding upgrade system, and unique power ups all push players to comb every inch of the game in search of treasure, which is very enjoyable. The story not being overbearing, while providing additional context to what was going on was also appreciated. My minor gripes with some of the upgrades being under powered and the boss fights leaving me wanting are not enough for me to advise people to steer clear. SteamWorld Dig 2 is a good game and if anything I’ve written above has you interested you should look into picking it up.

Full review here if you like reading: https://frostilyte.wordpress.com/2018/02/22/steamworld-dig-2/

author: {'steamid': '76561198030462418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1519440216}
review:
SteamWorld Dig was a slight, but eminently enjoyable game. SteamWorld Dig 2 expands on the first in most every way and I highly recommend it. 
The world feels more fully fleshed out; between the memorable characters, expansive world, and clearly designed experience, I was never disappointed in my time with the game. Without spoiling anything, Dot gains a series of mobility improvements throughout the game that at times felt as though SteamWorld had become a classic action platformer.
While it's not the longest game, at no point did I feel like my time was being filled by uneccessary activities. 
If you enjoy anything Metroid style exploration, or think you would enjoy exploring a fun vibrant world (and stripmining it for precious, precious jewels), this would be up your alley.
