author: {'steamid': '76561198002560940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1518424842}
review:
I played the original Steamworld Dig on the Wii U and I loved that game. It definitely could have been longer and have more things to do but it was an enjoyable experience and very relaxing to play.

The sequel here improves on a lot of what was in the first game with a few little hiccups. Aside from that it's a fantastic game and people should definitely check it out!

Pros:
-Fantastic steampunk robot world remains awesome. 
-Some really nice new art style , little more glossier looking.
-Digging is still addicting and fun. Killing enemies and solving ways to get more cash and manuever around terrains and in puzzle caves is still really fun.
-More upgrades to obtain , always a good thing. Ranges from upgrading your pickaxe , to your torch , bag size , water supply and more. 
-Cog Upgrade system allows you to obtain special abilities to further enchance your already upgraded stuff. I don't remember if this was in the first game but this is a great system and makes the game better when you have full movement on certain abilities.
-Bigger maps , really adds more to the game in a huge way.
-Despite seeing some compliants , I think the game has a good amount of hours. You can probally beat it in 10 , but I went beyond that trying to explore and do as much as I could.
-Plenty of Challenge Caves with various puzzles. Some are BS and you may rage as they explain nothing to you.
-There's 42 Artifacts in the game to find , a lot of them are hilarious and have great descriptions. 

Mixed:
-Story isn't bad , it's just not great. There's not enough detail to it. If you play the first game it connects to it.
-Soundtrack like the Story isn't bad but it's not great. And they keep looping the same songs over and over. Gets very annoying fast especially in that grotto area with the glowing plants. Endless creepy piano. The Town Theme IMO is the best.

Cons:
-[spoiler] While it's absolutely fantastic. Once you get the Jetpack you basically can do anything you want. [/spoiler]
-[spoiler] Having to unlock the ability to air shoot the water bombs...really? [/spoiler]
-[spoiler] After collecting all 42 artifacts , you're rewarded with a floating skull cave in the air that is a series of brutal challenges to get a certificate saying you did everything. It's very counter productive because you've already busted your butt trying to find everything. Why make the player suffer? I feel bad for achievement hunters. [/spoiler]
-I know the game is trying to maintain a challenge but losing everything you have or a good portion of it when you die is ridiculous as it suffers from the problem the first game had. No lost gems respawn, so if you get it ...that's basically it. It will never respawn again. You can equip an ability that lowers the amount you lose, but to be honest it's not that impressive. I had 250g worth of gems on me , it took 150g off  that one death.
-[spoiler] The Grappling Hook's [/spoiler] Controls feel very stiff and spotty , it's kind of a let down to be honest. Even with the upgrade.

Nitpicking:
-No New Game Plus+
-No Randomly Generated Steamworld Dig yet. Can you imagine the potential here.

Anyways pick it up. Highly recommend it. This team is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015269415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1647138447}
review:
[b]Ein toll gemachtes 2D Jump&Run das alles richtig macht, gut unterhält, nicht zu leicht oder zu schwierig ist und ausreichend Abwechslung bietet. Ideal für ein paar gemütliche Abende.[/b]

Wer lieber Zahlen mag: [b]80/100[/b]

SteamWorld Dig 2 bietet im Vergleich zu seinem Vorgänger mit etwa 8-10 Stunden die doppelte Spielzeit. 
Das Spielprinzip ist das gleiche: Schätze ausbuddeln, Schätze in Gold eintauschen und damit die eigene Ausrüstung verbessern, Gegner bekämpfen und sich immer tiefer graben. Natürlich macht man das nicht grundlos, es gibt eine kleine Story und somit ein Ziel das man verfolgt. 

Die Gegnervielfalt ist jetzt nicht sonderlich groß aber wie bei allen Teilen des Spiels wird einem etwas Neues vorgesetzt wenn man gerade denkt, das Gebiet kann ich nicht mehr sehen, immer die selben Gegner etc.
Die wenigen Bosskämpfe sind nicht sonderlich anspruchsvoll noch wirklich spannend. Da wäre deutlich mehr drin gewesen.

Anmerkung: Es gibt keine Schußwaffen in diesem Spiel. Es wird nun mal gebuddelt und dann dient das Grab-, Greif- oder Sprengwerkzeug als Waffe. Die Kämpfe sind aber auch nicht das, was das Spiel ausmacht.

Neben den Kämpfen gilt es Schätze auszugraben, versteckte Artefakte zu finden, vereinzelt ein paar kleine Rätsel lösen.

Graphisch sieht das Spiel sehr nett aus, im Vergleich zum Vorgänger gibt es nun mehr Gebietsarten unter der Erde was optisch und spielerisch für etwas Abwechslung sorgt. 

Soundeffekte und die Musik sind ebenfalls sehr gelungen und passen toll zum jeweiligen Levelabschnitt.

Die Steuerung (GamePad wird empfohlen!) funktioniert gut und man stürzt wegen dieser so gut wie nie in den Tod.

Es gibt ein paar Herausforderungen die man bei einem erneuten Durchspielen erfüllen kann, aber insgesamt ist der Wiederspielwert ziemlich gering.

Ich empfehle den ersten Teil vorher zu spielen. Der ist fast genauso gut.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998816230', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1507901030}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027236055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1529535339}
review: I don't play platformers usually but this one is so much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970358346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1518273590}
review:
Delightful platformer crossed with a Dig-Dug aspect that brings an enjoyable sense of exploration, and where you'll learn right up to the game's end different ways to reach stuff while digging, or ways to drop boulders on enemies and not yourself. :)
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1302194356
Enjoyable dialogue and personalities, and distinctive graphics.

Surprisingly deep skills trees for buffs and equipment upgrades (Cog Mods).
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1302192708
Spot-on controls when using a controller (XBox360 for Windows for me) -- I don't recommend kb/m due to the sheer amount of button-mashing but it's certainly supported. Satisfying I would think for more avid platformer fans, but just the right of "forgiving" for less adept platformer players like myself. The game is generally quite generous with quick-travel waypoints and then eventually a way to fast travel back to home base from almost anywhere, and does not viciously punish you for making mistakes.

Lots and lots of secrets and secret passages to find; I didn't come close to finding them all on my first try.

My only couple tiny 'cons' would be there's one platformer sequence involving windy weather I found truly exasperating. I almost thought I wouldn't get past it; just took some patience. :) The finale of the game all but requires a certain level equipment upgrade and then special Cogs upgrade -- but if you go in a different direction through the upgrades during the course of the game, you can paint yoursef into a corner where it's very difficult to scratch together enough money for those needed upgrades.

Other than that, I found Steamworld Dig 2 an utter and playfully addictive delight, and I'm not really much of a platformer player. :) I'm anxious to try the first game (2013 release) at some point.

If you're seeking a platformer that's playful in both gameplay and character personalities, explorative and just plain fun - rather than one of soul-crushing difficulty - I highly recommend it. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970488438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1519302994}
review:
This is not a Metroidvania. I really don't understand why so many people consider it to be. The combat is terrible. Movement is slow and impercise and the Dig Dug mechanic is as far from Metroid or Castlevania as can be. The character progression is mostly based around grinding for cash and paying for minor upgrades once you've aquired the basic tools, which happens VERY early on.

Metroidvania's are about discovering new, game-changing methods to traverse the environment, not grinding for cash (resources serve no purpose other than trading for cash) and paying to shoot a grenade just a little farther. There's no fluidity to the gameplay; just cumbersome plodding through grid-style levels that differ only in asthetics.

In short, this game is slow, repetitive and just plain boring. I only wish I had come to this conclusion within my two hour return window.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026700243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1518423302}
review: The game graphics, the gameplay, and the music are done extremely well.  A fantastic merge of mining and metrovania style games.  The joystick control is tight, the puzzles are smart, there is a strategy as to where to dig and how to defeat enemies.  There are not that many boss fights, I didn't finish the game yet but I have only fought one single boss after about 10 hours playing.  Good metrovania games are pretty rare and this one gets rated way up there. A must buy for anyone who likes action adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993473791', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1518189816}
review:
XBOX Oneコントローラーを使用。前作、今作ともにクリア済み。前作との比較多めのレビューになっています。

[u]「スチームワールド ディグ」の続編のメトロイドヴァニア系横スク2Dアクション。ストーリーは前作の続きになっているが、前作未プレイでも問題なく進行できる。[/u]

[h1][b]【良い点】[/b][/h1]

◆ 基本的なシステムは前作同様で、地面を掘り進み、鉱石や敵を撃破時に出現するアイテムを拠点に戻って換金してそのお金で各種装備のアップグレードをしていき潜れる範囲を広げていくシンプルな物になっている。

◆ 前作と比較した場合、敵撃破時にも鉱石（素材）が出現するようになったので戦闘が無駄ではなくなった。合わせて、敵を撃破する事によって経験値が溜まるようになり、レベルが上昇する毎に鉱石の売却価格が上昇するようになった。一部装備のアップグレードには一定のレベルが必要だ。

◆ 今作では「Cog Mod」という、装備に能力を付与する機能が追加され、「Cog」というアイテムを使用して装備する。例えば「つるはし」のModであれば「敵を撃破時に追加で経験値「5」を得る」等の効果が追加できる。「Cog Mod」自体は対応したアイテムのレベルが上昇したり、設計図を入手する事で解放されていく。

◆ 所々にチャレンジ系の洞窟があり、洞窟の最後には上記した「Cog」や今作での収集要素の「Artifact」が置かれている。この洞窟自体はクリアせずともゲームの進行には影響はないが、「Cog」を入手すれば後半が楽になるし、洞窟の仕掛け自体が面白いものも多いので、チャレンジしていて面白いものになっている。

◆ 随所にショートカット用のチューブ（今作のワープ装置の様な物）が配置されたことにより、前作で面倒だった拠点への帰還が容易に行えるようになった。

[h1][b]【悪い点】[/b][/h1]

◆ 日本語がバッサリと抜かれている。解せぬ。

◆ 前作よりは多いものの、ボス戦が相変わらず少なめ。ゲームのシステム上、仕様が無いと言えば仕様が無いが

[h1][b]【総評】[/b][/h1]

前作での不満点を概ね解消した良作。目的がシンプルなこともあり、迷いにくく、メトロイドヴァニア系初心者の方にもオススメの作品だ。ただし、戦闘やボス戦を期待している方はご注意を。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/Fgp1xuGYOkc]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198066356014', 'num_games_owned': 1048, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1517698315}
review:
This was a huge step up compared to the first one. 
- This is about two to three times longer than the previous game. 
- Some of the puzzels were complex and some were really clever.
- Enjoyable locations especially how you can destory titles with enemies and things that explode.  
- Music was quite enjoyable and the artstyle for characters and enemies were charming. 

I didn't really have any issues or complaints about the game aside from these:
- For some reason on my end, OBS wouldn't allow the game to run well at all when game capture was on. Screen capture was fine, just not that.
- Twitch likes to mute a few parts of the game in VODs (looks like around the same area too). 

Honestly for 20 bucks, it's worth it. There's even something for you after getting the artifacts..... WHICH I WILL NEVER TOUCH AGAIN! Even with all of the upgrades I needed, I couldn't handle the trials the place throws at you! THAT is a place of skill which I hardly have at all. Good luck on that place if you do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078667637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 2543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1529155180}
review: Esperando SteamWorld Dig 3, 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071518291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1669198502}
review:
Played the original Steamworld Dig on the 3DS, of all things. Came to play it on Steam after and thoroughly enjoyed it, even though it was a bit on the short side. Eventually I decide to play this. I haven't regretted it at all.

It is as the other reviews say it is. It really a game that can serve as a truly worthy sequel. I have absolutely enjoyed my time with this game, which I can't say about too many other new or indie titles.

The game has so much more variety in just about everything. Enemies, ores, tools, upgrades, locations, NPCs... the list goes on, really.

A fantastic spelunky-thingy game and one I'd genuinely recommend to just about anybody.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054201744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1512836665}
review:
One thought that's plagued me ever since I played Rayman Legends was, "Man... Barbara REALLY needs her own Action RPG." Dig 2 is almost the EXACT game I imagined.

Positives:
- Tight controls
- Uprgrades are a blast
- Improved pacing from first game
- Beautiful artwork
- Rich world-building
- Short-and-sweet story

Negatives
- ...I can't think of any

author: {'steamid': '76561197986593893', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1516346296}
review:
tl;dr if fun and challenging are exclusively mutual, then pass on this. otherwise you'd better get it.

Overall I recommend the game however, i do have a negative point to share. 

I feel that the difficulty in this game is a bit off. I think it was way too easy- not to say that it wasn't fun, it just felt like i was never really challenged. 
Even now I'm trying to think of some parts that were challenging or tricky to figure out and the only thing that comes to mind was this one cave where you needed to use your grappling hook to avoid pushing buttons. But even that cave wasn't too bad, it only took me a few attempts. 
I appreciate the puzzles in the game, but they aren't challenging. 

I think the main issue is that the only things that stand in your way are puzzles and enemies. Your light going out is pretty much a non issue. And like i said puzzles weren't hard to figure out. That leaves us with enemies; at first they are easy, then a little more challenging as you find new ones, and finally they become non issues just like the light once you upgrade your gear a bit. It gets to the point where I don't even have to worry about anything I just ignore enemies and let them hit me because I'm pretty much invincible. It could be that the scaling of enemy difficulty falls behind the abilities from upgrades, or it might be depending on how you upgrade your gear, I'm not sure. I just know that as long as you're not a moron you're going to get the "best" upgrades- light can't go out, water heals you, etc. 

The funny thing though is that given the nature of the game, of course things trend more and more towards easiness- you are constantly getting better while remaining in the same areas. Don't get me wrong, there is a lot to explore and many areas that could be challenging if visited unprepared. But in the time you journey from one place to another you are digging through so much ore that in order to face challenge, you pretty much need to actively be less efficient/smart about things. Phewf ok well that's all for my rant.

In the game there are certain upgrades that only make the game harder, and i always had all of those enabled (as well as disabling the map pointers). This brings me to the logical thought of "well maybe I should have just not upgraded anything." I suppose that would be a matter of preference- I think I'd have less fun without the upgrades because there would be a huge sacrifice in the feeling of progression.

Anyways, I could go on but i don't want to get hung up on the same point. Everything else about the game is pretty great. I can nitpick on things like how it feels to control dot, but there's nothing that really interferes with enjoying the game. 

in conclusion: i don't recommend the game if challenge is a necessity, most of the time you know what to do and how to do and skill doesn't play a huge role- but it's fun to dig, collect, and buy/upgrade. You don't feel like you're on autopilot. It's always fun and exciting to find and enter caves. If you're a fan of motherload or anything like that where you mine and upgrade rinse and repeat, then this is a no brainer- best digging game I've ever played.

edit: the truth is that if you want a challenge you can find it in achievements, and not even the annoying ones like ending the game with gold stars in all categories. to hell and back in particular. but yeah just to /beat/ the game and not 100% is not a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053400872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1566239235}
review:
Великолепное продолжение неплохой игры.

Разработчики проделали феноменально качественную работу и учли и улучшили ВСЁ, что можно и нужно было учесть и улучшить. За что ни возьмись – всё радует.


Первая часть имела приятный визуальный стиль; очень условно присутствующий сюжет, выражающийся в весьма одинаковых комментариях горожан об очередном твоём апгрейде; но геймплейно она на 100% описывалась фразой "я и моя кирка" – это была игра исключительно про КОПАТЬ, о чём как бы намекали индикаторы "твёрдости породы", сразу встроенные в миникарту, и там же счётчик глубины, на которой ты находишься. Это не плохо, это просто как факт.


Во второй же части, при сохранении той же базовой механики копания, всё изменилось радикальнейше. Тут и сюжет завезли с какими-никакими персонажами и развитием. И карту сделали большую и разнообразную, с красивыми уникальными локациями, между некоторыми из которых ты реально путешествуешь, и не только под землёй – вместо вертикального столба, в который ты монотонно закапываешься всю игру. И главное, главное – изменился геймплей. Он стал НАМНОГО динамичнее и веселее. Разработчики явно понимали, что просто копать вниз во второй раз будет не интересно. Так, бомбомёт, взрывающий блоки за пределами досягаемости твоей кирки, который в первой части был твоим почти финальным апгрейдом, теперь дают едва ли не со старта – а значит, меньше возвращений назад чтоб сверху достать место на той стороне провала. Лестницы-расходники, позволяющие залезть туда, куда так было не допрыгнуть, исчезли – теперь у нас есть крюк-кошка! И он офигенен, между прочим, с ним – весело! Финальным апгрейдом мобильности выступает мечта любого исследователя – аж целый джетпак, и теперь можно удовлетворить свою розовую мечту залезть в каждый чёртов уголок карты. В общем, чем ближе к концу, тем больше игра из симулятора кирки становится "экшеном с вертикальным геймплеем" – на джетпаке и крюке летаешь по пещерам и ползаешь по стенам, расстреливая залпами бомб врагов, которые при смерти взрываются и таким образом меняют "поле боя" – ну красотища. Это увлекательно, это весело, это, в конце концов, ощущение прогрессии в игре – от шахтёра до Бобы Фетта.


Главное, что могу сказать насчёт механики – в игре есть перки, и выбранные перки можно сбрасывать и перекомбинировать как душе угодно. И это великолепно. Уже просто за это я люблю эту игру.


Минусов в игре я нашёл два:

1. Момент с перелезанием через стену в долине ветров. Там даётся буквально секунда-полторы между порывами ветра, и ты просто не успеваешь подпрыгнуть, приземлиться и перебежать через уступ. Я проторчал там минуты четыре, постоянно падая вниз, и так и не понял, как умудрился пройти это место. Очень неприятно.

2. Тайник позади голема в локации "Алтарь големов". Предполагается, что голем должен прошагать вперёд и упасть с уступа, открыв тебе дорогу. Вот только... он НЕ ПАДАЕТ с уступа. Он каким-то образом, вопреки всем законам физики, буквально пяточкой остаётся на этом уступе стоять – тем самым намертво блокируя путь, т.к. залезть наверх и активировать его снова становится невозможно. Пришлось возвращаться в это место аж после получения джетпака (спасибо хоть он есть в игре). Явный косяк разработки, чуть-чуть недокрутили время/скорость движения голема.

В остальном же, за вычетом упомянутых минусов – это идеальная игра. Получил огромное удовольствие и массу приятных впечатлений от прохождения, и очень советую всем. И аплодирую авторам. Великолепная игрушка.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998146124', 'num_games_owned': 4530, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1516898781}
review:
I thouroghly enjoyed the game from beginning to end. I don't care to 100% it. I didn't like the upgrade that let you shoot a rope as I had a difficult time using it.

I enjoyed the story. I agree with other reviews that the game had everything that was good in the first game and fixed most of the bugs that existed in the first game.

I like the fact the world isn't randomly generated and most of the upgrades.

It was a blast playing it. I hope there's a Steamworld Dig 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209910323', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1517007140}
review:
Genialna kontynuacja Steamworld dig. Przed zagraniem wypada zagrać w pierwszą część, aby fabuła była bardziej zrozumiała. 
Zalety:
+grafika
+optymalizacja(stałe 60 FPS na słabym laptopie) 
+fabuła, która wciąga 
+ciekawy mechanizm ulepszania postaci poprzez manipulowanie zębatkami, dający niestandardowe ulepszenia
+setki sekretów, po kilkadziesiąt w każdej lokacji(widziałeś kiedyś 20 sekretów w lokacji tutorialowej? xD) 
+otwarty świat, pozwala odkrywać nowe miejsca w starych lokacjach wraz z nowymi umiejętnościami

Wady:
-dobry, ale ubogi w ilość pojedyńczych utworów soundtrack

author: {'steamid': '76561198064906892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1707835436}
review: I love this game and Steamworld Dig 1 . They were extremely addictive and fun even for someone like me who is not typically good at platforming. The jumping was really hard but not to the point of frustrating yet (cross my fingers). Sometimes, I accidentally back out of the cave entrance and had to redo the cave, or I miss some gems because I couldn't make the jump. I think I am about 1/3 through this one and 2/3 through the 1st one. I am playing them simultaneously. I find Steamworld 2 better in terms of the number of portals they give you to get back to town. I also like the interchangable cog system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131657907', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1552332667}
review: nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198008693173', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1516632086}
review:
This builds successfully on Steamworld Dig. The story is more engaging and better character development. 

The puzzles are good fun if a bit of frustration at times. 

I really enjoyed the simple mechanics of digging, selling minerals, and upgrading. This game builds on the previous mechanics and just makes the core gameplay feel more enjoyable. 

The game has additonal items to find and secrets (normally rewarding you with upgrade cogs). 

I did like the use of the upgrade cogs so you could switch in tools and weapon mods that fit your play style.  

Overall, I would really recommend checking out this game (also the previous title in the series).

author: {'steamid': '76561197982983713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1658356639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077222032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1613328537}
review: Нереальная годнота. Немного подгорал из-за постоянных смертей по своей групости, но игра стоит кадого потраченного рубля! Рекомендую! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198298353882', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1604560306}
review:
Огромным удовольствием для меня оказалась новость о том, что внезапно выходит вторая часть игры.
Я ожидал многого: багов, недоделонностей, отсутствия сюжета, и, скатывания интересности повествования куда-то с горы вниз, как это обычно бывает в продолжениях линеек игр/сериалов.

Но эта игра - просто великолепно. Настолько теплых, летних, детских переживаний я не ощущал с момента самого детства. Когда ты уезжаешь в свой маленький мирок, куда-нибудь к бабушке за город. По утрам кукарекают петухи, ты просыпаешься с лучами солнца в окно, а уже вкснюще пахнет с кухни. И для тебя волнительное время: ведь ты собираешься на базар, где много разного интересного для маленького мальчика! И еще тебе там обязательно что-то купят, хоть и не говорят об этом. И у тебя нет никаких забот: все что тебе нужно делать - это читать книги из летнего списка чтения... 

У каждого, думаю было что-то такое, любимое, что прячется в глубине сердца.

Так вот, в игре - нет cgi роликов, здесь не нанимали актеров, нет реалистичной графики, на которую тратятся миллионы сейчас и нет ни одного слова в привычном звучании. Но она дарит то, что должны дарить игры: минуты удовольствия. От каждой детали. Разработчики сделали несколько огромных шагов вперед, хотя я и от прошлой части был в восторге.

Я крайне рекомендую эту игрушку. Здесь есть сюжет, который меня на удивление тронул почти до такого, как и Mass Effect, без шуток. Я купил игру с какой-то небольшой скидкой, как она только вышла, всего рублей на 30 дешевле, но и за полную цену ее смело можно брать. Таких ребят, кто создает игры душой а не ради наживы - стоит поддерживать. Тем более в плане эмоций вам это в пару раз точно окупится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321262752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1515594580}
review: This game absolutely rocks!!! One of the most fun games I've played in ages. Everything is done well and smartly. It only took me about 14 hours to beat, so my only complaint is I wish it was longer. But I highly recommend you play this!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999847024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1516463647}
review:
Can't add much to the other reviews...not a "hardcore" platformer, but FUN. You won't be repeating puzzle levels 20 times to get through them, or doubling back to things you couldn't get before an upgreade. Some of the minerals are a bit tricky to get, which is, again, fun. So: challenging enough to be fun for non-hardcore platform people, but mellow enough not to be pulling your hair out (though i don't have much left as far as that goes). 

Let's just say I have a number of other digging and spelunking type of games, and dug (sorry) right into this one where the others didn't really engage me. HIGHLY recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005574741', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1516416594}
review:
If you ever played the MotherLoad game back in the old days of Miniclip you will be right at home. 

Steamworld Dig 2, is a digging mining 2d platformer. The main objective is to collect precious metals and crystals to fund your quest to your lost friend Rusty who has mysteriously disappeared.  

The game balances the gameplay experience by giving you interesting Puzzles (Caves) to complete and you progress through the depths of the earth. You encounter enemies that lurk and harm you if provoked, Using the supporting load out which you can customise on the surface you can defeat these enemies in interesting ways. 

Overall really enjoyed this game and how it slowly ramped up in difficulty whilst still being refreshing and captivating.

review: This is an excellent game. I don't normally play Metroidvanias but I gave this game a shot and I loved it more every hour I played it. author: {'steamid': '76561197965573875', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1516133536}
review: A good sequel. Knows exactly when to drip-feed you new abilities and challenges in order to prevent the experience from feeling too repetitive. If you enjoyed the first game, or just want a smooth-playing 2D platformer that's all about rewarding the player for their efforts - with a healthy amount of optional logical puzzles and a couple of boss fights - then Steamworld Dig 2 has you covered.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968668200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1515855735}
review:
Fazit: Wer den ersten Teil mochte, der wird hier sicher seine Freunde haben. Für den nächsten Steam Sale kann man diesen Titel mit gutem Gewissen auf die Wunschliste packen.

Game: Der zweite Teil der Reihe SteamWorld Dig orientiert sich sehr stark am Spielprinzip seines Vorgängers und baut dabei seine Stärken noch weiter aus. In der direkten Fortsetzung steuert ihr nicht mehr den rostigen Roboter Rusty mit seinem roten Halstuch, sondern die aus dem Vorgänger bekannte Misty, die Rusty im ersten Teil schon immer bewundert hat und ihn mit allen nötigen Werkzeugen versorgt hatte.
Im zweiten Teil nimmt sie sich ein Herz, insofern dampfbetriebene Roboter mit einem Eigenleben ein solches besitzen und macht sich auf die Suche nach Rusty, da dieser spurlos verschwunden ist. 
In gewohnter Sidescrollermanier lauft, klettert, grab, springt und schwebt ihr in netter 2D Perspektive von rechts nach links und grabt euch immer weiter nach unten. 
Besonders positiv ist im zweiten Teil zu erwähnen, dass es nun eine Vielzahl an Gegnern gibt, welche alle unterschiedliche Herangehensweisen verlangen. Genauso geht es nun immer mehr durch Abzweigungen nach links und rechts fern ab der normalen Mine und ihr gelangt auf diesem Weg in Bonusareale. Diese sind nicht zwingend erforderlich, sind aber definitiv eine Reise wert.

Zudem hat sich in der Charakterentwicklung einiges getan. Nun könnt ihr euch nicht nur immer neue Ausrüstungsgegenstände kaufen. Ihr könnt nun auch "Rädchen" sammeln und so zusätzlich verschiedene Upgrades leveln. Auf diese Art könnt ihr noch einmal etwas mehr auf die Entwicklung Einfluss nehmen und motiviert euch genug um in alte Areale vorzustoßen und mit neuen Fähigkeiten auch dort noch einmal jeden Stein umzudrehen. Erwartet aber kein ausgeprägtes Charakterdesign, hierbei handelt es sich lediglich um eine ganz kleine und abgespeckte Version einer Spezialisierung. Das tut dem Spiel auch sehr gut, mehr wäre an dieser Stelle auch nicht zielführend gewesen.

Die Geschichte dagegen ist doch sehr vorhersehbar und birgt keine großen Überraschungen. Die Story gibt uns einen Grund, warum wir immer weiter und weiter buddeln, mehr aber auch nicht. Die Hauptmotivation liegt mehr im meist recht entspannten daddeln für zwischendurch, was auch wirklich viel Freude bereitet. Genau wie im ersten Teil seid ihr nach 5-10 Spielstunden am Ende angelangt. Je nachdem wie zügig man sich voran buddelt, ist man also recht zügig durch. Ich empfehle jedoch: Nehmt euch die Zeit und genießt es. Schaltet einen Gang zurück und lasst das wirklich schön gezeichnete Design des Spiels und der Charakteren auf euch wirken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048787867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1515891347}
review:
I just beat SteamWorld Dig 2 (10.9 hours). The overall difficulty of this game over the first one felt much lower due to the cogs allowing you to make the game play to your style. A small complaint I had was that some upgrades made certian other weapons feel under utilized (Jetpack>Grapple). I would for sure recodmmend this to anyone who played the first game and liked it. 

Pros:
+With cogs you are allowed to play according to your play style.
+Lots of fanfare if you have played the first game and Heist
+Quicker gameplay than the first game.
+Liked the differnt areas.
+Loved the jetpack.

Cons:
-Re-tracking some of the same areas in the later part of the game didn't feel needed.
-The level up system didn't not really benifit the gameplay as money was already fairly abundant. 
-A few cog upgrades are almost mandatory (lava boots).
-Wish there was a post-game of some sort, it relaods before the final boss.

This should be a must buy :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198151780051', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1515357265}
review:
[h1]ОУСОМ![/h1]

Купив как-то на распродаже первую часть данной игры, и не ожидая от неё ничего особенного, я был приятно удивлён, чего уж там, я влюбился в этот прекрасный и чудесный мир, созданный волшебниками из Image & Form. Эти ребята подарили мне совершенно ни с чем не сравнимое чувство восторга от прохождения их игр, которое напомнило мне те детские впечатления от моих первых игр на Sega Mega Drive и PC, которые полностью поглощали мой разум и не давали от себя оторваться. Вот примерно то же самое я ощутил поиграв в первую часть Steam World Dig, а вторая часть была, так сказать, второй дозой кайфа. Это именно тот случай, когда сиквел берёт все лучшее от оригинала и делает все то же самое, только чуточку лучше.

[h1]Оставляет после себя приятное впечатление![/h1]

Игровой процесс прост до безобразия, но за это ведь люди и любят indy-игры: ты не должен разбираться в премудростях управления, сеттинге игры, её хитростях и прочем. Ты просто играешь и получаешь удовольствие. Easy as duck, right? Мы копаем шахту, добываем ресурсы, попутно прокачивая инвентарь. И всё это происходит под флагом ненавязчивой сюжетной линии разбавленной всякими заданиями. 

По сравнению с предыдущей частью, игра заметно стала длиннее. У меня прохождение заняло без малого 9 с половиной часов (по сравнению с 6,7 часов в первой части) при этом процесс прохождения совершенно не давал оторваться, заставляя засиживаться у монитора до поздна, не смотря на то, что утром нужно рано вставать на работу)))) А за крипи-уровень в вектроне - вообще большой респект! Не знаю как, но создатели каким-то образом заставили меня покрыться мурашками, музыка и нарастающее чувство тревоги сделано прям на 10-ку. 

Так что для любителей easy-going на пару вечеров - бест чойз!
Лично я с нетерпением жду продолжения!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067095535', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1711560733}
review:
Sie ist da!!! Die meinerseits so sehnsüchtig erwartete Fortsetzung des Roboter-Buddlers, welcher mir vor 3 Jahren – WTF?! Echt so lang her? :O – zwar recht wenige, dafür umso vergnüglichere Spielstunden beschert hatte und schlagartig meine Liebe zum SteamWorld-Franchise auflodern ließ. Endlich wieder die Spitzhacke auspacken, mich tief in Minen durchgraben, Klunker und Erze einsacken und all dem bösen Wild das mir ans Blech will eins überbraten. SteamWorld Dig 2 (= SWD 2) hat all das was schon seinen Vorgänger so auszeichnete (und so zum Geheimtipp machte), und doch ist es mehr als eine bloße Kopie desselben. Mit größeren Untergrund-Welten, noch mehr gut versteckten Geheimnissen, einem Zuwachs an Charakter-Fähigkeiten/-Upgrade und noch größerem Suchtfaktor haben die Entwickler ein weiteres Sahnestück im Metroidvania-Genre geschaffen bei dem Entdecker-Drang und humorvoller Charme nicht zu kurz kommen.

Wir erinnern uns:
In SWD1 zog Cowbot Rusty ins Wüstenkaff Tumbleton, wo er das frisch geerbte Bergwerk in Augenschein nahm. Er grub sich tiefer und tiefer ins Erdreich, brachte Unmengen Bodenschätze zu Tage, stieß auf geheimnisvolle Untergrundwelten – und auf Voltbot, einer mächtigen wie fremden Vectron-KI die alle Cowbots zu assimilieren bzw. zu unterjochen versuchte. Rusty stellte sich ihr, bezwang sie… Und ging danach ohne Abschied wieder seiner Wege.
Dorothy (oder kurz Dot), eine der wenigen Tumbleton-Bewohner die ihn kennenlernen durfte, sucht nun nach dem Held der sie alle gerettet hat. Sie folgt seiner Spur in Richtung El Machino, wo er zuletzt gesehen wurde. Dort angekommen, muss sie sich nicht nur – wie zu erwarten – durch tiefste Stollenwerke durchkämpfen, sondern auch der Ursache schrecklicher Erdbeben auf dem Grund gehen die die Erde auseinanderzureissen drohen…

Der Story große Aufmerksamkeit zu schenken ist hier zwar keine Pflicht, dennoch schadet es nicht den kurzweiligen, textbasierten Dialogen zu folgen. Wie schon Teil 1 ist auch Dots Abenteuer von viel Witz, frechen Bemerkungen und genüsslichen Wortspielen geprägt, und allein dafür kann sich SWD2 einen ganz großen Sympathiepunkt sichern.
Kleine Fun Fact-Anmerkung: SWD2 liefert eine schöne Erklärung warum sich die SteamBots zukünftig im Weltraum aufhalten, wie in „SteamWorld Heist“ gesehen. ;)
Das eigentliche Gameplay hat sich verglichen zum Vorgänger nur geringfügig (aber sinnvoll) geändert, und das ist durchaus positiv zu verstehen. Nach wie vor bleibt die Spitzhacke das wichtigste Werkzeug überhaupt, und weiterhin bahnt sich der Spieler seinen eigenen Weg durch die komplett von Hand erstellten Erdschichten um in noch tiefere Gegenden zu gelangen. Freigeschaufelte Erze wie Edelsteine werden eingesackt und allerspätestens dann an der Oberfläche gegen Bares verkauft wenn man nicht mehr tragen kann oder die Öllampe kein Licht mehr spendet. Im Grunde also ein ständiges, wortwörtliches Rauf und Runter. Eine Routine die aber ungemein viel Spaß macht. Sind die Einnahmen hoch genug kann damit Dots Equipment stetig verbessert werden: Die veredelte Spitzhacke schlägt sich besser durch härteres Gestein, die Sammeltasche vergrößert sich, die Lebensenergie steigt und die Brenndauer der Lampe hält länger an. Desweiteren kommen nach und nach weitere Extras hinzu, wie z.B, ein Presslufthammer, eine Bombenpistole oder ein Greifhaken. All das ist nicht nur bloßes Beiwerk, sondern ungemein wichtig um zunächst undurchdringbare/ unerreichbare Areale früher oder später zugänglich zu machen. Wer sich außerdem die Mühe macht und nach verflucht-gut versteckten Artefakten plus Verbesserungsrädchen sucht und fündig wird, bekommt zusätzliche Mods freigeschaltet welche die Buddelarbeiten erheblich erleichtern bzw. Rückwege enorm verkürzen können.
Das Spielgefühl ist für SWD1-Kenner augenblicklich vertraut, aber selbst Neulinge werden sich hier bestens zurecht finden, da Image&Form interface-mäßig alles übersichtlich und klar verständlich hält, einer langwierigen Eingewöhnungsphase bedarf es hier nicht.

War der Erstling noch gut 7 Stunden lang, so darf man hier gerne 10 Stunden (+/-) einplanen, wobei die Spieldauer auch ein wenig davon abhängt ob man ganz akribisch nach jedem einzelnen der insgesamt 42 Artefakte sucht und jedes Areal zu 100% erforscht oder eben nicht. Aufgelockert wird das Buddeln zudem durch zahlreiche kleine Rätsel bei denen u.a. Schalter-Mechanismen ausgelöst oder nicht sofort ersichtliche Routen entdeckt werden wollen. Ein Paar Bosskämpfe gibt es auch, zählen aber nicht zu den eigentlichen Highlights des Spiels. Dazu hätten die Entwickler mehr Zwischenbosse mit zusätzlicher Herausforderung einbauen müssen, doch wie gesagt, der Spaß findet sich im stetigen Buddeln, Forschen und Rätseln, und davon hat SWD2 eine ganze Menge. 
Die Bedienung erweist sich als tadellos; Dot lässt sich sehr präzise steuern, ihre Fähigkeiten problemlos auslösen, und je mehr Verbesserungen sie sich aneignet desto agiler und dynamischer ist sie in den Minen unterwegs. Einzelne Gameplay-Eigenheiten des Vorgängers haben die Entwickler hier sogar besser integriert oder gar entschlackt, wie z.B. der Wegfall der kostenpflichtigen Lebensenergie oder des Lampenöls, diese füllen sich nun automatisch auf sowie Dot regelmäßig in El Machino aufschlägt.

Die comichafte 2D-Optik im serientypischen Zeichenstil hat auch in SWD2 nix an Reiz verloren, darum fühlt man sich auch in der Dots Blechhaut und ihrer Umgebung schlicht pudelwohl. Die vielen kleinen Details und liebevollen Animationen stechen hier noch viel besser hervor, die Beleuchtungs-/ Lichteffekte erscheinen noch hübscher, generell wirkt das Spiel in Bewegung noch einen Tick runder/flüssiger als Rustys Debüt (welches aber auch heute nach vielen Jahren weiterhin gut ausschaut).
Die Soundkulisse ist gemessen an der Zahl der herauszuhörenden Effekte zwar nicht sehr breit gefächert, fügt sich aber sehr gut ins Untergrundgeschehen ein, während die musikalische Untermalung abermals von Western angehauchte Themen mit etwas Steampunk verbindet und eine immerzu passende Stimmung erzeugt.

Fazit:.
SWD1 hat einen würdigen Nachfolger erhalten. Die echten Neuerungen sind gar nicht so tiefgreifend wie man denken würde und soviel anders macht dieses Sequel am Ende auch nicht, trotzdem spielt sich Dots Reise in unbekannte Tiefen einfach fabelhaft. SDW2 ist daher nicht zu Unrecht einer der Besten seines Genres – und ein unglaublich Süchtigmachender noch dazu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024807046', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1516987835}
review:
Really good game! I haven't played the original, but this seems to be universally better then the first.

Steamworld Dig 2 a blend between a mild action game (like Metroid, or Guacamelee), and exploration game as Minecraft or Starbound. 

The design and style of the whole game is great. Every screen has lots of depth, the characters and backgrounds are detailed and beautiful. The music is amazing. There are some repetitive tracks, but every theme is very unique and fits, or better enhances, the style of the world. 

The gameplay is mostly exploration and fighting a bunch of different enemys on the map. The game feels very good to play. Movement feels direct, the game performs good, loading times are almost not noticable. The fighting works well with both projectile and melee weapons.
You can upgrade your kit thoughout the game and switch your tech-tree on the fly, which is nice to adapt to certain situations or enemys.

The story is not memorable. Even though the characters are unique and interesting, I didn't feel the need to engage with the story more then just read the text to find out where to go next. The hook for me is really the exploration and upgrade grind.

Absolutely worth the money they're asking for it.


Two ideas on how to make this game even more awesome:
adding more items/gear for customization, like in a dungeon crawler eg. Diablo; and expanding on the economy aspects, like integrating more ways how to spend money, coupled with a progression system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100388140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 845, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1515957560}
review:
Достойное продолжение первой части. На этот раз придётся спасать пропавшего дядю Расти из лап… нового злодея! Дороти умеет орудовать киркой ни чуть не хуже и с каждым апгрейдом в шахтах остаётся всё меньше руды и драгоценных камней.
Геймплейно это всё та же вертикальная метроидвания с тайными пещерами, коварными врагами и обвалами, головоломками и очень приятной музыкой.
С гайдами игру пройти можно очень быстро, но призываю вас отказаться от них, хотя бы на первое время, и вы получите удовольствие от этого приключения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153675640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1515981408}
review:
Superbe jeu et superbe metroid-vania, tout aussi génial que le premier, proposant peut être un peu plus de défi sur ses secrets et pour certaines de ses mecaniques de gameplay.

L'univers dans lequel vous vous enfoncerez sera: parfois chaleureux et "cosy" et parfois plus oppressant voir-même terrifiant pour un certain endroit.

Tout à fait jouable et terminable par des nouveaux venus pour ce genre et les habitués y trouveront sûrement de quoi les satisfaire.

Pour ceux ayant terminé le premier volet, ce jeu soulevera quelque questions comme: 
Vectron est il vraiment mort?   Rusty est-il encore lui même?    Est-il seulement vivant?
Mais d'où viens c'te truc qu'est l'pouss-café?    Pourquoi les soifard z'en ont b'soin?

Je vous recommande fortement ce jeu si vous aimez l'exploration, l'aventure et les jeux de plateforme.
En tout cas j'ai adoré le parcourir et je vais maintenant me pencher sur le décodage de ce cryptium si mystérieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000138415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1515353940}
review: Steamworld Dig 2 is a fun metroid-vania title which combinies traditional genre elements with a RPG-like resource grind  which keept me playing. review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197977852000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1515873977}
review:
Imagine Metroid, except the entire world is full of thousands of blocks that you have to tap a button to break before you can move forward. Also there's a timer that reduces your visibility as you tap, so you have to backtrack to town every couple of minutes.

Sounds terrible, right?

It feels to me like this game's positive reviews were paid for.

The only positive thing I can find to say about this game is that it has a relaxing soundtrack.

review:
this was a great game to play just casual while i watch shows and such, it continued the story fairly well after the first one (i bought this instantly after the first one ended) and the plot is well written, the new graphics are very welcome and the characters enjoyable
     the new money ways took a bit to get used to and upgrades took a bit to get the good ones
      but the further in you get the more caught by the story and fun mining you get, the cave designs are also made so you dont realise at first just how much there is

   the end boss was terribly designed compared to the rest and the ending was really lackluster, you know, they tried to do something big but ruined it by making it too big
 
    handy gabby is the best character
[edit]
   i just discoverd i beat the game before i found the grenade launcher

author: {'steamid': '76561198108552492', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1542426829}
review:
派手さはありませんが非常に良質で落ち着いて楽しめる2Dアクションゲームです。

つるはしで地面を掘る、鉱石を見つける、見つけた鉱石を地上に持ち帰り換金する、換金したお金で能力を強化する、これがゲームの基本的な流れになります。地下を探索中まわりを明るく照らすランプには時間制限があり、徐々に照らす範囲が狭くなっていき音楽も物悲しいものに切り替わり不安をあおります。ランプは地下にあるアイテムをとることで回復も可能ですが基本は地上に戻り回復することになります。

お金で入手する能力とは別に地底にかくされた「ステーション」を発見すると主人公の機能が強化され、移動できる場所が増えます。この手のアクションゲームでは定番のゲームシステムですが、先に進めなくて気になっていた場所に行けるようになるとすごくワクワクしますし、隠されたエリアを発見すると「ピロリーン」と音が鳴り達成感が刺激され癖になります。

地下探索のパズル要素は難易度的に適切だと感じました。私は難解なパズル要素があるゲームでは自分で解くことをあきらめて攻略動画を頼ることがあるのですが、このゲームではエンディングまでの一通りのプレイは全部自力でなんとかしました。これは単純に簡単だからというわけではなく、ゲーム画面から得られるヒントが適切なことと、プレイヤーキャラクターの行動選択肢がコントローラーの各ボタンに割り振られたアクションに限定されていることが理由だと思います。行動に自由度が高すぎると何をやっていいいかわからなくなり「無理、わからん」と諦めモードに入りがちですが、できることが厳選されていると、絶対なんとかなるはずという意識になり、いろいろ試そうという気になるからです。私は難解なパズル要素はゲームのテンポを悪くするだけで嫌いですが、本ゲームのような程よい足止めになるバランスのパズルは好きです。

ボス戦の数は少ないですが、特殊移動アクションの駆使と戦闘エリアの地形の考慮が必要で独特の緊張感があります。ボス戦での体力回復は戦闘エリアに複数固定配置された回復アイテムを取ることで行われますが、どのタイミングでとりに行くかの戦略も必要です。主人公ドロシーはボス戦では予想以上に脆くすぐ爆散します（ロボットとはいえショッキング）ちょっとでもダメージを受けたらすぐ回復アイテムに向かったほうがいいでしょう。

このゲームの印象をよくしている要因としてミスしたときに納得でき、リトライすることが苦痛ではないということが挙げられます。初めて遭遇する敵キャラクターも基本的に地下の壁越しとなるため、壁を崩して敵と接触するか、迂回して接触を避けるかはある程度プレイヤーの判断で行うことができます。また、危険な固定配置物も初見殺し的なものは無く（一部あったかも・・・）、ミスしたとき「はぁ？なんだそりゃ！」と思うことがなく次は注意してああしよう、こうしようと素直に思えるのはポイント高いです。

キービジュアルの主人公が不気味なことやSteam版は現時点で日本語が無いなど難点もありますがお勧めです。

review:
If you like SteamWorld Dig you can buy part two without hesitation. 

+More of everything, bigger, same humor. References to the actual popculture (yes, maybe even to a RAMMSTEIN song).
+You'll get addicted to dig deeper, get more minerals, spend it on more upgrades, search for secrets, repeat

-The only con I would mention is from time to time my Xbox360 controller wasn't as responsive as it used to be in every other game. Specially with very narrow timed jumping passages this can lead to a small amount of rage

author: {'steamid': '76561198108096921', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1702605967}
review: I just barely got done finishing the game... I must say it was quite a wonderful experience. I highly recommend anyone to give it a try if you are thinking about getting it. The game's strengths are its beautiful visuals, creative exploration, and customization on player build. I had an absolute blast playing this game and anyone else who has, would probably say the same. The only real downfall from this game was the short story. I managed to beat the game (not 100% by the way) with about 7 hours. I took my time playing and was not rushing for the most part. I just really wish the game was a bit longer. Therefore, I give this game about an 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198127592072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1515193113}
review: Хорошее продолжение 1 части. Примерно 5 миров с большими локациями, много пещер с загадками, некоторые довольно сложны в понимании. Прекрасный левел-дизайн, а так же карсивая графика и прорисовка окружения и персонажей. Хорошая музыка. Ну и конечно же сюжет со своими твистами. концовка игры дает понять, что если и будет продолжение, то оно должно быть совершенно другим, не похожим на первые 2 части. Разработчики молодцы.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991387553', 'num_games_owned': 1889, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1514572073}
review:
Fantastic game, strongly recommend for any metroidvania fan - it takes every element from the first game and dials it up to 11. Everything from digging to new weapon usage just feels so much better than in the original. The first game I quit playing after 3 hours, this one sucked me in and I finished it over 2 days and I cant wait for the next game.

Controls and platforming elements are tight with a good weight behind them and progression is paced perfectly.

review: Not terribly difficult of a game nor very long, I finished it in about 10.5 hours (took about twice as long as Steamworld Dig).  Only died a handful of times (almost all due to my own stupidity) and finished off the final boss in "Normal" mode on the first try.  Enjoyed it more than Steamworld Dig and may re-play it again to see if I can find all the "Secrets".

author: {'steamid': '76561198002062454', 'num_games_owned': 1484, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1515105802}
review:
A small and nice exploration game which may lack the depth and variety of other metroidvanias but offer a pleasant and refined experience nonetheless.
Lots of extra challenges and shortcuts will make sure every player feels challenged regardless of his skill level.

+ Great completionist experience
+ Sequence breaking is incouraged
+ Exploration is always rewarded, even with special items and upgrades
+ Cute graphics and music

- 21:9 support is the old fake horizontal zoom
- Controls feel a bit heavy

Difficulty advice: Normal, of course

4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198097590274', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1593742028}
review:
Fiquei completamente apaixonado pelo primeiro SteamWorld Dig, e não pude deixar de comprar a segunda versão. Como não se mexe em time que está ganhando, a equipe manteve praticamente o mesmo estilo de jogabilidade que fez o primeiro jogo ser tão legal. Se você jogou a primeira versão, só há duas diferenças importantes: 1) não é mais possível comprar escadas, o que, sinceramente, não fez falta nenhuma pra mim; e 2) os orbs brilhantes que serviam pra comprar coisas junto com dinheiro foram eliminados, graças a tudo o que é mais sagrado.

Embora a jogabilidade seja praticamente a mesma, a dificuldade está muito mais alta. No primeiro jogo você explorava com calma e as maiores chances de morrer eram caindo de algum lugar muito alto (por burrice sua mesmo). Já no segundo jogo tudo e todos querem te matar, e vai ser BEM mais difícil desbloqueaar a conquista de terminar o jogo sem morrer nenhuma vez. O jogo também é mais longo do que a primeira versão, o que é um ponto positivo, embora em alguns momentos pareça que o jogos está ficando mais e mais repetitivo a troco de nada.

Os gráficos estão ligeiramente melhores, com alguns efeitos novos, e agora há músicas (muito boas, por sinal) nas fases. O design dos níveis é magistral, e há bem mais variedade visual do que antes (muito necessário, diga-se de passagem). Minha única preocupação é como a série pode evoluir a partir daqui, já que parece que exploraram tudo o que poderiam explorar sem deixar o jogo repetitivo. Mas isso é coisa pro futuro. Jogo recomendadíssimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366049423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1683962266}

review: Excellent follow-up game to the original SteamWorld Dig.  The game developers expanded on the original with new environments, abilities, upgrades, puzzles and game mechanics.  Loved the graphics, music, and gameplay.  If only there was more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131943857', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1515037504}
review:
Wow....

Well, spoiler free review all I can say is it delivers. It fixed everything wrong with the 1st game and then some. Story was still shorter than I would like, and I still get sad that after you dig up all the ore, there is nothing left to dig, but I realize this isn't minecraft. It has a story, and a good one too, the point is to beat it, not dig all day lol.




Getting into some spoilers here, I'd say that I saw the end credits, looks like earth went boom, so... steamworld dig 3? I'd buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040002911', 'num_games_owned': 933, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1515018558}
review: Steamworld Dig 2 is the largest improvement a sequel has made that I've ever played. While Steamworld 1 was an interesting proof of concept, Steamworld Dig 2 is a full fledge platformer/dig-dug hybrid oozing with polish. One of my favorite games of the past few years.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998080923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1525996089}
review:
If you are a fan of the Steampunk sub-genre, or the Metroid games, or like exploration in video games in general, then Steamworld Dig 2 will deliver! Personally, I am amazed by the attention to detail put into the environments and by all the hidden secrets there are to find in the game world.

In addition, I find the art style and graphics very appealing and effective - the whole game  looks absolutely beautiful. Finally, the soundtrack is amazing - I actually have some of the themes stuck in my head now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989201926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1585046392}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001117740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 4820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1677381965}
review:
Loved the first game. The most disappointing thing about it was that it was so short.

I've already hit the same playtime with the 2nd game and I'm very happy that I've got WAAAYYYY more left to do. It's a lot more diverse in all aspects - a true successor done right!

Update: I finished the game and it was still too short. PLLLLLLLEEEEEAAAASSSEEE make a 3rd one with 20 bazillion hours of gameplay!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994666064', 'num_games_owned': 3746, 'num_reviews': 611, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1512948497}
review:
Bacana pra caramba, não consegui amar tanto quanto amei o primeiro, mas dá pra notar que o motivo é que o primeiro foi tão bom que minha expectativa nesse estava alta demais para simplesmente me contentar com o que foi dado. Por outro lado é um metroidvania robusto, contendo tudo o que o primeiro tinha e bem aberto com áreas próprias, uma quantidade enorme de segredos e upgrades, realmente bom! Análise detalhada aqui:

http://www.nerdmaldito.com/2017/12/steamworld-dig-2-picaretas-em-punho.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197999461808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1514683216}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994340232', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1514684324}
review:
Puxa, fantástico! Uma boa evolução em relação ao primeiro, e ainda sem perder a essência. Muitos segredos, os power ups são bem variados e as modificações deixam o jogo ainda mais interessante, podendo até mesmo acrescentar desafio. Gostei bastante, os mapas são maiores e mais variados, há mais ferramentas e os mapas são fantásticos. Uma fantástica jornada, com desafios variados e muitos segredos pra encontrar. A história é bem simples como no primeiro, mas satisfatória, e o mais legal é que acaba explicando uma coisinha do Steamworld Heist, vou até jogá-lo agora apesar de ser um gênero diferente.

Super recomendo, um ótimo jogo de aventura e exploração, com bons elementos de rpg e muitos puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992595004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1514206038}
review:
It's a solid game but nothing special.

Not sure why it's receiving so much praise - there's really nothing notable about this game at all. All the pieces fit together properly, it's colourful and reasonably charming.  But there's nothing I could point to that I really enjoyed doing, or that stood out. The best thing in the game is the hookshot and that's pretty limited.

Still a recommendation because I don't think anyone would have a bad time with this, just don't think any one's going to be thinking about it in 6 months.

I finished the game in about 7 hours with a moderate amount of collectible hunting.

If you're looking for a game in a similar vein that does a better job I'd go with [url=store.steampowered.com/app/367520/Hollow_Knight/]Hollow Knight[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198226372308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1515343804}
review: If you have played Steamworld Dig, then this game is a must have. If you have not play Steamworld Dig, then be aware that you may lost track of time when playing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143178945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1514570982}
review:
There is an okay game burried beneath this really unpolished game. Unfortunately you have to deal with some really floaty controls, some god awful level design. Then you'll be dealing with some absolutely absurd gameplay mechanics. I hope you'll enjoy going back to the hub area over and over again just to refil your lanturn and water because the game thinks you'll enjoy doing that for most of the game. You'll die a ton from enemies and falling rocks, and you'll probably find treasure seeking more frustrating than fun.  Also the end game content is beyond garbage, prepare to endure some absolutely horrendous, bullshit hard levels that only people who enjoy playing Cup Head with boxing gloves on will enjoy.

If you think this game might be up your alley, it's probably worth $8 at most, and that's if you're willing to tollerate what I listed above. The $20 list price is outrageous for this junk, it's clear Image and Form learned absolutely nothing from the first installment (Which I played on the 3DS). Terrible controls, terrible level design, extremely convoluted secrets. At the very least I can say I could convince myself to beat it, but that's not good enough to recommend it. There is ZERO replay value here, this is a poor sequel that just repeats all the mistakes the first game made.

If you want a good metroidvania game, go play Hollow Knight instead, it's a MUCH better game than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108241454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1514591715}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999920602', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 624, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1675588398}
review:
The third fantastic game from Image & Form. It’s a perfect blend of platforming, mining and metroid. The controls are tight, the level design and dialogue is great, and it’s a really satisfying mix between exploring and upgrading. Practically no backtracking and loads of content. This game bridges the first SteamWorld Dig game with SteamWorld Heist (and explains how they got in to space). Cannot recommend highly enough - looking forward to more from this studio. I played through the entire game in two sessions, which is incredibly rare for me.

[b]Completed in 8 hours (about 84% completion)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197960583962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1514560666}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023547654', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1514508738}
review:
Great game. Takes everything that makes Steamworld Dig fun and added onto it. Only problem I had was the ending.

"How should we end the game?"
"After you beat the boss, this will this happen."
"That's good but how do we resolve it?"
"Well we put some pictures at the credits, that don't even resolve it in a satisfying way. Which can only be resolved with DLC or another game!"
"That's a great idea!"

It was not a great idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089110753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1623651507}
review:
I really loved the original SteamWorld Dig.  Then I played SteamWorld Heist, although a little hesitantly.  Surprisingly loved that game even more than the original Dig.  But then this game came out and really blew the other two out of the water.  This is a really beautiful, awesome, well-designed game.  Normally I would wait for games to drop in price significantly (I have a rule that I try to buy games that are <$5), but I paid full price for this, and it was completely worth it.  10/10, would totally recommend.

Only two problems in my mind is: 1) it's too short, i want more! :( and 2) the final challenge (the trials of heaven and hell) is not as well done as say Guacamelee.  But this game is still completely worth it! Go buy it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024992655', 'num_games_owned': 3289, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1514495613}
review:
Admittedly I didn't play the first episode but I loved Steamworld Heist so I picked this up without hesitation despite being a completely different genre. 
Long story short, I enjoyed Dig 2 a lot! Actually it's the first platformer in a while I finished. Time flew by so quickly with this one that I never felt like I had to take a break.

Thanks for supporting Linux/SteamOS! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198049742690', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1514473006}
review: I beat this entire game in under 7 hours. The game is a true joy to play. Some other reviews have said that it takes time to get going, and they are not that wrong. I really did enjoy this game, and I believe that you should play it.

review: 很好玩的游戏，主要玩法就是挖矿—卖掉换钱—升级让自己变得更强—再挖更贵的矿—再卖掉再升级，很容易让人上瘾。关卡设计相当不错，几场boss战难度适中，操作手感也很舒服。剧情比较俗套，没有中文也无所谓。流程略短，完全没有在意隐藏要素收集的情况下五个小时就通关了，总之还是不错的一个小游戏，值得一玩。原价略贵，打折可以入手

author: {'steamid': '76561198011703826', 'num_games_owned': 1733, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1514500534}
review:
SCORE: 9/10

First off, Steamworld is an amazing universe. Image and Form have crafted it with love and humor, and I've really enjoyed my time in it. Steamworld Dig 1 and 2 were both polished game loops that were just fun. Steamworld Heist blew me away because it really was XCOM in 2D, but much cuter, funnier, and more fair. Steamworld Dig 2 is a great sequel because it improves on the first one in every way AND doesn't overstay its welcome with padding. It is concise and respects your time and skill, but has an amazing amount of replayability and collectible-hunting if desired.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975364621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1513934996}
review:
Short version:  Simple fun.
==================

Long version:
----------

The good:
- The controls are responsive.  The character is fun to control.
- Very little is just handed to you.  Your upgrades feel like you have earned them, which is satisfying.
- The upgrades feel impactful as soon as you get them.  Progress feels good.
- The colors and areas are vibrant except for Vectron, the machine place (Fair warning: that place can be a tad scary).  Areas stretch on for a bit, but they've put in good effort to vary up the locales.
- The map is simple but is easy to use.

Mixed:
 - Not exactly difficult.  Most of the fun comes from exploration and remembering places that you can access with later upgrades.
- While there is a bonus for finding all of the collectables, there is only one ending.

The bad:
- I mentioned that some of the areas stretch on for a bit.  I got slightly lost a few times just from the sheer expanse of the tunnels.
- The plot is probably the weakest point.  You start off with a simple yet adequate story of "Find your friend.  He was last seen at this place."  Nothing wrong with that, but the culmination to the ending lacks any real sense of "OH SNAP.  S*** IS GETTING REAL." except for a single prompt before the final boss that says you won't be able to go back.

In summary:
Though the abrupt ending will probably leave you wanting more, you want more for a reason.  The gameplay feels good all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990347787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1514453864}
review:
Une suite à peu près parfaite sur tous les points.
La boucle de gameplay du premier Steamworld Dig est toujours aussi plaisante ici : creuser des galeries, choper du minerai, remonter en surface, acheter des upgrades, redescendre.
Quand au reste, tout est beaucoup plus riche : il y a plus de zones à explorer, plus de donjons, plein de secrets à découvrir, on débloque un super grappin... En même temps ils ont évité le feature creep, les nouveaux systèmes sont clairs et ne sont pas envahissants durant le jeu. Bon, la barre d'XP est un peu dispensable, si on veut pinailler.
La maniabilité est toujours top, la direction artistique aussi. Vraiment un excellent moment de fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197970262267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1515319122}
review:
Mining games are usually about making successive trips into the underground. Haul back a few loads of ore, and get equipment that allows you to dig deeper, haul back even more, stay down longer, etc. In Steamworld Dig 2, the mining is almost superficial. This is because the game layers one mechanic on top of another in steady beats, always opening up new options. Digging for gems is sort of a side-show that allows you to keep on upgrading all this gear you unlock. 

The story is neat and ties into the whole Steamworld universe, but is self contained enough to allow you to play it without having played its predecessor or other Steamworld games. Each objective sends you deeper into one of its shafts, which you were inclined to do anyway for the precious gems. But each area is hand-crafted and designed to challenge you with the different tools you get. 

Can you use the water bombs to their fullest potential to reach secrets? What options does the grappling hook open up? In true metroidvania style, you will pass areas that need a tool you don't have yet. But the vast majority of secrets are able to be discovered without needless backtracking. Which is great because once the loot is gone, it's gone. Handy fast travel points minimise the amount of time you need to be travelling to and from each area. 

In all, it's a wonderfully crafted adventure. So much more than just a mining game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993516952', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1515044509}
review:
I came into this as someone who enjoyed Steamworld Dig and thought it a fun little game with a fun twist on the genre. This is a more expansive title with greater emphasis on character building and hand crafted puzzle rooms. I found the experience a little too easy for my liking, but I was never lost interest in exploring the map. I think all of the mainpath upgrades are worthwhile and introduce new gameplay mechanics to keep the experience fresh for its entire duration. I'm a bit bummed that the vertical space isn't used very much. I still think combat is pretty weak, not sure why you can't use your melee weapon while jumping. Once I acquired the jetpack I went out to the open areas and explored to find a whole lotta nothing (save the endgame bonus room). All in all, I dug this title. It's a solid 12 hours if you explore thoroughly. 


Strengths

Character Progression - there's a far greater empahsis on upgrades and perks with which you can tool out your character for a given area/challenge

Exploration - handcrafted puzzle rooms are littered throughout the game world that, while on the easy side, make good use of your upgrades

Upgrades - new gameplay mechanics are introduced that open new avenues of exploration and keep the game feeling fresh throughout


Weakness

combat - while ranged combat feels solid, melee combat feels clunky and I don't know why you're not able to attack while jumping. 

veritcal space - severely underutilized. once I acquired the jetpack I was disappointed to learn that there were very few reasons to explore the vertical space in the outer areas

selling goods - having to come back and forht into town was grating in the early game. it reminded me of Torchlight and how that game allowed you to send a pet to sell your junk for you while you kept exploring. thankfully this became less of an issue once I was able to purchase the 

skill caps - I'm not sure locking certain perks behind levels/blueprints was a good idea, I would have much prefereed being able to select from all of the perks, that way I could save my points for something I really wanted 

invisible walls - this is mostly personal taste, but I'm not a fan of hiding secrets behind regular looking walls. anything that encoruages pixel hunting is a negative in my book. Thankfully, not all secrets are done in this manner

author: {'steamid': '76561198080230714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 82, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1712403860}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046711798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1613738253}
review:
I loved SteamWorld Heist, and I had very high expectations for this game.

This game exceeded my expectations, and I might love it more than SteamWorld Heist.

The game starts slowly, but it keeps getting better and better. Some people complain about the controls - the controls are great, they just take a little getting used to. Others compare it unfavorably with Spelunky - I have thousands of offline hours playing Spelunky. This game isn't trying to be Spelunky, but it does pay loving tribute to it.

9.9/10, this is metroidvania heaven

author: {'steamid': '76561198037414064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1514319738}
review: Terrific game, picked it up after never having much interest in metroidvania games. The fusion between metriodvania and digging games is seamless and level design is top notch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012925188', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1514486992}
review: It's so relaxing to spend some hours digging through this world. Sweet graphics, the upgrades are cool and the game feels fair when it comes to progressing. If you just go for quickly finishing the story, then you won't have as much fun and I guess it's kind of short lived as well. I liked the story, although it's short, but I liked the grinding even more and finding the artifacts. It makes addictive :3 What's nice: they let you know, if you found all the secrets in a dungeon, so you don't have to guess where to search. The difficulty is okay, that's the only thing I wish there was more options on. But at the end of the game they rate your time, equipment and progression, and you can try to get gold stars on those categories, so you have the possibility to replay the game, if you like  achievmenthunting. Grab it on sale, if you are not sure wheter to get it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990531230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1514260544}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 hugely expands on everything that was good about the first one. It's exceptionally well-crafted and very fun to play. There's so much to explore and do. The variety in the locales and surprise secrets are awesome. All of the secrets are tricky to find but they're always subtly telegraphed so you're not just wandering around looking for fake walls, and there are powerups that help. The ability progression is really awesome, and by the end you're a mining superhero, which was super fun. 

The only con is the story is rather weak; there's a lot of text dialogue but very little of it is interesting or plot-related. I don't think it detracts from the experience at all though. One minor nitpick is that (like many games) the game ends quite soon after you get all of the awesome abilities; I would have appreciated a bit more game play being an ALL POWERFUL MINER.

This is "overwhelmingly positive" for a reason. Top notch, highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040118278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1535724979}

About twice as long as the first one, the story was even better than the first, aside from a bit of an odd sequence about halfway in. Absolutely love and reccomend this game.
