author: {'steamid': '76561197972001726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1614185071}
review:
Mit einem Wort: großartig! Steamworld Dig war für mich anfangs ein Gelgenheitskauf für den Nintendo 3DS und wurde schnell zu einem der meistgespielten Titel dort. Grund war das einfache Gameplay kombiniert mit Graben / Geldverdienen / Upgrades und ein paar Knobelpassagen. 
Als nun der zweite Teil erschien, war klar: das Spiel muss her und um das Fazit gleich vornewegzunehmen: ich wurde nicht enttäuscht. 
Aber was macht das Spiel für mich denn nun zum Highlight? Nachfolgend werde ich diese Frage in mehreren Kategorien beantworten.
---
1. Das Spielprinzip
Wie schon in Teil 1 ist es eine Mischung aus Jump'n'Run, Erkundung (Mining), Beute sammeln und Upgraden, um weiter voranzukommen. Diese Mischung wurde komplett beibehalten und erinnert mich an die 2D-Klassiker Metroid.
2. Das Leveldesign
Die Levels bestehen im Grunde aus einer einzigen großen Karte / Spielwelt mit verschiedenen Arten, sei es Wüste, eine wildwuchernde Pflanzenwelt, eine hitzige Lavaumgebung oder ein technisiertes, futuristisches Szenario, genannt Vectron. Man beginnt an der Oberfläche und gräbt sich im Laufe des Spiels immer tiefer ins Erdinnere vor und kann dabei mit allerhand technischen Hilfsmitteln den Untergrund durchbrechen, sei es die unverzichtbare Spitzhacke, ein Bohrer für härteres Gestein oder die neue praktische Haftbombe für Sprengungen außerhalb der Reichweite ersterer Werkzeuge.
DIe Levels sind dabei nichtlinear, d.h. man betritt die meisten Areale mehrfach und bekommt dank Spielefortschritt und Upgrades nun Zugang zu bisher verschlossenen oder verbrogenen Bereichen.
Erschwert wird die Suche durch allerhand feindliches Gesindel, wie Käfer, Insekten, Magier(!) und sonstigem Getier, die alle mit unterschiedlichen Agriffsmustern aufwarten.
Hinzu kommen noch fallenartige Einrichtungen, wie etwa gefährliche Flüssigkeiten, explodierende Fässer oder herabfallende Steinbrocken.
Praktischerweise entdeckt man in regelmäßigen Abständen Transportröhren zurück in die Stadt, wo man seine Ressourcen auffüllt und das gesammelte Zeug zu Geld macht.  
3. Das Sammeln
Wie in Teil 1 wird fleißig Diamanten gesammelt und in der Stadt an der Oberfläche zu Geld gemacht. Damit lassen sich wiederum praktische Upgrades erwerben, die einem das Vorankommen deutlich erleichtern, wie etwa eine größere Tasche für mehr Beute, mehr Lebensenergie, verbesserte Ausrüstung oder einen größeren Wassertank. 
4. Das Erkunden
Abseits von den eigentlichen Zielen gibt es unzählige Türen und Geheimnisse zu entdecken. Erstere beinhalten wertvolle Bonusgegenstände, die man sich durch eine "Knobelkammer" teilweise hart erarbeiten muss und letztere findet man zufällig oder bei entsprechend guter Aufmerksamkeit.
5. Grafik und Sound
Mit einer tollen, stimmungsvollen Musik, passender Geräuschekulisse und einer wunderbar gezeichnetenm, bunten, effektvollen 2D-Grfaik ist das Spiel einfach hervorragend umgesetzt.
6. Die Steuerung
Mit einame Gamepad lässt sich das Spiel präzise steuern und dank der Möglichkeit, einen Sprung in der Luft noch mal nachzujustieren, sind pixelgenaue Landungen möglich. Ab und an werden diese auch abverlangt. 
Probleme hatte ich hier nur mit der Kombination Wurfhaken + Klettersprung und anschließendem Richtungswechsel. Wer da in Hektik kommt, wird den einen oder anderen Sturz erleiden.
7. Die Bosse
Anders als in Teil 1 gibt es hier Zwischenbosse, die für etwas Auflockerung sorgen und der Endboss scheint im ersten Moment eine harte Nuss zu sein, ist aber mit etwas Konzentration gut zu meistern. 
---
Somit hat Steamworld Dig alles, was in Teil 1 gut funktioniert hat, übernommen und vieles hinzugefügt. Vor allem das Ausrüstungssystem wurde vielseitiger, da man nicht nur mit Geld, sondern auch mit Zahnrädern verbesserte Funktionen erzielen kann. 
Die lästigen Energiekugeln hingegen gibt es nicht mehr und man muss auch nicht allzu weite Wege gehen, da die Transportröhren deutlich häufiger vorkommen und somit auch der Teleporter überflüssig wird. 
Mit 7 Stunden für den ersten Durchlauf mit 36% gefundenen Geheimnissen und einem Bronzestern ist noch viel Luft nach oben für weitere Sessions. 
Alles in Allem finde ich das Prinzip super und kann es jedem empfehlen, der Spiele wie Boulder Dash, Metroid oder im weistesten Sinne auch Terraria mag (ohne Freeplay und Bauen natürlich).
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist nicht allzu hoch, die Motivation aber dafür umso mehr. Solche Titel gehören gefördert, denn sie zeigen auf, was an Spielen früher toll war, bevor alle nur noch online spielen und ihr Geld für Zusatzinhalte (= vorenthaltene Inhalte) ausgeben wollten. Auch das muss mal gesagt werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023792903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1514199432}
review: After refunding on Steam I bought it on Nintendo Switch (after a year or so) and completed it. Even with all the problems of controls and some mechanics, it's still pretty good game. So I changed my review to Recommend. Just don't expect perfect controls and fast-paced gameplay like Spelunky. The game is slow and sometimes boring, but fun in digging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970898685', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1514749830}
review:
The original SteamWorld Dig is one of my favorite sit back & relax games. Its only drawback was that it felt more like a demo than a full game. I spent around 6 hours beating the original and I'm nearing that mark with the sequel but I've barely touched the subsurface of this game.

The sequel brings back the precise controls of the original. A vast network of locations to mine, explore & secret rooms to uncover. The upgrade system has been expanded to the point where you'll almost have to pick and choose as I don't think there are enough resources for all.

There's also a much wider array of enemies to contend with but like the first one, they aren't a major obstacle.

So while the original felt like a demo, this feels like a full game. Easily worth the full price & if you haven't tried the first one, it's so cheap you might as well give it a go to see if you'll like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420849597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3338, 'last_played': 1567119488}
review:
This game is even better than the original. The gameplay is immersive and the story kept me hooked throughout the adventure. I wasn't a huge fan of the original when I played it, but I absolutely fell in love with both of the Dig games after playing this one. The ending of this game also gave me such powerful feels (it still does when I replay the game).
I was having a hard time around the time this game came out, and I must say that this game pulled me out of my funk. I don't know how to fully explain it, but I just want to thank the devs for making this fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969284508', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1607273060}
review:
Um jogo cheio de charme. Comprei instantaneamente quando vi na loja, pois já havia gostado muito do primeiro jogo da série. Basicamente, melhoraram o jogo original em todos os aspectos!

A maior parte da gameplay consiste em minerar, vender o que minerou e comprar uma das (muitas!) melhorias para seu personagem. Ao explorar novas áreas você encontra segredos (provavelmente são mais de 100 espalhados pelo jogo) e ganha novas habilidades que o permitirão acessar áreas que até então eram inacessíveis e derrotar os inimigos mais facilmente. É um ciclo viciante. Quem já jogou Minecraft, Terraria, Starbound ou similares e gostou, vai adorar esse jogo com certeza!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977473283', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1514124819}
review:
I read somewhere that SteamWorld Dig 2 was sort of, just a little bit, like Spelunky. Heck yes, I love me some Spelunky, so gimme!

Suffice to say: the comparison is apt. In SW Dig 2 you run and jump around a world mostly constructed of blocks. You can mine some of the blocks, gather ores, then sell those for profit, which in turn can be used to purchase upgrades to help you get deeper into the game world. Over time you will uncover secrets, puzzle rooms and, obviously, the story of the game, along with several boss fights.

SteamWorld Dig 2 has a visual style of its own, a curious hand-drawn look, but as I played the game I began to feel that this type of visual style and the intense labour required to create content with it might have limited the game somewhat. Enemy types are sparse, animations simple and none of the enemies in the game, save for the last boss, offer any significant challenge combat-wise. Somehow I feel that these matters are linked to one another...

As for audio, the game sits steadily in the "functional, fine, but not really memorable" -category. The music lacks memorable melodies, but serves its purpose as a fine ambient accompaniment to the more laid back moments of adventure, or strolling around the small town, talking to the handful of NPC's. Voice acting, if you can call it that, harkens back to the good ole' Nintendo 64 -days, where characters talk in unique little squeaks, beeps, boops and such.

So what do they talk about then? What's the story? Well, you play as a blue robot called Dorothy, adventuring out to find your lost friend Rusty. Alas, Rusty has gone missing deep in the mines and so you are sent deep down to find him. Oh, and to bring back a bunch of valuables. Gotta earn your keep, eh? What follows is an occasionally comedic romp through mines, caverns, temples and other, more otherworldly, locales, as you follow one clue after another and, as is the case with these things, try to stop the world from ending as your side job. Easy-peasy!

While I can't say I played the game anywhere near to a 100% completion, let alone go for the more challenging modes on offer later in the game, I feel that I have to go back to the Spelunky comparison for a moment: SteamWorld Dig 2 is a more streamlined, designed, hand-crafted adventure. It has a clear beginning, middle and an end, and it relies fairly heavily on its story. As such, there is very limited replayability, and I doubt anyone, apart from the hardcore speedrunning crowd, will find more than maybe 10-12 hours of gameplay here. Nowhere near the hundred hours one can sink into something randomly generated like Spelunky.

Is that a good thing or a bad thing? That depends heavily on the player, really. Spelunky gives more bang for your buck, when it comes to raw hours of gameplay, and while it is a simpler game at its core, it gives the player more of a sensation of discovering things. SteamWorld Dig 2 on the other hand has more potential to give its player a few nice evenings of adventuring, digging and exploring, followed by a satisfying ending and a feeling of accomplishment one might not find in Spelunky even after months of playing.

If you ask me: Both are good games and well worth your time!


Playtime: 6+ hours (single playthrough)

Ratings (1-10)
Visual: 8
Audio: 7
Story: 7
Gameplay: 9
Overall: 8

author: {'steamid': '76561197967629529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1514043397}
review:
I do kind of recommend this game, but it teeters on a knife's edge. I've switched between the 'Yes' and 'No' button several times, but ultimately the price is too high for the length and the potential of the game is wasted.
I played SteamWorld Dig on the 3DS and SteamWorld Heist on the PC, the latter of which is a far stronger game than this title in almost every way.

The game is roughly 9 hours long if you spend at least some time looking for secrets. 
For 20€ that's way too short a game and it could've been made longer simply by adding more spaces to dig through, especially early on when you have to think over how to go about getting ore without any mistakes. There should've been more room to 'overfarm' ore and get all the upgrades and cogs to max out your character.

The pacing is kind of bad and the story is worse than in the first game and has a rushed conclusion. Fans of the first game probably remember Vectron fondly, but while it was featured nicely in Dig 2 the visit was all too brief.

Mechanically the game is fairly strong, the upgrades are interesting and while some of it is a repeat of the first Dig, most would accept that digging is the core part of these titles. Mechanically, my worst complaint is that the character floats too much in the air, which can be very frustrating in some areas.

For 10€ you could get Hollow Knight with its DLC's (which is an absolute steal!), or if you like alternative Metroidvania's then Song of the Deep is 15€ and nearly half again as long. 
While Dig is a relaxing platformer/metroidvania, the lack of challenge is sorely felt. Whether it detracts from the game is up to the player, it might simply be how the developers want it to be.

When I finished this title, it reminded me of when I played Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow, if you didn't have the correct item to pass the first 'ending'. Sadly, while in C:DoS you'd realize there was much more, Dig 2 ends somewhat abruptly and you wish you'd saved your money.
Despite the negatives, Dig 2 isn't a bad game, I just wish there was a lot more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975176802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1335, 'last_played': 1684094550}
review:
I really liked this game, but I did have a few irritations, so I'll get those out of the way first...

I think the visual presentation is overly glossy, and doesn't really do justice to the *actual visual design* underlying it, which by contrast I quite liked (example: how much nicer does the title screen look than how things are rendered in-game?). and there are a few aspects of the controls which I suspect aren't as easy to use as they were meant to be, not to mention a puzzle area or two apparently designed by actual sadists, which force you to wallow in the mediocrity of specific aspects of the controls ("floor is lava" puzzle, looking at you. twice), rather than enjoying the parts of them which actually work well. as such, IMO this game could easily be doing a better job of playing to its strengths in these regards.

but those are basically my only real complaints, about a game which I'm otherwise finding to be very entertaining, engaging, rewarding, and also well-written, which is a rare bonus among games these days and one I really appreciate. and hey, it's always nice to see a female protagonist who doesn't appear to be any flavour of walking cliche, something which we still seem to struggle with producing.

the gameplay itself is a clever and (at least imo) somewhat innovative take on contemporary metroidvania-like games on the one hand, and contemporary boulderdash-like games such as spelunky et co on the other. there isn't a huge amount to add except simply that it's a well-designed and well-polished rendition of those basic concepts, along with a gear upgrades system and a reassignable customization interface which allow the player a large degree of agency over how they approach any particular area, even though which items you do or do not have depend on your progress through the game's plot.

between the clear thought and polish that have gone into mechanical gameplay concerns, the creative environment and character design, and the story and dialogue which have _clearly been written by actual writers_, this title is a clear standout against the flood of samey, uninspired drek which we on Steam are drowning in at present. and it does so in spite of being, mechanically speaking, a merger of two very well defined existing formats; this isn't hard to do when you have a world and a thematic concept which are original and which also map well to existing well-defined formats.

excellent work, from a studio I'll definitely be watching from now on. you folks are what keeps this industry, and this market, alive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045149740', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1514008635}
review:
[u]What I liked: [/u]
[list]
    [*]Improved upon everything from the first game
    [*]Game combat and movement is faster
    [*]World is bigger and open requiring a map now for non-linearity

[/list]
[u]What You Need to Know: [/u]
[list]
    [*]If you’ve played the first one, this is a must buy, its better in every way. The game might not still change those that don’t like the mining aspect of the game as it’s still the main gameplay loop.

    [*]Let’s get the bad out of the way first; they don’t have any music to listen to outside the game. The first one had the cool main menu theme, and SteamWorld heist had an entire album I bought. So nothing gameplay wise, unless the game being too easy would turn you off. (Restarts are counted as deaths somehow, died less than 10 times overall)

    [*]Overall the game is a vast improvement from the first game, from mechanics, pacing, amount of content and polish that I don’t feel bad spending near full price compared to getting the first for pennies. The mining aspect is what set it apart and the game doubled down on just making its levels, caves and abilities great instead of trying to fit in the normal metroidvania genre that most people think of. The game is unique with this style and can’t wait for what they come up with next in the SteamWorld series.
[/list]

[u]Compared to first game: [/u]
 [list]

    [*]The game starts out faster with you able to get important gear fast making the start not such a slow start compared to the first game and the game has double the content, more caves, bosses, secrets, all no filler and double the playtime from this expanded sequel.

    [*]You get new powers like a sticky bomb, grenade, jetpack and hook that work both as tools to move, mine and kill enemies.  Each with upgrades that are found in the world and some are optional. Old powers items like ladders and teleports are not needed and replaced with preset portals you have to reach.

    [*]The upgrade has added more options with money unlocking the straight upgrades needed to go farther down, but you now have cogs that you slot into vastly altering abilities ranging from simple to overpowered, like chance to get double resource, heal on kill, healing in pools, and cooling instantly your jetpack. You can’t have all of them and you have to choose what’s more important. You can re-slot them, so choices are not permanent.  There are probably 30 slots to fill, with the more powerful ones requiring more cogs to balance it. Some are only unlocked through milestones and secrets.

    [*]Speaking of secrets, the game has more complex secrets and harder to find ones since the abilities are different, keeping track of secrets is better as, on the map you have caves icon change when all secrets are found inside each area’s total amount displayed.

    [*]I forgot to mention they have a map, as the world is bigger and not linear and digging straight down the whole time. You have different hub locations that are on the horizontal and going from town to any location discovered is fast with zero load time and just a button press away.

    [*]Combat is the exact same as the first one, with some range with the jetpack and ranged weapons. Don’t expect any nuance that you might get in other metroidvania games. You do technically have 3 bosses, which the first was too simple for me to really consider one. Still at least double from the first game and overall better designed ones as well. Final boss is way better than the first one.
 [/list]


[h1]My Score: [/h1]
[b]A+[/b]

[b]Paid:$13 [/b]
[b]Completed in: 12 hours [/b]

Games similar I recommend: 
[list]
    [*]SteamWorld Heist 
    [*]Outland
    [*]Ori and the Blind Forest
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197966751902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1513984312}
review: Really great game, picked it up on sale - but totally worth its full retail price. Very fun progression, like other metro-vania games, you will be flying around by the end in areas you had to take it slow through. My playtime is about half the secrets, with a few hours of idle time (damn kids). My only complaint is the music, what is there is great - but it plays on a very short loop and gets super reptative (in town espically). Would love to see more challeging puzzle areas like the mine cart dungeon at the end of the game, where the reward is front loaded for completing the area. Too many secrets are complete luck you found them. Look forward to number 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974717576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1611, 'last_played': 1513624518}
review:
Absolutely loved this! It has the same charm, playability and fun factor as the first SteamWorld Dig - plus a little bit more. The characters and their animation I found particularly nice.

I can't get enough of this stuff so hopefully a third or some kind of DLC will be forthcoming. I would really appreciate some random map generation though, so I could squeeze some more hours out when the storyline is completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158149244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1513884103}
review:
Obviously there are some good parts to this game and it's got a lot of fans see reviews below. I however am not one of them and wanted to offer a balanced opinion for those on the fence about this purchase.

What is it?:
I would say it's a metroidvania, casual, cartoony, open-world, mining, platformer with a focus on puzzle solving, exploration, and simplfied combat.

What isn't it?:
Challenging, Original (in direct contrast to a certain popular websites reviewers stated opinion), Mechanically Sound, Long, or particularly deep.

The GOOD:
Constant Feel of Progression (Triple Star Here As I Believe This May be Why Many Love This Game and Overlook other Aspects)
Good-Balance (Helps and goes hand in hand with the first one) at least until you unlock a certain item and it seems to instantly break the game (which isn't necessairly a bad thing).
Bright and colorful world (the art does seem to be original and well done)
Exploration is consistently rewarding (prizes and unlockables galore)
If your looking for a true Casual Game it's probably going to be a winner
Easy Backtracking and frequent warp points (well pipes in game) make a difficult obstacle for this genre to overcome essentially null and void.

AC/DC:
Sound - Not my cup of tea but did not enchance or degrade the game for me
Length - If your not into exploring and just want to beat the pavement I think you could probably finish it in under 5 hours, however if you're going to explore you can probably squeeze 12 hours or so out of a single playthrough.
Plot - If your here for that it's probably best you go elsewhere...

The BAD:

Control - This is a platformer with stiff controls and awkward physics a cardinal sin in my gaming bible
Combat - It's repetitive which is okay except it's not challenging which makes it a bore. The exception here is for the challenge you will unnecessarily have controlling your character. It's an easy enough game that it won't jump out as being as unfair as other harder games that suffer from this issue but it's an annoyance some (obviously me) just won't be able to live with.
One path progression-Limited amount of customization, They try hard but honestly many of the upgrades are worthless and hurt this aspect of the game. It's also strange in that the World is pretty Open but your path through it seems extremely defined by the lackluster plot.
Challenge - Other than the standard setup of Metroidavnia roadblocks and finding a way around them I found the challenge here to be very lacking. It's a fine line to draw but I don't think I spent more than a minute or two on any one puzzle and they came off as uninteresting to me.
Plot - I mean it's there...If you really like cutesy cartoony characters perhaps the ones here and their limited amount of character traits will be of interest but there's nothing special about it. The best thing I can say is that most of the dialouge interactions are short.
Content to Cash Ratio - $20 dollars US when off sale seems a bit steep for this game. As a rule of thumb $1 for one hour played is what I'm expecting. Although with good polish and production values this game does lower the ratio I would need to feel content with my purchase.

Overall Rating 4.5/10

It's a logjam of different genres in a game and although it's handled here better than many others in terms of trying to make all those parts work together ultimately I won't recommend any game labeled a platformer that has such poor controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995689855', 'num_games_owned': 3856, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1513947128}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972924033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1525656949}
review: Good classic digging fun, just like its predecessor, but surprisingly still unique in its own ways.  Improved on a lot of the functions and flaws, and added many much-needed features and polish.  Also, Rick and Morty's Summer got real buff.  Real swoll.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968858994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1513553157}
review: Great game! I've finished both SteamWorld Dig 1 & 2 and both are wonderful. 11 hours to complete this one with a little farming and exploration. 18 deaths and 53% secrets found. The early game is a bit brutal. 15 of my 18 deaths were within the first 3 hours of play. Early on, I wasn't having as much fun as I did in SWD1. However, after getting a few really fun mobility upgrades, the fun really picked up and I stopped dying. And the last 40% of the game was an absolute blast - surpassing SWD1 in every way. The toys you get in this game are a amazing. Final boss was 1-shot, but that didn't really disappoint since the game was a joy. Oh, I muted the music because the town music was horribly annoying. Minor gripe.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973353150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1513524676}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027322573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1576, 'last_played': 1513293203}
review:
If you played and enjoyed the original SteamWorld Dig then you shouldn't hesitate to get this game. It has all of the fun and charm of the first game but expands on many of the mechanics, giving you more variety of play and a wider set of locations to explore.

If you're new to the SteamWorld Dig games then I'd wholeheartedly recommend picking them both up. They are fun, casual games that you can pick up and play for a short while and still make progress. However, if you're anything like me you won't be playing for a short while, you'll always find just one more thing to do before you turn off and go to bed!

In total this game has taken me about 26hrs play to complete and i've gathered just over 80% of the collectables in that time. It's been a good 26hrs and good value for money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066493468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1549053814}
review: It's basically Metroid meets Minecraft. I didn't particularly enjoy it, as I played both of those games extensively, but if you are interested in either of them, you will likely enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971485856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1513983433}
review:
A wonderful sequel which greatly expands what the original set out to do. Plenty of things to discover, items to acquire and upgrade, an average story, and a somewhat abrupt ending. If you liked the first, you'll like this one more. SWD2 is what a sequel should be, with a longer lasting flavor.

Worth full price.

review: Considered the first Steamworld Dig to be a minor classic, but holy heck they hit this sequel out of the park. author: {'steamid': '76561197964619116', 'num_games_owned': 1860, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1512252005}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2
by Image & Form
Genre: Metroidvania
Release: September 8, 2017

-----

I REALLY love Metroidvania games! Those awesome exploration fests that require additional abilities to go back and unlock new areas or get awesome new abilities are some of my favorite games ever. So, when I saw (belatedly, I’m sorry to say) that Swedish developer Image & Form had released a sequel to their amazing game which I also loved, SteamWorld Dig, I jumped on it as soon as possible!

Rusty, the protagonist of the first game, is missing! So, the merchant from that game, Dorothy, sets off in search of him. She ends up in El Machino, a town buffeted by earthquakes from deep beneath Archaea, the planetwide mine which was also a setting of the first game! The town’s mayor beckons you to go underground and see what the problem is, mainly so the economy can keep rolling rather than for any safety concerns (such a politician, heh). Dorothy obliges him, and so sets off on her quest…

She has a little spark friend, who provides her with a constantly-updating map of the surroundings, and this time, once it’s in place, it’s locked – there’s no procedural generation here, which means there is more potential for great puzzle action! And that potential is fulfilled, in spades! Quite a few dozen caves have many secrets waiting for you to discover them, but to get far in the world, you will of course have to collect new items…

and that’s where the Metroidvania comes in! From the start you’ll be able to wall-climb, but it becomes clear very soon that you’ll need more advanced equipment! So, you get equipped with pressure bombs for precision detonation of pesky, out-of-reach blocks; a jackhammer to smash through brick; a hookshot to speed through the treacherous caverns with ease; and much, much more! Also, you can collect cogs throughout the mines and other locales! These can be installed on your equipment using the workbench up in town, and provide all kinds of interesting and useful effects!

Keep your lantern full of fuel at all times or you could be stranded in the dark! Keep that water tank as full as you can to fling those bombs and work your jackhammer! And watch out below; a long fall can really, really hurt, in more ways than one; when you’re scrapped, you give a share of your gathered valuable resources, mined from the very rock itself, to the powers that be that you may return to life.

I would most definitely recommend this to Metroidvania fans like me, and those who are enthralled by the SteamWorld; for more from this awesome franchise, also check out Heist, a tactical turn-based action game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017569093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1512962401}
review:
Charming, solid little game with some "metroidvania" style elements.  The gameplay is not particularly challenging, but some well-hidden secrets and interesting little puzzles and a nice "feel" to the controls [except when climbing ladders].

Some missed opportunities when it came to the NPCs in town - the majority of them serve no real purpose other than spouting the occasional bit of flavour text.  I kept hoping they'd give me a side-quest or something.  Would also have been nice to see the town itself evolve a little more over time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105316597', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1512927973}
review:
[h1] [9/10] [/h1] 

《一本道没什么不好》
相比上一作，这一代加了许多新的元素。
新的能力，新的收集要素，自由配置的天赋以及一丝丝沙盒的设计。

制作组最擅长的关卡设计依旧出色，例如大部分的挑战洞穴都会根据角色的某项能力进行专属设计。
让你感叹设计精妙的同时，操作水平也在逐渐变得精通。
最后的BOSS如果你想要无伤通过，那你就要对自己所掌握的所有操作技巧了如指掌才行！
这同时也是这代技能设计的优秀之处。
唯一不足之处就是BOSS战稍微少了一些，但看在设计了这么多精妙的挑战洞穴的份上，也无可厚非了。

收集要素中的收藏品(遗物)，一个很容易想到的设计居然在一代里没有，令人觉得有些费解。
此外，虽然说加了一些些沙盒的元素，但其实说透了只能算是传统的"选关"。
实际上还是和一代一样一本道的通关方式了。

但是话说回来，一本道有什么不好的，花个15-20个小时，将一款游戏100%通关，不留任何遗憾的开启下一段游戏之旅。
在当今各种游戏层出不穷，未玩的游戏多如牛毛的情况下，这种精致的一本道设计让我感觉非常舒服。

Image & Form，这家公司目前出的三个作品都非常优秀，我现在已经迫不及待想要看看你们还能将这群蒸汽机器人玩出什么花样了！
或者在这之前，出一个DLC满足我这饥渴的探索之魂吧！！！
                        --Wingo

review:
Dieses Spiel spielt sich wunderbar intuitiv. Allerdings nur mit einem Gamepad.
Mit der Tatstatur hingegen ist es etwas hakelig handzuhaben. Mit etwas Übung aber... ;-)

Die Story und die Charaktere sind sehr schön gezeichnet und in der Suche nach den letzten Geheimnissen kann man sich wunderbar darin verlieren.

Wenn man nicht nur durch das Spiel eilt, sind dies locker 12 - 15h Spielspaß.
Seinen Preis ist es dafür allemal wert.

review:
Even better than the first one, this platformer has everything you come to expect from the genre (movement-based puzzles, item collections, jumping, flying, swimming, bouncing off things, enemies, swinging and hanging around, increasing complexity as it goes... it has it all!), and it has an enjoyable storyline.

I would have a hard time recommending it enough.

Like the first, you should play with a controller.

review:
Amazing adventure game, I loved everything about it:
- the story is simple, yet you get to love the characters
- the exploration of the mines is very fun, especially after you get to unlock better items and upgrades
- the puzzles are fun, I love that the game notifies you when a cave is completed so you don't spend time thinking that you may have missed some secrets
- the graphics and the sound are exceptional

author: {'steamid': '76561197980152011', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1512179532}
review:
As a great Metroid fan, I had SteamWorld Dig on my FAVORITES category on steam.

When I finished Steamworld Dig 2, it too, I added to that category.

The story is amazing, the level design is so fresh, and it basically does everything steamworld dig 1 does, only better.

The ending is quite moving.

I strongly recommend this game to absolutely everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039051326', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1104, 'last_played': 1512183699}
review:
This is one of the very few games I have played that made me sad because it was over.  I don't think I can give a game a higher review than that!  10/10, perfect game,as far as I am concerned. 
The music was fantastic, the visuals were something to behold, the gameplay was smooth and fun and challenging!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170930913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1511740214}
review: I actually need more recommend buttons as one is not enough! Do you like mining? Do you like platformers and puzzles? What about RPGs??? If you answered yes to any of those than this game is for you! It was absolutely well made and thought out. The different ares were all gorgeous and pretty vast in size. The Leveling system leaves a bit to be wanted but works really well as its impolemented in game.  THe Puzzles can be quite tough on the brain at times and the difficulty can also be challenging but always fun. With one exception, the Trials. not wanting to spoil anything for others but there is no reason for that activity to be like that. Anyways!! My only other gripe with the game is I wanted more of it! There was alot of unused area underground that i would have gladly explored and dug through. The game itself was fairly short if not collecting everything and even a new game + would have been awesome! All in all I highly recommend getting this game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040765684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1512075890}
review:
Un jeu sympathique, fluide et agréable à explorer. 
C'est un réel plaisir de miner pour pouvoir s'acheter des améliorations !

En revanche, même si je suis assez fan de ce genre de jeu (les "métroïdvania") j'avoue avoir été un peu déçu par la difficulté trop basse (boss final tombé du premier coup) et par le manque de durée de vie (jeu fini en 6h).

La durée de vie peut être prolongée si l'on recherche tous les trésors (j'ai environ trouvé 50% des secrets sans trop chercher), mais cela reste un peu juste pour moi. 

En résumé, laissez-vous tenter si vous voulez un petit jeu agréable et simple. Si vous cherchez un peu plus de profondeur et d'immersion, je vous recommande de vous tourner vers d'autres titres comme "Ori and the blind forest" ou l'excellent "Hollow Knight" .

Edit : Je tiens à préciser que je n'ai jamais joué au premier de la série.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009319048', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1611308043}
review:
Пройдя дважды первую часть(один раз в ориджин бесплатно и после того как купил в стим) приступил ко второй. И она оказалась даже лучше оригинала! Механики сохранены, история является прямым продолжением первой, но с другим персонажем, развили в целом игру, добавили неписей, раскрыли сюжет и как водится дали "злобного" помощника)
Очень круто, игра получилась дольше чем первая раза в 2, а интерес раз в 10!) Очень рекомендую к покупке, но обязательно пройдите первую ибо это сиквел.
10 из 10.

review: This game does progression better than almost any other game that I have played. There are no moments wasted in Steamworld Dig 2, as secrets are everywhere and they give meaningful upgrades. It almost feels like a different game in the end, but it is always fun to play. The art is pleasant, music is cool and the game just feels very good. The only complaint that I can think of, is that the combat is very simple. But still, 5/5 would dig again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978433339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1647554424}
review:
Thorougly enjoyable, just like the first iteration. Image & Form has hit on a recipe that is both simple and beautiful.
Nice game for a casual sitting of an hour or less at a time, or even for a speed run replay.
Enjoyable music, puzzles are just hard enough to not be insulting to ones intelligence, and simple enough to not feel tedious.
Even the fact that Kotaku endorses this game doesn't retract from its qualities, though it did lower my expectations.
I for one am looking forwards to the next iteration of Steamworld.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988573955', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1511886690}
review: A very solid Metroidvania that builds upon the success of the first SteamWorld Dig. Plenty of exploration and challenges, with a fun little story. You can blow through it fairly quickly, if you're not into exploring the world - I finished the story in just under five hours - but if you're the type to try everything a game has to offer, you'll find lots to keep you busy way beyond my playtime. Gorgeous art-style and animation with plenty of charm in every aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033158081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1514572752}
review: Эх хорош как ни крути этот мир стимботов! Что SteamWorld Dig, что SteamWorld Heist погружают в себя незатейливым, но крайне увлекательным геймплеем, красивой картинкой и легкой незамысловатой системой развития персонажа (-ей). Берешь и играешь без всяческих заморочек. Отдых и удовольствие одним словом. Если Вам понравились SWD или SWH,  либо Вы просто любитель отличных платформеров, то берите не задумываясь! Цена смешная, но несмотря на недолгую сюжетную линию, удовольствия получите вагон и маленькую тележку шестеренок!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029705265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1512103408}
review: This is not a helpful review. I do not feel like writing a helpful review. I just want to add to the aggregate rating. It's good. Buy it if you like the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023580992', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1511844887}
review:
Have played games for 20+ years, variety of types and this I can say it has some of the most frustrating and irritating puzzles I have ever come across.

Unless you find wasting time doing the same puzzles over and over again because of slight hand eye coordinative miscalculation.... Enjoyable..... I suggest not buying this game. 

Perhaps many would laugh at the failed persistence but in my honest opinion.... some of the puzzles in this game are too frustrating to finish the game.

So save yourself the money if you are on the fence and somewhat easily irritated with silly unforgiving puzzles.

For Example, pushing a lever and having to fly from wall to wall only using the grappling hook with Not entirely time accurate natural ability refreshes, while being expected to jump and grapple from wall to wall in Several Rooms of which MOST surfaces contain buttons that shuts the door at the end the lever at the beginning opened, essentially, touch a surface and press a button... go back to the beginning, press the lever and try again and again and again and again and again and again.

Not my idea of a good puzzle. If it is to you, by all means purchase the game, if it does not sound like fun, save yourself the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007026426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1493, 'last_played': 1687905481}

"И ещё один из рода копателей..."
Отличное продолжение для тех кому понравилась первая часть, как выяснилось это и плюс и минус. Плюс - расширили локи, способности, разнообразили вражеские силы, немного глубже познакомили нас с мирами древних машин и одичавших человеков , которые  опять все про**али. Ну и в общем все заправлено традиционно отличным дизайном и музыкой, все что надо чтобы с любопытсвом копать, взрывать и повторять это ещё кучу раз после работы. Минусы тут скорее как белый налет на шоколаде, худо не делают.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960277861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1511791951}
review:
With multiple 'sequence-breaking' routes possible, this game is probably the closest thing I've played to Super Metroid in about a decade. No zone is truly "gated" off from the rest of the map, and exploration is rewarded instead of punished. The first time I beat the game I was missing about half of the power-ups due to the route I took. I didn't test it, but i think it is possible to beat the game without beating any boss besides the final.

It's also quite enjoyable to play the game as intended, though the characters and story are rather weak.
Don't try for the hardest two chievos unless you want to spend a weekend routing and practicing movement exploits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063580960', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1507425126}
review: Hace mucho tiempo no me terminaba un juego con tanta alegría, hace mucho tiempo que no tenía tantas ganas de sacarle el 100% a un juego y hace mucho tiempo no me divertía tanto con un género que no es de mi estilo. Steamworld Dig 2 me ha sorprendido este año y a pesar de lo corto que fue en relacion a los grandes del año, se queda como uno de los mejores juegos del año para mi, la jugabilidad es PERFECTA y lo hace muy adictivo y en ningún momento me sentí aburrido o con ese tipo de sensación de seguir solo porque hay que hacerlo, muy feliz de haberlo encontrado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963163105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1528889848}
review:
A polished but otherwise unremarkable sequel to the surprise hit Steamworld Dig. It’s a resource and collectables-fest in the style of a Metroidvania-lite, however its relatively short length highlights the need for a new game + mode with more challenges or an extended story mode for greater replayability.

At $15, if you liked the first Steamworld Dig you’ll be happy enough with this, but it doesn’t have the wow-factor of the first one.

review:
Awesome platforming action with some puzzle elements. It takes the good parts of good old 16 bit platformers and elevates it with modern technology. 

As a sequel it's very well handled. Logical continuation of the story much like DKC to DKC2. Improves established concepts from the first one while also adding new ones without making a completely different game. 
And it's a very good game even if you didn't play the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055113034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1512139983}
review:
In world where everyone is raving about the Destiny 2 or playing Overwatch (which are both increadibly lame in my opinion)- I feel like an entire generation has missed out on the fun of single player exploration platformers.

Ori and the Blind Forest was Good
Guacamellee was Great.
But this is actually the best Metroidvaina style game I have played in years.

100% thumbs up, There is just nothing to fault.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034188195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1512373596}
review:
Maybe the best game in the steamworld serie. 8.52/10 
This episode connects the story of the other games, but you don't have to play them in order ( they are not in chronological order in the first place). It's pretty cool to see things get tied together. 

Great level design, great controls and lots of cool moves for that little robot. It's pretty deep (no pun intended). 
The side kick is pretty funny though overall the dialogues arent that exciting ( not the strongest point in the other titles either). 

Overall if you enjoy platforming and exploration, you'll probably like it. 
If you played the first steamworld dig, its all the same stuff but much better. And the metroidvania aspect is much more developped! 

Finishing the game without searching for secrets or doing every challenge rooms ( maybe the funnest part of the game) probably takes 7-8 hours. Took me 13h to 100% it and it felt satisfying, it ended when I was ready to move on. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043544224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1566012283}

author: {'steamid': '76561198186389322', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1586719503}
review:
Так как однажды стал поклонником творчества "Image & Form", однозначно ждал эту игру ещё с первых анонсов. Вторая часть невероятно насыщенная по сравнению с первой, но, к сожалению, не намного длиннее. Скорее всего специально не делают эпично длинные игры оставляя пробелы для будущих предисторий и продолжений. Кто бы мог подумать, что оказывается между Dig и  Heist не только одна вселенная, но и одна история. Ещё из Heist было понятно судьбу планеты разлетевшейся по всему космосу. В эпилоге Dig 2 очень мощный спойлер для тех, кто играл в Heist. Теперь остаётся только ждать ещё пару лет до выхода нерасказанной истории между уничтожением и процветанием в космосе.

За всё игровое время не обнаружил ни одного бага. Это же насколько нужно быть идеалистом в своём хобби. Вы не подумайте, что отрицательные отзывы (да, они существуют) ссылаются на проблемы игры. Нет, просто некоторым игрокам сложно понять как играть в такие игры, от того и недопонимания. Здесь вылезано всё настолько, что Вы просто обмазываться будете от прохождения этой игры.

Разработчик невероятно тонко продумал хардкор игры. Вот держите сложность поменьше, но легко не будет. А если хотите посложнее, то найдите 3 потерянных братьев и соберите достаточно реликтов, что уже можно считать хардкор, так как секреты не так очевидны порой. Наградой будет 4 дополнительных опции усложнения процесса игры, хотя можете и не включать.

Ещё одно большое спасибо за ещё одну потрясающую игру. Браво!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030946828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1507557404}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971257342', 'num_games_owned': 1726, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1511137059}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 is a charming side scrolling platformer/metroidvania/puzzle game that evokes those fun feelings I got playing games like Mario and Rayman back in the day. That whimsical, charming feeling that you get when you play something that just feels fun. 

I love how good the movement feels and I love the thrill of finding a new power deep in the mines that helps you get around even quicker. I love finding secrets and collecting resources as I dig to power myself even further. 

With wonderful music and excellent art to back it up, steamworld dig 2 is an easy recommendation to anyone that was a fan of dig dug, spelunky, motherlode, or any of those countless digging flash games online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048681229', 'num_games_owned': 1057, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1511832932}
review: SteamWorld Dig 2 me impressionou por ser simples porém cativante, assim como no primeiro jogo o objetivo é cavar blocos de terra para achar recursos e então fazer melhorias em seus equipamentos, isso enquanto novas habilidades são encontradas durante a exploração, remetendo a jogos estilo Metroidvania. Controlamos Dorothy que vai a procura de Rusty, e os personagens não faltam carisma, os novos equipamentos que Dorothy encontra em sua jornada são divertidos e mostram que o jogo realmente inova em relação ao primeiro. A jogabilidade é bem construída e o jogo é muito fluido, o estilo de arte e as músicas são muito bons, e também gostei muito da forma como a Image & Form conecta a história dos jogos da série SteamWorld. Recomendo muito, principalmente para aqueles que já gostam do primeiro SteamWorld Dig.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972126139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1665164319}
review:
Awesome sequel to the original!

Offers the best possible kind of pacing and unlocking abilities while you venture deeper and further. Revisiting places after getting upgrading your character feels great. Also you never get stuck on getting the wrong upgrades as you can rearrange them constantly according to the levels you encounter.

If you enjoyed the first one, getting this is a nobrainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996827095', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1511392256}
review:
Finished the game.

Good points that I liked within the game:
-8 hours gameplay, Focused a lot on finding all the secrets.
-Great map details in some areas.
-Nice impleted Skills that have a purpose to each map.
-Puzzle hidden caves that are different and fun to complete.
-Many secrets (Idol items) to find and rewarding with custom upgrades you can unlock.
-Creative level desiged maps.
-1 spooky map that actually made me anxious to play.
-Addicting type of gameplay to make people complete the game.

Bad Points that I didn't like in the Game:
-Lack of bosses, could have been great to get the special upgrades after a mini-boss and actually feel rewarded.
-Dull interactions between NPC's, Could been added funny context or cool scenes to feel more immeresed into the story.
-Lack of good Story elements, I didn't paid any attention to the story only until the end. bored me quite fast from the start, The storyline didn't felt like it was making an impact on the game essence.
-Felt somewhat a bit short even tho' I played as complitionist and tried to find all the secrets. (Isn't really as bad as it sounds, just a feeling I had)

Overall summary:
The Game is great, worth the price and I had more fun than most games I played recently.
I would say the Bad Points I wrote don't have a big impact on the game experience, but rather would make the next SteamWorld Dig Game with those changes even more exciting to play and more enjoyable.

Rating: 8 / 10

I would buy the game again for the same price if the story was different without a doubt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000799606', 'num_games_owned': 1338, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1527087262}
review:
Прокопал дофига тунелей, но так и не нашёл Расти. Копать дальше? Кончно да!
Отличейшая игра- продолжение. Рисовка, динамика, умения - теперь всего в достатке.
Геймплей такой же динамичный и оригинальный: добывваем ресурсы - относим в деревню наверху (теперь уже город), там продаём все камешки и взамен получаем всячекие улучшения для нашего героя. Свиду простая механика заставляет восторгаться каждый раз новыми находками в игре.
Советую всем. 10 металлоломов из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023997885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1511099407}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008892933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1511457117}
review:
Like the first part this is an excellent game.

I like the whole Steamworld idea, the underlying story is very interesting but not too complicated to distract from the fun gameplay - digging deeper and deeper in search of treasure and upgrades.

It's mixing Bouderdash (and I'm showing my age with that reference) and Metroid, that is very addictive.

I can only reccommend this game, especially if you like the first part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058798890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1606250876}
review:
Tolles Spiel
Spielt sich sehr flüssig, die Charaktere sind lustig gestaltet und man kann sie lieb gewinnen. 
Man kann durchhetzen und dabei Spaß  haben oder auch Zeit damit verbringen alle Geheimnisse aufzudecken. Beides gute Optionen. 
Die Spielzeit ist (leider) nicht ewig lang, aber dennoch lohnt sich der Kauf.
Controllersteuerung wird empfohlen, mir hats aber auch mit Maus und Tastatur getaugt und sich gut spielen lassen.
Hoffentlich wird es einen genausoguten 3 Teil geben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011681451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1506944011}
review:
Купил эту игру т.к Origin была раздача первой  части и по прохождению оной возникло сильнейшее желание добавки.
2 часть оказалась не хуже первой игра стала разнообразней больше улучшений (за деньги и за шестерёнки),секретов многие не найдёшь пока не купишь определённые улучшения приходится возрощаятся на уже пройденные уровни для их открытия.Вобщем хорошая игра со своей атмосферой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006306622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1573741141}
review: Шикарная игрушка! Из той редкой категории, когда одинаково интерестно играть и детям и взрослым, что на самом деле большая редкость! Хорошая картинка, прекрасная музыка, отличный геймплей! Хочешь просто побегать пожалуйста, хочешь харда на тебе хард! Из аналогов на ум приходят, только Rayman Legends, Origins, а сравниться с ними уже огромный плюс! В общем от моего семейства 50 из 10 ( четыре человека + кот)! С разработчиков продолжение! Желательно с кооперативом!

author: {'steamid': '76561198127847962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1512747643}
review:
セーブができない。購入日にプレイしたときにはできたのに、突然セーブができなくなった。ゲームはおもしろいんですがね。返金もできない。残念。
----------------------
と、昨日書いたのですが今日試したら、セーブできたりできなかったり。
セーブができたかどうかはワープや洞窟の出入りで左上に表示されるので気を付けて見ておきます。ゲームは面白いので4時間ほどのデータが飛んだのは痛いですがクリアまでがんばります。
ゲーム終わる前にワープ出入りしてセーブを確認しましょう。
ちなみに私の環境はwin10です。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971300886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1527230236}
review:
Improves on the original in pretty much every way. If you're not familiar, it's a relaxing digging/exploration series with a little combat. It controls well, you get a great sense of progression, and it's just...nice.

My one (minor) complaint is the Vectron levels. They're brief, but they're also oppressive and chaotic. I assume it's meant to stand in stark relief compared to the rest of the game, but these levels also lacked the tight control of the rest of the game. Thankfully, they're brief and don't really affect the overall experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979934027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1511408745}
review:
This game is a fantastic sequel to the first one. Really, it is just how a sequel should always be made. References the Steam World Dig enough to make me want to go back and finish it, but strong on it own points so I did not feel I was missing anything if I did not.
And it EXPANDS. My GOD, does it EXPAND the first game!

My only complaint is that I did not like the ending. I get what they were trying to do... but not my cup of tea.

review:
Uma obra prima, entrega mais que o prometido, a mesma fórmula do primeiro, mas ampliada. Excelente sistema de progressão do jogo e para melhorar ainda mais, a história segue como sequência do antecessor, ou seja você ouvirá falar de Rusty novamente.
Gostaria de elaborar melhor essa análise, mas o tempo é curto e tenho de dormir, espero que seja o suficiente para ganhar a insígnia :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197980258736', 'num_games_owned': 7207, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2199, 'last_played': 1508037413}

If you enjoyed the first game, you'll enjoy this one. Every aspect from the original has been improved upon in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013107574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1511134170}
review:
Quite a short game, managed to finish in one sitting on a lazy Sunday, but a great entertaining game. Really enjoyed the SteamWorld Dig 1 and this was also a top game. 

Recommend to anyone who likes any of the SteamWorld series games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182059993', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1527521480}
review:
absolutely incredible. an amazing followup to the first game, finally providing answers to the questions from the first game (and those from Heist.) lots of replayability, an amazing world, super great looking environments, character models, and animations. this is a game i highly recommend you to experience. but play the first game before you do so. and also maybe the spinoff title, SteamWorld Heist. theyre all good games, but this one blows them all out of the water, especially after devoting so much time to the first two.

TLDR, buy the entire series and play them in order of release (SteamWorld Dig, SteamWorld Heist + DLC, SteamWorld Dig 2)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993893949', 'num_games_owned': 2804, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2777, 'last_played': 1606287952}
review:
I had pretty high expectations for this game after having a blast playing Image & Form's previous games - namely SteamWorld Dig and SteamWorld Heist. And oh boy did this game deliver and then some!
I tend to stay away a bit from platformers (yeah, I am not really good at games requiring quick reflexes) but this game just captivated me from the beginning and I could not pull myself away from playing it.

Beautiful graphics, great sound effects and background music, intense and tight platforming that provides so many fun ways to navigate around and fight enemies, puzzle sections to make you feel smart, just the right amount of hidden treasures... the list of good points for this just goes on and on.

I've seen some people complain about the game length and yeah, this game is not as long as the Skyrims and Witcher RPGs out there. But then, this game has no boring filler stuff that just exists for the sake of extending playing time. Just chock full of tight, interesting, fun content.

Will definitely be looking out for Image & Form's next project, whenever that may come. Thank you to the developers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994652489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1511402775}

Sorry for the poor english but this game needs a boost :)

review:
Super Spiel mit Suchtfaktor. Man möchte gerne sofort alle Geheimnisse lüften auch wenn man noch nicht die Technik freigeschaltet hat. Hier ist geduld gefragt. Aber man bekommt die Technologie schnell zusammen. Man auch alle möglichen Gegenstände sammeln. Die Story ist schön gesteltet und die Dialoge sind zum Teil auch mit Humor geschrieben. 
Alles in allem kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031076797', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1572155702}
review:
Jogaço!
Ainda melhor que o primeiro.
O sistema de aprimoramentos ficou perfeito! Alguns aprimoramentos fazem ganhar mais dinheiro/gemas/exp em troca de não recuperar hp/água/luz tão facilmente, deixando o game bem mais desafiador.
Jogabilidade muito boa, não tenho do que reclamar, localização dos botões configurável e compatibilidade com controles (originais, apenas).
História boa, muitos colecionáveis/locais secretos (ainda não achei todos) e final interessante. Deixa a idéia que poderá haver um terceiro jogo (o que pra mim será muito bem-vindo!)
Recomendo, tanto este como o anterior.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031632709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1507312121}
review:
Games from the SteamWorld series are among the few ones that I'm comfortable bying day 1 for full price and  make me genuinely excited to play them. They are just so joyful and positive, from art style to music, it makes you feel happy. One can really see how much care and effort the developers have put into them.

SteamWorld Dig 2 does not disappoint. As in the original SteamWorld Dig, it is still a pleasure to explore the world (which is much larger now) and you even get lots of new great tools, like hook shot which is really fun to use (I recommend going for the sequence breaker achievement).

Just buy and play this game already :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050224753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1703459855}
review:
There is very little to be said that is negative about this game other then that it is a little bit short if you stream line it. But why would you want to? half the fun of the game comes from exploration, combat, and mining. The story is a bit bare bones but it works in the games favor as you aren't distracted with some overly convulted plot line. that isn't to say there is no plot, through the game you experience an expanding mystery around the dissapearance of a friend, I won't go any farther nto that but the story does expand from that.

anyways. Game is fun, and I would highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970950758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1510348958}
review:
Thanks to the developer and publisher of Steamworld Dig 2, Image & Form, for creating an excellent  game for me to escape, explore and enjoy.

The first  games on PC in the Steamworld series, Dig and Heist, were pretty good but like all good developers Image & Form doesn't reinvent the series but they made a good series into a great one by making it better in every way.  Steamworld Dig 2 is a beautiful, addicting, polished and most importantly fun game that is easily one of the best games of the year.

Steamworld Dig 2 is a platform jumping, digging, exploration, action game. You play as Dorthy, an ally from the first Dig game, who is trying to find her friend Rusty. While looking for Rusty you are also hired to help out the local town in trying to find the answers behind mysterious earthquakes. If new to the series, the world of Steamword Dig is set in a steampunk western setting that is inhabited solely by robots. Language is incoherent but the look of each character and their dialouge exlemphies each ones personality. The story is simple to follow and not a burden and was I surprised by the emotional ending.  

In the game you will be exploring a pretty massive underground world. There are a lot of diverse environments to explore and each with their share of treasures, challenges, hazards and enemies. At first you will only be given your trusty pickaxe but later tools including a jack hammer, water cannon, hookshot and the best accessory ever, the jetpack will be awarded for completing missions. All of these awesome tools are upgradeable with cash earned from excavating  gems and additional features are upgraded with cogs. Cogs for the most part are in secret areas or in puzzle rooms scattered around the map. There is also a vendor in town who sells cogs but its unnecessary to ever purchase any. There are also secret objects(42 total) that when a certain number is found you will be rewarded with a blueprint. These also unlock additional upgrades for your equipment. All of this is so rewarding and returning to the store with a full backpack of gems never gets old. I will say its kind of a slow start as the opening level gems in the area do not pay, but once you go deeper unlocks begin to happen more frequently.   

Graphically Steamworld Dig 2 looks beautiful and ran perfectly at 1080P(Ultrawide) max settings. Its almost looks like a bright shiny saturday cartoon and movement and controls are excellent. Sound is also really good especially when hitting away at all those rocks, enemies and that rewarding sound of when collecting coins. The soundtrack is also impressive though near the end i was a little tired of the one track that plays constantly when you are just simply exploring. 

Steamworld Dig 2 is a rare game on the PC that achieves the unthinkable and thats the deserving rating of polished. Its execution, gameplay, controls, levels and world are near flawless. Its probably the best released game i've played in recent memory without any needed patch or DLC needed. One of the best games this year, easily. 

Played on max settings 1080P ultrawide MSI R9/390 with no problems

Positives

Polished in every way
Beautiful diverse World to explore
Exploration is rewarding
Jetpack 
Ultrawide supported
Large variety of enemies
Fun boss fights
The right amount of challenge, not too easy/ difficult

Negatives

Not a lot of missions
Some upgrades unnecessary
No maps to buy showing secret locations

author: {'steamid': '76561198004667014', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1510793252}
review: The metroidvania approach gets kinda boring at  the beginning due the lack of interesting upgrades and poor customization system for itens etc. things get way interesting in mid/late game although, mainly because of infinite jetpack and other features you will be able to unlock by solving lots of puzzles inside caves collecting cogs and idols, changing the gameplay a lot giving you an addictive experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047970707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1694061548}
review: Well thought through progression in the game. You slowly gather tools to improve your access to areas and secrets, making it fun to trek back to previously visited places. The pacing was just right and managed to hold my attention over the span of a few nights. I did not care much for the story and the ending was kind of anticlimatic. But we don't play this for the story and play it more for the digging and the digging is excellent!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120222580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1510646613}
review:
This is what all sequels should strive to be, improving all the strong points from its previous installement, fleshing it out until you obtain a nice polished gem (Hah, mining jokes). But it's not just that. It also gets rid or tone down of most if not all of the flaws of SteamWorld Dig 1, and to top it all off, adds a lot of new things to enjoy. If you enjoyed the first game as much as i did (a lot), there is no hesitation to have, this one is such a massive improvement it'd be criminal not to get it.

Incredibly fun, and not as short as a few reviews make it sound like. It's well worth the price. Easily a dozen hours or more if you like to complete most/all of the game and not blast through the story.

Music and ambience are quite good, though not the most memorable soundtrack.

Art is really pleasant to look at.

Story isn't going to blow your mind, but it's pretty enjoyable and engaging enough, lot of interesting dialogues which is much more than what Steamworld Dig had to offer.

The gameplay is really all about block digging, selling, upgrading, and metroidvania elements, much like the first one, but it is deceivingly satisfying and addictive, and not like a borderline abusive relationship you'd have with an MMORPG. Where this aspect shined before, SWD2 turns it up tenfold. You also get rewarded a lot more for killing enemies.

The content is also much more rich in terms of upgrade, map design, characters, secrets, creative challenge rooms and so on. The only real downside you could argue about is the lack of enemy diversity, which is a recurring problem. Still, the replayability/lifespan of the game is higher than i had expected, and i'm really not regretting the price tag. It's a bit less linear than the first one, which can be confusing but gives you a nice sense of freedom.

The difficulty is also a bit disappointing if you want a challenge, but it's not much of an issue if you're in it for the relaxing digging aspect.

Technical side, controls and options are still perfect. No bugs i can remember of either.

Overall, SteamWorld Dig 2 is one of my 2D loves alongside, Terraria, Ori, Hollow knight, and a few others.

This game deserves no less than an 8/10.

EDIT: I feel i forgot to mention an important point, but blocks do not respawn and the random generation seems to be either very limited or non-existent, which would have been a selling point. This doesn't stop the game from being fun for a good ammount of hours regardless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965182450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1510453373}
review: The first SteamWorld Dig gave me only 5 hours of game play.  This one extends on it.  More abilities to unlock.  Larger underground exploration.  The story kept me going right from the start, since I began right after finishing the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076061891', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1508024036}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 is a nice sequal that improve on pretty much everything from the first game. It's probably not a game that will be on many peoples best of 2017 list at the end of the year, but for the price it's a pleasent metroidvania. I liked the first game well enough but preferred the gameplay from Steamworld Heist but this was a nice diversion until we get that sequal. 

The environments are more varied, the upgrades are no longer just objectively better stat boosts and there is more of a story this time. The core gameplay loop is the same, dig for recourses and use the money on upgrades with ocotional puzzle room where you might find new items or abilities. Pretty much standard metroidvania fare but it's well designed. If you liked the first one, then this is a solid recommendation. You should almost certainly like this even more, but even if you didn't there are significant improvements that might change your mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082383002', 'num_games_owned': 3292, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1672763394}
review:
Eu fiquei anestesiado ao jogar Steamworld Dig 2, principalmente pelo pacote completo que os desenvolvedores trouxeram ao fazer essa sequência, que expande e complementa o universo "Steamworld".

[h1]A história e os personagens:[/h1]
Nesse jogo, você controla "Dorothy", acompanhada pelo seu 'amigo', Fen a procura do desaparecido "Rusty". É um fato inegável, a dorothy não carrega o mesmo carisma de rusty e é pouco explorado o seu desenvolvimento, mas em compensação Fen é um personagem carismático, dúbio, sádico e com um senso de justiça e moral meio turvo. 

A história do jogo no entanto consegue ser melhor do que a primeira, trazendo boas perguntas a serem resolvidas e deixando o jogador intrigados nos mistérios que cria durante a narrativa. Narrativa esta que possui um ritmo pulsante, nunca deixando o jogador cansado ou desfocado no seu objetivo principal: Encontrar Rusty.

[h1]As mecânicas e a jogabilidade:[/h1]
Quanto ao gameplay, em boa parte é um metroidvania, isto é, você pode andar, correr, pular, se segurar na parede e usar habilidades especiais que vai ganhando conforme o avanço do gameplay, como atirar uma minibomba, usar um jetpack nas botas,  dentre outras. Há também a mecânica de exploração e mineiração, isto é, quão longe na mina você alcança, a fim de faturar mais e aumentar seu progresso.

O jogo possui também um  pouco de mecânicas de RPG, pois você escolhe quais upgrades quer fazer [e pode ficar alternando constantemente, gerando várias combinações possíveis, como um personagem mais forte, mais resistente, mais rápido para perfurar, etc]. Outra coisa bacana do gameplay é que há vários desafios a serem realizados, cada um testando uma habilidade diferente sua, algumas em questão de timming, outras em precisão, mas todas são diferentes e testam uma skill a qual você vai obter no gameplay; há também vários itens a pegar que acrescentam no lore da história e são bons coletáveis, acrescentando umas horas de gameplay.. É uma jogabilidade desafiadora e engajante em mais de 8 horas de campanha [para completar TUDO vai em média umas 13h]. 

[h1] Os gráficos, a trilha sonora e aspectos técnicos: [/h1]
Os gráficos do jogo são lindos, 2D estilizados num universo que combina o stempunk com faroeste, é visualmente cativante e traz você para o universo do jogo, além de fazer um ótimo uso de sombras, e poeira no vento, dando um certo destaque à direção de arte do jogo.

A trilha sonora é viciante, em especial o tema de "Archea" e o tema de "El Machino".


 A movimentação é bem fluida e dinâmica, em especial da dorothy que é mais ágil e leve que o rusty. Steamworld Dig 2 é um jogo bem otimizado que não causa quaisquer problemas técnicos por ser muito bem desenvolvido.



A IA do jogo é ligada no modo "kill kill" e não há muito que se comentar. A física do jogo, apesar de ser meio surrealista, é boa, você toma dano e pode até morrer dependendo da queda, toma dano em ambientes com lava ou ácido.

Sobre bugs, o jogo crashou apenas 1x e o máximo de bugs que encontrei foram alguns inimigos que morreram, mas "continuavam lá", mas foi algo bem raro.


[h1]Conclusão e Nota: [/h1]
Steamworld dig 2 supera seu antecessor em termos de jogabilidade, apesar de ter uma protagonista não tão interessante, há um roteiro promissor e belíssimos gráficos.

Nota: 8,9/10.

[h1]Para mais análises, apoie-nos seguindo nosso [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/30823884/]Curador[/url]
