author: {'steamid': '76561197974933037', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1510360388}
review:
[h1]HAI-HO, HAI-HO, SI TORNA A LAVORAR![/h1]

ADORO la saga di Steamworld. Il primo "Dig" è un inaspettato Metroidvania che mi ha tenuto incollato fino al 100% del completamento; "Heist", il secondo episodio, è un simpatico strategico a turni alla Xcom dalle belle musiche, favolosi cappelli e missioni impegnative. Entrambi hanno assolutamente qualcosa da dire e questo terzo capitolo non è da meno.
La trama riprendere esattamente alla fine del primo gioco: [spoiler] Rusty, il protagonista, è riuscito a sconfiggere il Voltbot a capo dei Vectron, ovvero una razza di robot elettrici disposti ad assorbire ogni Steambot nella collettività ("La resistenza è inutile"). In chiusura lo si vede allontanarsi nel deserto con gli occhi accesi di una strana energia blu. [/spoiler]
La piccola Dorothy, che col padre dirige il negozio di oggetti acquistabili e a cui Rusty aveva salvato la vita all'inizio del gioco, non vedendolo tornare, decide di andare a cercarlo divenendo l'eroina del nuovo capitolo.

La struttura di Steamworld Dig 2 è di fatto identica al primo (scavare, guadagnare gemme con cui comprare oggetti e trovare potenziamenti per poter proseguire gli scavi), c'è però un'evoluzione: ogni oggetto acquistato con le gemme avrà un potere dormiente che potremo attivare incastonandoci degli ingranaggi speciali. Ogni ingranaggio potrà essere rimosso e riposizionato a piacere, trasformando così Dorothy (Dot per gli amici) in un robot configurabile e il gioco in un mezzo RPG, una via di mezzo tra i primi Final Fantasy (per i poteri legati agli oggetti impiegati) e Diablo (per le gemme da incastonare).
Le mappe sono ancora più grandi del primo Dig e le situazioni/enigmi/segreti leggermente più impegnativi. Ci saranno sempre brillanti in posizioni rischiose, oggetti dimenticati imboscati chissà dove e tesori da scovare, ma tutto più in grande, insomma.
Ne vale la pena? Assolutamente sì. Soprattutto se avete apprezzato il primo capitolo. E poi così scoprirete come siamo giunti... al secondo (no spoiler!!!)! ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198138213224', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1509807151}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 é jogo indie de aventura/plataforma com fortes influências do gênero metroidvania. Desenvolvido e distribuído por Image & Form, mesma equipe responsável pelo sucesso de SteamWorld Dig e SteamWorld Heist. O título foi lançado oficialmente no dia 22/set/2017 e até o momento desta review estava com 97% de analises positivas na plataforma Steam, consolidando o sucesso da franquia. O game está bem produzido, conseguiram manter a essência dos anteriores ao mesmo tempo que deram um toque inovador nesta sequência.

Não tenho como explicar com exatidão todos os eventos em torno da história sem que revele alguns spoilers, por isso vou resumir de uma maneira bem breve e que não entregue algo além do que já se encontra na descrição do jogo em sua página de compra. Aqui você volta há assumir o papel de um steambot – como nos outros jogos, caso já tenha jogado – que é basicamente um escavador/explorador, a trama realmente começa quando se depara com um centro comercial muito antigo que vem sofrendo com tremores e terremotos fora do comum.

O jogo consiste em muita exploração, mas não se engane, ação também é um elemento que não falta, assim como pequenos chefes que podem dar alguma dorzinha de cabeça – no normal, no fácil é.... Fácil – com o tempo você pode fazer upgrades para explorar novas áreas e conseguir novos acessórios para facilitar sua vida, mas tenha muito cuidado, quanto mais fundo você ir, mais armadilhas mortais vai encontrar e inimigos poderosos vão estar lhe aguardando.

SteamWorld Dig 2 é fácil de jogar, seus comandos seguem padronizados e durante o jogo ele mesmo vai lhe ensinando – um tutorial básico para cada nova função que libera – é possível jogar no teclado, até porque muitas pessoas já se adaptaram ao mesmo, porém com o controle em mãos é uma experiência sempre nostálgica e o mapa de botões está muito confortável, acredito que não será preciso mais do que alguns minutos para lembrar todas as funções. Visualmente o game está impecável, assim como sua trilha sonora que é um verdadeiro espetáculo. Posso afirmar que se trata de um título que atrai tanto os mais jovens como tem conteúdo para chamar atenção dos gamers de longa data.

A história é razoavelmente grande, não é nada complexa, porém é bem explorada no decorrer dos eventos, só é uma pena que não tenha legendas em português – e que a comunidade deve cobrar – pois em 2017 um jogo, mesmo que indie, deveria ter legendas ao menos em PT/PT. Fiz diversos testes de desempenho, alterei funções e tentei forçar alguns erros, mas o jogo se saiu muito bem em tudo, sua otimização é certamente um ponto alto, mesmo computadores bem fracos podem desfrutar deste maravilhoso game e sem perder a qualidade visual.

Sinceramente? É um jogo fantástico e merece todas as análises positivas que vem recebendo da comunidade, é difícil achar pontos ruins num jogo que claramente foi desenvolvido com muito empenho e carinho pela equipe responsável, SteamWorld Dig 2 é mais uma amostra que embora o gênero de mundo aberto esteja ganhando mais espaço do que nunca, os games de plataforma possuem muita força e podem surpreender ainda mais.

[h1]Destaques:[/h1]

+ Otimização;
+ Controles simplificados;
+ Visual e trilha sonora deslumbrantes;

[h1]É preciso atenção:[/h1]

- Adicionar legendas em PT/BR ou PT/PT;

[h1]Bugs encontrados:[/h1]

# Nenhum;

[quote][b]+ [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/mamilosclub]Mamilos Club[/url] (Grupo no Steam)

+ [url=https://discordapp.com/invite/mamilosclubsteam]Nosso Discord[/url] (Games, keys, news, sorteios e mais)
+ [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/mamilosclub#curation]Nossa Curadoria[/url] (Reviews dos mais diversos jogos)[/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197979785822', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1675809996}
review:
I'm starting to really like Image and Form, I hadn't played the original one but I played Steamworld Heist and decided to give this one a go aswell, based on that. Was not let down. The game is very fun to play and does a good job to compel you to keep playing. 

I had a little issue with the verticality of the digging mechanics, being only at the very end do you get equipment that lets you traverse upwards. I guess it's just part of the balance. 

Combat felt adequate and the bosses were fairly easy. The game's challenge is however challenging you make it. The diggin mechanics are made difficult by enemies also destroying terrain, often having rocks fall down on your resources. So a methodical approach nets you more rewards. There is also the option to turn on blueprints that make the game harder.
It's not really a heavy storydriven game, Rusty merely serves as a McGuffin to keep the plot going forward, aswell as the game. But this didn't bother me in Steamworld Heist either, the gameplay makes the game. 

Performance wise it runs excellent. 144fps locked without a hitch and fast loading times. And the game looks amazing, especially if you have a vibrant panel.

Can't wait what Image & Form bring next. Indie is definitely the way to go these days, what with AAA only making lootbox infested tripe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011933591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1797, 'last_played': 1650699873}
review:
SteamWorld Dig (2) ist ein absolutes Juwel unter den PC spielen. Mit viel Metroivania, liebevollem Retro-Steam-Punk Design, und einem ebenso schlichten aber süchtigmachenden Spielprinzip hat es mich voll begeistert. Der zweite Teil macht sogar alles besser, was der erste Teil noch nicht so perfekt umgesetzt hat.

Im Grunde genommen läuft es auf einen Mix hinaus aus Story, graben, verkaufen, aufrüsten, graben, erforschen, Story, verkaufen, aufrüsten, graben... graben... graben... bis der Arzt kommt :D

Die ersten Playthroughs dauern etwas (8-16 Stunden), wenn man selbst nach allen Geheimnissen sucht. Und die sind hingegen andere Spiele hier wirklich auch selbst findbar, dank späterer In-Game "Helferlein".

Um jedoch alle Achievements zu erhalten muss man einen anspruchsvollen Speedrun hinlegen, bei denen man eine volle Gold-Wertung erhalten muss in allen 4 Disziplinen (Zeit <4 Stunden, Geheimnisse 100%, Credits >15000, Anzahl Tode =0). Das war sehr fordernd, aber nicht unmöglich, da man auch den leichtesten Schwierigkeitsgrad spielen darf. Selten lasse ich mich zu Speedruns hinreissen - hier hat es dem ganzen neuen Pepp gegeben udn Spass gemacht.

Man darf auch ein wenig Schummeln, was die Tode betrifft - solange ihr das Spiel verlasst, bevor ihr die Todesmeldung quittiert mit OK, kann das Spiel den Tod nicht speichern (das geht aber nicht bei allen Spielszenen) ;)

Mit Gamepad spielt es sich deutlich angenehmer, und der ist fast für den Speedrun Pflicht. Dank dem verbesserten Gamepad Support den Windows und Steam erst vor kurzem für den Playstation 4 Controller eingeführt haben, kann ich den Controller endlich im vollen Umfang nutzen ohne InputMapper zu verwenden um einen XBox-Controller vorzugaugeln - klasse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086634308', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1509652824}
review:
È a prima vista un plagio totale: tutte le meccaniche sono ereditate da Dig Dug, Boulder Dash, Spelunky, Rick Dangerous, oltre che da Metroid e Castlevania. Ma presto ci si accorge della fusione perfetta fra azione, esplorazione, strategia, comandi perfetti, grafica ammaliante.

Niente picchi di difficoltà artificiosa come in Ori and the Blind Forest o respawn selvaggio come in Hollow Knight: il miglior Metroidvania moderno è questo, come ben evidenzia la rivista Edge. 

Una cosa proprio bella è la possibilità di sperimentare liberamente i potenziamenti. I nemici sono ben assortiti, sebbene le boss fight vere e proprie siano relativamente poche.

La localizzazione in italiano è eccellente, a parte alcuni typos che ho segnalato agli sviluppatori e che forse verranno sistemati in occasione di un'eventuale prossima patch.

Ora devo proprio andare, sono ancora immerso nelle profondità di questo capolavoro e al momento non ho alcuna voglia di riaffiorare in superficie.

Voto: 9.2 su 10 - Ipnotizzante

author: {'steamid': '76561197996691024', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1509660148}
review: I took a slow, sorta scattered, not quite playing through as the story goes playthrough of this game and I would say I mostly enjoyed it.  I initially had some annoyances in some areas before I realized I hadn't collected the right upgrades to get through them either making them harder than necessary or impossible, requiring me to go back to them, but I did choose to play the game in that way.  I do beleive I got a few sequence breaks with getting some items earlier than expected.  I wouldn't say any of this is a flaw though.  I imagine the game flows well if played through as intended and I wouldn't want it to keep me on rails to keep me from exploiring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028651970', 'num_games_owned': 1572, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1509389327}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is a sequel to adventure-platformer that involved going underground and mining precious ores. In this game, the niece of the hero from the first part is trying to find him. The game expands the ideas from the first part: you still need to dig through the caverns, seek valuable resources, sell them and upgrade your gear while trying to uncover some plot mystery. But it’s all done in a way bigger scale.
	
	I’m not talking about the size of the map (it has also increased), but the functionality as well: the arcade elements are there, but the game feels more like metroidvania now: apart from simple digging deep below, you get new locations like cultist temple, windy plains, human town. This all add flavor to the game and enhance the story.

	Speaking about the story: it still feels pretty straightforward, but my impression was that it is not the main focus of the game. What the game succeeds at is aesthetics and progression, coupled with engaging gameplay. First, let’s talk about the aesthetics: the style is cartoonish and colorful, but that gives a very strong charm to the characters of the game. The backgrounds differ much more than they did in the first part, making locations distinguishable and much more memorable. 

	The main gameplay loop is at its height: gathering metals, ores, valuables deep down below is done in a very formidable way. The player is gradually introduces to new game features, be it grappling hook, drill or remote bombs. Those mechanic introductions are followed by new tasks that player needs to solve. It indicates that SteamWorld Dig 2 has a great game design. In the end, the game presents challenges, gives you the tools to solve them but does not throw a correct solution straight at your face, giving you time to think and fulfillment from solving riddles. The digging itself is very pleasant, the pickaxe sound + the rock crumbling are really well-done. It’s addictingly fun to go back to town and see the numbers grow.

	Speaking about the riddles, there are special challenge rooms located around the map. If you finish them – you get cogs to upgrade your gear with various adjustments. Those rooms are well thought out, you won’t need to dig much there, but focus on solving situations that often require the use of newly-gained mechanic. On a negative side, this dilutes the digging experience (if you are more into that). To counter that argument, those challenge rooms are not exactly mandatory.
	
	Also, the game is going to be as difficult as you want it to be. Apart from normal difficulty settings, there are special equipment addons that can make enemy battles much more challenging.

	Honestly, I usually list the cons at this point but I could not find them here. Some mention the game is too short, but the completionists will find things to do nonetheless (challenge rooms + getting all secret objects that give special blueprints, there are 42 of them).

	Overall, the game is a highly polished and pleasing experience and I can confidently recommend it to fans of the genre, especially to the people who loved the first part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107110538', 'num_games_owned': 2585, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1511092367}
review:
Игровой контент очень интересный и удивительный, а главное не нудный. Красивый дизайн Дикого Запада, великолепная музыка, разнообразие игрового контента, а главное прокачка снарежения и повышение уровня героя затянет в игру на несколько часов (мне очень нравится апгрейд в играх).

Отлично сделанная работа, от меня большой спасибо разработчикам, надеюсь пройти ее полностью и открыть все секреты, как в игре так и в стиме.

Игра стоит внимания и потраченных денег.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E8LIQYdppdA

author: {'steamid': '76561197960392996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1509399744}
review:
[h1]Wholesome & Lovely[/h1]


For over a week it was my perfect after work activity. A bit addictive, but on the other hand so nice that I didn't want it to end, so I rationed it to entertain me for over week.
The storytelling gives us a bit of background, but can be described as the weakest part. Luckily this deficiency is outshined by the gameplay mechanics. The controls are  finetuned, and you quickly develop a smooth flow.
The game progresses very nicely when it comes to upgrades and such. During the last two hours or so I felt a bit overpowered, but beside that the game feels well balanced.
It took me ~ 17 hours two finish it, and there is still stuff left to do.

At least on the PC the release was a bit outshined by Cuphead, but a plattform lovers should feel blessed that there are still devs out there who release such high quality games.
Support the developers and buy this game if you love platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042023224', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 1033, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1509277546}
review:
별 탈 없이 잘 계승된 땅굴파기 메트로배니아.

행방불명된 전작의 주인공인 러스티를 찾기 위해 그의 동료였던 도로시가 이번에는 직접 곡괭이를 들고 지하 세계를 탐험한다. 땅을 파고 들어간다는 컨셉 상 다른 메트로배니아 게임과는 다르게 위에서 아래로 나아가는 진행 방식이 인상적인 메트로배니아 게임이다. 이 때문에 동일 장르의 다른 게임과는 판이한 진행 양상을 보인다. (미스터 드릴러를 RPG처럼 즐긴다고 생각하면 편하다.) 그래도 조작도 원활히 잘 되고 난이도도 적절하다. 자원을 모아 장비를 갖춰야하기 때문에 극초반이 살짝 지루하게 느껴질 수 있지만, 이 극초반만 잘 넘기면 상당히 재밌게 즐길 수 있을 것이다.

3D로 바뀐 그래픽과 주인공이 무뚝뚝한 채굴로봇 러스티 대신 말괄량이 여자(...겠지, 아마) 로봇 도로시로 바뀌었단 점을 빼면, 전작과 크게 다른 부분은 없다. 땅을 파고 들어가는 게임플레이부터 전투 방식과 장비 강화, 줄거리의 진행 양상까지 거의 모든 게 유사하다고 봐도 좋을 정도. 전작과 별로 다른 부분이 없다고 할 수 있겠지만, 이걸 다른 말로 하자면 그만큼 전작의 장점을 잘 계승해왔다는 소리도 된다. 좋은 점이라면 굳이 고치기보단 적당히 유지하고 보수하는 편이 더 좋으니 말이다.

단 하나의 지하 구역만 준비되있던 전작과는 다르게, 스팀월드 디그 2에는 총 세 개의 구역이 준비되어 있다. 각 구역마다 각기 다른 컨셉을 보이고 있어 플레이할 맛이 나고, 텔레포트 시스템도 잘 갖춰져 있어서 구역 간 이동도 매우 편하다. 다만 구역이 다양함에도 불구하고 각 구역의 길이가 긴 건 아니다보니 보통 4시간에서 6시간이면 엔딩을 볼 수 있을 정도로 플레이타임이 그리 긴 게임은 아니다. 이 역시도 전작과 동일한 부분.

그래도 엔드 컨텐츠라고 할 수 있는 추가 즐길거리들도 꽤 충실하게 준비되있다. 총 42개의 아티팩트와 이것들을 다 모으면 도전할 수 있는 최후의 챌린지 던전, 그 밖에 각종 숨겨진 요소들이 준비되있으며, 시간/돈/사망회수/비밀의 4가지 조건아 따라 엔딩 후 받게 되는 랭크 시스템이 준비되어 있어 야리코미와 스피드러너들을 위한 즐길거리도 잘 마련되있다. 게임 본편이 조금 짧게 느껴지더라도, 이것들까지 감안한다면 준비된 것은 꽤 많은 게임이라고 할 수 있겠다.

전작에 이어 '땅을 파고 지하로 들어간다.'라는 컨셉을 아주 잘 살린 메트로배니아 게임. 전작과 동일한 구석이 많은 게임이니 전작과 함께 즐겨주면 더욱 좋다.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/221138995671

author: {'steamid': '76561198165268861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1507473967}
review: A faithful follow-up to the first Steamworld Dig – engaging characters, art, music, and smooth gameplay. A huge drawback: The length of gameplay vs. the price. Shelling out $20 for a game with so much flash and so little gameplay seems a bit excessive – and calls the value of this gameplay experience into question. Especially when similar entries in this genre retail for a lower price point and offer much more immersive and longer-lasting experiences. Unless devs are planning a DLC or a roll-out of DLCs that let you truly dwell in the Steamworld Dig 2 universe, would recommend waiting for a price cut on this one.

review:
I have not enjoyed a Metroidvania game this much since the classic Metroid games themselves. The lore is great, the story has that sense of mystery, the secrets are clever and the progression is exciting.

Most of all, it's not stupidly difficult.

One of my favorite indie titles to date. I hope these guys keep making games.

review:
99/10!
Просто обалденное продолжение обалденной первой части SteamWorld Dig. 
Графика, геймлей, юмор и просто неимоверная красота. Эту игру хочется проходить снова и снова, даже после того как раскрыл 100% всех тайн на локациях, щемит сердце и не верится что уже нечего выкопать или открыть тайную зону.
Финал игры дает задел на продолжение, чему я очень рада, надеюсь в ближайшие годы увидеть третью часть и не ждать так долго как вторую =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967470691', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1508469233}
review:
Fantastic - if you enjoyed Steamworld Dig 1, this is a must buy. If you havn't played Dig 1, go play that first :)

Things I particularly liked:
- Music - catchy, pleasant, sinister and ominous when needed, otherwise upbeat.
- Controls were tight, and this has some light platforming challenges. Played with a USB 360 controller.
- Pacing was perfect, upgrades come right as you get comfortable with the previous upgrades. By the time you beat the game, your mobility and mining options are vastly different then at the start.

An all around upbeat, pleasant game. Sometimes you've maybe had enough of your everyday dystopian / post-apoc / zombie murder fest, and after a long stressful day at work all the grimdark bullshit is just too much. Games like this with bright palettes, pleasant music, and relaxing challenges are an awesome change of pace. Kudos for Image and Form for releasing another solid title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974893959', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1508383817}
review:
Just an upfront preamble before the actual review. The company who made this game, Image & Form Games, sent me a free copy of the game and requested that I make a YouTube video covering it. They did not request a review be written, I'm doing that on my own accord. My video covered first impressions of around the first thirty minutes of the game, and is linked below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fKIQh9wRYT4&ab_channel=darkchiron

[b]Overview:[/b] The game itself is a 2D platformer where you use a pickaxe to mine ever deeper into the Earth in search of a lost friend. As you progress you acquire new abilities, such as a bomb launcher to blow up things, and a hookshot to allow you to pull yourself to walls, ceilings and floors. You will also acquire upgrade cogs, that will allow you to access extra functions for the abilities you unlock, such as making your pickaxe do more damage to enemies. You will find gems that you can sell to make your abilities overall more powerful, like making your pick axe mine through blocks faster or giving you more bomb launcher ammo. There is also a levelling system in the game, and each level makes your gems sell for more money, and allow you to further level up your abilities. The game is littered with dungeons, smaller areas that serve as a place to challenge yourself within the game and find upgrade cogs and artifacts. There are also a number of secret areas to find throughout the map.

[b]Gameplay:[/b] Overall the gameplay is fun and engaging. The game in general is very easy, outside of one or two sections that can pose a challenge. The secret trials unlocked at the end of game by collecting every artifact is also a welcome challenge if you're looking for it. Besides a (kind of) boss at the start and the final boss, there are no other major enemies within the game, just minor enemies to serve as obstacles as you make your way through the game. If you're looking for a game to really challenge your abilities, this game probably won't do it. But if you're just looking for a fun platformer that you can enjoy progressing through and exploring for secrets, then this is the game for you.

[b]Story:[/b] There is a story, but it doesn't get incredibly in depth. The basic story is that you are Dot, a robot in search for her friend who went missing after he defeated Vectron and saved the world in the previous Steamworld Dig game. You quickly find a new friend to join you on your journey, as you dig further down into the mines and discover that a sinister plot is unfolding. The story is pretty interesting, but it doesn't really seem to be the focus of the game. It serves more as a reason for you to keep exploring and moving through new areas of the game. But in that respect, the game does do a very good job of making sure you know where you're supposed to be going by making sure it is marked on the world map.

[b]In Closing:[/b] I played enough of the game to beat it with all artifacts collected and access the hidden trials at the end of the game. Having played it all, I can fully endorse this game to anyone who enjoys 2D Metroidvania style games. If I had purchased it for $20, I would have felt it was money well spent given I enjoyed all 12 hours it took me to fully complete the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019082287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1508029883}
review:
Pros:
+Great exploring experience
+Nice atmosphere
+nice graphics
+nice soundtrack
+nice little story going on, not too much, not too little
+cute little city hubs
+Cool level design:
>multiple environments, each with their own flair
>EXCELLENT variety of challenges, like platforming and awareness, with smooth difficulty (about Super Metroid difficult)
>EXCELLENT variety of puzzles
+Upgrades are pretty alright
+Good progress experience with nice ability range

Cons:
-could have had more boss battles, it would have been a mustplay title
-artdesign might not click with everybody
-Fen character arc hollow and unconvincing (though perfectly ignorable, since not much stressed on)

I had a wonderful time with this little gem. If you are a fan of the old browsergame MotherLoad and of Metroid, you have to give this a try. 
If not, there's still a very, very nice game here, with excellent quality gameplay design. Astounding job for an independent game company. 
Wishing all the best and hoping for a great SteamWorld Dig 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1508008846}
review:
Wer Steamworld Dig 1 mochte, dem wird auch der Nachfolger gefallen. 
Die Zeit vergeht beim buddeln und upgraden wie im Flug. 

Ich freue mich schon auf das nächste Steamworld Game. :)

Ich fände ein Crossover der bisherigen Steamworld Games nicht schlecht, also Buddeln mit Rundenkämpfen gemixt.

review: Improves on the original in every way: lots of content to unlock and various play-styles to choose from depending on how you customize your character's abilities (fly around using your jetpack and drop bombs on unsuspecting enemies, fling them away with your hook or simply swing your trusty pick-axe), challenges involving puzzles that reward you with loot, funny NPCs with lots to say, beautiful visuals, a large variety of enviroments and enemies, but all self-contained in the metroid-vania style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992579488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1507524964}
review:
Отличное продолжение хорошей игры! Тот самый случай, когда вторая часть стала удобнее и разнообразнее, не растеряв по пути все хорошее из первой. Приятный игровой процесс, симпатичная графика, интересный антураж - замечательная игра для отдыха! Если вы не знакомы с серией - смело начинайте со второй части: все нужное для понимания сюжета в ней будет представлено в диалогах с персонажами.
Вперед и вниз!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011052721', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1507927019}
review:
I never played the first game but i did however play Steamworld Heist and fell in love with the gameplay, artstyle and music in that game so i thought i'd give this a shot. Now this is a very different game, i was expecting a digger game, like dig yourself down towards the bottom and collect shiny things on the way, rinse repeat. Now after i finished it (In 13 hours or so with everything unlocked and 88% secrets found) I'm more keen to calling this a platformer with digging elements. Lot's of upgrades to be found which all feels nessesary, a ton of secrets thats really fun to look around for and quite challenging puzzle caves and on top of that a sweet story that directly ties in to Heist.

Overall this is a very pleasant game in every way, the difficulty is just right for some lazy couch gaming and for the ridiculous low asking price i can't recommend this enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993148381', 'num_games_owned': 4366, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1514999872}
review:
[I]SteamWorld Dig 2[/I] is another hit from Image & Form, building on the success of the first game in pretty much every way. The game sees players taking control of Dorothy, a companion to the first game's protagonist, Rusty, as she seeks to discover what has happened to Rusty, and develops into a full-blown 'Metroidvania'-style exploration game while retaining the mining and wealth accumulation from the original [I]SteamWorld Dig[/I].

While it's easy to drop in and out of the game for brief stints of gameplay, it's very easy to lose yourself in the game's core mechanics, which make for a very relaxing, engrossing and ultimately satisfying experience, as you gradually expand and improve Dorothy's abilities. New to this over the original game are a range of additional bonus abilities that can be selected (and swapped out at will) - the range of these expanding as more core upgrades are obtained/purchased - which themselves also encourage further exploration to gather more of the upgrade 'cogs' that each bonus ability costs to enable.

Dotted throughout as you dig deeper through each of the the game's key areas are a number of secondary cave areas, the majority of which present a challenge or puzzle or some kind. There's an impressive range of different scenarios offered by these, each of which is very enjoyable to solve, rewarding upgrade cogs and other materials. For those who want to challenge themselves, there's good potential for replaying the game with a speedrunning approach, or limiting the abilities that you allow yourself access to, but even without this the game has a good length.

This is all presented with some attractive graphics and animation, making for an excellent overall package - highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969074709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1639923313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198323778423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1558725171}
review:
[h1]SteamWorld Dig 2 – Coming home after more than four years of being lost in the dark feels far better than expected..[/h1]

With SteamWorld Dig 2 Image & Form has proven once more that they are currently on top of their game.

Straight from the first moment that i had spent with SteamWorld Dig 2 everything in the Game was at the right place and the Gameplay felt so perfectly streamlined that the first two hours of the Game went in a blink of an eye past through me without even realizing how long I had already spent with the Game.

[h1]Compered to SteamWorld Dig a couple of gadgets where removed that always felt out of place.. [/h1]

While this is said at the same time Image & Form did expand the among of gadgets in the game that you get access to overall and made those upgradeable at the same time to fit your own gameplay style even more.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1165858988

On top of that a second upgrade tree was added to the Game where you can upgrade those Gadgets with cogs that you can collect in the Game by either either fulfill some of the task you get to do in the Game or do some of the new Challenges in the Game or find many times secret places in the Game while you just play through the Game.

[h1]Digging is still a major part of the Game but it doesn`t feel as dull as it did in the first Steamworld Game..[/h1]

More than once in the Game i was surprised how well the new locations in the Game are designed and specially some of the secrets in the Game were at places where i had expected them to be without even knowing it beforehand.

It just felt right and I really appreciate that Image & Form seem to put much more time into designing the World then they did with the first Game. It payed off in the long turn. Well done.

[h1]The Game is much longer than the first Game without making you feel that parts of the Map where added just to stretch the overall gameplay length..[/h1]

While the overall Gameplay length was obviously improved the Backtracking in the Game never was an issue at all or felt somehow stretched.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1165858813

At every single moment I reached a point where I couldn`t move further forward in the Game I was offered a different route to go somewhere else and return at a later point back to where I had stopped.

[h1] Conclucion:[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1149399636

Before I loaded up SteamWorld Dig 2 I did play through SteamWorld Dig to get a better understanding what might have back then be done better in the long term.

Finishing SteamWorld Dig 2 earlier this week I came to the conclusion that Image & Form did indeed took their time to clearly work out all those rough edges that were still left when they finished the first Steamworld Dig Game and tried to work on those issues to not repeat those same mistakes from 2013 again.

The result is speaking for itself. SteamWorld Dig 2 turned out to be not only almost perfect but too Image & Form did improve so many of those aspect that I had criticized in the first Game that after my first playthrough of around nineteen hours I just kept playing the game to get the rest of the other achievements and the Game still was enjoyable even there was nothing else to do in the Game after that.

“It just feels right.” That`s how I would describe the Game.

It doesn`t matter if it`s the Level Design, the Music from El Huervo/Cahndlerby, the new Gears Upgrade Feature in the Game, the Boss Battles,..if you look at the whole picture everything is where it should be and I couldn`t praise the Game enough for what it has achieved that way.

As far as it goes SteamWorld Dig 2 from Image & Form is one of my Game of the Year candidates..

[h1]Thumbs Up[/h1]

That´s it. Thanks for reading and have a great time ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198196552814', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1892, 'last_played': 1527383450}
review:
[h1]Steamworld Dig 2 is a sequel for Steamworld Dig and takes place befor Steamworld Heist.[/h1]

Steamworld Dig 2 focuses more on the story then the previous SWD and also includes more stuff to explore.
With the 42(+1) Artifacts to find and a ton of eastereggs as well, Steamworld Dig 2 made me play it 2 hours more, just to find all the artifacts, etc.

Steamworld Dig 2 has an amazing soundtrack, that doesnt get boring that quickly like in SWD 1, where there werent that many tracks.

The Artstyle is really nice and beautiful, nicer than in the previous Steamworld games.

I spend somewhere between 12-13 Hours on my first playthrough and gotta say i enjoyed every second.

The game isnt that hard to complete, therefor there are 3 modes you can activate, and also a lot of achivements (+ there are in the end 4 categorys (money earned, time taken, deaths and secrets found) where you get a rating (a bronze-, silver- or goldmedal) so for somebody looking for a real challenge, that might be something).

Steamworld Dig 2 is also not that linea than Steamworld Dig 1, which makes Steamworld Dig 2 really dynamic.

Gameplay: 10/10
Music: 10/10
POSITIVE OUTCOME: GREATER THAN ZERO/10
Secrets: 8/10
Artstyle 10/10
Story: 7/10
Price(in €)/Time(in h): 1,6

author: {'steamid': '76561197974029675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1507717562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008190734', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1507706683}
review: This seems like a game you'd get for free with a console or something, but it's actually pretty magical. It's like the mining of Minecraft or Terraria, but the maps are pre-made and your abilites are more limited, so mining becomes a constant spatial-reasoning puzzle. It's not a long game and it has zero replay value, but I enjoyed every minute of the 15 hour playthrough and didn't feel frustrated nor bored once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018604282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1507587668}
review:
I'd like to start and say that I was not a fan of the original Steamworld Dig.  I do enjoy the concept and the asthetic of the games (and I did enjoy Steamworld Heist), but Dig had gameplay issues I could not get past.  That being said, SD2 is a lot of fun and I enjoyed it from start to finish.

You are a steambot named Dorothy who is in search of her friend Rusty, the bot from the original SD.  You are digging in the mines to find him, all while collecting ore, which you sell to upgrade your gear.  You can also find cogs and artifacts which you use to activate mods on your equipment, which changes how they work.  

Moving around the underground was my biggest problem with SD, and they have made it much, much easier to get around in SD2.  It's fun to collect and go back to town to sell stuff to upgrade your items.  The story is cute, but not fantastic.  Graphics and sound are adequate, but nothing too special.

So I definitely recommend SD2 if you were a fan of the original, as this is better in every way.  And if you just want a fun action adventure type game (I hate to use the term Metroidvania, because it means so much to me, but it fits a little here), definitely check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014812621', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1507506510}
review:
I just finished this game after a 12 hour spurt.  It was so fun that I finished it in only two sessions, which is hard for me to do nowadays.  I rarely can sit for a game for much more than an hour or 2.  This game has it all.  Exploration and character upgrades, in metroidvania style, mixed with a digging game - the latter of which was something I've never been interested in, yet this game does it in such a way that made it a blast

As I mentioned there are tons and I mean TONS of upgrades for your character.  Even when I thought I was surely done finding them, I just kept finding more.  And that's not to mention that each item itself can be upgraded multiple times, which unlocks various perks.

I am so impressed with this game.  Anyone likes those old school exploration and leveling games will love it.  The art direction is fun and quirky.  It's not overly difficult, but then I grinded so much that I was just about maxed with everything except the jackhammer.  

Amazing job development team!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043856500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1596030890}
review:
10/10

just play it if you're into metroidvania style game.

It'll run on just about anything and will actually play on a laptop on battery for a significant amount of time. Proving again that a good game isn't all about the graphics.  

The story and its characters are humorous and quirky.
The character development is well built and allows you to fit your own play style.
The music is well written and complements the game so well that I found myself raising it's volume over the game's sound. 

The game is just the right amount of time, leaving me satisfied once done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201016050', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1612378663}
review:
I've finished the game once, completely blind. And this is what I got out of it.

Pros:
-It felt like an expansion of the first game.
-Only one place lagged for me, with an older laptop.

Cons:
-You no longer lose money when you die (which in hindsight isn't that bad), in exchange for your resources. This did not sit well with me.
-The game itself was shorter than I expected. I think there is more content post-endgame if you complete it 100%, which is what I'm doing right now.
-Passed up buying the soundtrack and the game together (big mistake).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970317911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1706263725}
review:

Not the most difficult game, but the content is varied and the pace of the game is really well done. I played it through to the end and then went back to collect all the artifacts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023466339', 'num_games_owned': 1344, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1507443076}
review:
Almost 6 hours to complete the campaign. I'm proud that I played the first recently because otherwise I would have missed the sequel. If you go for the main goals the game is sort but if you want to go for the 100%, it might take double of what I played. 

One thing that this game is different from the first is the economy which is less focused in big amounts of money and gems and different vendors. This time all upgrades can be purchased from the same place, the gems are out and the perks that add extra skills to your tools are a great choice and they can be reassigned in El Machino whenever you want for others.

I don't know if they will go for a third game or they will connect the universe with SteamWorld Heist in a sequel of that game all I can say is that its been a great time with this game and is worth the time and money without question. Now is time for SteamWorld Heist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968956752', 'num_games_owned': 1893, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1507429096}

✓ Good Metroid-like and platformer mechanics
✓ Well balanced difficulty, interesting challenges
✓ Good level design
✓ Good soundtracks and sound effects

A very polished game, improving greatly on the legacy of the first game.
Not a single bug or crash, smooth framerate all along on Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969817139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1558987261}
review: Если бы первую часть не раздавали бесплатно в Origin, то я бы даже наверно не обратил внимания на вторую. Вроде простенькая аркада, а затягивает так, что не оторваться. В игре имеются забавные персонажи, хорошие графика и звук. Большую часть игры Вам предстоит провести под землей - в шахтах, пещерах, храмах. Главная героиня в процессе игры будет находить различные устройства, которые будут помогать в ее не легком деле. Найденные ресурсы можно обменивать на деньги и покупать улучшения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030384775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1507389930}
review: This is a fun little game and doesn't overstay its welcome.  The various secrets and what-not throughout the game are well (and cleverly) placed, and towards the end they give you some real nice utilities for finding any of those last secrets you missed.  The combat mechanics are pretty basic.  Overall this is a really fun game and I would definitely recommend it if you are feeling up for a fun little steam-punk mining game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966600333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1507937922}
review: Not worth $20, especially in a year that brought us Hollow Knight and Dead Cells for a cheaper price point.   The story feels rushed and unfinished and the ending comes out of nowhere, which is a shame because it plays very well and they obviously put a lot of effort getting the game to look, sound, and play better than the first.  It feels like they had to cut a lot to get it out the door, to me.  Wait for a steam sale, definitely worth $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212112868', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1587151124}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2, such an awe inspiring sequel to the first. The first game had it's ups and downs, and I expected this one to be very similar to it. Oh boy was I wrong, SWD2 keeps all the same spirit, but with brand new 'upgrades' for your character. Throughout the game I kept expecting there to be an upgrade that was the same, and non of them were. I congratulate the dev team for making the second game different to the first in more than just the art style. 

If you want to play this game, I HIGHLY recommend playing the first game, because otherwise you wouldn't understand any of the story. 

Time for the pros and cons!
Pros:
- Completley new upgrades
- New 'cog' system
- Revamped graphics
- Runs probably too well on my potato laptop
- Takes about 7-10 hrs to complete casually

Cons: 
- Sometimes the gameplay can get kind of repetivtive, just mining and hitting creatures
- Some secrets aren't explained very well (But I guess that is why they are secrets)

If you want to get this game, I hope you enjoy it!
                                                                   - Keep on fighting! :2016gameingame:

author: {'steamid': '76561198001174242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1307, 'last_played': 1507334624}

review:

Si no jugasteis al primero espera una oferta del primero y cómpralo así sabrás si es tu estilo de juego.

El juego es un plataformas de ir recogiendo minerales en una mina, mejorar tu equipo y habilidades, explorar cuevas y encontrar diversos tesoros. Por supuesto la cueva está plagada de criaturas, cada vez más peligrosas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965604733', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1507319903}
review:
This was exactly what I was looking for. A great digger with excellent mechanics, meaningful upgrades and fun gameplay. I thoroughly enjoyed my time with this game and loved finding secrets everywhere. Steamworld Dig 2 doesn't wear out its welcome, it knows right when to give you new abilities and is just the right length with plenty of replayability to find everything. Very cool game, highly recommend if you like this sort of thing. :)

Side note, I love how they tie the Heist and Dig universes together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010088698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1512625009}
review:
Some gamers didn't seem to find the gameplay of the first game all that fun and engaging, but they might find this sequel enjoyable.  The core gameplay mechanics have been improved and it feels more like a platformer. You have more abilities and it is more action-oriented than the first.  There is a broader skill set that you can practice and hone your skills.  They really expanded upon all the fundamentals of the game while keeping some of the core concepts from the first.

The RPG elements are better, the story is better, the characters are better, the abilities, game mechanics, size of the maps, and length of the game are all just better.

If you found the first game boring, you should definitely give this a try because it might be fun enough for you to enjoy now. For others who enjoyed the first game like myself, you'll most likely love this sequel!  Runs beautifully in Linux and with a gamepad, great couch game, well done devs! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561197996715488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1507260992}
review: Very good sequel to a very good game. It follows up the story of the original, it keeps the original premise and improves it, has a solid soundtrack. Really there's no complaints here. Worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979310513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1588532401}
review: Extremely fun gameplay loop between collecting minerals and artifacts, and purchasing upgrades to your various tools you find along the way. The puzzles can be fun and challenging...some you might bang your head against a few times before you realize an upgrade is needed, or there's a special trick. For the most part, the environment is pretty chill, and the music is really relaxing. There are a handful of areas that raised the hair on the back of my neck, but I was able to get through without a ton of trouble. The dialog is also charming and good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960760763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1566562687}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962365244', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1588980434}
review:
Lovely game but a little too easy if you go for all the upgrades early on.

There are parts of the game that give you cogs for hard platforming elements. These are made really simple if you go to them late-game and have things like the jetpack but they can be done much, much earlier. Doing them early allows you to get a load of extra upgrades early on. That makes the whole thing really easy.

I didn't die once on the final boss.

That all said, it [i]is[/i] a lovely game. More of the same as SWD1. But prettier and somehow less grindy. I like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034432515', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1507187546}
review:
Про эту игру ничего не знал, пока случайно не наткнулся в стиме, зашёл посмотреть на ютуб, что она из себя представляет, по геймплею вроде понравилась, решил всё же купить, с начала игра особо ничем не выделялась но потом стала затягивать всё больше и больше, играя в неё вспоминались такие игры как  Quack Shot Starring Donald Duck для Сега и Duck Tales 2 для Dendi. В игре есть множество секретов, потайных комнат и испытаний, также есть где поломать голову над очередной загадкой. Игру прошёл за 19 часов, облазил все локации нашёл все секреты, и игра не успела надоесть, но как всё хорошее, она должна была закончится. Жду продолжение истории Дороти МакКранк.
Игру рекомендую к покупке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030893114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1506799038}
review: Worth the wait a thousands times over

author: {'steamid': '76561197998116681', 'num_games_owned': 3146, 'num_reviews': 600, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1555278996}
review:
Well, it's exactly just more of the same, but this time with really bad music. It ranges from forgettable to town theme, which sounds like very dirty disk (it means vynil) with Aerosmith - Dream On is stuck on loop in tiny pathephone (different thing), which have been sat on.

The game takes place some time after the end of the first one and before the Steamword Heist. Which both neatly ties the whole Steamworld universe, even the Outsider DLC for Steamworld Heist, and makes said DLC even more aggravating, rendering the comparison with Mass Effect 3: From Ashes even more on point. 

In it's core the gameplay is still good and feels like streamlined single adventure module for terraria (or Starbound, with its puzzles) with post-metroid level-design decisions. Game doesn't restrict your tools and there is a lot of sequence breaking possible. New upgrade and ability customization system is very nice and allows some neat synergies.

For some reason they turned Dot into a crazy frog and she not only looks like it but also animated like it. The other boots look just fine, but the main character in motion looks very uncanny as if it's cell-shaded 3D model or morphed animation instead of the doll one. Overall main character looks very unpleasant, and considering that you stuck with it and it's the main focus of your sight, it's kind of an issue.

Game works fine with UWS UHD Surround, but limits the view field instead of increasing it. Still there is an option to use pillarboxing to fix that.

Overall, if you want more Steamworld Dig — it is one and good at that. Also it's one of the best games of the year, which says more about the year than about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960294629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1528151080}
review:
Holy moly! Been looking for a platformer that would fill the void since Ori and Owlboy but haven't really been look that much. Then the guys over at GiantBomb (best gaming podcast there is) praised the game and I just had to check it out, and oh man it's a great game!

Six hours in and when I though the game was going to end after the first you-know-what then *BAM* they give you even more stuff and a lot more of caves to explore! You could already tell from the beginning that the map was kinda huge but this is just insane! Game says 44% complete and I'm in love the whole time!

Would easly recommend this game to anyone who likes platformers with the 'ol getting and buying upgrades and using mods (which you btw easly can remove and put back in) depending on many cogs you find.

Extra plus for having the desert music sounding like the Tristram town music from Diablo 1 :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198036677219', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1507154856}
review:
Amazing game! Character progression and mining are very satisfying, platforming is tight and responsive, and difficulty is very reasonable for people who are, like me, bad at platformers. Graphics and music are great.

Kinda short, though. Took about 10 hours to beat, get all upgrades and find 60% of all secrets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314624033', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1507029136}
review:
不得不说蒸汽世界掘金2这个游戏在近期同类型的游戏中素质是一流的，虽然标签是类恶魔城银河战士，实际上本作并不将战斗作为卖点[spoiler]boss战总共三次，教学管卡，魔法师，最后boss，实际上算两次[/spoiler]，大多数时间里还是挖矿[spoiler]这游戏的挖矿可以逼死强迫症[/spoiler]和跳跳乐。

游戏装备种类比较丰富，各个装备的手感都非常不错，连贯流畅，可以用优秀来评价；再加上类RPG的设定，可玩性也很高。要说缺点嘛就是主线太短了，没玩够呢就结束了，算上刷满挑战关卡也不够玩；其次就是很多secret藏的实在是太深了，能把人找到发狂，部分挑战关卡难度太高，缺乏提示。

这个游戏剧情我也看不太懂，3DM蒹葭汉化组汉化V1.0版本进游戏会报错，所以只能玩英文版了。

下面说一些游戏的技巧吧。
1、挖矿一定要注意尽量消除任何L型的缺口，这种缺口非常容易导致自己爬不回去，后期可以无视。
2、注意齿轮的加成，能很大幅度增加你的续航。
3、有些挑战管卡需要后期再去，但是会缺乏标志，需要自己留意。
4、挖掘距离虽然是1格，但是在方块上站在靠边的位置可以挖到第二格。
5、石头会彻底摧毁矿石，所以尽量避免坍塌。[spoiler]一定要用齿轮点出吸引矿石的属性[/spoiler]
6、很多secret在很高而且很偏的地方，建议后期使用喷气背包进行仔细检查，点满齿轮的情况下是可以无限飞行的。
emmmmmm暂时就想这么多了。

总的来说是非常推荐这个游戏的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198206684609', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1697313457}
review:
Completamente recomendado, vale la pena.
He jugado ya 13 horas a este juego, completar la historia es ya de por si bastante largo y sus toques de metroidvania lo hacen aun mas divertido, teniendo que desbloquear distintas habilidades para acceder a nuevas zonas y encontras secretos en zonas ya exploradas, solo con eso vale la pena la compra, pero ademas de eso contiene secretos que te tomaran unas cuantas horas mas encontrar, una vez que consigues el 100% de los secretos desbloqueas El Ultimo Juicio donde debes superar distintas pantallas en orden aleatorio sin morir y tiene una dificultad bastante alta.
Yo con mis 13 horas jugadas ya complete la historia y el 100% de los secretos, aun no logro pasar El Ultimo Juicio aunque ya lo he intentado un par de veces y cada pantalla es una prueba de diferentes habilidades.
En mi opinion, esta 100% recomendado.

P.D: Si tienes pensado comprar el 1 recomiendo que lo compres en oferta, ya que tambien es un buen juego pero bastante mas corto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035061137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1506975424}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980144911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1554706701}
review:
Давненько у меня такого не было. Про игру и серию ничего не знал, увидел в топе продаж, заинтересовало то, что увидел в ролике. Купил, зашел в игру посмотреть, что она из себя представляет - вышел через 14 часов. Даже поесть не смог отойти.  Благо игра короткая, и с большим количеством ачивов удалось добить во второй выходной.

Ближайший ориентир для меня, любимейшая и неподражаемая - Ori and the Blind Forest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970320868', 'num_games_owned': 3644, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1506908095}
review:
This is a good 12-16 hours, and I mean a GOOD 16 hours.  Very little fat here, you'll have fun platforming and puzzle solving and digging.  The puzzle sections and some of the deeper mining bits borrow heavily from Boulder Dash, and in may bits you'll be reminded of Shantae, and those are both good things.

Also without too many spoilers, this thing has a huge power curve. You'll start off just being able to jump and dig, and you really have to think about how you have to dig because it's easy to cut yourself off from resources.  As you powaaaa up, you will get consistently more mobile, and by the end of the game you will have no problem getting all the bits you left behind.

Great animation, great music, great diggings, dig in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042069229', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1511708752}
review:
[b] If you enjoy this review please consider following my Curator page [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31067175-ParanoidAndroid-Picks/] here [/url]. [/b]

It’s always nice when a sequel improves upon its predecessor without any steps back and that’s exactly what has happened with SteamWorld Dig 2. Coming from the immensely talented Image & Form, SWD 2 improves upon every facet of the original to create an exceptional metroidvania experience.

Honestly, I bounced off the original Dig and was much more a fan of SteamWorld Heist with its strategy leaning gameplay. But with Dig 2, Image & Form have really outdone themselves here. The core loop of getting minerals to get upgrades to help you get minerals easier is more satisfying than the original in part because of the arsenal you’re given. Traversal options are increased and the world is just a joy to explore. 

I adore the visual aesthetic of the game and find it much more appealing than Dig 1, which reminded me too much of a low budget flash game. Dig 2’s visuals really pop with a rich and vibrant palette of colors. The areas are diverse enough to keep things interesting while remaining visually distinct. Much like Heist, the music here is phenomenal. Normally when I play a game with lots of exploration I might put on a podcast, but not here. Even running through areas multiple times I never got tired of the soundtrack. It simply marvelous.

If I had to knock for Dig 2 for one thing it would be the combat. While normal enemy encounters where fine and as you get more abilities you can do quite a bit, I found boss battles to be pretty subpar. Combat is not the focus of the game and it shows. Luckily there are only a handful so it wasn’t that big of a deal. And this is not to say that combat is bad necessarily, it’s just the weakest part of an overall sublime experience.

I’m honestly shocked by how big of an improvement SteamWorld Dig 2 is over the first. The game is a joyous experience as I clocked in at about 10 hours with not even half of all the secrets uncovered. There is certainly a lot to unpack here and should give you some good bang for your buck. I hope we get a Heist 2 announcement at some point as this big of a leap there would be incredible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043330224', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1555103282}
review:
С первых минут очень затягивающая и медитативная игра. 

Игровой процесс как и в первой части: бьем блоки, убиваем насекомых и других недругов, ищем ресурсы, делаем апгрейды и идем по простенькому сюжету. 

Главное здесь - это геймплей. Поэтому все строго на любителя. Но качество игры на уровне.

Минусы: 
Опять же нельзя бить в прыжке, бить по диагонали, нет ролевой составляющей (к концу игры вы просто становитесь Рэмбо со всеми скиллами и улучшениями), к концу игры становится скучно, потому что у вас будет джетпак, с которым играть проще простого. Например, есть пещеры (например, где куча кнопок со всех сторон и к ним нельзя прикасаться и т.п.), которые я прошел БЕЗ джетпака и это было ТРУДНО, но ПРИЯТНО чувствовать вкус побед и свершений. А с джетпаком эта комната пролетается легко и скучно. И тут либо ты сам придумываешь правила и усложняешь себе игру, чтобы было интереснее, либо игра становится слишком простой и казуальной.

Плюсы: 
Очень много секретов, есть где поисследовать, разные биомы (похоже на Террарию, только казуальнее и в своем крутом стиле). 

В целом, игра очень хорошая, но именно для своей ниши. Многим она может показаться нудной и однообразной. Остальным - очень рекомендую! Ощущения от первого прохождения, изучения, открытий и приключений - просто крутые! 

*Над пещерой испытаний пришлось попотеть! Прошел с четвертого раза на последнем дыхании с 0.5 последней жизни! Жаль, таких испытаний тут мало.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968907104', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1507199849}
review:
This is a really good indie gem. 
A metroidvania game with A LOT of destructible environment, worked into all sorts of platforming and smaller puzzles & challenges. Upgrades that you can buy and apply yourself as well as whole new skills & tools found in Mega Man-like capsules.

It can be played without any knowledge of the previous games, there are just a few recurring characters (which are explained anyway).

Graphics, audio and story are all good. There is no voice acting, instead you will hear "robot noises". It is hard to describe, but it does sound very fitting.

And as always, a big plus for supporting linux as well as seeming almost bug-free (I did not encounter a single one).


The biggest two downsides are:
A) It is relatively short - though by far longer than the first game, so improvement here
B) It is pretty easy if you do not have two left hands with thumbs for every finger

So if you are looking for a very challenging game, this is not it. Other than a handful of (optional) challenge rooms, you won't have any troubles. Therefore, this one is more for people wanting to explore and relax a bit, absorbing the great atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025001257', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1543178473}
review:
Absolutely amazing, superb game in the Metroidvania genre.
If you love Super Metroid or the more recent Guacamelee(one of my fav.) - just get it.
Bigger and bolder than the first game. 

At first it starts slow, with more mining and digging, but after a couple of hours, you get many new abilities and the game opens up - so many amazing secrets, hidden rooms and puzzles.
For me personally - 10/10.  You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260297880', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1527280567}
review:
Well where do I start? I love the wonderful and charming first game and I have to say so far this game is very true to the original in both story and gameplay. It is really fun, couldn't love it more. I honestly enjoy these types of games as they feel very casual but can suck life away faster than getting a wife and kids.

Pros[olist]
       [*]Alot of time consuming but incredibly fun and totally lovable gameplay.
       [*]Smooth tight controls and if played on a decent system you can have extreemely great visual quality for very cheap system requirements.
       [*]Overall really fun and really really goddamn good. occasiional stuttering but that was probably because I decided to play it on an IGPU to see if it could run smoothly and loved the experience of a shitty resolution on that game.
       [/olist]

Cons[olist]
        [*] on maximum it can get mildly intensive and has some qweird memory leakage but anything with 8 GB RAM is really good enough to cover that.
        [*]When this game recommends that you use a gamepad [h1]USE A GAMEPAD[/h1] makes the game so much more enjoyable though to be fair i used an Xbone Elite controller but still it was a really smooth experience compared to the wonky keyboard system   [spoiler][which is the real reason why i typed this diatribe][/spoiler}
        [*]could use a couple patches to fix that weird stuttering issue but could just be little ol autistice me having a braintard moment
        [/olist]

[spoiler] This game will suck out your life and fuck up everything you hope to gain because you will spend hours trying to fix that shaft you dug only to reaslise you were like 2 feet from a pipe system entrance. Happy mining bots![/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198028020795', 'num_games_owned': 6567, 'num_reviews': 502, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1507934882}
review:
Full review: https://cublikefoot.com/2017/09/30/steamworld-dig-2-game-review/

A great sequel to a great game. SteamWorld Dig 2 takes what made the original fun and expands on it, adding several new features to keep the experience fresh while still maintaining the charm of the original. There is more than enough content this time around, even if the difficulty and combat may be lacking.

Pros:

Great sense of progression. I absolutely love the progression in this game. The leveling, upgrades/mods, and the overall pacing is very well done. The new cog system for mods is easily one of the best changes the sequel has made. Being able to add and remove mods so easily allows plenty of room for experimentation. Don’t like a certain mod? Remove it and put those cogs towards some other mod instead. There are numerous upgrades and mods to try out, so much that I barely had half of them by the time I beat the game.

Overall, the progression was great. Coming back up from the mine to purchase a new upgrade or use a new mod was always an exciting experience. I found myself looking forward to what could possibly be unlocked next, as some of the mods are quite creative.

A larger, livelier world. The world this time around is much, much larger than that of the first game. Not only are there now numerous mines to explore, but there is simply more life to the world. More people to talk to, more secrets to discover, and more diversity overall. The pneumatic tube system, allowing the player to jump between various points on the map, was an excellent addition as well. It made the world a lot easier to explore and kept the game from getting repetitive.

Plenty of content for completionists. It took me just under five hours to beat the game, but I had only discovered 40% of the game’s secrets (for which I earned a bronze star). I could easily get another 5-10 hours out of this game just trying to find all the secrets and getting all the unlocks. There is a plethora of content to explore and I did not even get through half of it in one playthrough. After beating the game, I was still able to go back into that save and do what I want, no restart required. A nice feature, especially if one just wants to 100% the game without restarting.


Cons:

A bit on the easy side, even with handicaps. While the sequel is a tad harder than the original, I still found myself flying through the game without issue. I was playing on the game’s “normal” difficulty (it is either that or easy) and even took some of the in-game upgrades to make the experience harder (like enemies doing double damage) and, while these changes to the base difficulty are noticeable, it still was a rather easy experience. I only really had difficulty with a couple of the different enemy types (like the bird things, which I just ran away from).

The combat. Also an issue with the first game, the combat in SteamWorld Dig 2 is shallow compared to the rest of the game. There are few combat upgrades compared to the amount of total upgrades available and a lot of them are on the pickaxe, which is difficult to use on a lot of the enemies found later in the game. The pressure bomb was good for taking out enemies at a short range, but that can only be used so many times before recharging. There are some upgrades to other tools, like the jet engine, which has a ramming upgrade. A cool upgrade, but really only useful against bats and other enemies in the air. I just wish that the combat had more diversity outside of just slapping enemies with the pickaxe or shooting them from afar.


SteamWorld Dig 2 is a fantastic sequel, improving on the original in just about every aspect. A great sense of progression, a larger world to explore, and the amount of content available is just fantastic. While the difficulty and combat may be lacking, I can definitely say I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995423810', 'num_games_owned': 902, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1698682587}
review:
[h1]Если копать в бездну, то бездна начнет копать тебя[/h1]
Чудесная инди-игра, одна из лучших в этом году. Размеренный, очень аккуратный геймплей про копание, собирание ништяков и секретов, почти незаметно и без безумного бектрекинга элементы метройда, грамотный геймдизайн, душевный дизайн локаций и подземелий. С любовью нарисованые персонажи, красивый графон и забавные диалоги. Здесь даже  в описании артефактов и перков Души больше чем в большинстве ААА игр вместе взятых! Случай, когда игра не просто продолжает первую часть, но эволюционно развивает концепцию и становится супер крутой. Увлекательное приключение в забое, которое я могу посоветовать всем всем.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354818996', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1564861141}
review: this game is by far one of the best games i've ever played. there are so many things that are absolutely amazing about this game. the exploration is great and satisfying, the story is amazing, the characters are well made, the ending is written very well, the art style and art is awesome and beautiful, the controls and movment feel amazing, the difficulty is challenging but not challenging enough that it gets frustrating, its calming yet needs focus and attention. The best aspect of it, in my opinion, is the progression curve. it is by far the best ive ever seen in any game, none of the upgrades you get are boring or stupid, none of them are useless or specific, they are always creative and useful, and you keep on feeling like you've reached the endgame upgrades, then they throw another one at you, probably something you were never expecting. this makes this game one of my favourites of all time, 11/10, I would recommend it to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971335644', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1507686009}
review:
The tl;dr version: In a word, phenomenal.

SteamWorld Dig 2 takes the enjoyable formula established in the first game, refines and polishes it to a shining diamond, and adds a lot more to it.  This game is bigger and better than its predecessor and one of the best metroidvania style games in recent memory.

At its core, SteamWorld Dig 2, like its predecessor, plays as a cycle of dig deeper, return to the hub, sell your ore to buy upgrades.  Once you have amassed a good bit of ore to sell you have a choice to make: Do you play it safe and go back to town, or do you push on and risk dying and losing some of your haul as your light dwindles in hopes of getting more ore and discovering a shortcut back to town deeper in the mine?  Along the way you encounter entrances into short, self-contained puzzle challenge rooms.  These rooms tend to revolve around a central mechanic and test the player's wit and skill.  There is quite a bit of variety to them and while they start out quite easy, they get fiendishly difficult later on.  These rooms often have secret objectives beyond the main objective too and these secret objectives can be especially tricky to obtain.  One such room presented me with a difficult decision at the end.  Once I figured out the mechanic to get through the puzzles it was down to my dexterity with the controller, something that has diminished as I've gotten older.  After several tries, I had reached the end of the puzzle, yet there it was, the optional objective, tantalizingly close, yet I was at near critical health and while the climb to get to the optional objective was short, it was definitely dangerous with a definite potential for me to take damage.  Do I leave the room, go back to town to heal, and come back for the optional objective?  If I do, then I have to go through the whole puzzle again, including a climb that requires a good bit of dexterity and split second climbing.  Or do I go for the optional objective since I'm already right there?  If I die then, while I don't lose anything I got outside this room, I will lose what I got inside it, including another optional objective I had gotten that was out of the way.  I would have to go out of my way to get it again, should I fall.  In the end, I decided to man up and go for it, and I succeeded, then limped back to town on a sliver of health after glorious victory.  The game throws such nice moments of tension at you from time to time.

There are also some pretty cool boss fights, as there were in the first game.  I won't spoil anything, but I think the boss fights are even better in this game.  They are quite imaginative and really fun.

The controls are tight and responsive.  There are a variety of mechanics. both from your own abilities and the level design, which is quite excellent.  There are quite a few available upgrades that you can tailor your character to your play style.  While you will eventually be able to afford to max out almost everything, through the early and mid game you need to decide what's more important to you, carrying capacity, light source, health, or some of the various digging implements and tools you have.

Visually the game looks great.  Image & Form have established a really nice aesthetic for their SteamWorld games and this may be the best example yet.  While the art style is very different, SteamWorld Dig 2 reminds me a bit of Trine in how colorful and vibrant the world looks.  It's very pleasing to the eyes.

The musical score is solid, as are ambient sounds and sound effects.  

While replayability is a bit questionable, the amount of content offered here is quite generous for the price asked.  It's definitely a good value.

Overall, SteamWorld Dig 2 is a really excellent game.  It looks great, it plays great, and it's constantly very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036479371', 'num_games_owned': 3988, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1572203357}
review: Awesome. Huge improvement over the first one with well over 10h of gameplay to 100%, more indepth upgrade system and a lot of collectibles and secrets.

Great visual queues and map design make this worth your money and time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045717790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1677642187}
