author: {'steamid': '76561198396926880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1506827078}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 is the latest masterpiece from Image & Form. Every aspect of the game is incredibly polished. It's tough to say whether or not it's better than Steamworld Heist, but either way, it's a fantastic game, and it is miles ahead of the first Steamworld Dig, which I also loved to death.

Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995631545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1665299694}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is a very well crafted game.
Story driven with well paced out mechanics that keep the gameplay fresh from start to finish.

The game doesn't give you everything, but lets you pick and choose what you value to use. I gathered almost every scrap of money I could find and ended with most of the unlocks which made the effort of that playstyle feel worthwhile.

I very much recommend this game for anyone interested in platformers or people who are looking for something enjoyable and stress free to sit down with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960279601', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1506401377}
review: Really fun game with a focus on exploration and traversal. I enjoyed the first one and this is even better. Recommended if you like digging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059561891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1506811127}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 does exactly what a sequel should do, it’s both bigger and better, yet holds true to the series’ legacy.

There are very few Indie games that I have picked up and could not stop playing until they were beat. Stardew Valley, Legend of Grimrock, Cat Quest, Owlboy, and my all time favorite, Transistor, just to name a few. Another was Steamworld Dig which I stumbled upon after getting it from a Humble Bundle. There was just something unique about that game which just clicked, it was addictive, fun and kept things going at a great pace. Next thing I knew, it was all over, and Vectron was defeated.

Here we are with Steamworld Dig 2 and it’s deja vu all over again. Things pick up right where they left off and I couldn’t be happier. If it isn’t obvious, I loved Steamworld Dig and pretty much every aspect has been enhanced, magnified, and gone over with a fine tooth comb. Fanboy aside, this is a game about digging, platforming, and minor combat. If you didn’t like the first game, then move along because Steamworld Dig 2 masters what it began in its first iteration.

In case you don’t know anything about the setting of Steamworld, it’s a mix of steam punk and western. From debutantes, corrupt town mayors, and rootin tootin cowbots, Steamworld is a unique world inhabited by Steambots and mystery. In the first game you played Rusty, a silent type who had a penchant for mining. To make a long story short, Rusty found himself in a bit of trouble with a big bad ancient evil machine called Vectron. With pick-ax in hand and nothing but the oil on his brow, he smashed that evil machine into smithereens.

After that everything gets a bit hazy and Steamworld Dig ended rather abruptly, some would say. In Steamworld Dig 2 you play Dorothy, a former friend of Rusty’s and daughter of the mayor Hank McCrank(love these names) of Tumbleton. After destroying Vectron there was a massive quake and Dorothy sets out to find Rusty and follows rumors to a new town, and there her own adventures begin.

From crazy cultists, sentient energy beings, and rumors of the world ending, it’s up to Dorothy to unravel the mystery of the recent earthquakes and find Rusty, who may or may not have something to do with them. Needless to say, Image & Form nailed its theme and aesthetic a long time ago, but they still manage to bring a fresh breath to the game. Everything looks sharper, brighter and better than ever, and I was already rather fond of the way the first game looked.

The first thing I noticed about the graphics, movement, and effects was how smooth they all are now. Everything seems the same but definitely has gotten a new coat of paint. The terrains are a heck of a lot more varied and Steamworld Dig 2 feels less about spelunking to the end of the earth, and more about being a cohesive adventure game with dungeons, puzzles, and more secrets than you can shake a stick at.

Everything does start off with a familiar tone of a mine, a pick-ax, and a flickering light. Fast forward twelve hours later and you’re knee deep in an Indiana Jones lava temple or dodging insane Vectron bots, which genuinely scared the freaking bejeezus out of me. I felt that Steamworld Dig 2 has a better flow of story mixed with adventure than its predecessor, where progress was about just going deeper and deeper. In the middle of the game you completely break off from what you are doing and go to a whole new area. I loved that.

If you’ve played Steamworld Dig or Steamworld Heist, then you know they that have a great ability to make very awesome looking characters. This is true here with this game as well. You meet a whole new cast of townspeople with their own unique personalities and thoughts. Character design is top notch and you even get the chance to interact with some of the Shiners who were all insane in the last game. 
Dorothy is a different bot from Rusty and brings her own bag of new tricks and challenges.

Steamworld Dig 2 is a metroidvania style game, same as the first. You will constantly be upgrading Dorothy as she unlocks better pickaxes, better lanterns, and new tech, like sticky bombs. Aside from a whole new set of gear to unlock there are also cog mods. This is where customization is kicked into high gear. As you progressively unlock better versions of equipment, you also unlock passive upgrades that can drastically change how that equipment works.

Each passive requires cogs that can be found throughout the game hidden in certain areas. You will also eventually unlock a merchant who sells them. You can equip and unequip these cog mods as you see fit to match your play style or situation. This is an awesome system and gives you motivation to explore every nook and cranny. While it isn’t impossible to make progress without the cog mods, certain passives are very, very helpful. Being able to hold two gems instead of one per inventory slot, for example, or the bounty hunter passive which gives you cash for killing things with your pick-ax. Some of the cog mod upgrades can only be unlocked by finding relics.

Relics are another obsessive and fun collect-a-thon item found throughout the game. As you adventure through mines, caves, and god knows what else, you may stumble upon a relic such as a moonshine six-pack, a rubber ducky or a Doom Cult to do list. While none of these items have a direct effect on the game, if you find enough, a certain Steambot in town rewards you with cog mod upgrades for finding more and more.

Platforming, just like everything else in this game evolves rather quickly. Dorothy starts off with the familiar jumping, wall bouncing and dashing. However, things begin to evolve when you get your hands on your hookshot and other crazy upgrades. You may find yourself in a situation where there is no floor at all. Steamworld Dig 2 definitely ups the ante when it comes to the platforming challenges. Improvements aside though, none of them were super difficult. Steamworld Dig 2 wants you to enjoy yourself more than you grind your teeth.

Combat is probably the area that more or less is kinda the same from the first game. There are plenty of new bot baddies to smash and they all look great. It doesn’t change the fact that combat feels simplistic at best. You have a couple new tricks to destroy enemies but they are mostly a hindrance and are there to annoy you rather than actually put up a fight. Bosses are another story, as some of  them can be rather tricky, but again not too terribly difficult. If you do focus on the combat you are rewarded by leveling up and gaining better sales bonuses per level. Also certain upgrades require you to be a certain level as well.

I can’t forget to mention that Steamworld Dig 2 is BEST played with a controller. The game starts up with a big image telling you as much. You can play this with the keyboard/mouse, but it really feels clunky. It’s far smoother with a controller.

In all, the gameplay is as enjoyable as the first, if not better. The “challenge” caves are fun little puzzles that never got tiring. The varied environments always kept things fresh and kept themes from over staying their welcome. Plus I never got tired of hookshotting my way around everything. If you liked the first then you will love Steamworld Dig 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039522521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1705260733}
review:
If you loved the first one, you'll love this one. More of the same Metroidvania-style gameplay with tons more polish, great visuals, great music, and great controls. The story is serviceable and the characters are pleasant enough, but this is a gamer's game at its heart and contains plenty of platforming thrills and interesting puzzles. Best of all, Steamworld Dig 2 is truly one of those games that feels like a labor of love, and it's a joy to play through from start to finish.

In all, it took me about ten hours to finish the story, and I'll likely spend a few more finding the rest of the secrets and collectibles. Top that off with a replay at some point down the line and I feel as if I got my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153966258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1507914744}
review: This sequel harks back to the original in so many ways. You have many game series diverging from what made the first game so good, but this game hits the nail on the head. Retaining most of the art style of the original, it still looks and feels like the first, but with extra replayability in the form of achievements and challenges. So basically, without spoiling it, it's the first game on steroids and a tone of extras.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970811200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1506642294}
review:
Steamworld Dig the first was a bite-sized, fun little platformer about digging for shiny rocks, getting crushed by bigger rocks, and uncovering little secrets here and there.

Steamworld Heist was something I never played but, presumably, it wasn't about gettng crushed by huge rocks, and is therefore inherently inferior to Steamworld Dig.

Steamworld Dig 2 is like Steamworld Dig one except slightly bigger, with a neat little gear upgrade system, and they also decide to give you a grappling hook and a jetpack so you can hook your way into areas beneath giant crush-rocks, as well as fly up into the crushrocks to make yourself look like both an idiot and a pancake at the same time.
An idiotcake, if you will.

I recommend the games if you can get them on sale, but I would also recommend them at full price if you can get them without putting yourself into financial trouble. "Beating" the game is easy and an affair that will take six to eight hours, in the case of Steamworld Dig 2, but finding all the secrets, little gems hidden here and there, as well as getting the scratch to upgrade everything will take you one to four hours more, depending on how ardent you are about it, and whether or not you are a mentel deficient like I tend to be in the case of puzzles and secrets.

Seriously, I've rubbed myself on every rock in Swim Swam Sway. What the hell am I missing?

That aside, let us say that Steamworld Dig one and two have both made me willing to look into a sequal, and if Steamworld Dig 3 is bigger, badder and better than Stemaworld Dig 2, then it will very definitely be a "Great" game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985246687', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 3560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1690747192}
review:
Купил игру, как только она вышла, настолько я её ожидал. И я не был разочарован. Такой должна была быть первая часть!

SteamWorld Dig 2 взял за основу предшественника и улучшил всё, что можно было улучшить. Меньше раздражающих моментов, больше свободы и разнообразия, более удобное управление и всё в игре стало яснее.

Перечислю ряд положительных моментов (на самом деле их даже больше):
[list]
[*]Развитие персонажа стало куда более интересным и нелинейным, как и путешествие по миру.
[*]Раздражающие моменты, вроде расходников, были упразднены. Здоровье и вода теперь, как и раньше масло для лампы, восстанавливаются при посещении города. Теперь деньги тратятся только на покупку постоянных улучшений, а не на восстановление здоровья и лестниц.
[*]Трубы для мгновенного перемещения теперь встречаются регулярно, позволяют перемещаться к любой другой трубе, а также отмечаются на карте. То есть они видны заранее, так что если карманы переполнены или закончилось масло, можно быстро прокопаться к следующей трубе, а не возвращаться к более отдалённой предыдущей.
[*]Больше никаких телепортов и гаданий, тратить драгоценные ресурсы на создание своего или нет.
[*]Есть карта всего мира, по которой можно легко ориентироваться.
[*]Сюжет теперь имеет развитие, а неторопливое прохождение занимает раза в два больше времени, чем в SteamWorld Dig.
[*]Геймплей стал не только разнообразнее, но и позволяет игроку подстраивать способности под себя.
[*]Появился большой стимул к поиску секретов и прохождению пещер, так как они содержат очень полезные предметы.
[*]Больше никаких переключений между оружием. Все инструменты теперь используются своей кнопкой на геймпаде, что намного удобнее старого управления.
[/list]

В общем, всем, кому сколь-либо понравилась первая часть, но не хватало глубины и разнообразия, категорически рекомендую SteamWorld Dig 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988671702', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1647023145}
review: I love these game. Fast, complicated from middle to end and gives very, very much fun. BUY IT, You will not regret.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966598434', 'num_games_owned': 1188, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1506614838}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 is absolutely fantastic both as a sequel and a standalone game. It improves on its predecessor in almost every way, taking an already charming and fun to play but quite small game and expanding it to full length -- my first playthrough took about seven hours, and I still would've had more hidden stuff and upgrades to go after.

Those seven hours were filled with pure gaming joy. The game looks charming and everything just oozes personality. The sound design is amazing (I dare you not to smile every time the "you found a secret" sound cue plays) with a smooth soundtrack. The real star is the gameplay, though. Steamworld Dig 2 gets the Metroidvania gameplay loop down pretty much perfectly. The game world is sizeable but not so huge to make your task seem impossibly daunting. The game itself is is paced so well that you constantly feel like you're improving, unlocking new things and accessing something you couldn't access before.

Ultimately Steamworld Dig 2 is a real gem and I'd wholeheartedly recommend it to almost anyone. I bought the game originally on Switch before receiving my review copy for Steam, and I ended up completing both versions after my "sit down on the PC for a while to capture some video" session turned into a five hour marathon without me even realizing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035731920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1506676538}
review:
한 큐레이터가 이 게임을 극찬을 하길래 한 번 사서 해봤다.
게임을 플레이하기 전에는 단순히 땅을 파고, 자원을 캐고, 장비를 업그레이드하는 게임인 줄 알았다.
하지만 직접 해본 소감은 플레이하기 전과는 매우 다르다.
땅을 파고 자원을 캐서 돈을 벌고 장비를 업그레이드하는 것은 맞다.
하지만 자원을 캐려면 떨어지는 바위에 맞지 않게 조금씩 생각해야하고, 이리저리 숨겨져 있는 요소들을 찾아내는 재미가 있었다.
하지만 후에 장비를 업그레이드하면서 숨겨진 것들을 찾는 재미가 살짝 반감된 것은 아쉬운 점이다.
하지만 의외로 가장 재밌었던 요소는 바로 액션이다.
장비의 성능이 향상되도 여전히 위협적으로 다가오는 적들, 생각보다 잘 만들어진 보스전들.
액션 부분에서는 굉장히 만족스러웠다. 단순한 요소들만 가진 이 게임의 평가를 끌어올려준 것이 이 액션이라고 생각한다.
플레이타임은 생각보다 적은 편이었지만, 숨겨진 요소들에 도전과제를 더하면 플레이타임이 꽤나 늘어날 것 같다.
엔딩까지 그저 달렸을 뿐인데 도전과제가 아직 반이나 남았다.
아직 즐길 거리가 남아있다는 것이 참 즐겁다는 느낌을 주는, 간만의 좋은 게임이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054869651', 'num_games_owned': 2880, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1506797726}
review:
Certamente mais um jogasso da franquia SteamWorld, se curtiu os anterioires, principalmente o primeiro, com certeza vai curtir esse.
Quem não jogou nenhum pode comprar sem medo e dar uma chance que o game não vai decepcionar. A trilha sonora e gráficos tão ainda melhores do que no primeiro Dig, e a história da sequencia o que deixa o game ainda mais interessante.

Primeiras impressões aqui: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y5rUwc3sqsQ

author: {'steamid': '76561197985925754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1512281912}
review:
Incredibly polished and lots of fun.

This developer makes games that are as close to perfect as you will find. It brings to mind the days of Nintendo cartridges that were bug tested and polished to an infinite degree,  because you can't patch a cartridge once it's out in a customer's hands. These guys deserve a lot of credit for putting out software that is as near perfect as you will find anywhere.

The movement, sounds, animation, and music all work together perfectly, like an orchestra. The world they have built and the characters that inhabit it are very charming,

As the game begins you play the part of a mining robot who is looking for their lost friend. You come into a town where you suspect he may have been seen. Things open up from there and you set to exploring. Going deeper into the tunnels, mines, and other locations requires upgrades to your base equipment. By mining resources and trading them in town you can decide which upgrades and perks are most important to you. The designers left this very open and you can tailor the upgrades to your play style. It is a lot of fun to see the results of your hard work when you get to try out a new upgrade.

The gameplay is superb. Playing with a keyboard did not feel like a hinderance, but I would imagine this game would be perfection with a controller. The movements of your character felt just right, and the game seemed to have a real atmosphere and weight to it. Things felt natural and the physics were predictable and consistent. That is important in a game with lots of jumping, swinging, flying and floating.

There is a large variety of challenges. The mines and tunnels have a number of 'rooms' that are self contained puzzle areas where you can find more treasure and artifacts. Some of these can be very frustrating, but they do end up giving you good training for what is to come further in the game. I was swearing like a sailor and vowing to never buy anything from this developer again, but when I finally managed to get through a puzzle, it was extremely satisfying.

This developer also considers the player from every angle. Everything is fast, menus are simple and easily navigated. The intro videos can ALL be skipped by tapping the space bar a few times. It also tells you how long it has been since your last save when you decide to quit. Small but important touches that make for a great playing experience.

If I had one complaint about the game, it might be length. It feels like it ends just when you are really getting the hang of it. There is not a 'third act' so to speak. Even though the story is complete, it feels like a chapter could have been inserted in the middle to flesh it out a little more. It is priced appropriately, however, and the time you do spend is action packed and lots of fun. To be honest, there is still more to go back for, as I didn't find all the artifacts, but there is no new areas to explore.

I certainly got more than my money's worth. I was just sad to see it end. I can't wait to see more from the SteamWorld!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013303354', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1558737931}
review:
Metroidvania de libro con elementos de excavación. Recomiendo pasase antes el primero.
Esta secuela aporta mucho más contenido sin caer en la monotonía, siendo muy satisfactorio y adictivo en sus mecánicas, con un apartado artístico impecable, con entretenidos puzles y enemigos finales.
Un par de días he tardado en pasármelo, los mismos que el primero a pesar de durar el doble. ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027748338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1509081856}
review: I did not expect this game to punch me in the gut with so many likable and memorable characters, emotions and the like. Definitely not the digging game I thought it'd be, it was so much better than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996824025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1512235414}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035826989', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 3128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1702011396}
review:
Play the first one first...

But you don't need to. I just recommend it. This game is fantastic, and much larger than the first, really well made and it's only tarnish is one annoying room with buttons and a lack of hats. (Though if you like aggravating puzzles, that one room is probably good for you.)

It still feels short by the time it's finally done, but completing certain challenges can keep you going for quite a long time. I completed the game in 11 hours, with all secrets found. (I may have forgotten how to sleep.)

Rusty (First game PC) May have had a better hat, but Dorothy (This game PC) Has an angry little familiar named (If you've played Steamworld Heist DLC) blue light, and without him it'd be an awfully lonely time!

I do not recommend this game to my friends, because I will probably buy it for their birthdays, if you buy it, I won't know what to get you.

If I do not know you, then buy this game now! And for your friends, on their birthdays!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961780979', 'num_games_owned': 1698, 'num_reviews': 362, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1506602995}
review:
2017/09/28

順帶一提NS也有出

目前只有3DM 漢化而且會報錯

真要漢化玩的話就只能用覆蓋方法而且會無成就但還是能截圖


基本上我覺得就是一代的加強版XD

這次的主角是一代的Dorothy  來尋找一代主角的下落

我覺得玩起來畫面比一代更順暢外  還增加了不少功能

裝備可以打MOD 也就是額外功能但需要齒輪來啟動

還有藍圖可在旅途中找到道具來跟NPC 交換或是找到隱藏地點NPC 獲得

可惜流程還是蠻短的QQ

如果不熱愛挖礦也不找秘密的話我想一天應該就通關了吧

這次怪會重生也會掉礦搭配MOD藍圖可以爽賺錢跟經驗  一代忘記能不能這樣做了

有些隱藏地點需要後期的裝備  建議有飛行器之後搭配專找秘密MOD再來啟程秘密之旅

若真的真的找不到  像我香菇森林跑了四次都找不到的話  社區還有完整攻略圖別擔心


最後這代有秘密關卡  關卡都比較難要進階操作且有限制

像是跳躍關卡就用不了飛行器跟鉤子  需要大跳跟反大跳  玩到這我才知竟有這種操作

重點是秘密關卡死了就要重來  過了之後就多了一件道具....也沒有然後了QQ


最後一句話  挖礦齁勝!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978784427', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1506635967}
review:
This is a fantastic sequel to the first Steamworld Dig. I beat the game in about 9,5 hours while not rushing but not going for 100% collectibles either. The story was good in my opinion and I especially enjoyed the same old 'feel' of Steamworld Dig with the new upgrades and mechanics they've thrown into the mix.

I honestly have no real complaints about the game, everything worked flawlessly and I had a really great time playing it. If you enjoyed Steamworld Dig, this sequel is a must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1508592459}
review:
Been playing it for 6 hours now and it truly feels like a title straight outta the Nintendo-catalogue. If you like Spelunky or any of the exploration/digging games out there this will hit home.

Also sound track is on point!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993288786', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1643099954}
review:
Absolutely awesome and gorgeous digging game!

I love going down the mine to explore and find new minerals and upgrade my character. Great gameplay loop! 

Graphics and controls are great!

EDIT: So after playing some more I must say that I still love the game but OMG the music is atrocious! This horrible violin sound in the first mines, urgh! I cringe everytime I hear it! It sounds like a horrible cat ululation! Please devs if you ever read this please slap the music composer in the face for me, thank you!

In German we would call the music "Trauergesang"

EDIT: 
So after finishing the game I must say: 

- At least the music in the outro nailed it! 

- The game makes many different things right and I loved to play through it. First my motivation was to only gather diamonds to get rich but in the end I was excited about the new features my hero would get. 

- The game has a very good scaling. While in the beginning you traverse the levels slowly as soon as you get the [spoiler]grappling hook and later the rocket drive[/spoiler] the game really opens up and in the end you are blastin through the levels.

- I love the difficulty of the game - not only the main game but also of the "riddle caves". I could solve them all and some were really difficult (floor is lava) but I felt really rewarded in the end. 

All in all I can totally recommend this game. It's kinda sad that this game does not get more appreciation from the gaming community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045261302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1682059204}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977801488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1602072177}
review:
More please.

I'm a huge metroidvania fan. Beaten Metroid 1, Super Metroid, Fusion, Prime 1-3, Zero Mission, working on AM2R and SR and also beaten Castlevania SotN, CotM, HoD, AoS, DoS, PoR, OoE and other giants in the genre like Ori, Axiom Verge, Guacamelee!, The Shantae Series, Rogue legacy, Teslagrad, Dead Cells, Shadow Complex, etc.

SteamWorld Dig 2 is sublime. Easily the best of the non-metroid/castlevania metroidvanias. I am skeptical another game will ever reach SotN/Super Metroid levels of awesomeness, but this game sure as hell comes close. Every area is handcrafted, a lot of thought went into the map. Tons of secrets are everywhere, opportunities for sequence breaking are abundant, the atmosphere (read: art design and music) are top notch, the difficulty curve is just right. I have no real complaints about this game. I'm not done yet but I'm already hooked - this game made me put down Metroid SR. Please make more. One thing I really liked about the first is that is didn't overstay it's welcome - that is, there is no grinding and each moment of playing both steamword dig games feels new, original and not like repetitive/lazy copy pasting - quite a task for a game about continuously digging down to sell gems and repeat. You feel like you're always progressing, always getting new upgrades, always unlocking new areas to explore. And then...the game ends! No wasted time. That was true for the first game anyway, and so far that's been true of this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983190667', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1506977852}
review:
Absolutely cannot recommend this game highly enough. Its fantastic! The gameplay is tight, responsive and thoroughly satisfying. The art style, the soundtrack and the overall feel is simply perfect. Its a rather short game but highly encourages exploration to find secrets and also tracks deaths and game time for medals so there is longevity in it.

If you played and enjoyed the original this is a must play! It improves upon the mechanics of the first with a longer and more challenging game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047003939', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1506579440}
review:
Es un excelente juego para llegar del trabajo y relajarte un poco, tiene la temática cyberpunk y visualmente es muy lindo, la música es excelente y te va envolviendo poco a poco en el juego. Durante el juego vas desbloqeuando nuevas mecánicas interesantes, el objetivo del juego es minar y conseguir recursos venderlos y conseguir upgrades a tus armas. Algunas cosas se desbloquean en la historia y otras comprándolas, tiene la manera de customizar tus herramientas preferidas y ajustarlo a tu manera de jugar. La campaña es divertida y se pone más difícil cada vez.

Les recomiendo mucho este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993424254', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 328, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1506530621}
review: Прошёл [b]SteamWorld Dig 2[/b], и он хорош. Его песочно-паззловый геймплей всё так же приятен и не выматывает, а за годы со времён релиза первой части на первой платформе стало видно, что «выверенность» и «полированность» входят в базовые ценности проекта. Душевный, милый сеттинг сохранён, несмотря на то, что юмор подистощился, а «полные реакций и мнений персонажи» стали слишком читаться как обязательные искусственные наборы «диалогов». Снова хороший flow, снова приятный гринд и снова «стальные яйца в концовке». Ну и при всей сравнительной несерьёзности – франшиза становится осмысленнее и детальнее в своём мироустройстве. Связь между [b]Hest[/b]-ом и [b]Dig[/b]-ом теперь понятнее. Ещё пять с половиной часов (если вы не перфекционист) приятного отдыха.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997472371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1521294275}
review:
je n'ai pas l'habitude de faire une évaluation sur Steam mais la sa doit être fait ! j'ai acheter se jeu sans grande conviction et au final j'ai passé presque 8h d'affilé dessus pour le finir ! tellement j'ai été pris dans l'aventure , dans l'évolution de mon personnage ,dans le plaisir de l'exploration !  et dans l'histoire tout simplement .
a acheter les yeux fermer pour les amateurs du genre surtout qu'il ne coute pas très chère ... enfin bref un grand plaisir une total surprise ! :) 
et merci image & Form pour se genre de jeu continuez ! ( en espérant qu'il y ait un 3 vu les possibilités qu'offre la fin de celui-ci )

author: {'steamid': '76561198045271722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1506336614}
review:
An absolutely lovely game. Get this if you enjoy digging-blocks kinds of game. There's plenty of that plus lots of other bashing to do.

A very well balanced throughout, secrets of normal-achievable difficulty. Things unlockable and relevant all the way till the end.

Great great soundtrack too!

Not particularly hard, nor grindy. Just right. 

About 20-30 hours for full completion with secrets.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037778794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1633163410}
review:
If you liked SteamWorld Dig, you'll love SteamWorld Dig 2.
If you loved SteamWorld Dig, you can't miss out on this.

This is a sequel in the best way; it is nothing but great improvements on the original game.

Better movment abilities
Better upgrade system
Better character interactions
Better exploration
And many more great secrets and puzzles. 

It's not a large game but that's not a bad thing as it doesn't overstay it's welcome.

Great fun 10/10.

I'm doing a blind let's play over on my youtube channel, so if you're interested in seeing the start of the game (or more) then you can check out my playthrough's play list here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLoEzRww9YfiE0ugTqqmB1VqNTddwTWYjm   
Thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248406600', 'num_games_owned': 1667, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1506044475}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 由 Image＆Form 开发并发行， 是蒸汽世界系列的第三部作品，剧情紧随前作SteamWorld Dig ，玩法依然以探索与挖掘为核心，只是这次主角变成了Dorothy（一位富有探险精神的女性）。由于前作主角Rusty的杳无音讯，Dorothy孤身一人来到陌生的蒸汽世界，在寻找Rusty的过程中，她遇见了Fen----一只可爱的像素精灵，在精灵的助攻下，Dorothy开启了奇妙的地底世界的征程。

Dorothy首先来到了受地震困扰的 El Machino 小镇，Dorothy接受镇民的委托，前往地下找寻地震的源头，她也希望在挖掘的过程中能找到Rusty。与前作一样，游戏围绕着丁字镐与石块进行，从缓慢的挖掘到最后一击一块。不同的是本作更注重解谜与战斗，借助原先已有的地下轮廓，玩家可以快速的挖通地底，而发现隐藏在岩石中的秘密才是游戏的乐趣所在。

[quote]◉ 感谢奶牛关野蔷薇与游戏方提供体验机会
◉ 点击阅读[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/SteamWorld_Dig_2/review/2737890]图文评测	[/url]	[/quote]

[h1]冒险与挖矿[/h1]

与泰拉瑞拉等沙盒游戏不同，本作以升级强化系统代替了制造体系。游戏开始时，玩家只有一个滞钝的镐头，每一次挖掘既浪费时间又消磨耐心，通过售卖挖掘时发现的矿石可以获得金币，玩家可以使用金币升级装备，提升Dorothy的血量与装备性能。

地下世界并不大，可以根据所在位置分为三个区域，每个区域都有边界，不能像泰拉瑞亚那样随心所欲地挖掘。因为隐藏的物品一般都在边界附近，所以我一般都是沿着边界挖，这边挖到了目的地的深度，就换另一边挖。玩家在挖掘的过程中会遭遇多种敌人，它们有不同的攻击方式，熟悉之后很容易击杀，击杀后则会获得血量回复与经验，当经验积满就会升级，获得能力提升与强化解锁。

没挖多久就能发现原先已经存在的传送炉与地下洞穴，玩家可以传送于各个传送炉间，而地下洞穴是我最喜欢的游戏内容。每个洞穴都是一个小关卡，完成难度不一的动作闯关或者是解谜，就可以获得强化所需的齿轮与隐藏的物品。在某些特殊的洞穴中，甚至可以获得新的装备，例如射击枪与飞行器等，依靠洞穴，玩家可以更快更简单的到达目的地。

[h1]解谜与战斗[/h1]

在地下待太久总得返回小镇呼吸下新鲜空气，每一次死亡或者主动传送回小镇都会回复所有的生命与水含量（射击等技能需要使用水）。回到小镇第一件事就是卖掉挖到的水晶矿石，之后就是强化装备了，使用齿轮启动装备的可强化属性，有些强化对于Dorothy来说是一次重生。

一周目通关，我用了10个小时。在这十个小时里，我完成了很多有趣的解谜，发现了32个隐藏物品（总共42个），也完美探索了绝大多数的地下地牢。我甚至觉得游戏内容有些少了，有一种还没玩爽的感觉，因为我本来就很喜欢玩动画/像素风的游戏，这类蒸汽朋克风格的类沙盒游戏正合我胃口，本以为可以玩几十个小时，没想到10小时就很快的结束了。

SteamWorld Dig 2 中的解谜不是很难，例如发现隐藏的隧道、推箱子与平台跳跃等，像是一个搭载了若干小游戏的冒险游戏，小而精。游戏中的战斗相对于泰拉瑞亚等沙盒游戏简单了许多，玩家不需要通过大量的走位与花哨的技能击杀boss，而是利用技巧在合适的时机将BOSS击杀。对我而言，战斗系统稍显简单，没有太多的惊喜与满足感。

[h1]结语[/h1]

感谢游戏中精致合适的音乐与有趣多样的过关方式，令这次挖矿经历如此有趣。之前我也玩过类似风格的游戏（打造世界等），但能让我静下心来一次玩通关的也只有本作了，总结原因可能就是游戏的动画风格与类沙盒的探索玩法了。

每次完成一个小目标或是获得性能强化都会得到满足感，要说可惜的话，就是游戏没有汉化，大部分的对话我都是直接跳过，虽然不影响进程，但总归少了点内涵与剧情支撑。总的来说，SteamWorld Dig 2 是一款非常优秀的蒸汽朋克风冒险挖矿游戏，女主Dorothy为了寻找前作主角Rusty，在未知的地下世界挖掘矿石探索洞穴。得益于游戏优秀的场景关卡设置与精致的画面音乐，这次地下冒险充满惊喜与挑战，一步一步向下挖掘，最后的真相或许会让你感动。

author: {'steamid': '76561198095348647', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1506849513}
review: Amazing game that only builds upon the first. The gameplay stays fun and enjoyable with a big collection of upgrades to buy. In addition to the engaging storyline is a plethora of artifacts to be found in enjoyable puzzles. Unfortunately, the repetition can occasionally make the game mundane, but it's no-where near enough to stop playing. If you somewhat enjoyed the first then you should definitely give SteamWorld Dig 2 a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020174715', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1507409743}
review: O jogo mantém as características positivas do antecessor. Com uma jogabilidade fluida, dificuldade crescente e bem balanceada, tudo dentro da pegada do Steam World, o trabalho é sem dúvida recomendadíssimo pra quem conhece o universo e curte um bom jogo com elementos de rpg junto ao insano gameplay de plataforma. Preço justo, trabalho fino.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037855759', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1506914827}
review:
This game is fucking amazing.

Best metroidvania game I have played since SOTN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021454753', 'num_games_owned': 1632, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1790, 'last_played': 1653732907}
review:
SteamWorld Dig 2 is everything that I wanted from the first game and more, from the story, music, atmosphere, gameplay and level design all comes together to make a very fun and addicting experience. In the game you play as Dot, a robot who’s goal is to find her friend Rusty and to discover what is causing many dangerous earthquakes in the valley. Along the way you will meet fellow bots to help guide you on your adventure.

Image & Form really stepped their game up with this one, they’ve listened to the complaints with the first game and made sure not to make similar mistakes, for that I applaud them. All the hard work created a beautiful and mechanically satisfying masterpiece. SteamWorld Dig 2 plays a lot like a Metroid style of gameplay except with ya know digging, you can explore and make bank or stick to the main story at hand, it is up to you and your playstyle.

Oh boy the music in this game, let me tell ya, it’s real nice. Walking into the hubworld for the first time made my ears dab with elation. A lot of tracks in the game fit the locations and atmosphere perfectly, at least it gives you an incentive to keep your lamp aflame when digging, if ya don’t then things can get a bit spooky, real quick. The visuals they’re great, just look at the trailer and see for yourself, they’re freaking gorgeous. There are some sections in the game that made me stop and go “whoa that looks insane” and I’m sure others would agree when seeing it for the first time.

Difficulty isn’t too high, however, it is much higher than the previous game forsure. Enemies in this game actually have attacks and can feel threatening when encountering them for the first time which is pretty awesome. There is a place from the previous game that has been completely reimagined for SWD2 and holy cow the enemies in that level scared the bolts out of me, I had no idea I was stepping into Resident Evil: Robot Edition. Was a really terrifying and badass experience, had me on edge the entire time. 

Pros:
-Graphics are really really nice
-Music is down right awesome
-Much longer than the first game if you 100% everything
-Upgrades, lots and lots of upgrades
-Did I mention Graphics? Cause those are pretty darn good
-Collectables with hilarious descriptions to find
-Actual story 

Cons:
-Some platform sections can be a bit confusing on where to go
-Still wish it was tad more difficult but that’s just me
-Should be a stat screen after beating the game to help speedrunners
-Fen ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Conclusion:
Do I recommend this game? Absolutely, this one is far more superior than it’s predecessor in every way shape and form. Image & Form said “YOLO” and put all the effort into this game. These guys really knocked it out of the park and I hope their future projects are as fun as this one.
 
If you loved the first game then you're in for a treat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043109634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1506559570}
review:
I'm really Digging this game so far!
It feels Deeper than the first game!
It's truly a Gem to be discovered!

-You can remap buttons, silly to have to bring this up as it should be standard nowadays, but I can't help but still appreciate games that allow you to do this!
-The gameplay is solid, movement feels good and responsive, exploring is rewarding and the puzzles are fun to solve. If you screw one up, you can reset the room and try again so it's also very forgiving.
-I use DS4 Windows with a PS4 Controller and it works like a charm!
-When Quiting out, the game shows you how long ago the last save was, very handy for those that forget the Save Early Save often rule, now you'll know so you don't have to lose progress!
Seriously these guys do solid work, lets keep supporting them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1506414239}
review:
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6142328/][b]Like this Review? Follow The Cpt Froggy Club Curator Page for plenty more![/b][/url][/quote]

SteamWorld Dig 2:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
Excuse me, have you seen a short bot with a cowboy hat who goes by the name of Rusty, by any chance? Of course, you haven’t. That was the only answer Dot (Dorothy) would receive as she walked east, all the way to the Wild West town of El Machino. There, the Mayor of the city definitely identified her friend Rusty. However, he is deep into the El Machino mine and most entrances are closed off due to recent unpredicted earthquakes. Come on Dot, it time to dig deep in SteamWorld Dig 2!

SteamWorld Dig 2 is an adventure / platformer / exploration game where you take control of Dot, who’s looking for her friend Rusty, who was last seen entering the mines of El Machino. 

As you reach El Machino, you’ll meet several bot characters, including the Mayor, Mic Yonker, who will give you quests, Barnacle Jones to whom you’ll be able to sell all valuable stones that you’ll find in the mine, and Turtle Bucket, who will help you with upgrades and enhancing your tools.  I will let you discover the other ones.

On the first couple of quests, Dot will only have access to her pickaxe, but as she digs down into the mine, she‘ll discover caves. Most of the caves will have COGS to be found (some of the caves have puzzles) and some of them will have this sort of cocoon machine where Dot will receive extra abilities or tools when she enters them.  In regards to the COGS, you can use them on the workbench to enhance tools or abilities at El Machino. Ultimately, your favourite bot will have a pickaxe, a grapple, an acid gun and a mechanical hand to smash heavy rocks. 

As you would expect, mines are full of dangers and this one has terrifying crawling creatures, such as crab-like critters or spiky crazy snails. There are flying enemies as well. Believe it or not, this mine has large blue parakeets and explosive wasp thingies and they are absolutely deadly. Be careful when coming across sorcerers has they can spell fire balls and teleport themselves around the mines and strike you back quickly and easily. On top of that, you need to avoid touching cactus, explosive barrels and acid balls too as they all will affect your health bar. The other point you need to be careful of is how much oil you’ll have in your lamp. If you run out of light, well, you can’t see a thing in a mine. To give you a tip, try to upgrade your lamp as soon as you can at the workbench. It will make Dot’s life a little bit easier.  However, make sure to collect as many precious stones before returning to the surface and sell them to the best broker of El Machino.  Death can come in many ways: by being hit too many times by enemies, falling from high ground, swimming in acid waters or dropping into bright hot lava. Each time Dot dies, she will respawn at the lovely El Machino town but without three quarters of the stones she might have collected. So, if you pockets are full of shiny stones, don’t hesitate to make a trip back to town to sell your goodies and pick up a few upgrades while you’re at it. And how do you get back into town? Extremely simple, Dot can use the extensive tube channels within the mines. 

Graphically, the game looks great and the soundtrack is good too. Control-wise, either you use the keyboard or the gamepad; the controls are very responsive. 
 
Positives:
~~~~~~~

-	Great graphics
-	Easy to play
-	Fun Story
-	Plenty of upgrades
-	Great gameplay and controls
-	Achievements and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 
 
-	Personally I think the puzzles could have been a little bit harder
-	A bit repetitive.

What are you waiting for? Go and help Dot find her dear friend Rusty.

7/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970771515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1333, 'last_played': 1636921439}
review:
2013年に発売された2Dアクションゲーム、Steamworld Digの続編です。

ツルハシ片手に地下に潜り、掘り出した鉱石を街で換金して装備を充実させさらに地下深くへ…という基本的な部分は前作と変わりありませんが様々な面でやりやすくなっています。
ブロックを破壊するのに必要な攻撃回数が減ったり、離れた地点のブロックを破壊する爆弾や壁に飛びつくフックショットといった便利な道具が序盤から使えますし、前作のように使う度に店で補充するといった手間も必要ありません。ファストトラベルも単に二点間を往復するだけでなく一度使用可能になったものは自由に行き来することができるようになり便利になりました。前作では1つの穴をひたすら掘っていくだけでしたが、今回は4つくらいあって交互に進めていく形なのでこれはありがたいところです。

大きく変わったのが自キャラの装備や強化に関する仕組みです。
ツルハシやカバンのような基本的な道具のほかにModと呼ばれる装備が追加されました。Modは道具の購入や探索により選択可能なものが増えていき、地下で見つけたギアの数の範囲内で組み合わせていくことが可能です。付け外しも街でコストなしで行なえます。上位の道具はツルハシの破壊力を上げたり持てる鉱石の数を増やしたりという基礎性能が向上しますが、Modではブロックを破壊したときに低確率で鉱石が2個落ちたり、30秒に1回敵の攻撃を無効化したりといった追加能力をプレイヤーに与えます。
なお上位の道具のアンロック条件は前作ではこれまで換金した総額であったのに対して、今作では敵を倒して上げていくレベルが条件に変更されています。

サクサク進めることができるようになり進行ペースが上がった一方でボリュームも十分に増えており、難易度Normalで探索はそこそこに1回クリアして所要時間は7時間半ほどでした。周回要素や上位の難易度が追加されたりということはないようです。
基本的なシステムは前作から引き継ぎ、よりストレスなく進めることができるようになっているうえに体感のボリュームでも見落とりせず順当進化と言えるでしょう。ただリプレイ性は低く1回クリアしたら終わりかなと…最後に所要時間や死亡回数などクリア評価が出るのでそれで好成績を狙うくらいしかありません。

とはいえ前作が気に入った人であれば間違いなく買いですし、あわなかったという人も試してみる価値は十分にあると思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197997152026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1506380998}
review:
- 7,5/10 - рекомендую! :]

- продолжение по-своему уникальной игровой серии из россыпи "квадратиков", кусочков дизайна наполненных смыслом сухого воздуха фронтира ... на месте плоское мышление, способное поглотить любой встречный жанр, добавив ему глубины под влиянием своей фирменной системы подачи контента, запрятанной под слоем качественного ощущения прогресса через разрушаемость мира в обертке совсем не случайно генерируемых сюжетных характеров и толики драмы - в этот раз пространственно разогнался платформинг - и грапплин хук, и джетпак, и невесомость, за счет кучи повествовательно легковесных секретов и малюсенького сюжетного шага вперед - и хотя это все еще в плохом смысле слова настоящий "инди-хит" с подкупающей душевностью страдающий от нехватки производственных мощностей ... все же продолжение удалось! :]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041527106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1599762043}
review:
Se avete giocato al primo SteamWorld Dig, sicuramente apprezzerete questo secondo capitolo, molto più vario e articolato rispetto al precedente. Si completa in circa una decina di ore ed è un metroidvania dalle meccaniche classiche. 
Insomma, non c'è un'innovazione particolare, però la giocabilità e le meccaniche consolidate lo rendono un titolo da provare per gli amanti del genere e coloro che vogliono divertirsi a spaccare cubetti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004148871', 'num_games_owned': 1611, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1640018090}
review:
Image & Form has made a "slam-dunk" when it comes to creating a sequel to their original game, Steamworld Dig 1.  When they were planning and making this game, I image this is how they planned the game:

Monday 9:00am - Figure out the story for the new game
Tuesday 8:00am - Hey, ask the fans what cool stuff they wish they had in Steamworld Dig 1
Wednesday 8:30am - Hey, would do you think we could surprise the fans with?
Thursday 9:15 am - Hey, ask the fans what they like in a new game and ask them to name a character while you are at it
Friday 7:30am (Breakfast meeting) okay, we got the story, we know what the fans wish they had, we know what we want to surprise them with and we got a wish list from them... now let's make the game!!!

I image this is true because the Steamworld Dig 2 speaks to all of this.

All good sequels have these traits in common:
- Builds on the strengths of the version prior
- Addresses the weaknesses / shortcomings with code fixes and/or improved game mechanics
- Enhance or add new game elements based on customer feedback that do improve the overall experience
- Ignore trolls that don't understand the genre and innovate

Steamworld Dig 2 accomplishes all these things and more.  There so many good things about SWD2, but here are the highlights:
-	Great story with surprises 
-	Tight gameplay
-	Meaningful, new game mechanics
-	New Cog system that allows for unique and varied gameplay based on personal preference and desired challenge level
-	New mechanics provide the right amount assistance to aid in finding secrets which is unique / rare in this genre
-	Has the right level of difficulty for achievements with ones that speak to players of all skill levels Causal / Regular / Hard-Core 

Clocks in around 15-20 hrs finding all the secrets 

Only one con, I really wanted more to play.  The pace of the game and length is right through.  But, whenever you find a really good Metroidvania game; you always and I mean always want more

So here’s the hoping we see a Steamworld Dig 3 game.

And yes, I have finished the game….

author: {'steamid': '76561198185984455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2027, 'last_played': 1506816006}

Desta vez você irá jogar com a Dorothy que sai em busca do Rusty (o porque não vou dizer pois no primeiro SteamWorld mostra, então vai joga o primeiro.) Os mapas são bem mais extensos, itens secretos, upgrades e encantamentos que você pode escolher da forma que desejar entre outras coisas. Valeu a pena esperar todo esse tempo haha

author: {'steamid': '76561198003544651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1506478655}
review:
Viele gute Verbesserungen gegenüber Teil 1.
Die Unterwelt ist viel verzweigter, statt dass es einfach nur immer tiefer geht.
Die Oberwelt ist viel verzweigter.
Der Metroidvaniateil klappt gut, Erkundung mit neuen Fähigkeiten macht Spaß.
Die neuen Fähigkeiten sorgen für Abwechslung und machen Spaß.
Es gibt mehr Öfen (Schnellreisesystem) als in Teil 1, und das ist gut.
Habe 9 Std gebraucht um es durchzuspielen mit 67% gefundenen Secrets.

Ich vermisse doch immer, dass man im Sprung auch schlagen kann. Auf Dauer ists nervig, dass es nicht geht, und ich hätte es mir als Upgrade gewünscht ab einem gewissen Punkt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021121604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1506244623}
review:
This is a review from a player that never played the previous SWD.
I beat the game with 83% on first play through which took me 12 hours. I then went back and got the rest with another 4 hours of play.

Graphics - (6/10) Nothing special here. I like the art style but there are very few different tiles which I expected a lot more for this kind of game.

Gameplay - (9/10) This is the ONLY reason this game is positive for me. The gameplay is great and a lot of fun. it gets repetitive but that's the level design fault.

Controls - (8/10) The controls are very responsive and easy to pick up. The one thing that I don't like here is the wall jumping which can be very annoying at times.

Level Design - (6/10) Some puzzles are good and there are neat hiding places but overall the level design is just mediocre. There are very few gimmicks which are not used to their fullest potential. The levels also don't use the players tool to their full potential.

Enemies - (3/10) Very simple and boring AI. Not that many variety, not that many bosses. Everything kind of works the same. So many enemy types missing that would complement the block type gameplay.

Story - (5/10) Predictable all the way. I kind of don't want to give this a score because I don't play these games for the story but if you're looking for a more engaging story like in Hollow Knight, this is not it. It does have some good humor in it though and tons of references.

Replayability - None.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045985565', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1506350353}
review: One of the best metroidvania-like games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121994986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1705455610}
review:
So as of this writing I do not have a ton of hours in yet, but i actually feel like the first impresssion is more important than the impression of one that has had a lot of time to learn to like the game , since what I look for is something that pulls me in right away in one way or another.

I played the original SWD on my ipad, and had some fun with it...so when i saw the sequel on steam i decided to give it a shot. 


I can say ( at least from IoS) its a definite improvement in every direction, not that the original was lacking in my experience. Graphically smoother and prettier, new interesting mechanics and upgrades etc, along with the old  favs, wonderful music and sound design. I do not see any steps backwards , every element of the game feels improved to me.

I am not typically a casual gamer,and usually focus hard on competitive FPS games , but I do play some single player stuff to relax. It is not unusual for me to uninstall a casual game within minutes if I can just tell I wont spend time on it, so when I do install a casual game and end up spending time on it, it feels worthy of reccomending....so here goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075700626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1636721788}
review:
Oh boy, don't I love this game! Everything great from SteamWorld Dig 1, and a bunch more!
Story's interresting and rewarding, digging, mining, exploring, all that stuff just feels right. Fells good!

If you liked first one, it's a no brainer. Great sequel!

Also congratulations on devs estimating the time. They got it nearly perfectly. :D

Also x2, apparently El Huervo is responsible for music? Cool thing to know. He did amazing job, by the way. Soundtrack's just simply beautiful.

review: Beat it in 7 hours got 100% in 3 more the 100% content that they boasted as big and worth the grinding was 100% not sadly just play it how you want. Yet is still an overall improvment to steam world dig and worth a buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034423898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1674785955}
review:
I have to say, this might be the best Metroidvania game I've ever played this year and with such a lack of actual Metroidvanias around and all are equally great, I have to say this one is in the top three so far.

The differences between the first game and this one are noticeably different, there is definitely more to explore as the areas are more expanded as opposed to the first one just having set depths being certain areas and the additional swappable upgrades make for a really interesting game.

I'd definitely recommend it if you're looking for such a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102094986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1566018743}
review: Joguei o primeiro, e estou adorando a continuação. Mapas maiores e mais aprimoramentos. Demorei um pouco pra chegar no final pq fui exploranado tudo, mesmo assim, ainda tem muita coisa pra achar, e é tão divertido q mesmo tendo terminado, vou continuar jogando por um tempo. Valeu cada centavo!!!! Recomendadissimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100523018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1506840547}
review:
muy buen juego el control responde muy bien la historia no es nada del otro mundo pero entretiene bastante, este juego es para los que le gusta hacer farming, hay niveles que te permiten ganar más dinero con el dinero compras mejoras de equipos. tiene un toque metroivania( repito tiene un toque, no es un metroivania) visualmente muy llamativo el apartado grafico es muy bonito, el juego te invita a que explores mas y mas y mas siempre tendrás en tu cabeza el pensamiento de "solo voy a Bajar un poco mas” o “solo voy a conseguir un poco mas de dinero” haha. Hasta el momento estuve como 4horas seguidas sin para es muy enviciante y por el precio es una compra prefecta.
Si te gusta la exploración, minería y Farming ESTE ES TU JUEGO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072750306', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1530516182}
review: An improvement on the first one in every way. Better characterization, better soundtrack, a fuller world, and, of course, more digging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242161956', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 2509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1507492922}
review:
Continua con la historia del primer juego, ahora en esta secuela el arte, los graficos y la musica son mejores y superan al juego anterior.

Algunas de las mejoras son las mismas que el juego anterior pero otras son bastante innovadoras y hacen el juego mas divertido tiene un buen toque de metroidvania, nuevos enemigos con un sistema nuevo de ataque, mas tiempo de juego, algunos nuevos minerales, muchos secretos etc.

La historia es bastante simple pero muy buena, el final fue buenisimo, algo que no esperaba, yo tenia en mente otro final pero no fue asi, ahora si te quieres pasar el juego de nuevo puedes hacerlo ya que hay zonas extra con secretos que no te diste cuenta, hay mas steambots con los que puedes interactuar, unas cuantas misiones secundarias y cada steambot que te encuentras tiene su propia personalidad, adictivo a mas no poder.

Esta secuela supera por mucho al primer juego.

10/10 

Antes de jugar este juego seria mejor que juegues el primero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026122709', 'num_games_owned': 1913, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1506291770}
review:
Excellent game. I had a lot of fun with it, nice metroidvania style game.

Only downside is it's a bit short. I cleared in 13h at ~90% of secrets found. Could be done much faster if you were skilled and knew where to go.

I'd definitly recommend the game, but your not going to spend 100 hours on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140677599', 'num_games_owned': 1827, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 1499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1693335329}
review:
Wow - I never thought I'd be including this on my favorite games of the year but here we are. Steamworld Dig 1 was a good game but it was short and didn't have a ton of variety. This game is absolutely massive and SO much fun! It improves upon it's predecessor in every conceivable way. I'm 12 hours in and although I did finish the story, there are still a great many upgrades and collectibles left to find and many caves to explore. 

If you liked the first game at all or enjoy metroidvania games - I highly recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028866882', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1506625688}
review:
Совпадение или что, но с обеими частями SteamWorld Dig я познакомился будучи на больничном из-за ОРЗ, посему было достаточно свободного времени ознакомиться с игрой. Первая часть зашла на столько, что не выключил пока не прошёл, благо дня хватило. Со второй частью столкнулся на торрентах, подумал, "Даладно, вторая часть вышла? Я обязан в это поиграть!", и с надеждой, что игра не хуже первой сразу полез в стим, и тут же выпал на 6 часов из жизни пройдя, наверное, только половину.

Великолепный стим-панк-сеттинг, метроид-жанр, пещеры-испытания (разработчики, я вас ненавижу из-за пещеры с вагонетками!). Спеланки вышел между двумя частями этой игры и немного её напоминает, только здесь нет рандома оружия - ты копаешь, ты собираешь, ты апгрейдишь сумки/кирку/прочее, ты качаешься, ты получаешь способности, ты наслаждаешься отличным 2D-платформером. Отличная система, эмм, перков чтоли, когда у тебя адова тьма модификаторов, которые ты открываешь в секретках, НО использовать можешь только ограниченное их число, ибо каждые требуют ресурсы, а ресурсы эти - очень редки. При этом весьма ощутимо меняется стиль игры - ты можешь в любой момент (ну, вернувшись в город, конечно), поменять раскладку модификаторов, как в дьябло 3, прям. Можно быть скупым жмотом, получающим двойной лут и мега-сумки, а можно быть непобедимым искателем приключений, которому все опасности не по чём с тремя слоями брони.

В общем, считаю это лучшая игра в жанре метроид-копателя. Надеюсь, разработчики запилят какой ещё контент.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023151011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1506280101}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991134089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1511555599}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197981143952', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1579906046}
review:
Very nice platformer, linear and at the same time not feeling too restrictive. Steady progression of enemies, environments and tools spread throughout the game, so it never feels too grindy. Not too long, which is a bit sad, but at the same time 10 hours of solid gameplay for a single run is fine – you can always try to 100% everything and that will add some hours.
As far as comparing to it’s predecessor – I’d say it’s a complete upgrade (not that SWD 1 is a bad game). It feels very similar in theme and gameplay, yet abilities are varied enough so you don’t feel like you are playing completely the same game.
Overall quite good game, I enjoyed it despite the fact I’m not a at all a big platformer/Metroid fan. Good theme, solid mechanics, and a ton of pop culture references in artifacts (they make me feel a bit old thb, but alas). Looking forward to the next one from the same developer – they already have 3 games set in the same-ish world, and hey, it’s a nice world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001800678', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1506255327}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025785576', 'num_games_owned': 1667, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1327, 'last_played': 1506285280}

author: {'steamid': '76561198206419128', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1506271758}
review:
挖矿，升级，逛洞穴找收集，这其实算是个很经典的ACT类型的游戏了。10小时通关，感觉还行，玩着玩着感觉特别像洛克人Zero。要站稳了抡镐，毕竟是矿工不是战士，挖下去的时候特别麻烦。其实游戏后期的时间都在找收藏品，要是自身有一个显示所有收藏品或者齿轮的cog就好了，省得去翻攻略。
最终BOSS战这就非常非常的ACT游戏了，加血加满复活cog带好5个回合也就敲死了。
PS：Fen长的跟阿里旺旺一毛一样

author: {'steamid': '76561198030828143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1506337571}
review:
Wie nicht anderst zu erwarten Geniales Spiel. Die alte Erz und Edelsteinsucht kommt wieder auf. Man will tiefer graben und noch tiefer um ja mit vollem Rucksack zurückzukommen. Dann oh eine neue Höhle, die schaue ich mir mal an. Ein paar Rätsel Später hält man ein Artefakt und ein Rädchen in seiner Hand.

Leider, leider kann es auch passieren das man es übertreibt, den Bogen überspannt und stirbt. Dann wird man um einige Ressourcen ärmer zum Stützpunkt gebracht und ist erstmal stinksauer, hauptsächlich auf sich selbst. Aber das macht zum teil auch den Reiz des Spiels aus, dieses Risiko und die Pure Freude wenn man dann mit vollem Rucksack fette Beute einfährt und sich coole neue Upgrades leisten kann.

Das alles, zusammen mit einer gelungenen Atmosphäre und einer netten Humorvollen und nicht zu ernsten Geschichte... 

(wirklich klickt alle NPCs nach jedem Upgrade eures Roboters durch eine Dampmaschine nochmal an und redet mit ihnen, echt witzige Dialoge)

...macht den besonderen Charm des Spiels aus. Sie haben das Areal das man absuchen kann auch vergrössert (soweit ich den Vorgänger noch im Sinn habe).

Die Gegner und die Umgebung sind Liebevoll gestaltet und es kommt eine gute Stimmung beim Spielen auf. Das Flair stimmt und das kann man heute leider nichtmehr von jedem der Fliessband Titel sagen.

Es motiviert sogar zum nochmal durchspielen, einfach weil es einen Heidenspass macht zeug zu Sammeln und seinen Bot aufzurüsten. Ich bin aber immer noch beim erstenmal.

Ein Juwel. ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198000082952', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1657991801}
review: The game is really cool and even better than the first one, but I feel like it is a bit expensive considering you can finish it at almost 100% in less than 10 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130055618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1506269120}
review:
Ich Persönlich finde solche Spiele immer wieder Lustig. Das verdienen vom Geld um Upgrades zu kaufen. 

Leider muss ich gestehen hätte ich ein wenig mehr erwartet für 20 € bin ich in nichtmal 8 Stunden durch. 
Hätte wenigstens noch ein paar Bonus oder was erwartet aber nein. 

Aber es war sehr lustig nur leider eben sehr kurz.

Wer solche Spiele liebt ist es nur zum Empfehlen..

author: {'steamid': '76561198124499839', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1506663299}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054978155', 'num_games_owned': 2688, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1506355806}
review: 一如往常的礦價崩潰。

author: {'steamid': '76561198070958597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1579954303}
review:
很久以前玩过一代，很喜欢这类游戏，二代虽然有点贵，但是还是买下来了
总体来说，游戏时长不会太长，全收集我总共用了13个小时，难度不高，地图比一代设计的更精细了点，也加入了更多剧情
虽然套路很常见，也直接预留3代的主线剧情，但是玩到最后还是有点难受，希望赶紧出3代找到fen

玩了两天，初见10小时，通关后可以继续再开相同存档，只不过档案会回到boss战前，可以全收集以后再去通关 
无死亡和速通成就只能新档继续啦

游戏可玩性高，音乐出色，喜欢挖矿游戏的话，这是一款超级有毒，停不下来的游戏，觉得贵可以等打折，这基本上是一个开了就不会吃灰的游戏！

author: {'steamid': '76561198368313952', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1687161809}
review:
ขอบอกก่อนเลยว่าผมชื่นชอบเกมนี้ในภาคแรกเอามากกๆ แล้วมาภาคสองตอนนี้เล่นแล้ว บอกเลยว่าใครที่เบ่นภาคแรกมาซื้อเลย
ทั้งภาพและแสงสวยกว่าภาคแรกอย่างแน่นอนอยู่แล้ว แต่ในภาคนี้มีความสนุกใหม่ๆอยู่แยะไม่ว่าจะอาวุธ หรือระบบใหม่ ตัวละควร NPC จากภาคแรกที่มีแค่4-5 จัว มาภาคนี้มีเป็น 10 ทั้งระบบที่ทำให้เราเล่นสะดวกขึ้น แต่ทำด่านถ้ำต่างๆ ให้ยากขึ้นทดแทน บอกเลยสนุกมา

author: {'steamid': '76561198001792999', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1525539309}
review:
Steamworld Dig was a great game build on well known concept of dig/exploring games. It was short but engaging game.

Dig 2 is taking best of first installement and doing it better with extra content on top of that. Animations are great, there are more beautiful environments, mechanics and movement got expanded. Most of annoying mechanics from Dig were replaced/changed and overall flow of the game feel much smoother and fun overall. Highly recommend, fantastic platformer!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971677134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1506534319}
review: The first game was great, this one is even better! Game development well done for a decent price. Clear recommendation!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007085114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1506425413}
review:
Sehr schönes Spiel. Es sind nette neue Ideem vorhanden. Die Story in Verbindung mit dem Graben ist gut gelungen. Es gibt viele Upgradmöglichkeiten und die Herausforderungen für Boni sind nicht zu schwer gestaltet.
Die Grafik finde ich im Vergleich zum Vorgägner ein wenig verbessert. Es gibt mehr Details und Effekte.

Auf jeden Fall eine Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081389534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1508001061}
review:
Si lo que buscas es un juego desenfadado, entretenido y divertido este es tu juego.
Un juego de plataformas muy bien diseñado, sin demasiada complicación, para mi es un juego casual pero que puede mantenerte enganchado un buen rato descubriendo todos los secretos y coleccionables. 
SteamWorld Dig 2 es la evolución de la fórmula que ya funcionaba de maravilla en el primer juego, ahora se ha aumentado la agilidad con la que se mueven todos los elementos en pantalla, habilidades y enemigos, es más accesible si cabe que su antecesor y más fluido.
Cava y consigue minerales raros, cámbialos por oro y consigue mejoras para tu personaje y aprovecha estas mejoras para seguir cavando y descubrir zonas que antes eran inaccesibles, no tiene más, historia sencillita, jefes entretenidos con nuevas mecánicas y puzles diferentes muy rapiditos.
A mi me encanta el juego porque es muy relax, no requiere de uno grandes esfuerzos ni seriedad por lo que en ciertas ocasiones viene que no veas para echar un rato divertido.
La única pega que le he visto es que cuesta acostumbrarse a tanto brillo en pantalla incluso quitando la opción de los efectos flash. al principio molestaba e incluso te advierten de que puede causar epilepsia y la verdad es que es bastante incómodo.

review: 스팀 월드 디그 2 말 그대로 스팀 펑크 세계관입니다. 나름 독특하며 깔끔한  그래픽이 좋네요 나름 구석구석 돌아다닐수있는 것도 있습니다.  먀냥 생각 없이 플래이할수 있네요 퍼즐및 몬스터 난이도 자체도  무난 합니다. 할로우 나이트와같은 메트로 베니아 게임중에선 가장 쉽네요 멥또한 무진장 친절하구요제가 7시간만에 엔딩을 봣으니 잘하시는 분들은 5시간 정도면 엔딩볼수있을꺼같네요 (퀘스트만 따라갔을때 기준)땅파는게 다소 지루하다 싶을때 엔딩이 나서 조금 아쉬운감이 있지만 나름 재미 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997855967', 'num_games_owned': 2575, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1506649885}
review:
I loved the first game and was very excited for the second, but the soundtrack was probably the last thing I was expecting to fall in love with. I love this kind of music and the song that plays when you hit the town is awesome.

This game is well worth the praise it is getting.

The core of the game revolves around incremental progression growing stronger and finding new abilities to help you progress further and deeper into the mines to find ever greater treasure and reach places you couldn't before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000179729', 'num_games_owned': 1286, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1506266133}
review:
Steamworld Dig 2 is all about progression. You start the game with a pickaxe and walljumps but by the end you have a jetpack, triple grenade launcher, flaming pickaxe, and all manner of life preserving upgrades. 

Movement feels good after you get a few upgrades, there are a few quirks to mining that may tick people off (you can't hit blocks while you are jumping) but taking some time to learn the game if you weren't already a fan of Steamworld Dig 1 will help. Tip: Stand on the edge of a block to hit a block that is one further away than where you can normally hit. 

Backtracking to complete earlier caves isn't a pain thanks to the transit system or the constant need for more money to spend on upgrades. 

You are heavily rewarded for being on the lookout for hidden passages and secrets. There are caves (puzzle rooms) towards the end of the game which will test your agility, timing, and sometimes patience, yet you always complete one feeling just a little proud. 

The visual style is charming and the music is adequate. There is a large variety in visual design for the places you explore, to name a few: nuclear-irradiated underground forest, apocalypse god worshipping temple, and a very cyberpunk-inspired robot graveyard. 

I highly recommend Steamworld Dig 2 and also 1 if you haven't already played it, it's considerably shorter than 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121049532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1506207965}
review: It's a good game. The most thrilling part of the game happens when you go to an unknown sector and I'm hoping the devs release dlc where we can go back there again for bonus final boss. The actually final boss is a bit of a letdown.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971770696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1598834699}
review: Skip playing the first game. Steam World Dig 2 does everything so much better. The pacing, upgrades, and platforming have improved so much. If you want to get lost in a metroid/digging game, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999830719', 'num_games_owned': 2366, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1618227766}
review:
Vraiment un trés bon jeu acheté le jour de la sortie avec 6 heures de jeu, une trés trés grosse impression, bien mieux fini que le premier Steamdig world, qui n'était pas mauvais ce dit en passant, je reconnais que le prix peut en rebuter mais a cette qualité la, j'avoue que je suis bluffé. Et pourtant jen joue à des jeux en 2d indépendant : super meat boy, rogue legacy,  spelunky, mais la ya quelque chose en plus... 

Alors par contre ya un truc que je trouve un peu dommage niveau suprise c'est que dans toutes les grottes sans exception il y ait toujours la même chose en terme d'objets à trouver, attention je dis pas que c'est simple loin de la mais un peu de suprise ça peut pas faire trop de mal...

alors par contre tout le reste comment la diffculté est gérée, pas de soucis particulier, mis à part certains passages dur comme le passage des gouttes ... 
 
Gameplay : trés bonne, et les touches sont configurables
Graphismes : le tout est trés lisible, aucun soucis
Rejouabilité : assez élevée vue la qualité du titre, avec (et je n'ai pas fini le jeu quand j'écris ces lignes) des options pour le durcir ...
Difficulté : on meurt c'est vrai, le tout n'est pas non plus frustrant, l'envie de continuer l'emporte, et puis c'est à cause de moi, pas du jeu.

En fait niveau qualité, ça me ait vraiment pensé à du "ori and the blind forest" si vous avez aimé ce jeu (Ori) vous l'aimerez aussi, il n'est pas aussi beau (et encore ... pas beaucoup moins beau), mais au niveau des mécanismes on s'y retrouve. 

Conclusion 9-10/10 
J'ai pas fini le jeu mais c'est du trés trés bon cru.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978881191', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1604018726}
review: Wonderful sequel to what was already a great game. SteamWorld Dig 2 is a super fun metroid-style platform rpg, where you can gather materials, upgrade your abilities, discover secrets, and traverse an interesting world. If you liked the first, you'll love this. Some of the challenges have definitely been ratcheted up, and I had some near rage-quit moments. Even after beating it, though, I was compelled to continue playing immediately to uncover more of the secrets and go further with my own upgrades. The Steamworld games are getting better and better with every incarnation, and I cannot to see what comes next.
